Funding_Level: Fixed Amount, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Funding Amount: £5,000 per year.
Duration: The scholarship is tenable for the entire duration of the undergraduate degree programme, subject to the recipient maintaining satisfactory academic progress.
Covered Expenses: The £5,000 annual award is paid directly to students in instalments as a contribution towards their living costs.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must have International/EU fee status. Candidates must demonstrate outstanding academic performance and extraordinary ability. Applicants must be accepted for full-time admission to an undergraduate degree programme offered by the School of Mathematics at the University of Edinburgh. The scholarship is not available to students who are already enrolled in a programme at the University. It is also not available to students studying Mathematics as part of a degree programme hosted by another School within the University. US students are eligible to apply and must have a minimum GPA of 3.0. The scholarship is for students pursuing an Undergraduate / Bachelor’s degree.
Eligible_Fields: Undergraduate degree programmes in Mathematics offered by the School of Mathematics at the University of Edinburgh.
Other_Requirements: No specific requirements for reference letters, career plans, age limits, gender, or special circumstances are explicitly stated in the provided information.
Scholarship_Info: The Edinburgh Global Undergraduate Mathematics Scholarships are prestigious awards offered by the University of Edinburgh, located in the United Kingdom. These scholarships are specifically designed to support international students pursuing undergraduate studies in Mathematics. It is a highly sought-after award for international students demonstrating exceptional academic talent in mathematics, aiming to support their studies at a world-class institution.
Application_Documents: Applicants must apply for full-time admission to an undergraduate degree programme in the School of Mathematics at the University of Edinburgh through the University and Colleges Admissions Service (UCAS). Applicants must have applied for admission to the University of Edinburgh to gain access to the scholarship application system.
Timeline:
Currently open : Application Opening
2025-03-31 : Application Deadline

Funding_Level: Tuition Waiver, Stipend
Funding_Details: The scholarship provides comprehensive financial support, covering tuition fees (waived) and a living allowance. It is tenable for the normal duration of the chosen undergraduate course. Recipients are advised to plan finances around the allowance, considering expenses like accommodation and meals, and to explore on-campus housing early.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be citizens of an ASEAN member country (Brunei Darussalam, Cambodia, Indonesia, Lao PDR, Malaysia, Myanmar, Philippines, Thailand, and Vietnam), excluding Singapore. Candidates must be outstanding freshmen applying for full-time undergraduate admission to NUS, with strong final-year results typically equivalent to A-Level, IB Diploma, UEC, or other recognised qualifications.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Final Year High School Student
Min_Gpa: Maintenance: 3.5/5.0; Application: Not specified (outstanding academic profile expected)
Experience_Years: Not applicable for this undergraduate scholarship.
Language_Certificate: Not specified
Other_Requirements: Reference letters are required (a referee information sheet is available on the official NUS website). Applicants must indicate interest in the scholarship during the undergraduate admission application process. Submission of a complete admissions package early is highly recommended. Maintaining a strong portfolio of leadership projects, community service, and regional initiatives demonstrating ASEAN impact is beneficial.
Scholarship_Info: The NUS ASEAN Undergraduate Scholarship is a prestigious program by the National University of Singapore (NUS) to support outstanding freshmen from ASEAN member countries (excluding Singapore). It aims to attract top talent to pursue full-time undergraduate studies at NUS for the normal duration of their chosen course.
Application_Documents: A complete admissions package for undergraduate admission to NUS, along with the referee information sheet.
Timeline:
Application Opening : The AY2025/26 NUS Scholarships application is currently open.
2025-03-26 : Application Deadline.
Monitor NUS offer timeline : Scholarship shortlist notifications.

Funding_Level: Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The NUS Global Merit Scholarship provides comprehensive financial support, covering various aspects of a scholar's university life. The benefits include:
*   Tuition Fees: Subsidised tuition fees (after the MOE Tuition Grant).
*   Living Allowance: An annual living allowance of S$6,000.
*   Computer Allowance: A one-time computer allowance of S$2,000 upon enrolment.
*   Accommodation Allowance: An annual accommodation allowance, with amounts varying based on the type of residence:
    *   S$4,700 if the Scholar is staying in a Hall.
    *   S$4,950 if the Scholar is staying in Ridge View Residential College.
    *   S$5,150 if the Scholar is staying in Houses @PGP, PGP Residence, UTown Residence, RC4, one of the University Town Residential Colleges, or NUSC Cinnamon Wing.
    *   S$6,500 if the Scholar is staying in NUSC West Wing.
*   Student Exchange Programme (SEP)/NUS Overseas Colleges (NOC) Allowance: An allowance per semester for approved overseas programmes, for up to a maximum of two claims:
    *   S$7,500 per semester for non-Asian countries and Japan.
    *   S$5,000 per semester for other Asian countries.
*   Other Benefits: Scholars receive priority consideration for the Residential College Programmes (University Town College Programme and Ridge View Residential College Programme).
Eligibility_Criteria:
Nationality: Singapore Citizens.
Student Type: Freshmen pursuing a full-time undergraduate course at NUS. This includes students from Polytechnics, 'A' Level, International Baccalaureate (IB), and NUS High School backgrounds.
Academic Excellence: Applicants must demonstrate academic excellence. While no specific minimum GPA is stated for application, a strong academic record is essential for consideration. Scholarship holders are typically required to maintain a certain GPA (often 3.0 or higher) throughout their studies.
Co-curricular Activities (CCA): Applicants must present an excellent co-curricular activities record.
Leadership Qualities: Applicants must exhibit outstanding leadership qualities.
Min_Gpa: Not specified for application; recipients generally required to maintain 3.0 or higher
Experience_Years: Not applicable, as the scholarship is for freshmen
Language_Certificate: Not explicitly mentioned for scholarship; standard NUS admission requirements apply
Special_Circumstances: Not specified
Career_Plan: Not explicitly mentioned as a separate requirement
Other_Requirements:
The scholarship application can only be submitted after the application for admission to NUS has been submitted.
Only one common scholarship application is required to be considered for the NUS Global Merit Scholarship, NUS Merit Scholarship, and NUS Undergraduate Scholarship.
Scholarship_Info: The NUS Global Merit Scholarship is a highly coveted award offered by the National University of Singapore to outstanding freshmen. It is designed to recognize and support high-calibre individuals who demonstrate exceptional academic achievements, a strong record of co-curricular activities, and outstanding leadership qualities. The scholarship is tenable for the normal candidature period of a full-time undergraduate course at NUS. It is a flagship university-level scholarship, reflecting NUS's commitment to nurturing future leaders. It is part of a tiered scholarship system, where a single application allows consideration for the Global Merit, Merit, and Undergraduate Scholarships, ensuring that deserving students are recognized at various levels of achievement.
Application_Documents: While specific documents for the scholarship itself are not listed beyond the common application, applicants would typically need to provide academic transcripts, co-curricular activity records, and other supporting documents as part of their NUS admission application, which forms the basis for scholarship consideration. An 'Application Guide' is available for assistance.
Timeline:
1 February 2025 : Application Opening Date
19 March 2025 : Application Deadline

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Fixed Amount, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The Lester B. Pearson International Scholarship is a fully funded award, providing comprehensive financial support to its recipients. The scholarship covers:
*   Full Tuition Fees: The total tuition costs for the entire four-year duration of the program are fully covered.
*   Books: Scholars receive $1,000 per term specifically for books and other necessary academic expenses, such as lab coats.
*   Incidental Fees: All mandatory incidental fees are included.
*   Full Residence Support: This encompasses both residence fees and a comprehensive meal plan for the entire four-year period.
The scholarship aims to ensure that financial constraints do not hinder deserving international students from accessing a world-class education at the University of Toronto.
Quantity: Approximately 37 scholars are named Lester B. Pearson each year.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Applicants must be international students, meaning they are non-Canadian citizens who require a study permit to study in Canada.
Candidates must be in their final year of secondary school (high school) or have graduated no earlier than June 2025.
Applicants must be international students entering the University of Toronto directly from secondary school, commencing their studies in September 2026.
Students from approximately 170 countries are eligible to apply for this scholarship.
Recipients must enroll and maintain full-time student status throughout their program.
Eligible_Fields: Life Sciences, Engineering, Computer Science (including all Bachelor's programs in this field), Music & Architecture, Commerce & Management, Humanities & Social Sciences
Eligible_Field_Group: Natural Sciences, Engineering & Technology, IT & Data Science, Arts, Design & Media, Construction & Planning, Economics & Business, Humanities & Social Sciences
Required_Degree: Final Year High School Student, High School Diploma
Experience_Years: No minimum years of experience specified
Language_Certificate: Not explicitly mentioned as a scholarship requirement
Special_Circumstances: No provisions detailed
Scholarship_Info: The Lester B. Pearson International Scholarship is a highly prestigious, fully funded undergraduate scholarship program offered by the University of Toronto in Canada. Designed to attract exceptional international students from around the globe, this scholarship recognizes outstanding academic achievement, creativity, and leadership potential. It provides a unique opportunity for students to pursue a direct-entry bachelor's degree at one of the world's leading universities, covering all major expenses for the duration of their four-year program.
Application_Documents:
*   Proof of Financial Support: A bank statement or an official letter demonstrating financial capability.
*   Copy of Passport: For identification and verification of international student status.
*   Letters of Recommendation: These are required if specified by the specific academic program to which the student is applying.
*   Personal Statement/Essay: An essay or personal statement is crucial. It should outline the applicant's achievements, leadership experiences, and articulate why they are a deserving candidate for the scholarship.
Timeline:
July 1, 2025 : Application Opening Date
October 10, 2025 : Application Deadline
September 2026 : Study Commencement

Funding_Level: Fixed Amount, Partial Funding, Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver
Funding_Details: The scholarship is a merit-based award ranging from $15,000 to $25,000 per year. It is renewable for four years (eight semesters) of undergraduate study, contingent upon the recipient meeting specified academic standards for renewal. The program can be partially or fully funded. For some exceptional recipients, the scholarship may cover the full cost of tuition for 7.5-15 undergraduate units per semester. Primarily covers Tuition.
Quantity: A small number of exceptional students worldwide
Eligibility_Criteria: Target Group: First-year international undergraduate students. Nationality: Open to students from any country worldwide. Academic Standing: Applicants must demonstrate excellent academic records and strong academic achievements. Qualities: Demonstrated leadership skills and active community involvement are key eligibility factors. Application Requirement: Eligible students must complete a separate Global Scholars Program application and essay in addition to their university application.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Final Year High School Student
Min_Gpa: Not explicitly stated for initial application; excellent academic records required. Renewal contingent on academic standards (other Clark scholarships often require 2.0/4.0 or 3.0/4.0 GPA for renewal).
Language_Certificate: No specific language test requirements are explicitly mentioned for the scholarship application itself. However, applicants should check Clark University's general admission requirements for international students, which typically include English proficiency tests.
Special_Circumstances: Applicants from United World Colleges (UWC) will be considered for both merit-based aid (including the Global Scholars Program) and need-based aid, potentially including UWC-specific funds.
Other_Requirements: Completion of the Global Scholars Program application and essay is mandatory. Submission of the CSS Profile (Clark University code: 3279) by the admission deadline is required if applicants are also seeking need-based financial aid. It is important to note that the Global Scholars Program itself is merit-based, and eligibility does not depend on family financial need.
Scholarship_Info: The Clark University Global Scholars Program is a prestigious, merit-based scholarship designed to attract outstanding first-year international undergraduate students to Clark University in Worcester, Massachusetts, USA. It is part of a broader range of scholarships offered by the university and recognizes students who demonstrate strong academic prowess, leadership capabilities, and a commitment to community involvement. The program aims to support these exceptional students in pursuing their undergraduate studies in the United States.
Application_Documents:
Clark University undergraduate admission application.
Global Scholars Program application.
Global Scholars Program essay.
CSS Profile (if applying for additional need-based aid).
Timeline:
Currently open : Applications open
November 15 : Application Deadline for early consideration
January 15 : Application Deadline for regular decision
Late March : Scholarship decisions released

Funding_Level: Partial Funding, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details: Need-based social scholarships, subsidiary funding, financial support. Determined based on demonstrated financial need, with a scholarship calculator available for estimation. Approximately 10 scholarships are offered on a competitive basis.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Must be an international/foreign student. Must be enrolled at ETH Zurich or the University of Zurich. Must demonstrate financial need. Must hold a Permit B status. Must be pursuing their first degree at the current level (e.g., no second Master's degree).
For Bachelor's Students: Must be regularly enrolled in their first Bachelor's study.
For Master's Students: The scholarship is primarily offered for Master's studies. New international Master's students can only apply after successfully completing their first semester and having gained a minimum of 20 ECTS in the previous semester. Applicants for a Master's must have been in the top 10% of their Bachelor's degree.
Min_Gpa: Master's applicants: Top 10% of Bachelor's degree
Language_Certificate: Not required
Special_Circumstances: Must demonstrate significant financial need.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must be available for an interview as part of the selection process. Must hold a Permit B status. Must be pursuing their first degree at the current level (e.g., no second Master's).
Scholarship_Info: The ETH Zurich Solidarity Fund (Need-Based) is a social scholarship program designed to provide financial assistance to foreign students. It is jointly provided by ETH Zurich and the University of Zurich, supporting students pursuing their studies in Switzerland. The fund offers need-based social scholarships, serving as subsidiary funding to support eligible students, with financial support intended to cover essential study and living costs.
Application_Documents:
Proof of income/pension of parents: Annual income of both parents before tax deduction for the year 2024. Original proof of income for the whole year in local currency (e.g., tax assessment notice or income confirmation from the employer, if no tax assessment is available).
Proof of income of the student: All employment contracts for the past, current, and upcoming semester, including expected salary information.
Official documents to provide evidence of financial circumstances.
Timeline: 2024-11-30 : Application Deadline

Funding_Level: Fixed Amount
Funding_Details:
Approximately 900 admission awards are granted annually, each valued at $10,000 CAD.
The award is a one-time financial aid of $10,000 CAD. While it contributes to educational expenses, the specific extent of coverage (e.g., full tuition, living costs) is not detailed beyond the award amount.
A U of T Scholars award may be tenable in conjunction with other scholarships in some cases. However, it may not be held in conjunction with a U of T Mississauga entrance scholarship. Students with an average of 95%+ applying to U of T Mississauga may qualify for the renewability portion of the U of T Mississauga entrance scholarship in years 2, 3, and 4, but this is distinct from the U of T Scholars award itself.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to outstanding domestic and international high school students applying for admission to any University of Toronto campus. Applicants who have previously attended a postsecondary institution are not eligible for consideration for the U of T Scholars Program.
Min_Gpa: Not specified (based on outstanding average determined by university)
Language_Certificate: PTE Academic: A minimum overall score of 65 with no part below 60. TOEFL iBT: A minimum score is required, but the specific value was not fully provided in the collected evidence.
Special_Circumstances: Not specified
Other_Requirements: Applicants who have previously attended a postsecondary institution are not eligible.
Scholarship_Info: The University of Toronto Scholars Program is a prestigious admission award provided by the University of Toronto in Canada. It is designed to recognize and support outstanding students upon their admission to the university. It provides recognition to U of T's outstanding students upon admission.
Application_Documents: No separate application documents are required for the scholarship itself. Applicants are automatically considered based on their university admission application.
Timeline: November 7 : Early Consideration Deadline (for some programs/applicants), January 15 : General Undergraduate Admission Deadline, February 2 : U of T Scarborough Supplementary Application Deadline

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Fixed Amount, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The scholarship is fully funded, offering substantial financial support valued at up to $30,000 per year. It is considered one of the most generous and transformative undergraduate scholarships available in Australia.
The scholarship aims to alleviate financial burdens, covering a wide range of costs, including:
*   On-campus residential costs (student accommodation)
*   Books and study materials
*   General living expenses
*   Living costs
*   Trips home
*   Other miscellaneous expenses
*   A one-off relocation grant of $1,500 for first-year scholars (applicable from 2024).
Quantity: Up to 25 new scholars are selected each year.
Eligibility_Criteria:
*   Must be eligible to apply to study at ANU in 2027 via the ANU Direct Application system.
*   Must commence an undergraduate program at ANU in Semester 1, 2027.
*   School leavers are eligible to apply.
*   Predicted ATAR of 95 or higher.
*   Applicants who are eligible for consideration under the Educational Access Scheme (EAS) may apply for a Tuckwell Scholarship if they are predicted by their school to achieve an ATAR of 90 or higher.
*   For those interested in the Tuckwell - MChD pathway, a minimum GPA of 5.0/7.0 is required after successfully completing a minimum 3.0 year Full Time Equivalent (FTE) bachelor's degree at ANU.
*   Completion of at least one high school English course/unit in at least one semester during Year 11 or Year 12.
*   Completion of at least one high school Math's course/unit in at least one semester during Year 11 or Year 12.
*   Applicants must meet ANU's English language requirements. This can be demonstrated by providing an acceptable English proficiency test result, such as the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) or Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic, unless otherwise exempt.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Final Year High School Student
Min_Gpa: Predicted ATAR: 95 or higher; EAS applicants: predicted ATAR of 90 or higher; Tuckwell - MChD pathway: minimum GPA of 5.0/7.0 after successfully completing a minimum 3.0 year FTE bachelor's degree at ANU; General ANU Admission GPA: 3.3 or more (for competitive courses).
Language_Certificate: Acceptable English proficiency test result (e.g., IELTS, PTE Academic), unless exempt.
Special_Circumstances: Educational Access Scheme (EAS) eligibility allows for a lower predicted ATAR.
Career_Plan: Not explicitly stated as a separate requirement, but commitment to service within the community and Australia is a selection criterion.
Other_Requirements:
*   Applicants are assessed based on intellect, character, leadership, and commitment to Australia.
*   Demonstrated strong academic potential and achievements.
*   Evidence of other significant achievements of any type, including a strong extra-curricular record.
*   Commitment to service within the community and Australia.
Scholarship_Info: The Tuckwell Scholarship is widely recognized as one of Australia's most prestigious, generous, and transformative undergraduate scholarships, awarded by the Australian National University (ANU). It provides comprehensive support for students pursuing any undergraduate degree, designed to offer significant financial assistance and foster personal growth, leadership, and a commitment to service. The program includes a special mentoring and enrichment program, dedicated support staff, and a Scholars House. A unique Tuckwell - MChD pathway offers direct admission to the ANU medical program without GAMSAT, provided specific academic requirements are met.
Application_Documents:
*   Tuckwell Scholarship Stage 1 Application Form
*   ANU Direct Application
Timeline:
March 3, 2025 : Applications opened for 2026 commencement
April 14, 2025 : Applications closed for 2026 commencement
April 13, 2026 : Application Deadline (for 2027 Commencement)
Semester 1, 2027 : Commencement of undergraduate program

Scholarship_Name: American University Emerging Global Leader Scholarship
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Partial Funding, Fixed Amount, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Two full scholarships are awarded, covering all billable American University expenses. This includes full tuition, on-campus room, and board.
Up to eight additional partial scholarships are available, each valued at $40,000 per year.
Both full and partial scholarships are renewable for a total of four years of undergraduate study, provided the recipient maintains acceptable academic performance.
Covered Expenses: Full tuition, room, and board.
Non-Billable Costs: It is important to note that non-billable costs are not covered by the scholarship.
Eligibility_Criteria: International students who require a non-immigrant visa (preferably an F-1 or J-1 student visa) to study in the United States. Applicants must not be currently enrolled in, or have already begun, any post-secondary studies at another university in their home country or the US. This scholarship is exclusively for students commencing their first undergraduate degree. Applicants must be 40 years of age or younger.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Final Year High School Student
Experience_Years: No specific minimum years of experience are stated, but a demonstrated track record is expected.
Language_Certificate: TOEFL iBT: minimum score of 95 or higher, with all sub-scores of 20 or above, or sub-scores of 24 or above (for paper-based TOEFL taken after May 31, 2017, sub-scores of 24+ required). IELTS: minimum score of 7.0 or higher, with all sub-scores of 20 or above.
Special_Circumstances: International students who require a non-immigrant visa (preferably an F-1 or J-1 student visa) to study in the United States.
Career_Plan: A personal statement outlining academic and career goals, and how the scholarship aligns with these aspirations.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must demonstrate exceptional academic achievement, a strong commitment to leadership and community service. A strong commitment to leadership, volunteerism, and community service is a crucial requirement; applicants should be able to demonstrate their involvement and impact in these areas. Standardized test requirements include SAT minimum score of 33.
Scholarship_Info: The American University (AU) Emerging Global Leader Scholarship (EGLS) is a prestigious, merit-based scholarship designed to promote educational access and opportunity for international students, thereby enhancing global diversity at American University. Its purpose is to foster international diversity and provide educational opportunities for future global leaders. The scholarship is renewable for four years, contingent on satisfactory academic performance.
Application_Documents:
Common Application or Coalition Application
All supporting documents required by the chosen application platform
AU EGL Scholarship application and essays
Official School Transcripts
Letter from EducationUSA advisor (if applicable)
Recommendation letters (as required by Common App)
Statement of purpose
Timeline: September 2025 : Application Opening Date for the 2026 academic year. January 15, 2026 : Application Deadline for Common or Coalition Application, all supporting documents, and the specific AU EGL Scholarship application and essays.

Scholarship_Name: University of Sheffield International Undergraduate Scholarship
Funding_Level: Tuition Waiver, Partial Funding, Fixed Amount
Funding_Details:
- International Undergraduate Merit Scholarship: £10,000 per year towards tuition fees. A total of 75 such scholarships are available.
- General International Undergraduate Scholarship: Typically £2,500 for each year of an undergraduate degree, subject to maintaining a 60% average. For courses in the Faculty of Arts and Humanities and Faculty of Social Sciences, some awards have been noted at £2,000 per year, while others state £2,500 generally. The official University of Sheffield website for the 2026 intake specifies £2,500 per year.
- Specific Intake Awards: For the 2023 intake, scholarships offering 50% tuition fee awards were available.
- All scholarships are explicitly stated to cover tuition fees.
Eligibility_Criteria: Must be an international student, eligible to pay overseas tuition fees. Must be starting an undergraduate degree programme at the University of Sheffield in programme year 1 or year 2. Awards are based on academic merit and high academic achievement. Applicants must not be sponsored students. Must meet the specific academic and English language proficiency requirements for their chosen degree programme.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Final Year High School Student
Min_Gpa: 60% average (required for some specific awards to maintain eligibility during the degree)
Language_Certificate: IELTS, TOEFL or equivalent
Other_Requirements: Exclusions for Medicine (A100/A101) and Dentistry (A200) degree programmes. Applicants must not be sponsored students.
Scholarship_Info: The University of Sheffield International Undergraduate Scholarship is a prestigious and competitive funding opportunity designed to attract high-achieving international students to pursue undergraduate degrees in the United Kingdom. The awards are primarily based on academic merit and are open to overseas fee-paying students commencing their studies in programme year 1 or 2.
Application_Documents: Essay (for International Undergraduate Merit Scholarship)
Timeline:
April 24, 2023, 13:00 (UK time) : 2023 Intake Scholarship Application Deadline
Autumn 2023 : Commencement of Study (for 2023 intake)
Late Autumn 2023 : Applications for a subsequent intake (likely 2024) opened
November 1, 2024 : Applications for the 2025 intake opened
April 21, 2025 : International Undergraduate Merit Scholarship 2025 Application Deadline
May 12, 2025 : General Scholarship (2025 intake) Application Deadline
Autumn 2025 : Commencement of Study (for 2025 intake)
September 2026 : Commencement of Study (example given)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Fully Funded, providing full financial support.
*   Tuition fees
*   Living allowance
*   Book allowance
*   Internship opportunities with Shell
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must meet stringent criteria to be considered for the scholarship: Consistently strong academic achievements; Demonstrated leadership qualities and active participation in extracurricular activities; Must be eligible to work in Malaysia, the country where the scholarship program is primarily offered; Must not be presently holding any other scholarships or educational loans. Minimum academic achievement: Minimum 8As (A/A+) in Sijil Pelajaran Malaysia (SPM) OR Excellent O-level grades. The scholarship supports students pursuing Pre-university A-levels and Undergraduate (Bachelors) degrees.
Eligible_Field_Group: Engineering & Technology, Natural Sciences, Economics & Business
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Final Year High School Student
Min_Gpa: Minimum 8As (A/A+) in Sijil Pelajaran Malaysia (SPM) OR Excellent O-level grades
Language_Certificate: Not mentioned
Special_Circumstances: Not mentioned
Career_Plan: Unique pathway into the energy industry through internship opportunities and potential career pathways within Shell.
Other_Requirements: Not mentioned
Scholarship_Info: The Shell Malaysia Scholarship Programme is a prestigious and fully funded opportunity for Malaysian students pursuing pre-university A-levels and undergraduate degrees. Provided by Shell Malaysia, the scholarship aims to support academically strong students with leadership potential and active extracurricular involvement, offering a unique pathway into the energy industry.
Application_Documents: Specific application documents are not detailed in the provided evidence, but applicants should prepare academic transcripts and any supporting documents that highlight leadership and extracurricular involvement.
Timeline:
May 5, 2025 : Application Opening Date
May 14, 2025, at 11:59 PM (Malaysia time) : Application Deadline
Online Application : Initial submission through Shell’s official scholarship portal
Virtual Interview : Shortlisted applicants will undergo a virtual interview conducted by the Scholarship Board of Trustees

Funding_Level: Full scholarship
Funding_Details: The Davis UWC Scholars Program is the largest privately funded international scholarship program globally, providing need-based financial aid to eligible students. Its primary purpose is to offer financial support for undergraduate educations, covering costs beyond what the partner university itself can offer. This ensures that exceptional UWC graduates can access educational opportunities they might not otherwise be able to afford.
Quantity: Currently supports almost 4,000 scholars; over 13,000 alumni.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must have graduated from one of the 18 United World College (UWC) high schools. Scholars must matriculate at one of the selected U.S. colleges or universities that partner with the Davis UWC Scholars Program. Students must apply and qualify for need-based financial aid directly through the financial support office of their chosen partner university. The Davis UWC Scholars Program supplements the aid provided by the university.
Language_Certificate: Not specified by scholarship; depends on partner university
Special_Circumstances: No requirement
Other_Requirements:
Maintain satisfactory academic progress (GPA of 2.0 or better).
Cooperate with requests for information from the Davis UWC Scholars Program.
Be committed to building cross-cultural understanding, fostering relationships, and seeding global networks for international understanding. The program aims to cultivate globally minded young people and transform U.S. collegiate campuses into more globally-engaged spaces.
Scholarship_Info: The Davis UWC Scholars Program is a prestigious, privately funded international scholarship initiative dedicated to supporting graduates of United World College (UWC) high schools in their pursuit of higher education in the United States. Co-founded in 2000, it has grown to become the largest scholarship program for international students in the U.S., partnering with over 100 colleges and universities.
Application_Documents: Not specified by scholarship; integrated with partner university application process.
Timeline:
2000 : Program founded
Since 2004 : Annual Reports released
Varies by university : Application deadlines for partner universities (e.g., February 1st for University of Oklahoma, March 1st for Hood College)

Scholarship_Name: Benjamin A. Gilman International Scholarship Program
Country: All world regions (excluding those with Travel Advisory Level 3 or 4 from U.S. Department of State)
Funding_Level: Fixed Amount, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
*   Standard awards are granted for up to $5,000 for study abroad or international internship programs.
*   Supplemental funding of up to $3,000 is available for students undertaking STEM-related coursework or internships abroad, or for those studying critical languages (languages deemed important to national security). This supplemental funding can bring the total award amount up to $8,000.
*   Award amounts vary based on the student's recommendation group.
*   Annually, nearly 3,000 students are awarded the Gilman Scholarship.
*   Covered Expenses: Tuition, Room and board, Books, Local transportation, Insurance, International airfare, Passport and visa fees.
Eligibility_Criteria: Must be a citizen or national of the United States. Must be an undergraduate student in good standing at an accredited institution of higher education in the United States. Must be enrolled at their home institution at the time of application and throughout their program abroad. Must be in the process of applying to, or already accepted to, a credit-bearing study abroad or international internship program (in-person or virtual). The program must be in a country or location with an overall Travel Advisory Level 1 or 2, according to the U.S. Department of State’s Travel Advisory System. Must be a student of limited financial means, typically demonstrated by receiving a Federal Pell Grant during the time of application or during the study abroad/internship program.
Language_Certificate: Not required
Special_Circumstances: The program specifically targets students of limited financial means, often Pell Grant recipients. Supplemental funding is available for students pursuing STEM-related coursework/internships or critical language study abroad.
Other_Requirements: Advisor Certification: Both a Study Abroad Certifying Advisor and a Financial Aid Certifying Advisor must certify the applicant's application by the advisor deadline. Transcripts: Official transcript(s) are required to accompany the student's application for review by the selection committee. Acceptance Letter: An official acceptance letter from the study abroad program or host institution is required prior to award disbursement. This letter must be addressed to the student with their first and last name, be in English, and clearly identify the study abroad program, host country, and term(s). Students should only apply for terms for which they can provide an official acceptance letter. If program information changes, advisors will need to re-certify the new details.
Scholarship_Info: The Gilman Program supports students of limited financial means to study or intern abroad, providing them with skills critical to U.S. national security and economic prosperity. Eligibility_Criteria: Must be at least 18 years old by August of the academic year (e.g., August 2025 for the 2025-26 academic year). Some country-specific age limits apply, such as 25 years or younger, or between 18-24 years old by the application deadline (e.g., for Pakistani citizens). Must be an outstanding undergraduate student currently enrolled in a college or university in their home country. Applicants must have one full year remaining at their home institution after the Global UGRAD Program year. (Students with a 3-year undergraduate university program are typically eligible if they are in their 1st or 2nd year). Specific country citizenship and residency requirements apply (e.g., citizen of China, currently residing in China; Pakistani citizens). Participants are required to return to their home country immediately upon completion of the program for a period of at least two years, as per J-1 visa regulations. Individuals who have participated in a U.S. government-sponsored Exchange Visitor program for more than six weeks and have not fulfilled their two-year home residency requirement by the application deadline are ineligible.
Language_Certificate: TOEFL score of at least 48 points
Age: At least 18 years old by August of the academic year (e.g., August 2025 for the 2025-26 academic year). Some country-specific age limits apply, such as 25 years or younger, or between 18-24 years old by the application deadline (e.g., for Pakistani citizens).
Special_Circumstances: Specific country citizenship and residency requirements apply (e.g., citizen of China, currently residing in China; Pakistani citizens). Participants are required to return to their home country immediately upon completion of the program for a period of at least two years, as per J-1 visa regulations.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must be identified as "emerging student leaders." Community involvement is common among participants.
Scholarship_Info: The Global Undergraduate Exchange Program (Global UGRAD) is a prestigious, fully funded one-semester scholarship initiative sponsored by the U.S. Department of State. Designed for outstanding undergraduate students from around the world, the program offers a unique opportunity for non-degree academic study in the United States. Its primary goal is to bring future and emerging student leaders to experience U.S. higher education, foster cross-cultural understanding, and develop leadership skills. Participants are expected to return to their home countries upon completion of the program to apply their enhanced knowledge and experiences. Global UGRAD provides one-semester scholarships for non-degree academic study at U.S. colleges and universities. The program aims to immerse future leaders in American higher education, promoting academic and cultural exchange.
Application_Documents: Specific required application documents are not detailed in the provided evidence, but applicants are encouraged to visit their local U.S. Embassy or Fulbright Commission website for country-specific instructions.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The Heinrich Böll Foundation Scholarships are fully funded, covering the entire duration of the study program. This financial support allows recipients to concentrate on their academic and social engagements without financial concerns.
Non-EU nationals (not educated in Germany) will receive a monthly amount of USD 934 along with various individual allowances.
Quantity: Approximately 1200-1500 scholarships are awarded each year. This includes about 150+ scholarships specifically for international students across undergraduate, master's, and doctoral levels. Annually, about 180 scholarships are awarded to doctoral candidates.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Open to particularly gifted students from Germany and abroad. Applicants are expected to have excellent academic records, be socially and politically engaged, and have an active interest in the foundation's basic values, showing excellent promise for future academic and professional careers.
Scholarships are primarily for graduates and doctoral students. This includes International Master's students with university entrance qualifications obtained outside of Germany. The scholarship department of the Heinrich Böll Foundation specifically grants scholarships to only graduates and doctoral students from outside Germany.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Experience_Years: Applicants are required to have at least two years of professional experience post-bachelor's degree.
Language_Certificate: Proof of German Proficiency is required, specifically Level B2 or DSH 2 (with certificate).
Other_Requirements: Applicants must demonstrate a strong commitment to the values of ecological sustainability, democracy, human rights, and social justice. They should be socially and politically engaged, have an active interest in the basic values of the foundation, and show strong motivation.
Scholarship_Info: The Heinrich Böll Foundation Scholarships offer a prestigious and highly competitive opportunity for international students seeking financially supported Master’s and PhD studies in Germany. Provided by the Heinrich Böll Foundation, these fully funded scholarships are designed to support particularly gifted students from Germany and abroad who demonstrate not only academic excellence but also a strong commitment to social justice, democracy, environmental sustainability, and human rights. These scholarships open gateways to advanced education at renowned German universities, combined with financial stability and professional growth opportunities, enabling recipients to focus on their academic and social commitments without financial worries.
Application_Documents:
- Recommendation Letters (personal reference detailing social commitment, expert reference from university lecturer or schoolteacher for new students)
- Updated resume
Timeline:

- March 1st : Application Deadline
- September 1st : Application Deadline
- Duration of study program : Scholarship coverage
- 2 years (standard, for doctoral candidates, with possibilities for extension) : Funding period
- Stage 1 : Submission of required written application documents via online portal
- 3 stages : Selection procedure

Funding_Details:

Eligibility_Criteria: Open to talented young Africans, citizens from Sub-Saharan Africa, students from Africa, or young people from the African continent. Applicants must demonstrate proven academic and leadership potential. Candidates must have access to few educational opportunities or face the highest social and economic barriers to opportunity. Applicants should not have previously completed a postgraduate degree. Applicants should not be enrolled (or apply to enrol) at a separate university whilst on the Mastercard Foundation Scholars Program scholarship. For online Postgraduate Diploma programs (e.g., at the University of Edinburgh): Applicants can have an undergraduate or Master's degree from an African university, provided they will graduate from either degree by 21 November 2025. Admission to a Master's program at a partner university is a prerequisite for scholarship assessment.
Eligible_Fields: Eligible fields of study and program types depend on the partner university. Examples include: Any full-time one-year postgraduate courses (Cambridge, with exclusions not provided); health-related disciplines, such as Biomedical Engineering (Toronto); Postgraduate on-campus and online Master's/Postgraduate Diplomas (Edinburgh); Master's programs at Graduate Schools (Sciences Po).
Min_Gpa: Above 2.80/4.0 (for some programs); Typically 3.0/4.0, competitive applicants often have higher; Satisfactory scholastic average generally required.
Language_Certificate: English Proficiency: AUB-EN, TOEFL iBT, IELTS Academic, GRE Verbal. Other languages possible depending on country/university.
Special_Circumstances: Talented young people from the African continent who demonstrate strong academic and leadership potential but face significant barriers to educational opportunities. Citizens from Sub-Saharan Africa, students from Africa, or young people from the African continent. Candidates must have access to few educational opportunities or face the highest social and economic barriers to opportunity.
Other_Requirements: Applicants should not have previously completed a postgraduate degree. Applicants should not be enrolled (or apply to enrol) at a separate university whilst on the Mastercard Foundation Scholars Program scholarship. Admission to a Master's program at a partner university is a prerequisite for scholarship assessment. Applicants must meet any additional requirements set by the specific degree program and partner university. For online Postgraduate Diploma programs (e.g., at the University of Edinburgh): Applicants can have an undergraduate or Master's degree from an African university, provided they will graduate from either degree by 21 November 2025.
Scholarship_Info: The Mastercard Foundation Scholars Program is a flagship initiative provided by the Mastercard Foundation. It is a global program implemented through a network of 33 partner universities and non-governmental organizations across multiple countries. The program aims to develop Africa’s next generation of leaders by providing access to quality and inclusive education.
Application_Documents: Two references. Specific program requirements may also apply for university admission.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Fixed Amount, Tuition Waiver, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The scholarship amount varies significantly by district.
    The minimum amount for any Global Grant is $30,000 (e.g., District 6220, 7070, 6250, 7305, 5360).
    Some districts offer $40,000 (e.g., District 6580, Indiana Rotary clubs).
    District 6040 offers one scholarship of $70,000 or two scholarships of $35,000 each per year.
    District funds are often combined with grants from Rotary International.
The scholarship typically covers:
    Tuition
    Travel
    Books
    Necessary equipment
    Fees
    *Note:* Under U.S. tax law, The Rotary Foundation must withhold tax from Global Grant Scholarships awarded for study in the U.S. on any expenses beyond tuition, books, necessary equipment, and fees.
Quantity: Varies by district. E.g., District 6080 offers one annually; District 6040 may offer one $70,000 scholarship or two $35,000 scholarships.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be at the graduate-level (Master's degree or certificate), not for doctorate studies. Study must be full-time, in-person, and abroad (outside the applicant's home country). For some districts, this means outside Canada and the USA. Typically for one academic year. Must be proficient in the native language of the host country. Academic and career plans must strongly align with at least one of The Rotary Foundation’s seven Areas of Focus. Previous work experience, volunteer experience, and/or education related to their chosen Area of Focus is required. Future career plans must be strongly aligned with one of Rotary's Areas of Focus. The scholar must outline and execute a service project in their study country. Qualified candidates are required to participate in interviews. Requires endorsement by a local Rotary Club, with a club member appointed as a Sponsor.
Eligible_Fields: Peace and conflict prevention/resolution, Disease prevention and treatment, Water and sanitation/hygiene, Maternal and child health, Basic education and literacy, Economic and community development, Environment
Eligible_Field_Group: Agriculture & Environment, Economics & Business, Education & Training, Engineering & Technology, Healthcare & Medicine, Humanities & Social Sciences, Law & Public Policy, Natural Sciences, Social Services & Care
Experience_Years: Previous work experience, volunteer experience, and/or education related to their chosen Area of Focus.
Language_Certificate: Proficiency in the native language of the host country is required; specific certificates not named but demonstration expected.
Special_Circumstances: The scholarship is explicitly not for doctorate studies. While the task title mentions "Rotary District Grants (Potential Undergraduate Funding)," the overwhelming evidence collected explicitly describes the "Rotary Global Grant Scholarship" as funding for graduate-level studies (Master's degree or certificate), not undergraduate. Under U.S. tax law, The Rotary Foundation must withhold tax from Global Grant Scholarships awarded for study in the U.S. on any expenses beyond tuition, books, necessary equipment, and fees. For some districts (e.g., District 7070, 5360), study abroad specifically means outside Canada and the USA.
Career_Plan: Future career plans must be strongly aligned with one of Rotary's Areas of Focus, demonstrating a commitment to service and impact.
Other_Requirements: Two academic and/or employer recommendations are required. The scholar must outline and execute a service project in their study country. This project will be discussed during the district interview. Qualified candidates are required to participate in interviews, which are a mandatory part of the selection process. Applicants must be available for these interviews. The application process requires endorsement by a local Rotary Club. A club member should be appointed as a Sponsor for the applicant. After club endorsement, the application is forwarded to the District Scholarship Committee Chair.
Scholarship_Info: This report provides a comprehensive analysis of the "Rotary Global Grant Scholarship," which is the primary scholarship program offered by Rotary International and its districts for academic study. It supports graduate students pursuing full-time, in-person study abroad in one of Rotary's seven Areas of Focus. Funding amounts vary by district, typically ranging from $30,000 to $70,000, covering tuition, travel, books, necessary equipment, and fees. Eligibility requires strong alignment of academic and career plans with Rotary's focus areas, proficiency in the host country's language, and a commitment to a service project. The application process is decentralized through local Rotary Clubs and districts, leading to variable deadlines and award numbers. The Global Grant Scholarship replaced the general Rotary Scholarship program in 2013. Since 1947, over 30,000 individuals from 100 nations have studied abroad through Rotary.
Application_Documents: Required documents include the application form, supporting documents, and two academic/employer recommendations.
Timeline:
Deadlines are highly decentralized and vary by Rotary District. Applicants must check with their local district for specific dates. Examples:
2025-01-26 : Application Deadline (District 7390)
2025-03-29 : Interview deadline (for final application by August 1, 2025)
2025-05-16 : Final online application deadline (District 7010)
2025-08-01 : Final application to Rotary Foundation
2025-11-08 : Application Deadline (District 5890)
2025-12-20 : Application Deadline (Indiana Rotary clubs)
Applications are typically for matriculation in the fall of the following year or spring thereafter (e.g., Fall 2025 or Spring 2026 for District 6270).
Application Process:
Initial Application : Submit to a local Rotary Club
Rotary Club Endorsement : Local Rotary Club considers and endorses candidates, appoints a sponsor
District Committee Review : Endorsed application forwarded to District Scholarship Committee
Interviews : Qualified candidates participate with District Scholarship Committee
Final Approval : Award subject to final approval by The Rotary International Foundation
Scholarship Period : Typically one academic year, but can be 3 months, 6 months, 1 year, or 2 years (for specific programs like Rotary Centers for International Studies).

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The Jardine Scholarship is a comprehensive, fully subsidised, and bond-free award designed to cover all essential expenses associated with undergraduate study at Oxford or Cambridge.

Covered Expenses Include:
*   University and college fees
*   Tuition costs
*   The cost of necessary books and equipment
*   Board and lodging (preferably on a college site)
*   A generous stipend for living costs
*   One return flight to the UK at the beginning and end of the academic year

In addition to financial provisions, scholars benefit from a robust mentorship program, connecting them with senior leaders from the Jardine Matheson Group and a network of current scholars and alumni.
Quantity: Not specified annually; 54 undergraduate scholars in 2021/22
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be pursuing undergraduate studies at selected Colleges at the Universities of Oxford and Cambridge. Must be citizens or permanent residents of countries where the Jardine Matheson Group has significant operations (Cambodia, Thailand, Singapore, Hong Kong, Indonesia, Mainland China, Malaysia, Myanmar, Philippines, Taiwan, Vietnam). Candidates are typically expected to be between the ages of 18 and 25. A minimum GPA of 70% or equivalent is generally required. Applicants must meet the rigorous admission criteria of their chosen Oxford or Cambridge college and course, including demonstrating English language proficiency through tests such as IELTS or TOEFL, unless exempt.
Eligible_Fields: Education and Research, Banking and Finance, Legal, Commercial, Medical and Healthcare, Industrial and Engineering
Eligible_Field_Group: Education & Training, Economics & Business, Law & Public Policy, Healthcare & Medicine, Engineering & Technology
Language_Certificate: IELTS or TOEFL (as per Oxford/Cambridge requirements)
Other_Requirements: Applicants must provide excellent references, including a reference letter from a teacher and a letter signed by their principal approving the application. Candidates should possess strong dedication to their studies and personal development. Upon accepting the scholarship, Jardine Scholars agree to: conduct themselves properly and strive for academic excellence; complete an annual report for the Foundation on their academic progress, with contributions from their tutors or supervisors; allow the Foundation to obtain information from their universities regarding grades and progress; seek written approval from the Trustees for any planned change in their course of study; obtain written consent from the Foundation and the University to defer commencement of their course (only under exceptional circumstances); comply with all university regulations; not accept any other employment during scholarship periods (other than short-term employment during vacations) without the Trustees' consent; not accept any other scholarship, either in name or substance, during the scholarship period.
Scholarship_Info: The Jardine Scholarship is a prestigious, fully subsidised, and bond-free scholarship program provided by the Jardine Foundation. Established in 1982, the Foundation annually awards scholarships to enable students to pursue undergraduate studies primarily at selected Colleges at the Universities of Oxford and Cambridge in the United Kingdom. Beyond financial support, the program offers invaluable mentorship from senior leaders within the Jardine Matheson Group, as well as current scholars and alumni, fostering a strong network for its recipients.
Application_Documents:
Required Application Documents:
*   Completed Jardine Scholarship application forms (available for download from the Foundation's website).
*   A personal statement highlighting the applicant's motivations and aspirations.
*   A copy of the completed Cambridge/Oxford application.
*   Certified copies of all relevant academic qualifications (transcripts, certificates, etc.).
*   Reference letters, including those written by teachers.
*   A letter signed by the principal of the applicant's current educational institution, approving the scholarship application.
