mid-August 2025 : Anticipated application opening for Fall 2026 courses
2026-10-21 : Application Deadline for 2026 Jardine Foundation Scholarship Awards

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver
Funding_Details: The Trustee Scholarship is a fully funded award, covering the full undergraduate tuition fees for the duration of the recipient's program. It is renewable for up to four years, contingent upon the scholar maintaining satisfactory academic performance. Each year, Boston University welcomes approximately 20 outstanding students into this highly selective program, making it one of the university's most exclusive scholarships.
Eligibility_Criteria: The scholarship is open to both prospective domestic and international students. Ideal candidates are those who possess an outstanding academic record and actively contribute positively to their school and wider community. Applicants must demonstrate exceptional academic prowess and meet all other specified eligibility requirements set by Boston University. While specific prior admission to a BU degree-granting school or college is generally required for scholarship consideration, the Trustee Scholarship is an exception, implying it's part of the initial application process for incoming students. Applicants are expected to demonstrate superior academic achievement. Beyond academic metrics, the scholarship seeks well-rounded individuals.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Final Year High School Student
Other_Requirements: Candidates often rank in the top one percent of their graduating classes. Successful applicants typically have an SAT score of 1500 or higher, or an ACT score of 35 or higher.
Scholarship_Info: The Boston University Trustee Scholarship is recognized as Boston University's most distinguished and prestigious merit-based scholarship, offering a truly unique opportunity for exceptional incoming undergraduate students. This highly competitive program aims to attract and support a select group of outstanding individuals who demonstrate not only academic excellence but also significant contributions to their schools and communities.
Application_Documents: Common Application and all supplementary materials required by Boston University.
Timeline: December 1, 2025 : Application Deadline

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Other Costs, Fixed Amount
Funding_Details:
The NNPC/Shell undergraduate scholarship is a fully funded, merit-based program designed to provide comprehensive annual financial support to successful applicants. The scholarship covers essential academic expenses, including tuition, accommodation, and other academic costs.
Annual grants are reported to be substantial, with figures of ₦200,000 or ₦250,000 per year. This continuous support is provided throughout the duration of the undergraduate program, typically commencing from the second year of study until the completion of the degree.
Quantity: Average applicants: 16,000; Average aptitude test takers: 4,000; 2018 awards: 400; 2025 awards: Not specified.
Eligibility_Criteria: The scholarship is primarily targeted at undergraduate students currently enrolled in or admitted to a Nigerian university. It is a merit-based scholarship. Applicants are generally expected to be first-year students at the time of application, with the grant commencing from their second year of study. There is a specific variant of the scholarship for undergraduates in Shell host communities.
Min_Gpa: Shell host communities: 2.5 CGPA; General national merit scholarship: Not explicitly stated, strong academic record implied.
Special_Circumstances: Applicants from Shell host communities have specific criteria, notably the 2.5 CGPA requirement.
Other_Requirements: A mandatory aptitude test or examination is a crucial part of the selection process. Thousands of students participate in these tests annually.
Scholarship_Info: The Shell Scholarship (Undergraduate) in Nigeria, officially known as the NNPC/SNEPCo National University Scholarship Award (Undergraduate), is a prestigious, fully funded, merit-based program for undergraduate students in Nigerian Universities. Jointly provided by NNPC, SPDC, and SNEPCo, it has a long history since the 1950s, offering annual financial support from the second year of study until degree completion.
Application_Documents: Specific application documents are not detailed beyond the general mention of 'What You'll Need' on the application portal.
Timeline:
1950s : Program commenced
Prior to 2025-08-15 : 2025 Application cycle opened
2025-08-15 : Application Deadline
Annual : Program runs annually, providing continuous support from second year until degree completion

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details: The Heinrich Böll Foundation Scholarships are fully funded, offering comprehensive financial support to recipients. This generally includes a maintenance grant, a study and research grant, a foreign study grant, a mobility allowance, and a family allowance, among other categories. Additional funding may be available specifically for scholarship-holders, particularly for German students, foreign students educated in Germany, and EU nationals.
Quantity: Approximately 1,500 scholarships annually to German and international students. For graduates and doctoral students specifically, around 1,000 scholarships are granted each year.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to international students from any country, as well as European Union and German students. Must be studying at a state or state-approved German institution of higher education. International Students are primarily eligible for postgraduate (Master's) and doctoral studies; undergraduate applications for international students are only open to those who have received their education in Germany. European Union and German Students are eligible for all study levels, including undergraduate, graduate, and PhD programs. The scholarship does not support second degree courses, study visits outside Germany, or final degree phases. For some specific doctoral grants, applicants may be required to be studying in Germany already. Applicants must demonstrate social commitment, political interest, and an active interest in the basic values of the foundation (ecology and sustainability, democracy and human rights, self-determination, and justice).
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree, PhD
Min_Gpa: 3.00/4.0 (or 2.50/4.0 with sufficient work or research experience)
Experience_Years: For postgraduate applicants, at least two years of professional experience post-bachelor's degree is required.
Language_Certificate: Written proof of German language proficiency (DSH Level 2 or TestDaF Level B2 certificate) is mandatory. Knowledge of English may also be expected.
Special_Circumstances: The foundation may provide funding for African students with disabilities.
Career_Plan: To promote future leaders and experts who are prepared to take on social responsibility, are interested in politics, and actively work to uphold the foundation's basic political values: ecology and sustainability, democracy and human rights, self-determination, and justice.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must demonstrate strong academic performance and recipients are expected to have excellent academic records. Doctoral students must provide proof of acceptance to a PhD program.
Scholarship_Info: The Heinrich Böll Foundation Scholarships are a prestigious opportunity for students aiming to pursue higher education in Germany. Its core objective is to promote future leaders and experts who are prepared to take on social responsibility, are interested in politics, and actively work to uphold the foundation's basic political values: ecology and sustainability, democracy and human rights, self-determination, and justice. Beyond financial support, the scholarship offers access to a valuable "Green network" and an annual "alumni salon."
Application_Documents:
Required documents include:
*   Written application form.
*   An updated resume (CV).
*   A personal reference on social commitment.
*   An expert reference from a university lecturer (or a schoolteacher for school leavers/new students).
*   Proof of German language proficiency (DSH 2 or TestDaF B2 certificate).
*   Proof of acceptance to a PhD program (for doctoral students).
*   Convincing reasons for applying to the Heinrich Böll Foundation.
Timeline:
Approximately six weeks before 1 March : Online application portal typically opens.
1 March : Primary application deadline.
Stage 1 (after deadline) : Submission of Written Application Documents assessed.
Stage 2 : Interview with a Liaison Lecturer for shortlisted candidates.
Stage 3 : Final Decision made.
Academic Year (April or October start) : Scholarships generally awarded.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Government-funded, competitive, and fully comprehensive scholarship program. No application fee is charged to students.
All Tuition Fees: Students are exempt from paying university tuition fees.
Monthly Stipend: Undergraduate students receive a monthly stipend of approximately 3,500 TL (Turkish Lira), which was also noted as approximately 250 USD.
Student Housing: Accommodation in student housing is provided.
Turkish Language Course: A mandatory one-year free Turkish language course is provided before the commencement of the academic program. This is required for all recipients, even if their degree program is taught in English.
Quantity: Around 5,000 new scholarships are awarded each year across all levels; Approximately 15,000 scholars are currently benefiting from the Türkiye Scholarships program.
Eligibility_Criteria: Citizens of all countries are eligible to apply, exclusively for candidates from all countries who wish to study at the undergraduate level. Applicants must be graduates of high school or those who will graduate at the end of the current academic year (before August). Individuals currently enrolled in undergraduate programs in Turkish universities are also eligible. Applicants must be under 30 years old for undergraduate programs and be in good health.
Eligible_Fields: A wide range of academic programs is offered across various disciplines, including competitive majors such as medicine and engineering.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Final Year High School Student
Language_Certificate: Mandatory one-year Turkish language course; may require SAT, TOEFL, IELTS, DELF, YDS depending on university/department.
Special_Circumstances: Individuals who are currently enrolled in undergraduate programs in Turkish universities are also eligible to apply for an undergraduate scholarship.
Career_Plan: Motivation letter should articulate reasons for studying in Türkiye and alignment with academic and professional goals.
Other_Requirements: Shortlisted candidates must attend an interview at Turkish embassies or consulates.
Scholarship_Info: The Türkiye Scholarships (Türkiye Bursları) is a prestigious, government-funded, and highly competitive scholarship program provided by the Turkish government. It is designed to attract outstanding international students and researchers from all over the world to pursue full-time or short-term programs at top universities across Türkiye. Specifically, the Undergraduate program targets international students aspiring to complete their bachelor's degrees in Türkiye. It stands as the largest Turkish scholarship program for international students, with a significant global reach, offering education opportunities at an international caliber.
Application_Documents: All requested documents must be submitted/uploaded into the online application system. A compelling motivation letter (500-1500 words, often in English) is a crucial component, articulating reasons for studying in Türkiye and alignment with academic/professional goals.
Timeline: 2025-01-10 : Application Opening Date; 2025-02-20 : Application Deadline; January 2026 – February 20, 2026 : Expected Application Window; June-July : Results Announcement

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The scholarship covers the University Composition Fee at the appropriate rate (either arts or science), approved College fee, and an annual stipend to cover living expenses. These scholarships are designed to provide full funding for tuition fees and living costs.
Covered Expenses:
* University Composition Fee (tuition fees)
* Approved College fee
* Annual stipend (living expenses)
Eligibility_Criteria: Available to applicants from developing member countries of the Commonwealth. Candidates must be applying for study at the Masters or PhD level.
Min_Gpa: Recommended: at least 3.7/4.0 for postgraduate studies
Language_Certificate: IELTS, TOEFL, or equivalent test scores are required unless otherwise specified by the University of Cambridge for admission.
Special_Circumstances: Trust scholarships do not automatically fund the optional writing-up period, if applicable, for PhD students. However, scholars pursuing a PhD may apply for a brief period of extension funding should it be required at the end of their scholarship.
Career_Plan: A personal statement detailing academic interests and future aspirations is generally required as part of the application process.
Other_Requirements: Typically, two reference letters from academic or professional sources are required. Applicants must proactively check with the Commonwealth Scholarship Commission for funding call deadlines and details of the application process. They must also apply for admission to the University of Cambridge by the funding deadline specific to their chosen course, referring to the Postgraduate Course Directory for precise dates.
Scholarship_Info: The Commonwealth (Cambridge) Scholarship is a prestigious award provided by the Cambridge Commonwealth Trust, enabling international students to pursue postgraduate studies at the University of Cambridge in the UK. The Trust has awarded over 9,000 scholarships to students from every Commonwealth country over 30 years, demonstrating a long-standing commitment to supporting students from across the Commonwealth.
Application_Documents: Required documents typically include an undergraduate degree transcript, English proficiency test scores (if applicable), a personal statement, and reference letters.
Timeline:
September 2nd : Applications for Commonwealth Master's scholarships for the 2026/27 academic year are anticipated to open.
October 2025 (approx.) : Applications for Commonwealth Master's scholarships for the 2026/27 academic year are expected to close.
Varies : Check Commonwealth Scholarship Commission (CSC) for funding call deadlines and details of the application process.
Varies : Apply for admission to the University of Cambridge by the funding deadline specific to your chosen course, as listed in the Postgraduate Course Directory.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The program is government-funded and highly competitive, offering a complete financial package. It covers everything international students will need during their academic studies, providing free higher education and a new life experience.
Covered Expenses:
* Full Tuition Fees: University tuition is entirely covered.
* Accommodation: Students are provided with accommodation, typically at university facilities.
* Health Insurance: Comprehensive health insurance is included, allowing students to benefit from widespread health services.
* Turkish Language Course: A mandatory one-year Turkish Language Course is provided for all awardees who do not possess a C1 Level Certificate for Turkish Proficiency, even if their academic program is in English or another language. Attaining C1 level is required by the end of the academic year.
* Monthly Stipend: A monthly stipend is provided to cover living expenses. For Undergraduate Level students, this is 3,500 TL per month.
* Travel: While not explicitly detailed in the provided evidence, fully funded scholarships often include travel support.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be international students. Citizens from all countries are eligible. Individuals currently enrolled in programs in Turkish universities at the level of education they will apply for are also eligible. Maintaining a high GPA is a key eligibility factor, particularly for competitive majors like medicine and engineering. A minimum of 70% academic achievement is required for Bachelor's degree applicants. Under the age of 30 for Master’s programs, under the age of 35 for PhD programs, and under the age of 50 for Research Scholarships. An endeavor is made to achieve a balance in the allocation of awards by gender.
Eligible_Field_Group: Engineering & Technology, Healthcare & Medicine, Natural Sciences, Humanities & Social Sciences, Arts, Design & Media
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Min_Gpa: 70% for Bachelor's degree applicants; higher for competitive fields like medicine and engineering.
Experience_Years: Minimum 2 years of relevant work experience for some programs; research experience accepted for Master's/PhD.
Language_Certificate: Mandatory C1 Turkish proficiency by end of first academic year (one-year course provided if not possessed). Internationally accepted language proficiency certificate (e.g., TOEFL, DELF, IELTS 6.5 for some programs) required for English/other language medium programs if mandated by university/program.
Age: Under 30 for Master's, Under 35 for PhD, Under 50 for Research Scholarships.
Special_Circumstances: Individuals currently enrolled in programs in Turkish universities at the level of education they will apply for are also eligible.
Career_Plan: Not explicitly required as a separate document, but implicitly addressed in recommendation letters.
Other_Requirements: No application fee is charged. International exam results (e.g., GRE, GMAT, SAT) may be required by the chosen university or specific program, especially for graduate studies or programs taught in English or other languages.
Scholarship_Info: Türkiye Scholarships (Türkiye Bursları) is a prestigious, government-funded, and highly competitive scholarship program offered by the Turkish government through the Presidency for Turks Abroad and Related Communities (YTB). It is designed to attract outstanding international students and researchers from all over the world to pursue full-time or short-term programs at top universities across Türkiye. The scholarship aims to provide education opportunities at an international caliber, a wealth of knowledge and experience, free higher education, and a new life experience, covering all essential needs for international students during their academic journey.
Application_Documents:
Required documents generally include:
* International exam results (GRE, GMAT, SAT, etc.) if required by the chosen university or program.
* International language test results (TOEFL, DELF, etc.) if required by the chosen university or program.
* Academic transcripts and diplomas.
* Reference letters (1-3, depending on the program/university).
* Other documents as specified in the online application system.
Timeline: 2025-01-10 : Application Opening, 2025-02-20 : Application Deadline, 2026-02-20 : Application Deadline (2026-27 Cycle)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Fixed Amount, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The scholarship program awards 100 undergraduate scholarships annually across top Canadian universities. The funding structure is as follows:
*   Up to CAD 120,000: Awarded to high school graduates pursuing Engineering degrees. This amount is typically distributed over four years.
*   CAD 100,000: Awarded to Schulich Leader Nominees admitted to Science, Technology, or Mathematics programs. This scholarship is valued at $25,000 per year for four years.
The scholarships are designed to be comprehensive, covering all expenses, including tuition, books, living costs, and rent, effectively providing a full-ride scholarship for the duration of the undergraduate degree.
Eligibility_Criteria: Candidates must be graduating high school or cégep in Canada during the 2025/2026 academic year, be a Canadian citizen, and be entrepreneurial-minded, exhibiting leadership, charisma, and a strong interest in innovation. They must be nominated by their individual high school or cégep and plan to enroll in an eligible Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics (STEM) program at one of the program's partner universities in Canada. Candidates must NOT plan to pursue studies in medicine after their undergraduate degree.
Eligible_Field_Group: Natural Sciences, IT & Data Science, Engineering & Technology
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Final Year High School Student
Experience_Years: Not specified, but involvement in relevant activities is implied by the 'entrepreneurial-minded' criterion.
Language_Certificate: No specific IELTS, TOEFL, or other language proficiency certificates are mentioned as required for the scholarship application itself, beyond standard university admission requirements.
Age: No specific age limits are detailed.
Gender: No specific gender requirements are detailed.
Special_Circumstances: No provisions for special circumstances are detailed.
Career_Plan: No explicit requirement for a detailed career plan is mentioned.
Other_Requirements: Successful nominees must enroll in an eligible STEM program at one of the 20 partner universities across Canada.
Scholarship_Info: The Schulich Leader Scholarships are Canada's most coveted and prestigious undergraduate STEM scholarships. Established in 2012 with a $200 million fund, the program aims to support the next generation of entrepreneurial-minded technology innovators. It awards 100 undergraduate scholarships annually.
Application_Documents: The primary application document is the online Schulich Leader application, submitted by nominated students.
Timeline:
January 28, 2026 : Nomination Deadline (School to Schulich)
January 30, 2026 : Schulich must receive nominations by this date.
February 18, 2026 : Application Deadline (Nominees)
The timeline is set for students graduating in the 2025/2026 academic year, aligning with university entrance for the 2026-2027 academic year.

Scholarship_Name: Melbourne International Undergraduate Scholarship – University of Melbourne
Funding_Level: Partial Funding, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The scholarship officially provides a 25 percent fee sponsorship for the duration of the course. This benefit is explicitly stated on the official University of Melbourne scholarship page and other sources.
Beyond the 25% fee sponsorship, the scholarship may also cover partial or full tuition fees, and potentially include financial assistance for living expenses and other educational costs. Some sources describe the scholarship as "fully funded," suggesting that for some recipients, the benefits can extend to comprehensive coverage.
Covered Expenses:
*   Tuition fees (partial or full)
*   Living expenses
*   Other educational costs
Duration: The fee remission is typically for the duration of the course, often noted as three years for a standard Bachelor's degree.
Quantity: Reported number of awards varies significantly across different sources: 50 scholarships per year (oyaop), 110 awards (collegedunia), Approximately 1,000 scholarships (leapscholar, noticebard, o4af). This wide range suggests that the number of recipients may fluctuate annually or that different sources refer to different categories or rounds of awards.
Eligibility_Criteria: High-achieving international students enrolling in a Bachelor's degree program. Applicants must be citizens of countries where international educational opportunities are limited by financial disadvantage. Candidates must have completed secondary school outside Australia, or a foundation program in Australia. Academic excellence is a primary criterion for selection. Reference letters are generally not required for undergraduate scholarship applications, with the exception of portfolios for specific fields such as art or music, which may necessitate supporting documentation. No specific age limits, career plan submissions, or gender requirements are stated for the scholarship.
Min_Gpa: US High School System: 3.9, Pakistan/South Asia System (Fsc): 70%
Experience_Years: No specific minimum years of work experience or accepted types of experience are mentioned as requirements for this scholarship.
Language_Certificate: While English language proficiency tests (like IELTS or TOEFL) are typically required for admission to the University of Melbourne for international students, no specific scores or certificates are listed as a direct requirement for the scholarship itself.
Special_Circumstances: A key eligibility factor is being a citizen of a country where international educational opportunities are limited by financial disadvantage.
Scholarship_Info: The Melbourne International Undergraduate Scholarship, provided by the University of Melbourne, is a prestigious award designed to attract high-achieving international students to pursue a Bachelor's degree in Australia. The scholarship offers various levels of financial support, ranging from a 25% fee sponsorship to potentially covering full tuition and living expenses. A key characteristic of this scholarship is its automatic consideration process, meaning applicants are assessed for the scholarship upon applying for admission to an undergraduate program, eliminating the need for a separate scholarship application. Eligibility is primarily based on academic merit, with specific requirements for secondary school results, and is targeted towards citizens of countries where international educational opportunities are limited by financial disadvantage.
Application_Documents: As consideration is automatic upon applying for admission, no separate scholarship application documents are required. Applicants should focus on fulfilling the university's general admission requirements.
Timeline: No separate scholarship application deadline; automatic consideration upon applying for university admission. No specific opening date is provided, as consideration is tied directly to the university's admission application cycles. While some external sources mention specific admission deadlines (e.g., October 31st or August 19th), these pertain to university admission cycles rather than a distinct scholarship application.

Scholarship_Name: Stamps Scholarship (network – theo trường đối tác)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Fixed Amount, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Multi-year scholarships range from $6,000 to $90,000 annually, totaling an average of $24,000 to $360,000 over four years. Many partner universities offer full cost-of-attendance scholarships. For instance, Oregon resident Stamps Scholars at the University of Oregon receive full tuition, fees, room, and board for four years, while out-of-state recipients receive nonresident tuition and fees. The University of Arizona also offers five full-ride scholarships annually to exceptional Arizona residents, covering the full cost of attendance.
Covered Expenses: The scholarship typically covers:
*   Tuition and fees
*   On-campus housing
*   Meal plan
*   University health insurance
*   Textbooks
*   Laptop allowance
*   An enrichment fund (e.g., $12,000 at the University of Miami) for activities such as:
    *   Study abroad programs
    *   Academic conferences
    *   Leadership training
    *   Academic and scientific research projects
    *   Cultural and leadership programs
    *   Conventions and regional conferences
    *   Unpaid internships
Quantity: Approximately 415 students receive the award every year across all partner institutions, with about 360 new scholars selected annually. The number of awards varies by university; for example, the University of Oregon awards 20 scholarships annually (10 to in-state and 10 to out-of-state students), while the University of Arizona awards 5 annually.
Eligibility_Criteria: Students must demonstrate: Academic merit, Strong leadership potential (a core focus of the program), Exceptional character, A commitment to community service. Generally targets first-year undergraduate students. Eligibility regarding citizenship varies by partner school. Some schools are open to international students (e.g., Barry University), while others may specify US citizens or residents (e.g., PA residents for the University of Pittsburgh, domestic students for the University of Oregon). Students are advised to check directly with the specific program they are interested in. The Stamps Scholars Program welcomes and supports students from all backgrounds and areas of study.
Min_Gpa: 3.5 or higher (high school GPA, often required, varies by institution)
Language_Certificate: International students may be required to take English proficiency exams such as TOEFL, IELTS, or PTE to be eligible.
Special_Circumstances: Not specified
Other_Requirements: Two letters of recommendation are typically required for Stamps Scholarship consideration, even if optional for the general university admission process. Students must apply directly through partner schools; applications cannot be submitted via the Stamps website. A separate application for the Stamps Scholarship is often required in addition to the general university application. Specific programs may have additional requirements, such as acceptance to an Honors Early Assurance Program for the University of Arizona.
Scholarship_Info: The Stamps Scholarship is a prestigious undergraduate scholarship program provided by the Stamps Scholars Program. Established in 2006 by E. Roe Stamps and his late wife Penny, the program aims to provide extraordinary educational experiences for talented student leaders. It operates through a network of partner universities across the United States, sharing the costs of the awards with these institutions.
Application_Documents: University-specific application form, a Stamps Scholarship supplemental application (where applicable), and two letters of recommendation.
Timeline:
2024-11-01 : University of Connecticut (main application) deadline
2024-11-08 : University of Connecticut (supplemental Stamps application) deadline
2024-11-12 : University of Oregon deadline
2024-12-10 : University of Arizona deadline
2026-01-07 : Virginia Tech deadline
Application opening dates are not uniformly specified and are tied to the individual university's admissions cycle.
Scholarships are renewable for four years (eight academic semesters) or up to 12 terms over five years for undergraduate study (excluding summer terms).

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The KAIST International Undergraduate Scholarship is a fully funded program designed to cover the comprehensive costs associated with studying at KAIST. It is offered to all admitted international applicants and is described by some sources as a need-based financial aid scholarship.
Covered Expenses:

*   Living costs
*   Other benefits (specifics not detailed in the provided information)

The scholarship is exclusively for international undergraduate applicants. A key aspect of the selection process is that applicants admitted to KAIST are automatically considered for the scholarship, meaning no separate scholarship application is required.

Eligible_Fields: Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Civil Engineering, Software Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, Chemistry, Physics, Mathematical Sciences

Other_Requirements: A recommendation letter is required as part of the application process, with a specific deadline (e.g., October 30, 2025). Applicants who have graduated from a Korean school or will graduate are eligible to apply.
Scholarship_Info: The KAIST International Undergraduate Scholarship is a prestigious, fully funded program offered by the Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (KAIST) for international students. This scholarship supports individuals pursuing a Bachelor's degree in South Korea, providing access to high-quality education delivered in English.
Application_Documents:
*   Online application submitted through the KAIST application platform.

2024-09-20 : Application Opening Date
2025-10-23 : Application & Documents Deadline

Scholarship_Name: International Freshman Scholarships – University of Alabama
Funding_Level: Partial Funding, Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Fixed Amount, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The University of Alabama offers generous scholarship opportunities for international freshmen, encompassing both partial and fully funded options.
*   Partial Funding: Scholarships can cover up to $6,000 USD in tuition costs.
*   Fully Funded Options: Specific scholarships, such as the International Freshman Automatic Merit Scholarships, provide comprehensive coverage including:
    *   Full tuition for 4 years.
    *   On-campus housing at the regular room rate.
    *   A $500 allowance for books.
Eligibility_Criteria: All international students are eligible to apply. Primarily for first-year students demonstrating strong academic performance in high school. Applicants must possess high ACT or SAT scores and good grade point averages (GPAs) from high school. The ACT or SAT must be taken prior to high school graduation, with qualifying test scores and GPA submitted by the stated deadlines. Students who have taken a gap year between completing high school and enrolling at The University of Alabama may still be considered for automatic merit scholarships. Their eligibility will be based on the amounts advertised for the year they would have enrolled immediately following high school graduation, provided they meet the qualifying test scores and GPA criteria.
Language_Certificate: Not explicitly stated as a scholarship requirement, but international students typically need to meet English language proficiency requirements for university admission (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS).
Special_Circumstances: Students who have taken a gap year between completing high school and enrolling at The University of Alabama may still be considered for automatic merit scholarships. Their eligibility will be based on the amounts advertised for the year they would have enrolled immediately following high school graduation, provided they meet the qualifying test scores and GPA criteria.
Other_Requirements: No other specific requirements beyond academic and test scores are mentioned for scholarship eligibility.
Scholarship_Info: The University of Alabama is known for offering substantial scholarship opportunities, particularly for first-year students who demonstrate strong academic profiles, evidenced by high ACT/SAT scores and GPAs. The scholarship program includes both automatic merit-based awards and competitive scholarships accessible via ASAM.
Application_Documents:
University admission application.
All supporting documents required for admission.
Completion of additional scholarship applications within the Alabama Scholarship Award Manager (ASAM).
The Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) is mentioned as a general step for freshmen to maximize scholarship opportunities, though its direct applicability for international students is often limited.
Timeline:
Not explicitly specified : Application process opens, tied to the university's admission application cycle.
November 3 : Deadline for spring admits to complete scholarship applications in ASAM and submit additional requested materials.
December 5 : Deadline for summer and fall admits (specifically for Summer/Fall 2026 consideration) to complete scholarship applications in ASAM and submit additional requested materials.

Scholarship_Name: International Scientia Coursework Scholarship – UNSW Sydney
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Fixed Amount, Tuition Waiver
Funding_Details:
Offer 1: Full tuition fee scholarship, paid directly towards tuition fees for the minimum duration of the program.
Offer 2: $20,000 per annum, paid directly towards tuition fees for the minimum duration of the program.
Covered Expenses: Full or partial tuition fees.
Payment Conditions: Scholarship payments are contingent upon students maintaining full-time enrollment in an eligible degree program at UNSW, as recorded on the Census date of the award year.
Eligibility_Criteria: To be considered for the International Scientia Coursework Scholarship, applicants must meet a comprehensive set of criteria encompassing their student status, academic background, and other qualifications. Must be an international student. Must be commencing full-time study in a UNSW undergraduate or postgraduate coursework degree program. Must have received an an offer of admission to UNSW. Candidates are rewarded for high academic achievement. Demonstrated leadership skills at their school, workplace, or in their community. Participation in extracurricular activities such as sports, cultural activities, volunteer work, or work experience. If receiving a Conditional English Package Offer (UEEC), students must be enrolled in the UNSW Institute of Languages and successfully complete the program prior to commencing their degree studies. Exclusions: Students undertaking UNSW online or UNSW Canberra programs are not eligible. Students who have completed a UNSW College Foundation Studies or Global Diploma Program prior to commencing an undergraduate program are not eligible for this award.
Eligible_Fields: Law & Justice, Business, Engineering, Arts, Design & Architecture
Eligible_Field_Group: Law & Public Policy, Economics & Business, Engineering & Technology, Arts, Design & Media, Construction & Planning

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Scholarship benefits include at least $18,200 per year plus tuition fees. One recipient reported a total scholarship amount of approximately $70,000 per year for four years, indicating the comprehensive nature of the award. The program is designed to address A-level financial need that would otherwise prevent eligible students from pursuing a UBC degree.
Covered Expenses:
*   Tuition Fee
*   Living allowance (accommodation, food, and daily expenses)
*   Health insurance
*   Other mandatory student fees
Quantity: Approximately 50 scholarships are awarded annually across four categories/awards.
Eligibility_Criteria: Must be an international student who will be studying in Canada on a Canadian study permit. Must be entering a first undergraduate degree program at UBC from a recognized institution. Must demonstrate superior academic achievement and significant financial need that would otherwise prevent them from attending UBC. Applicants should be academically outstanding students from around the world who demonstrate strong leadership, community engagement, and a desire to make an impact globally and locally. Applicants applying for the International Scholars Program are not eligible for other merit-based entrance awards, including International Major Entrance Scholarships (IMES) and Outstanding International Student Awards (OIS).
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Final Year High School Student
Experience_Years: No minimum years specified; however, demonstrated leadership qualities, exceptional contributions, strong community engagement, and a desire to make an impact globally and locally are essential.
Language_Certificate: Required (e.g., IELTS, TOEFL) unless an exemption applies, to meet UBC’s general admission requirements and English language standards.
Special_Circumstances: Must demonstrate significant financial need that would otherwise prevent them from attending UBC.
Career_Plan: A desire to make a significant impact globally and locally.
Other_Requirements: A teacher referee is required. The applicant is responsible for requesting a teacher referee to submit their recommendation. Applicants must be nominated by their school or a non-profit organization. The applicant is responsible for initiating the award application, requesting a nomination from their institution, collecting all required information, and submitting their completed application by the specified deadline.
Scholarship_Info: The UBC International Scholars Program is a prestigious scholarship offered by the University of British Columbia (UBC) in Canada. It is specifically designed for academically outstanding international students who demonstrate strong leadership qualities, exceptional contributions to their communities, and a desire to make a significant impact globally and locally. Scholars accepted into the program join a vibrant community of engaged and supportive young leaders, enriching UBC and the global community with their diverse perspectives and innovative initiatives. The program fosters a community of young leaders, offering numerous opportunities inside and outside the classroom. These include community-based experiential learning projects, annual retreats for networking and planning, and dedicated support from International Scholars Program advisors and UBC staff across various faculties and services. This support aims to encourage academic, personal, and career development throughout the scholars' degree.
Application_Documents: While specific documents are not detailed, the process requires collecting "required information," which typically includes academic transcripts, essays, nomination letters, and referee statements.
Timeline:
2025-08-13 : Opening Date
2025-11-15 : Deadline to submit the International Scholars Program application.
2025-11-17 : Deadline to submit the award application for consideration for the UBC International Scholars Program awards (11:59 pm PST).
2026-01-15 : Deadline to apply to UBC to be considered for the International Scholars awards for many programs (11:59 p.m. PST).

Scholarship_Name: Reach Oxford Scholarship – University of Oxford
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
- Full tuition fees
- Full college fees
- An annual stipend for living expenses (approximately £9,000 per year, subject to annual increases due to inflation)
- Accommodation and other living costs
- One annual return airfare from the scholar's home country to the UK
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be international students from low-income countries or countries that receive official development assistance (ODA). Candidates must demonstrate significant financial need and prove that, for financial or other reasons, they cannot undertake a degree in their own countries. Applicants must be first-year undergraduate students at the University of Oxford. Crucially, applicants must have first applied for admission to an undergraduate course at the University of Oxford via UCAS and secured an offer of a place. The University cannot consider scholarship applications from students who have not received an offer. Students holding an offer for deferred entry for an undergraduate course at Oxford, or those applying for Oxford’s Astrophoria Foundation Year Programme, should apply for the scholarship in January of the year they intend to commence their undergraduate degree course.
Eligible_Fields: All undergraduate courses offered at the University of Oxford, excluding Medicine
Eligible_Field_Group: Education & Training, Arts, Design & Media, Humanities & Social Sciences, Economics & Business, Law & Public Policy, Natural Sciences, IT & Data Science, Engineering & Technology, Construction & Planning, Agriculture & Environment, Social Services & Care, Personal Services & Tourism, Security & Defense, Library & Information Management, Transportation & Logistics
Language_Certificate: Required (English language proficiency)
Special_Circumstances: The scholarship specifically targets disadvantaged students from low-income countries who face significant barriers to higher education abroad.
Other_Requirements: Strong letters of recommendation from former teachers or professors are a critical component of the application. Applicants must provide verifiable proof of financial need, which may include documents such as bank statements or other financial declarations. The scholarship selection process is highly competitive. Candidates are first assessed for their academic merit and suitability for an Oxford undergraduate course. Only those who receive an offer of admission to the University are then considered for the Reach Oxford Scholarship. Receipt of the award in subsequent years is contingent upon satisfactory academic progress.
Scholarship_Info: The Reach Oxford Scholarship, provided by the prestigious University of Oxford, is a fully funded opportunity designed for international undergraduate students from low-income countries. It aims to enable academically excellent students who, due to financial or other constraints, cannot pursue a degree in their home countries, to study at one of the world's leading universities.
Application_Documents:
- Letters of recommendation from former teachers or professors.
- Proof of financial need (e.g., bank statement).
- Proof of English language proficiency.
Timeline:
2025-10-15 : UCAS Application Deadline (for Oxford Undergraduate Admission)
2026-01-14 : Scholarship Application Opening Date
2026-02-12 : Scholarship Application Deadline (noon UK time)

Scholarship_Name: HKUST Admissions Scholarships for International Students – HKUST
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The scholarships provide substantial financial support. The largest amount of scholarship funding is equivalent to the full tuition fee plus an allowance of HKD60,000 per academic year. This funding is renewable for the normative duration of study, subject to the recipient maintaining satisfactory academic performance.
Covered Expenses:
* Full tuition fees
* An annual allowance of HKD60,000
* Accommodation costs
* Living costs
Quantity: Not specified; multiple awards granted under a 2-tier system for continuing scholarships.
Eligibility_Criteria: Specifically targets international/non-local students. Admissions scholarships are awarded to top students from all backgrounds based on academic merit and outstanding performances. New full-time non-Chinese international applicants with outstanding performances and recommendations may apply for an Entrance Scholarship. Students must take admission in an undergraduate degree at the university to be considered for the award. The Future Leaders Award specifically considers financial need in addition to academic excellence for non-local students.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Final Year High School Student
Min_Gpa: For renewal: Minimum 3.5 GPA; or 3.2/4.3 GPA; or cumulative GPA of 2:1 or above (equivalent to approximately 55% of the class, with a First Class Honours being the top 10%)
Language_Certificate: Not specified for scholarship; university admission typically requires English proficiency tests
Special_Circumstances: Financial need is a consideration for specific scholarships like the Future Leaders Award.
Career_Plan: Not explicitly mentioned as a requirement
Other_Requirements: Recommendations are required for the Entrance Scholarship for non-Chinese international applicants. Outstanding performances are generally expected. Exceptional academic achievements are required for prestigious scholarships such as the Hong Kong Jockey Club Chairman’s Scholarship. Satisfactory academic performance is mandatory for scholarship renewal.
Scholarship_Info: HKUST offers a range of academic and admission scholarships specifically targeting top international/non-local students pursuing undergraduate degrees. These scholarships are designed to attract high-achieving students from diverse backgrounds, recognizing academic merit as the primary selection criterion. The scheme is also referred to as the "University Admission Scholarship Scheme for Non-local Students." HKUST is committed to attracting top international talent by offering a range of admission scholarships. These scholarships are awarded to students with outstanding academic records and potential, aiming to open doors to their dreams of studying in Hong Kong. The university offers various scholarships, including the Hong Kong Jockey Club Chairman’s Scholarship and the Future Leaders Award, under its broader admissions scholarship scheme.
Application_Documents: Supporting documents are generally required as part of the university admission application. Specific scholarship applications may require additional materials.

Recommendation: Early application is highly encouraged/strongly advised.

Scholarship_Name: International Student Excellence Scholarship – University of Auckland
Funding_Level: Partial Funding, Fixed Amount, Tuition Waiver
Funding_Details: Up to NZD $10,000. The scholarship amount is applied directly towards compulsory tuition fees for either postgraduate or undergraduate study.
Quantity: Up to 50 scholarships are offered per cycle.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Applicants must be new international students enrolling full-time at the University of Auckland. They must have gained university admission based on overseas secondary or post-secondary qualifications.
A minimum Grade Point Average (GPA) of 6.0, or a Grade Point Equivalent (GPE) of at least 6.00, is required. Alternatively, applicants must have achieved an average score of 75% in their previous studies.
The scholarship is open to students enrolling in: Undergraduate degrees, Postgraduate Diplomas, Master's degrees (minimum 120 points). Students enrolling in research master's programmes are explicitly not eligible for this scholarship.
There are no specific field restrictions mentioned, implying eligibility across all disciplines offered by the University of Auckland, provided the program type is eligible.
Applicants must provide proof of English language proficiency. Specific requirements will depend on the University's admission criteria.
Recipients must undertake full-time study at the University of Auckland.

Language_Certificate: Applicants must provide proof of English language proficiency. Specific requirements will depend on the University's admission criteria.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must be new international students enrolling full-time at the University of Auckland. They must have gained university admission based on overseas secondary or post-secondary qualifications. Recipients must undertake full-time study at the University of Auckland.
Scholarship_Info: The International Student Excellence Scholarship, offered by the University of Auckland, is a prestigious award designed to attract high-calibre international students to pursue full-time undergraduate or postgraduate studies in New Zealand. It is recognized as one of the most prestigious scholarships available for international students in New Zealand. It is awarded biannually for Semester One and Semester Two intakes.

Scholarship_Name: Entrance Scholarships for International Students – HKU
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Stipend
Funding_Details:
These are merit-based scholarships. For International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma students achieving a score of 44 or above, the scholarship amount is typically "Full," indicating comprehensive coverage. While many scholarships are generous, the level of funding can differ. For instance, out of fewer than 150 international students admitted annually, only 1-3 may receive a full scholarship, which in some cases covers tuition fees only.
Covered Expenses:
*   Full tuition fees
*   Accommodation
*   General living allowance
*   Some full scholarships may cover tuition fees only.
Quantity: Over 430 (2023-24 academic year, HK and ~40 countries/regions); For international full scholarships: 1-3 out of <150 admitted international students.
Eligibility_Criteria: International undergraduate students demonstrating remarkable academic achievements. Scholarships are awarded based on remarkable academic achievements. For International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma students, achieving a score of 44 or above is a key criterion for a full scholarship. For local HKDSE students, achieving Level 5** in 5 or more subjects is a benchmark for top awards. Non-local applicants must apply directly to the University of Hong Kong and meet all necessary admission requirements. HKU explicitly states that it does not use agents for admissions. Some scholarships are designed to support students from countries under specific initiatives, fostering international links. Admission decisions, which are intrinsically linked to scholarship consideration, are based on a holistic review of academic performance, interview performance, personal statement, references, and other submitted documents.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Final Year High School Student
Min_Gpa: IB Diploma: 44 or above; HKDSE: Level 5** in 5 or more subjects
Language_Certificate: Required for applicants from non-English medium institutions (e.g., IELTS, TOEFL). Starting from 2026 intake, IELTS and TOEFL test results must be obtained within two years prior to September 1st of the admissions year.
Other_Requirements: Interview performance, Personal statement, References/Letters of Recommendation, International Student admission form, Direct application to HKU (no agents), Meet all necessary admission requirements.
Scholarship_Info: The "Entrance Scholarships for International Students – HKU" are prestigious awards provided by the University of Hong Kong (HKU). These scholarships are designed to attract and support outstanding international students pursuing undergraduate studies at HKU, aligning with the university's goal to groom graduates who can build lasting links between their home communities and Hong Kong. They are merit-based, and some may be renewable, subject to academic performance during studies.
Application_Documents:
A completed application form.
All required supporting documents, preferably combined into a single PDF file.
A personal statement.
References/Letters of Recommendation.
An International Student admission form.
Applications are generally submitted via the HKU Portal.
Timeline:
All year round: Applications accepted
First week of December / December 2nd: Recommended application deadline for specific annual scholarships
December - July: Offers for admission and scholarships made
Beginning of Semester 2: Annual scholarship seminar by AASO

Funding_Level: Fixed Amount
Funding_Details:
Twenty scholarships, each valued at CAN $10,000, are awarded annually. The scholarship amount is typically divided and paid in equal installments during the 1A and 1B terms of the first year.

The scholarship provides a fixed monetary value rather than comprehensive coverage of all living and study expenses. It does not cover expenses such as airfare, visa, accommodation, meals, and tuition fees, despite some third-party claims.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Must be an international student.
Must be an undergraduate first-year admitted student, entering Year One of a Bachelor's degree program at the University of Waterloo.
Must have a strong academic record, typically an admission average of 90% or higher.
Open to students admitted to any program offered by the University of Waterloo.
Language_Certificate: IELTS 6.5+, other language certificates accepted as per university admission standards
Special_Circumstances: Not mentioned
Other_Requirements: An Admission Information Form (AIF) may be required as part of the general university admission application process. For general university admission, a Resume/CV may be required, and for specific departments like Fine Arts or Music, a portfolio or interview might be necessary.
Scholarship_Info: The International Student Entrance Scholarship is a prestigious award offered by the University of Waterloo, designed to attract and support outstanding international students commencing their undergraduate studies at the university. This merit-based award recognizes outstanding academic achievements.
Application_Documents: No separate scholarship application documents are required. All necessary documents are submitted as part of the general University of Waterloo undergraduate admission application, which typically includes academic transcripts, English language proficiency test results, and potentially an Admission Information Form (AIF). International students generally apply via the Ontario Universities’ Application Centre (OUAC) for undergraduate programs.

Funding_Level: Fixed Amount, Partial Funding, Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
McGill University offers merit-based entrance scholarships to first-time university students entering a full-time undergraduate degree program. These scholarships are broadly categorized into one-year entrance scholarships and Major Entrance Scholarships.

*   One-Year Entrance Scholarships: All eligible applicants are automatically considered for these awards.
*   Major Entrance Scholarships: These are valued between $12,000 and $48,000, typically disbursed as $3,000 to $12,000 per annum and renewable for up to 4 years. Other Major Entrance Scholarships are valued at $3,000, $5,000, $10,000, or $12,000 and are also renewable.
*   Other Entrance Awards: For the Fall 2025 cohort, 95 entrance awards ranging from $5,000 to $20,000 were offered. For September 2024 entry, 100 entrance awards were available through the McCall MacBain program, which also offered 30 full scholarships.
*   Covered Expenses: Entrance scholarships can be part of a larger financial assistance package that may include tuition, room and board, and other expenses.
*   Award Limitation: Centrally-administered entrance scholarships are limited to receiving a single award.
*   Faculty-Specific Scholarships: Certain faculties at McGill also offer their own faculty-specific entrance scholarships.
Quantity: While the exact number of general one-year entrance scholarships is not specified, the McCall MacBain Scholarships program offered 30 full scholarships and 100 entrance awards for September 2024 entry, and 95 entrance awards ranging from $5,000 to $20,000 for the Fall 2025 cohort.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Entrance scholarships are merit-based and primarily for first-time university students entering a full-time undergraduate degree program at McGill University.

*   Automatic Consideration: All applicants to McGill undergraduate degree programs are automatically considered for a one-year entrance scholarship if they meet minimum academic requirements. Students who apply for, but do not receive a major scholarship, will also be automatically considered for a one-year entrance scholarship.
*   Student Status: Applicants must meet admission requirements at McGill University and can be either domestic or international students. They must commence studies in any undergraduate program.
*   Ineligible Applicants: Transfer, Mature, Diploma, Exchange, Special, Part-time, and Visiting students are not eligible for entrance scholarships.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Final Year High School Student
Min_Gpa: For Canadian High School (outside Quebec and Ontario): minimum 97% average on all academic Grade 12 and Grade 11 level courses, and/or ranking in the top 1% of their class. Suggested for Major Entrance Scholarships: an average around 95% or ranking in the top 1-2% in their class. For renewable scholarships: sessional GPA of above 3.5 or 3.7 on a minimum of 27 credits.
Language_Certificate: Applicants must meet the general minimum degree and language requirements for McGill University admission, which typically include IELTS, TOEFL, or other language certificates for non-native English speakers.
Age: For specific programs like the McCall MacBain Scholarships, there are age criteria for those who earned their first bachelor's degree more than five years ago (must be 30 years or younger on January 1, 2025). For general undergraduate entrance scholarships, no specific age limits are mentioned.
Special_Circumstances: Not mentioned
Other_Requirements: Extracurricular activities are considered for Major Entrance Scholarships. Applicants may need to provide details on their extracurriculars as part of their application, elaborating within character limits.
Scholarship_Info: McGill University offers merit-based entrance scholarships to first-time university students entering a full-time undergraduate degree program. These awards are administered by McGill's Scholarships and Student Aid office and are broadly categorized into one-year entrance scholarships and renewable Major Entrance Scholarships. They can form a component of a broader financial assistance package.
Application_Documents: For Major Entrance Scholarships, the application may require detailed information regarding extracurricular activities.

Scholarship_Name: University of Calgary International Entrance Scholarship
Funding_Level: Fixed Amount, Tuition Waiver
Funding_Details:
The scholarship provides a substantial award of $20,000 per year.
It is renewable annually for the second, third, and fourth years of study, provided the recipient maintains eligibility criteria.
The scholarship funds are primarily intended to cover tuition expenses. However, recipients should note that they are still required to pay an international differential tuition fee as international students.
While often described as "fully funded" in some contexts, the $20,000 per year specifically targets tuition, and other living expenses may not be fully covered.
Eligibility_Criteria: Exclusively open to international students who are not permanent residents or citizens of Canada. Applicants must be entering the first year of an undergraduate degree program directly from high school. Candidates must be beginning their studies in the autumn term at the University of Calgary. Open to eligible students from all countries.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Final Year High School Student
Language_Certificate: TOEFL, IELTS, PTE Academic, Cambridge qualifications
Special_Circumstances: Not specified
Other_Requirements: Applicants are expected to demonstrate excellent academic potential and the capacity to contribute positively to the university community. Selection is based on outstanding achievements.
Scholarship_Info: The University of Calgary International Entrance Scholarship is a prestigious award designed to recognize and support outstanding international students commencing their undergraduate studies at the University of Calgary. Valued at $20,000 per year and renewable for up to four years, this scholarship aims to cover tuition expenses for recipients. It is highly competitive, with only two awards granted annually, and selection is based primarily on academic merit and demonstrated potential for contribution. It underscores the university's commitment to attracting global talent and fostering a diverse academic environment.
Application_Documents: Not specified, submitted online via My UCalgary Portal.

This fund is specifically designed to support Hungarian students pursuing higher education in the United States. Funding_Level: Tuition Waiver, Partial Funding, Full scholarship
Funding_Details: The ICSP scholarship provides tuition-waiver scholarships ranging from $9,000 to $35,000 per year, covering up to 15 credits per term each year. Some sources indicate a lower range starting from $6,000. The specific award amount can vary depending on the student's world region. It is described as a partial to full tuition scholarship. The scholarship primarily covers tuition fees. Multiple sources confirm it is a "tuition-waiver" scholarship, with some explicitly stating it applies to tuition only.
Quantity: Approximately 16 scholarships are awarded annually. However, other sources suggest varying numbers, with some indicating 8-12 awards and others mentioning 30-40 competitive scholarships.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to both new and continuing international students at the University of Oregon. Applicants must demonstrate sufficient financial resources in addition to the scholarship and also demonstrate financial need. The scholarship is renewable each year until the completion of a UO degree, provided the student consistently meets the requirements of the ICSP program. A core requirement of the ICSP program is for students to complete 66 to 80 hours per year of cultural service. This involves acting as cross-cultural ambassadors in the Eugene-Springfield area by giving presentations about their home country to various groups, including children, community organizations, and UO students, faculty, and staff.
Language_Certificate: Not explicitly stated as a scholarship requirement, but applicants must meet the University of Oregon's general admission requirements for English proficiency (e.g., IELTS, TOEFL).
Special_Circumstances: Not mentioned
Other_Requirements: Reference Letters are likely required, based on past application cycles. Application Process: 1. New students must first apply for admission to the University of Oregon. 2. Applicants must log into the UO Scholarship Dashboard using their Duck ID. 3. Submit the "Profile" and the "ISSS Endowed Scholarships Application." 4. Proceed to complete and submit the specific "ICSP Scholarship Application," which includes questions about the applicant's cultural background and experiences.
Scholarship_Info: The International Cultural Service Program (ICSP) is a unique and prestigious opportunity designed for international students at the University of Oregon. It serves as a vital program for international students, the university, and the wider Eugene/Springfield community by fostering cross-cultural understanding. Recipients are expected to embody the role of cross-cultural ambassadors, sharing insights into their home countries and cultures. The scholarship is renewable annually, contingent on adherence to program requirements, and provides significant tuition support.
Application_Documents: Scholarship Dashboard Profile, ISSS Endowed Scholarships Application, ICSP Scholarship Application. Reference Letters are also strongly implied as a requirement.

Funding_Level: Tuition Waiver, Partial Funding
Funding_Details: The scholarship offers a substantial financial benefit, covering 50% of the tuition fees. This is provided as a tuition fee waiver or reduction. The scholarship is merit-based, rewarding academic excellence. Multiple awards are granted each year, indicating a commitment by Griffith University to support a significant number of international students. Once awarded, the scholarship is applied prior to the census date of each trimester, contingent upon the student meeting ongoing enrolment requirements.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Applicants must be citizens of a country other than Australia or New Zealand. Applicants must be new, commencing students at Griffith University. Applicants must have received an offer to study at Griffith University by the scholarship application closing date.
A minimum GPA of 6.0 or above on a 7-point scale, or an equivalent academic standing in previous studies, is required.
The scholarship is applicable to all undergraduate and postgraduate coursework degree programs offered at Griffith University. It is explicitly not applicable to: Higher Degree Research (HDR) programs (e.g., PhD, Master by Research), Online programs, Non-award courses, Study-abroad programs.
To maintain the scholarship once awarded, recipients must adhere to the following conditions: Be enrolled full-time in their program of study, unless credit prevents full-time enrolment. Make satisfactory academic progress in their studies. Meet all requirements of their program of study. Meet all student visa requirements.
Scholarship_Info: The Griffith Vice Chancellor’s International Scholarship is a prestigious, merit-based scholarship offered by Griffith University in Australia. It is designed to attract and support exceptional international students pursuing undergraduate and postgraduate coursework degrees. The scholarship provides a significant 50% tuition fee waiver, making higher education at Griffith University more accessible for high-achieving students from around the globe.

Funding_Level: Fixed Amount, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
- Entrance Scholarship: A substantial $15,000 entrance scholarship awarded in the student's first year of studies. This monetary award is intended to support the student's educational and living expenses.
- Faculty Mentorship: Recipients gain access to valuable mentorship opportunities with University of Toronto faculty members, providing guidance and support for their academic and career development.
- utmONE Scholars Admission: The program includes admission to utmONE Scholars, an enriched academic program designed for high-achieving students at the University of Toronto Mississauga (UTM) campus.

Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must display high levels of academic excellence, distinguishing them as outstanding secondary school students. Open to both domestic and international secondary school students. Recipients must be applying to the first year of direct-entry undergraduate studies at the University of Toronto. Students are automatically considered for the scholarship upon admission to the University of Toronto; no separate application is required for the scholarship itself. The program is open to applicants to any of the University of Toronto's campuses (St. George, Mississauga, or Scarborough). While a specific minimum GPA is not explicitly published, the program targets "outstanding" and "highly qualified" students, indicating that a consistently high academic record is essential for consideration. Applicants are typically secondary school students applying for their first undergraduate degree.
Required_Degree: Final Year High School Student, High School Diploma
Min_Gpa: Not specified, but consistently high academic record is essential
Language_Certificate: TOEFL (88), IELTS (competitive overall score), if applicable

Other_Requirements: Applicants must meet the University of Toronto's general English language proficiency requirements, if applicable.
Scholarship_Info: The President's Scholars of Excellence Program (PSEP) is a prestigious distinction awarded by the University of Toronto to its most outstanding incoming first-year undergraduate students. Designed to recognize and support academic excellence, the program offers a significant entrance scholarship along with unique academic and professional development opportunities. Consideration for this scholarship is automatic upon admission to the University of Toronto, making it a highly sought-after award for top-tier secondary school students globally.

Scholarship_Name: MAECI Scholarship (Study in Italy Grant – Short-term/Living Allowance)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Fixed Amount, Stipend, Tuition Waiver, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The MAECI Scholarship is a fully funded program, offering comprehensive financial support to its recipients.
The scholarship provides a total grant of 9,000 euros. This includes a monthly living allowance of 1,000 euros. For those pursuing 3-month Italian language and culture courses, a specific grant of 3,000 euros is allocated.
The scholarship covers the following expenses:
*   Tuition Fees: Exemption from enrollment and tuition fees at Italian universities.
*   Health Insurance: Health and medical/accident insurance is provided directly by MAECI.
*   Living Allowance: A monthly living allowance of 1,000 euros.
Travel expenses to and from Italy are not explicitly listed among the covered expenses in the provided information.
Eligibility_Criteria: The MAECI Scholarship is open to foreign students living abroad and Italian citizens living abroad (IRE - Italian Residents Abroad). Both international and local students are eligible. Applicants must be pursuing Master's degree programs, PhD programs, higher education, advanced training, or research projects at top Italian universities and must meet academic criteria. For the 3-month Italian language and culture courses (which receive a €3,000 grant), prior admission to an Italian PhD program is a mandatory requirement. Applicants for Master's or PhD programs must have obtained their Bachelor's degree before submitting the MAECI scholarship application. While no minimum years of experience are specified, a strong Curriculum Vitae (CV) detailing educational background, work experience, and relevant extracurricular activities or achievements is highly valued. Applicants must demonstrate proficiency in either Italian or English, depending on the language of their chosen program. Strict age limits apply at the end of the application period: under 28 years for Master's Degree Programs / AFAM / Language Courses, under 30 years for PhD Programs, and under 40 years for Research Projects under Academic Supervision.
Eligible_Fields: higher education, advanced training, research, Master's degree programs, PhD programs, Italian language and culture courses
Experience_Years: No minimum years of experience are specified
Language_Certificate: English: B2 level (IELTS); Italian: A2 level (CEFR), with B2 level also stated as required in some contexts.
Age: Under 28 for Master's/AFAM/Language Courses; Under 30 for PhD Programs; Under 40 for Research Projects under Academic Supervision.
Special_Circumstances: often includes specific national quotas.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must meet academic criteria. For the 3-month Italian language and culture courses, prior admission to an Italian PhD program is a mandatory requirement. A strong Curriculum Vitae (CV) detailing educational background, work experience, and relevant extracurricular activities or achievements is highly valued. The scholarship can be renewed for the subsequent academic year, provided that students meet specified performance requirements.
Scholarship_Info: The MAECI Scholarship, officially known as the "MAECI Scholarship (Study in Italy Grant – Short-term/Living Allowance) for the academic year 2025–2026," is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship program provided by the Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI), also referred to as the Italian Government. This initiative is designed to strengthen cultural, scientific, and technological cooperation, promote the Italian language and culture globally, and support Italy’s role in international education and diplomacy. It aims to foster broad international cooperation and often includes specific national quotas. The scholarship is centrally managed through the official "Study in Italy Portal."
Application_Documents:
*   Valid passport or identity document.
*   Curriculum Vitae (CV) detailing educational background, work experience, and relevant activities/achievements.
*   Reference letter(s).
*   Research proposal or study plan (mandatory for PhD and research applicants, detailing objectives and methodology).
*   B2 level English language proficiency certificate (e.g., IELTS).
*   Italian language level certificate (minimum A2 CEFR, with B2 CEFR also stated as required in some contexts).
*   Work experience letter (may be required, potentially after the scholarship opens).
*   Official Scholarship Award Letter (for visa application post-award).
Timeline:
February 10, 2025 : Document submission possible
April 24, 2025 : Applications open
May 16, 2025 : Application Deadline (2:00 PM CET)

Eligibility_Criteria: Open to students pursuing full-time publicly-funded degree or above level programmes, including both undergraduate and postgraduate programmes that are publicly/UGC-funded. The scheme is open to current students who are actively pursuing eligible programmes. Applicants must demonstrate outstanding academic performance. Specific GPA requirements vary significantly by institution: Some institutions require a minimum Year GPA of 3.3. Others may require a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.7 by the end of the preceding academic year. A minimum GPA of 3.33 has also been noted in some contexts. No specific requirements for minimum years of experience, language test certificates (like IELTS/TOEFL), reference letters, career plans, age limits, gender, or special circumstances are universally stated for this scholarship type, though individual institutions may have their own internal nomination processes that consider these factors.

Excellent performance in academic studies, demonstrated leadership abilities, and good communication skills are essential. For some institutions (e.g., PolyU), students must have attained a minimum of 24 credits in the preceding academic year (e.g., 2023/24 for the 2025/26 award).
Scholarship_Info: The HKSAR Government Scholarship Fund (GSF) - Scholarship for Outstanding Performance (OPS) is a prestigious award established in 2008 by the HKSAR Government to recognize and support outstanding students pursuing full-time publicly-funded degree or above level programmes in Hong Kong. The scholarship aims to foster academic excellence, encourage contributions to the institution and society, and develop leadership and communication skills among students. It is one of the five key scholarships under the broader GSF.
