Scholarship_Name: University of Hong Kong Scholarships (General International Awards)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details: These fully funded scholarships target outstanding international students across undergraduate, master’s, and PhD programs. They cover tuition fees and provide a living stipend. For full-time PhD and MPhil students, the Postgraduate Scholarship (PGS) offers a basic level of HK$19,135 per month, effective from September 1, 2025. The Hong Kong PhD Fellowship Scheme (HKPFS), a highly competitive award, provides an annual stipend of HK$337,200 (approximately US$43,230) and a conference and research-related travel allowance of HK$14,000. Other scholarships, such as those offered by the HKSAR Government, provide up to HK$80,000 per year for non-local students. Some prestigious awards, like the Hong Kong Jockey Club Chairman’s Scholarship and the Future Leaders Award (mentioned in the context of Hong Kong scholarships), can cover full tuition fees plus an allowance of HKD60,000 per academic year.
Quantity: Historically: over 430 students from Hong Kong and about 40 countries/regions; another year about 200 students from Hong Kong and over 30 countries/regions. HKPFS: more than 230 PhD Fellowships in 2017/18.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be outstanding international students applying for undergraduate, master’s, or PhD programs. For the Postgraduate Scholarship (PGS), full-time PhD and MPhil students who hold a first degree with second-class honours first division (or equivalent) or above are normally considered eligible. Entrance Scholarships are specifically awarded to outstanding overseas students. Certain scholarships target specific demographics, such as non-local students from any countries along the Belt and Road for publicly-funded research postgraduate programs, and non-local recipients from APEC member economies for the "Hong Kong, China-APEC Scholarship."
Eligible_Fields: Business Administration, Economics, Education, Environmental Management, International Affairs, Eligible PhD Programmes offered by participating institutions
Eligible_Field_Group: Economics & Business, Education & Training, Agriculture & Environment, Humanities & Social Sciences
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree, MPhil, PhD
Min_Gpa: First degree with second-class honours first division (or equivalent) or above
Language_Certificate: Not explicitly detailed, check program admission requirements
Special_Circumstances: Non-local students from any countries along the Belt and Road are eligible for certain research postgraduate programs; Non-local recipients from APEC member economies may be awarded the "Hong Kong, China-APEC Scholarship."
Other_Requirements: Demonstration of outstanding academic and non-academic achievements is crucial for selection; Satisfactory academic progress required for scholarship renewal (PGS)
Scholarship_Info: The University of Hong Kong (HKU) offers a range of prestigious scholarships and awards for outstanding international students across undergraduate, master’s, and PhD programs. These "General International Awards" aim to attract top global talent and are recognized as competitive, fully funded opportunities. HKU provides various international scholarships, fellowships, and grants, including the Hong Kong Scholarships for Leadership, Postgraduate Scholarship (PGS), HKU Presidential PhD Scholar Programme (HKU-PS), and Hong Kong PhD Fellowship Scheme (HKPFS).
Application_Documents: Completed application form, Supporting documents (may include reference letters)
Timeline: September 01, 2025 : Postgraduate Scholarship (PGS) basic level effective; November 21, 2025 : Application Deadline for For Our Future Scholarship 2025-26; December 01, 2025 : Application Deadline for Hong Kong PhD Fellowship Scheme (HKPFS) for 2026 intake; December 31, 2025 : Application Deadline for General Scholarship Application System (by 6pm); January 02, 2026 : Application Deadline for HKU ADB Scholarship 2026

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation
Funding_Details: The Evans Scholarship is a life-changing, full tuition and housing college scholarship. It covers the entirety of tuition and housing expenses, with a potential value reaching up to $120,000. This comprehensive coverage ensures that recipients can focus on their academic pursuits without the burden of significant educational costs. Funding for the scholarships is robust, stemming from a diverse array of sources including private donations, various fundraising events, and proceeds from professional and amateur golf tournaments held nationwide each year.
Quantity: Currently enrolled: 1,260. Total graduates since 1930: Over 12,575. University of Chicago partnership: at least 4 new scholarships annually.
Eligibility_Criteria: The WGA Evans Scholars Program targets high-achieving caddies who demonstrate significant financial need. Applicants must possess a strong caddie record, which entails having caddied regularly and successfully for a minimum of two years, and are expected to continue caddying at their sponsoring club. A record of excellent academic performance is essential. Applicants must demonstrate limited financial means, as the scholarship is both merit-based and need-based. Outstanding character and leadership qualities are crucial considerations. Applicants must be residents of the United States. The program is open to both high school seniors and college freshmen. Beyond academic and caddying achievements, applicants are expected to demonstrate outstanding character and leadership qualities, often evidenced through participation in clubs or other extracurricular activities.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Final Year High School Student
Experience_Years: A minimum of two years of regular and successful caddying experience is mandatory.
Language_Certificate: Not mentioned
Special_Circumstances: Not outlined
Other_Requirements: Applicants are expected to demonstrate outstanding character and leadership qualities, often evidenced through participation in clubs or other extracurricular activities.
Scholarship_Info: The WGA Evans Scholars Program is a prestigious college scholarship provided by the Western Golf Association Evans Scholars Foundation (WGAESF). Headquartered in Glenview, Illinois, the Foundation operates as a nonprofit organization under the Western Golf Association. Its core mission, established in 1930, is to offer full tuition and housing college scholarships to deserving golf caddies in the United States who demonstrate limited financial means. It stands as the nation's largest scholarship program specifically for caddies.
Application_Documents: Essay: Not required. Reference Letters: Not explicitly provided.
Timeline:
Beginning of an applicant's senior year of high school : Applications open annually.
October 15 : Annual application deadline.

CIEE is a significant provider of study abroad financial aid, awarding over $10 million in scholarships and grants annually. These funds are designed to help students pursue their international education dreams. While the total number of individual awards is not explicitly stated for all college programs, specific grants may have limited awards (e.g., up to 10 grants for some, or a single annual award for others). Scholarships and grants from CIEE can help cover a variety of study abroad expenses, including:
Airfare
Local transportation
Books and supplies
Visa fees
Other personal expenses
Quantity: Over $10 million in scholarships and grants annually. Total number of individual awards across all college programs is not specified. Some specific grants may offer a limited number of awards (e.g., up to 10 grants for a particular scholarship, or one annual award for another).
Eligibility_Criteria: Eligibility requirements are specific to each scholarship or grant. Awards are primarily based on demonstrated financial need, proven academic merit, and alignment with specific CIEE program areas. Some scholarships may have additional criteria, such as: Academic Standing (applicants may need to be a freshman, sophomore, or junior), Financial Need (Pell-eligible students are often prioritized for certain need-based awards), Diversity (identifying as an ethnicity typically underrepresented on study abroad programs, e.g., American Indian/Alaska Native, Asian, Black/African). All students applying for CIEE funding must complete the CIEE Study Abroad Scholarships & Grants task within their program application by the stated deadline.
Language_Certificate: No specific IELTS, TOEFL, or other language certificates are mentioned as a requirement for scholarship eligibility. Program-specific language requirements may apply for admission to certain study abroad programs.

Career_Plan: Not explicitly mentioned as a scholarship requirement.
Other_Requirements: Merit-based scholarships typically require a brief essay of 300 words or less. The essay topic focuses on how the chosen CIEE program will impact the applicant.
Scholarship_Info: CIEE aims to make study abroad accessible by offering a wide range of scholarships and grants to college students. These awards support participation in over 200 programs across 41 countries in Asia, Australia, Africa, Latin America, and Europe. The scholarships are categorized into need-based, merit-based, and other specific funding areas, providing financial aid for various program types including semester, summer, and quarter abroad programs.
Application_Documents:
Completion of the CIEE Study Abroad Scholarships & Grants task within the main program application.
A brief essay (300 words or less) for merit-based scholarships, detailing the impact of the CIEE program.

It is important to distinguish the International Merit Scholarship from other Monash scholarships like the Research Training Program (RTP) Scholarships or the John Monash Scholarships, which have different providers and deadlines.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Covered Expenses:
*   Full tuition and fees for academic studies at selected U.S. universities.
*   A monthly maintenance allowance (living stipend) to cover accommodation, meals, and personal expenses.
*   Accident and Sickness Program for Fellows.
*   Round-trip international travel to and from the United States.
*   Travel within the United States as required for program activities.
*   Books and other essential academic materials.

Exclusions:
It is important to note that the fellowship explicitly does not cover the expenses of the grantee's accompanying family members.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be mid-career professionals with a demonstrated commitment to public service. Candidates must be citizens of one of the designated participating countries. Applicants must contact their U.S. Embassy or Binational Fulbright Commission in their home country for complete application details and to confirm their country's eligibility. The program is strictly for non-degree graduate-level study. Individuals primarily concerned with expanding a corporate focus or those seeking a degree program are generally not suitable for this fellowship. Candidates are typically experienced professionals. For some fields or countries (e.g., Estonia), a doctoral degree or equivalent in medicine, health, behavioral, or social science is preferred. Applicants must have a minimum of five years of full-time professional experience in their relevant field prior to the application deadline, gained after completing their undergraduate degree. The program targets accomplished mid-career professionals, experienced professionals, policy makers, and administrative managers. While not universally strict, some countries have preferred age ranges (e.g., Thailand: 30 to 55 years of age). Specific country requirements apply, such as being a citizen in good health (e.g., Thailand).
Eligible_Fields: Economic Development, Finance and Banking, Public Policy Analysis and Public Administration, Technology Policy and Management, Other fields focusing on contemporary development issues, including population growth and agriculture.
Eligible_Field_Group: Economics & Business, Law & Public Policy, Engineering & Technology, IT & Data Science, Humanities & Social Sciences, Social Services & Care, Agriculture & Environment
Min_Gpa: Thailand: 2.75/4.0 (Bachelor's), Guatemala: 85/100 or top 15% of class. Other countries: Not specified.
Experience_Years: Minimum 5 years of full-time professional experience after undergraduate degree.
Language_Certificate: Not explicitly stated; consult local U.S. Embassy or Fulbright Commission.
Age: Preferred range 30-55 for some countries (e.g., Thailand); not universally strict.
Special_Circumstances: Not mentioned
Career_Plan: Not explicitly detailed; refer to specific application instructions.
Other_Requirements: Specific country requirements apply, such as being a citizen in good health (e.g., Thailand). The fellowship does not cover the expenses of the grantee's accompanying family members.
Scholarship_Info: The Hubert H. Humphrey Fellowship Program is a prestigious, one-year, non-degree, full scholarship offered by the U.S. Government to accomplished mid-career professionals from designated countries worldwide. Administered by Fulbright Commissions and the Institute of International Education (IIE), the program focuses on professional enrichment and non-degree graduate-level study in the United States. It aims to enhance leadership capabilities and expand professional networks, particularly for individuals engaged in contemporary development issues.
Application_Documents: Application instructions and a list of approved fields of study are typically available for download from the respective U.S. Embassy or Fulbright Commission websites. Requirements for reference letters or a career plan are not explicitly detailed.

The discount is provided for the normal full-time duration of the awardee's course.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The Match Scholarship is a comprehensive full four-year scholarship, valued at over $325,000, covering the full cost of college at the recipient's matched school. This extensive coverage includes:
*   Tuition
*   Housing (room and board)
*   Books and supplies
*   Travel expenses
Beyond the financial coverage, the program also provides significant logistical benefits, such as waived application fees when applying to college partners through the National College Match application.
Quantity: Recent year: 2,627 Finalists matched; Cumulatively: over 17,000 high school seniors have received full four-year scholarships.
Eligibility_Criteria: The QuestBridge National College Match targets high-achieving, low-income high school seniors in the U.S. Applicants must be U.S. Citizens or Permanent Residents, OR students, regardless of citizenship, who are currently attending high school in the U.S. Candidates must be academically distinguished, demonstrating a strong academic record and rigor (holistically reviewed, no minimum GPA specified). Applicants must demonstrate significant financial need; most matched finalists have a Student Aid Index (SAI) of -1500. Family income levels around $50,000 are often cited as examples for qualifying as low-income, though QuestBridge assesses this holistically. The scholarship is exclusively for high school seniors applying for an undergraduate degree. Standardized test scores (such as SAT/ACT) are often considered but the program does not explicitly mandate them, suggesting a flexible approach.
Language_Certificate: Not explicitly mandated
Special_Circumstances: High-achieving students from low-income backgrounds
Other_Requirements: Letters of recommendation are typically a standard component of college applications submitted through QuestBridge.
Scholarship_Info: The QuestBridge National College Match is a distinctive college and scholarship application program for high-achieving, low-income high school seniors in the U.S. It offers a unique pathway to early admission and a full four-year scholarship to one of QuestBridge's college partners, matching students to top institutions across the United States.
Application_Documents: The primary application document is the National College Match application itself.
Timeline:
Late summer : National College Match application opens
September : Students submit National College Match application
Late September : Application deadline for Finalist status
QuestBridge reviews applications to determine Finalist status
Finalists have the opportunity to rank their preferred college partners
Students are notified of their Match Scholarship status
Finalists who do not match with a college or choose not to rank colleges can still leverage their QuestBridge application to apply to college partners through other early and regular decision opportunities

Funding_Level: Fixed Amount, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Each Dell Scholar receives a $20,000 scholarship, intended to lessen the burden of loans and debt associated with higher education.
Beyond the monetary scholarship, the program provides a comprehensive package of support, including:
*   A laptop
*   Textbook credits
*   Free teletherapy services
*   Access to discounted legal, financial, health, and personal services, designed to help students navigate challenges through college and into their careers.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be a high school senior on track to graduate from an accredited high school. They must be dedicated to pursuing a college education and plan to enroll at an accredited bachelor’s program in the fall directly following high school graduation. Participation in an approved college readiness program during their junior (11th) and senior (12th) years of high school is mandatory (e.g., 10,000 Degrees, ASPIRE, AVID). Applicants must demonstrate significant financial need, typically evidenced by being Pell Grant Eligible. Personal qualities are highly valued: applicants are expected to have overcome adversity and demonstrate "G.P.A." – grit (overcoming challenges), potential (participating in a college readiness program), and ambition (desire to obtain a college degree). The program places greater emphasis on a student's determination to succeed than on their academic record and test scores.
Language_Certificate: Not specified
Special_Circumstances: Applicants must demonstrate that they have overcome adversity and are Pell Grant Eligible, indicating significant financial need.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must complete one essay. Participation in an approved college readiness program in grades 11 and 12 is mandatory. Must plan to enroll at an accredited bachelor’s program in the fall directly after high school graduation. One letter of recommendation is required.
Scholarship_Info: The Dell Scholars Program, provided by the Michael & Susan Dell Foundation, is a comprehensive scholarship and college completion program designed to support high school seniors in the U.S. who are dedicated to pursuing a bachelor's degree. The program offers a significant financial award of $20,000, along with a suite of non-monetary benefits aimed at ensuring college success. A key distinguishing factor is its emphasis on a student's determination to succeed and their ability to overcome adversity, rather than solely focusing on academic record or test scores. Since its inception in 2004, the program has supported 6,000 scholars, with over 4,500 having successfully graduated from college.
Application_Documents:
The initial application is completed online. Semifinalists will be asked to provide additional documents, which include:
*   One letter of recommendation
*   A copy of their high school transcript
*   FAFSA Student Aid Report
*   One essay
Timeline:
October 1st : Application Opening Date
December 1st : Application Deadline

Funding_Level: Fixed Amount, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The Coca-Cola Scholars Program awards a substantial $20,000 scholarship to 150 students annually. The scholarship funds are versatile and can be used to cover a range of educational expenses. These include:
*   Tuition fees
*   Other school-related costs
*   General educational expenses
The scholarship supports undergraduate education at any accredited U.S. college or university for a duration of four years.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be current high school seniors, enrolled in high school, and planning to graduate the following year. Students who have already graduated from high school prior to the application year are not eligible. Only students eligible to apply for Federal Financial Aid are eligible for this scholarship, including U.S. Citizens, Permanent Residents, Asylum-Seekers or Asylees, Conditional Permanent Residents, and Cuban or Haitian Entrants. A minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is required at the time of application. Applicants must have taken at least three courses in each of the following core subjects: English, math, science, and social studies. Immediate family members (children or grandchildren) of current Coca-Cola Company employees or Coca-Cola Scholars Program staff are not eligible to apply.
Experience_Years: Not specified, but applicants are required to submit a professional resume outlining their academic, service, social, and career (employment/internship/externship) experiences.
Language_Certificate: Not specified
Age: Implicitly set by high school senior requirement
Special_Circumstances: Immediate family members (children or grandchildren) of current Coca-Cola Company employees or Coca-Cola Scholars Program staff are not eligible to apply.
Career_Plan: Not explicitly required, though personal statements often touch upon future aspirations.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must have completed at least three courses in English, math, science, and social studies.
Scholarship_Info: The Coca-Cola Scholars Program is a prestigious achievement-based scholarship provided by the Coca-Cola Scholars Foundation. It is designed to support exceptional high school seniors in their pursuit of undergraduate education within the United States. The scholarship aims to foster future leaders by providing significant financial assistance and a network of support. It is a highly sought-after scholarship that recognizes and rewards high school seniors who demonstrate exceptional leadership, service, and academic achievement, providing them with significant support for their undergraduate journey.
Application_Documents:
Required Documents:
*   A recent professional resume detailing academic, service, social, and career experiences.
*   A one-page typed or printed personal statement/essay.
*   For semifinalist applicants, a recommendation letter from a faculty member is required.
Timeline:
August 1 : Phase 1 application typically opens
September 30 (5 PM Eastern Time) : Phase 1 application closes
November 5 : Semifinalist notification (approximately 2,000 applicants)
Phase 2 Submission : Semifinalists submit additional materials, including the faculty recommendation letter
Final Selection : 150 Coca-Cola Scholars are ultimately selected

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
•   Full tuition fees for the Master of Arts in China Studies program.
•   Accommodation in the Yenching Academy's residential college or Yenching Academy House.
•   A generous monthly stipend to cover living expenses, including campus living costs and expenses related to field studies.
•   Travel expenses, specifically one round-trip journey to and from Beijing.
•   Costs for study fields and related fees.
•   Basic health insurance.
Eligibility_Criteria:
The scholarship is open to individuals from all nationalities, with no specific citizenship requirement. However, application deadlines and processes may differ for international applicants, as well as citizens of Hong Kong, Macao, Taiwan, or mainland China.
Applicants must hold a Bachelor's degree in any field, or be currently enrolled in a degree program that will be awarded no later than August 31 of the year in which they wish to enroll.
A strong interest in the interdisciplinary study of China is essential.
Applicants should demonstrate an outstanding academic record.
A record of extracurricular achievement, community engagement, social responsibility, and leadership potential is highly valued.
English proficiency is required.
Min_Gpa: Minimum GPA of 2.50 (or the equivalent). Most successful applicants typically have a GPA of 3.7 or higher.
Language_Certificate:
IELTS: Minimum score of 7.0.
TOEFL iBT: Minimum score of 100.
Exemptions may be granted if the applicant has completed a degree program taught entirely in English.
Special_Circumstances:
Partner Universities: Applicants from partner universities must first apply through their home university’s internal pre-selection process before submitting their application to the Yenching Academy.
Hong Kong, Macao, and Taiwan (HMT) Applicants: These applicants must apply through *both* the Peking University Graduate Admissions website (http://www.studyatpku.com) and the Yenching Academy online admissions portal. An additional Peking University deadline in January 2026 applies to HMT applicants.
Campus Deadlines: Many institutions have internal campus deadlines that precede the official Yenching Academy deadline. Prospective applicants should check with their university's fellowships or international programs office for specific internal deadlines (e.g., November 1st or November 4th).
Other_Requirements:
There is no application fee for the Yenching Academy Scholarship.
Applicants are expected to demonstrate an outstanding academic record, a strong interest in the interdisciplinary study of China, and a proven track record of extracurricular achievement, community engagement, social responsibility, and leadership potential.
Scholarship_Info: The Yenching Academy offers a one- or two-year Master of Arts in China Studies degree program. This is an intensive, residential program that provides interdisciplinary classroom and field study of Chinese history and culture, alongside real-time issues in China’s development. The program aims to prepare a diverse group of exceptional international and Chinese students with profound knowledge of China, enabling them to become global citizens and leaders. Scholars are deeply immersed in Chinese culture through field excursions and an intensive Chinese language program integrated into their degree studies. The Academy's residential program fosters a community of enthusiastic, globally oriented young innovators within Peking University.
Application_Documents:
•   Completed online application form, submitted via the Yenching Academy admissions portal.
•   Personal statement (maximum 750 words).
•   Two Academic Letters of Recommendation.
•   Two Yenching Recommendation Forms.
Timeline:
September 10, 2025 : Application Opening Date
November 1, 2025 : Example Campus Deadline (UCLA)
November 4, 2025 : Example Campus Deadline (Wellesley)
December 1, 2025 (9:00 am Beijing Time) : Main Application Deadline
January 2026 : Additional Peking University deadline for HMT applicants

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Fixed Amount
Funding_Details:
Recipients of the International Talents @Unibo scholarship will receive a comprehensive financial package that includes:
*   A study grant of €6,500 gross.
*   Full exemption from tuition fees.
Eligibility_Criteria: To be eligible for the International Talents @Unibo scholarship, applicants must meet the following requirements: Be a deserving international student intending to enroll in a Second Cycle Degree Programme (Master's) at the University of Bologna for the 2025/26 academic year. Must have obtained, or be in the process of obtaining, a qualification from a non-Italian education system that qualifies them for admission to a second-cycle degree program at the University of Bologna. Applicants are required to have taken the GRE test by the application deadline. Verification of financial status is mandatory; if income/assets are outside Italy, an equivalent financial status certification is required; for income/assets in Italy, an ISEE 2025 (Equivalent Economic Situation Indicator) certificate is necessary. The scholarship cannot be granted to students who register in multiple or joint programs for which the fees have to be paid to a partner university. A minimum GPA of 3.0 is required. Applicants must demonstrate English proficiency.
Eligible_Fields: Second Cycle Degree Programmes (Master’s degree programs) across various disciplines, including engineering, social sciences, health, humanities, and International Horticultural Science.
Eligible_Field_Group: Engineering & Technology, Humanities & Social Sciences, Healthcare & Medicine, Agriculture & Environment
Language_Certificate: English proficiency required, specific certificates not detailed.
Special_Circumstances: The University of Bologna offers separate support for students from the Gaza Strip, providing 9 scholarships for enrollment in degree programs or single learning activities in the a.y. 2024/25. These are distinct from the International Talents @Unibo scholarships. Students granted international protection are eligible to apply for scholarships offered by the Italian Ministry of the Interior in partnership with CRUI.
Other_Requirements: Register on the University of Bologna’s application portal. Complete the online application form specifically for the "International Talents @Unibo" scholarship, ensuring all required fields are accurately filled. Send GRE scores to the University of Bologna (Institution Code: 7850).
Scholarship_Info: The "International Talents @Unibo" scholarship program, offered by the University of Bologna, is a prestigious initiative designed to attract and support outstanding international students pursuing Second Cycle Degree Programmes (Master's) in Italy. It aims to provide financial assistance and encouragement to deserving international students enrolling in its second-cycle (Master's) degree programs.
Application_Documents:
GRE test results.
Documentation on the family's economic situation (ISEE 2025 certificate or equivalent financial status certification for non-Italian income/assets).
Qualification from a non-Italian education system that enables admission to a second-cycle degree program.
Timeline:
Currently open : Application Opening
2025-05-30 12:00 CEST : Application Deadline

Funding_Level: Fixed Amount, Other Costs, Stipend
Funding_Details: The ACI Foundation Scholarship provides a substantial educational stipend of $5,000. This stipend is intended to cover a range of educational expenses, including tuition, residence, room, books, materials, and other general educational costs. The award amount is paid directly to the student in two equal installments over the course of one year.
Eligibility_Criteria: The scholarship is open to both graduate and undergraduate students. Applicants must be enrolled as full-time students for the entire duration of the scholarship award term. It is available to citizens of all world countries, making international students eligible for non-region-specific awards. Candidates are required to maintain a minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Proof of English proficiency is a mandatory requirement for all applicants. No specified age limits, gender requirements, or special circumstances mentioned as eligibility criteria.
Eligible_Fields: Construction, Construction Management, Design, Structures, Architecture, Materials, Forensic Engineering, Civil Engineering, Concrete Technology, CIM (Concrete Industry Management) programs
Eligible_Field_Group: Construction & Planning, Engineering & Technology, Economics & Business
Language_Certificate: TOEFL, IELTS, or written statement of English proficiency
Special_Circumstances: Not mentioned
Other_Requirements: Applicants must be full-time students throughout the scholarship award term.
Scholarship_Info: The ACI Foundation Scholarship program encompasses both fellowships and scholarships, offering a comprehensive support system for students in concrete-related disciplines. The awards are for the 2026-2027 academic year, specifically covering the 2026 fall semester. The educational stipend is disbursed directly to the student in two equal installments over one year. Recipients gain recognition in Concrete International magazine and on the ACI Foundation's platforms.
Application_Documents: Applicants are required to submit a resume, which must be in Microsoft Word (.doc) format. Additionally, proof of English proficiency, either through TOEFL/IELTS scores or a written statement, is necessary. All submitted documents must be in the English language.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs, Partial Funding
Funding_Details:
The scholarships offered at Tsinghua University are predominantly fully funded, particularly the Chinese Government Scholarship (CGS) and the Schwarzman Scholars Program. The Beijing Government Scholarship covers tuition costs in full or in part.

Covered Expenses (for Full CGS):
*   Tuition Fees: Full coverage.
*   Accommodation: Free university dormitory or an accommodation subsidy.
*   Stipend: A monthly living allowance.
*   Medical Insurance: Comprehensive medical insurance.

Partial CGS: Includes one or a few items from the Full CGS benefits.

Schwarzman Scholars Program: This is a one-year, fully-funded Master's program.
Quantity: Approximately 60 scholarships are awarded (for Chinese Government Scholarship (CGS) at Tsinghua University)
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be non-Chinese citizens. Must possess a valid ordinary-type passport. Applying for full-time international graduate programs (Master's or PhD). Candidates should be outstanding students.
Language_Certificate: Not detailed, consult official program admission requirements
Special_Circumstances: Not specified
Other_Requirements: Pre-admission Status: Tsinghua University only selects scholarship candidates from students who have already been pre-admitted to a graduate program. This is a crucial step in the application process. Annual Review: Scholarship recipients are subject to an annual review to ensure continued eligibility and academic progress.
Scholarship_Info: Tsinghua University offers a range of scholarships to attract outstanding international students, primarily for graduate-level studies. These scholarships aim to support academic excellence and foster global talent within China's leading educational institutions. The most prominent among these is the Chinese Government Scholarship (CGS), but other significant opportunities include the Schwarzman Scholars Program and the Beijing Government Scholarship.
Application_Documents: A detailed list of required application documents is not provided in the collected evidence. Applicants should refer to the official Tsinghua University graduate admissions portal for comprehensive instructions and document checklists.
Timeline:

February 28, 2026 : Primary deadline for Chinese Government Scholarship (CGS) and Beijing Government Scholarship applications
March 31, 2026 : General application deadline for MScIH
September 2026 : Expected program start date
Ongoing : Schwarzman Scholars Program applications are open for the 2026/2027 academic year
Not explicitly stated : Specific opening dates for all scholarships, but applications are generally open several months prior to the respective deadlines

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Partial Funding, Stipend
Funding_Details:
The Bocconi Merit and International Awards are comprehensive scholarships for international students, primarily for the Academic Year 2026-2027, with some provisions for AY 2025-2026. The awards are structured into two main types:
*   **Merit Award:** This is a fully funded scholarship providing a full tuition waiver, valued at approximately €12,000 per year for Undergraduate programs and up to €13,000 per year for Graduate programs. Crucially, the Merit Award also includes free accommodation. The Bocconi Graduate Merit Award specifically covers full tuition and fees for the academic year 2025-2026.
*   **International Award:** This award consists of a 50% tuition reduction, worth approximately €6,000 per year. The exact value of the reduction is based on the applicant’s assigned tuition bracket.
**Covered Expenses:**
Recipients of these awards can expect to have the following expenses covered:
*   Full or partial tuition fee waivers.
*   Housing allowances, with free accommodation specifically for Merit Award recipients.
*   Stipends (details on specific amounts are not provided).
Students admitted to the MSc in Cyber Risk Strategy and Governance, a joint degree with Politecnico di Milano, may also be eligible for the Cyber Partnership Scholarship, which is equivalent to the Bocconi Graduate Merit Award.
Quantity: limited number of these scholarships each academic year.
Eligibility_Criteria: Candidates must be outstanding international applicants admitted to the first year of a Bachelor Program or Master of Science program at Bocconi University. The candidate's academic profile must be considered among the top applicants. Evaluation is primarily based on the candidate's academic achievement, including GPA, SAT or GMAT scores, combined with their personal profile as presented in their CV. The awards are automatically renewed for subsequent years, typically for a maximum of two years (or four years for Law programs), provided the recipient meets specific minimum GPA and academic progress conditions. For example, for AY 2025-2026, awardees must earn at least 50 credits as of August 10, 2025. The exact number of credits and GPA requirements will be specified in the scholarship acceptance form.
Eligible_Fields: Bachelor Programs, Master of Science programs, including the MSc in Cyber Risk Strategy and Governance (a Joint Degree with Politecnico di Milano).
Eligible_Field_Group: Economics & Business, Law & Public Policy, IT & Data Science, Humanities & Social Sciences
Language_Certificate: Proficiency in English is a mandatory requirement for all applicants. Valid test scores are necessary, and specific requirements include: IELTS Academic: A minimum score of 6.5, with at least 6 in every section. TOEFL IBT: A minimum score of 88. Duolingo English Test: A minimum score of 110. GRE/GMAT: A GRE or GMAT score is highly recommended for applicants, particularly for graduate programs, and is a significant factor in the academic evaluation.
Special_Circumstances: No requirement
Other_Requirements: International Student Status
Scholarship_Info: The Bocconi Merit and International Awards are prestigious scholarships offered by Bocconi University, a leading private university in Business and Economics in Italy. These awards are specifically designed to attract and support outstanding international students pursuing their academic goals in Italy.
Application_Documents:
Applicants must submit the following as part of their online admissions application:
*   Online Admissions Application form.
*   Curriculum Vitae (CV).
*   SAT or GMAT score (for academic evaluation).
*   English proficiency test scores (IELTS/TOEFL/Duolingo).
*   GRE/GMAT score (highly recommended, especially for graduate programs).
Timeline:
Applications for Bocconi University Scholarships are generally open.
November 2024 to May 2025 : Graduate Programs Deadlines (align with admission rounds)
November 12, 2025 : Application Opening Date for Bachelor and Law Programs (Early Session/HEC 1st round AY 2026-27)
November 30, 2025 : Application Deadline for Undergraduate Merit Awards
December 3, 2025 : Application Deadline for Bachelor and Law Programs (Early Session/HEC 1st round AY 2026-27)
Academic Year 2026-2027 : Scholarships available

Funding_Level: Partial Funding, Fixed Amount
Funding_Details:
Western University offers a range of admission scholarships for international students, which are partially funded. The scholarships are primarily monetary awards to offset educational costs.

Key scholarships include:
*   International President's Entrance Scholarships: three scholarships valued at $100,000 each and five additional scholarships valued at $50,000 each.
*   Automatic Admission Scholarships:
    *   Western Scholarship of Excellence: $8,000
    *   Western Scholarship of Distinction: $3,500
    *   Western Admission Scholarship: $2,500
*   Meena and Amit Chakma International Student Scholarship
*   Transfer Student Admission Scholarships

Specific covered expenses are not detailed; the scholarships provide direct monetary awards.
Quantity: Three $100,000 International President's Entrance Scholarships and five $50,000 scholarships are available for international students. The exact number of automatic scholarships (Excellence, Distinction, Admission) is not specified, as they are awarded based on meeting academic thresholds.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be international students entering full-time undergraduate studies at Western University. Consideration for the Western International Admission Scholarships is guaranteed if the admission application through the Ontario Universities’ Application Centre (OUAC) along with all supporting documents is submitted by March 15th. Automatic scholarships are specifically for students admitted directly from secondary school. Separate admission scholarships are available for students transferring into an upper year of an undergraduate program from another post-secondary institution.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Final Year High School Student
Min_Gpa: Western Admission Scholarship: 90.0% to 91.9% average. Western Scholarship of Excellence: Top high school admission averages. International President's Entrance Scholarships: Highly competitive, implying exceptional academic achievement.
Language_Certificate: Required for university admission, not explicitly for scholarship
Special_Circumstances: Not mentioned
Other_Requirements: Timely submission of the admission application through the Ontario Universities’ Application Centre (OUAC) along with all supporting documents by March 15th for guaranteed consideration for the Western International Admission Scholarships. No specific requirements for reference letters.
Scholarship_Info: Western University, located in Canada, offers a robust program of undergraduate admission scholarships for international students, aiming to attract high-achieving individuals. These scholarships are distinct from those offered by other institutions.
Application_Documents: Complete admission application submitted through the Ontario Universities’ Application Centre (OUAC), along with all necessary supporting documents for university admission.
Timeline:
2024-12-01 : General Scholarship Application Opening Date for the 2025-2026 academic year
2025-03-01 : General Scholarship Application Deadline
2025-03-15 : Guaranteed Consideration Deadline for Western International Admission Scholarships

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Partial Funding, Stipend, Fixed Amount, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Benefits typically include:
*   Tuition Fees: Full or partial coverage of SMU tuition fees, with some scholarships offering full tuition fee waivers or subsidies. For instance, the Sumners Foundation Scholarship covers the full cost of tuition and fees. Some scholarships may cover approximately 75% of tuition and fees.
*   Overseas Experiences: Sponsorship for university-related overseas trips, including a study abroad experience during the May term of the sophomore year for some awards. Annual Scholarships for Study Abroad 2025 specifically offer tuition fee subsidies and a monthly stipend.
*   Living Expenses & Textbooks: A stipend for living expenses and textbooks is often included, particularly with comprehensive scholarships like the Sumners Foundation Scholarship.
*   Full Sponsorship: Certain scholarships, such as those for STEM subjects, offer full sponsorship.

Award Amounts:
*   Scholarships for study abroad experiences typically range from $500 to $4,000, depending on financial need and available funding.
*   SMU awards an average of $21,500.00 to each student.
*   Grants, which require FAFSA submission, can provide up to $2,000 per academic year.
Quantity: Approximately 35 SMU Merit Scholarships are awarded annually; Overall, about 1 in 3 freshmen at SMU receive a scholarship or financial award.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Eligibility requirements are diverse and specific to each scholarship, but common criteria include:
*   Citizenship/Residency: Singapore Citizens or Permanent Residents are required for scholarships such as the GMC Scholarship, Wee Kim Wee Scholarship, and STEM scholarships. Other scholarships, like the SMU School of Computing and Information Systems (SCIS) Scholarship and CCPL Scholarship, are open to both local and foreign undergraduates.
*   Academic Standing: Good academic results are generally required, with a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.00 for scholarships like the GMC and Wee Kim Wee. Outstanding academic performance in STEM subjects is a prerequisite for STEM scholarships. Recipients are typically required to maintain a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) throughout their studies.
*   Study Level: Many scholarships target undergraduates, including first-year full-time undergraduates. The Kwa Geok Choo Scholarship is available to outstanding law undergraduates and postgraduates (JD).
*   Specific Backgrounds: The SMU Elevate Scholarship (established 2024) is specifically for working adults aged 25 years or older or those with extensive work experience. Demonstrated financial need is a key criterion for some scholarships (e.g., GMC Scholarship) and grants, often requiring the submission of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
*   Qualities & Interests: Demonstrated leadership is a requirement for the Wee Kim Wee Scholarship. A passion for scientific research is essential for STEM scholarships.
Eligible_Fields: Information Systems, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Law, STEM Subjects, Any Degree Programme
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Final Year High School Student, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Min_Gpa: 3.00/4.0 for specific scholarships (GMC, Wee Kim Wee); recipients must maintain a minimum CGPA.
Experience_Years: Extensive work experience for SMU Elevate Scholarship; working adults aged 25 years or older.
Language_Certificate: Not mentioned
Age: 25 years or older for SMU Elevate Scholarship
Special_Circumstances: Demonstrated financial need; Passion for scientific research (for STEM); Demonstrated leadership (for Wee Kim Wee Scholarship).
Other_Requirements: Maintain minimum CGPA; FAFSA submission required for grants.
Scholarship_Info: The Singapore Management University (SMU) offers a diverse portfolio of scholarships, collectively known as the "Singapore Management University Scholarships." These scholarships are provided directly by SMU and are designed to attract and nurture a new generation of inspiring and impactful leaders, supporting students pursuing their studies in Singapore. They are offered from various donors.
Application_Documents: FAFSA is required for grants, implying financial need documentation.
Timeline:
2025-11-14 : Application Commencement for MOE-START/Overseas PG Scholarship Intake 2026
2025-11-17 : Application Opening Date for Academic Year 2026-27, 12:00 PM Singapore Standard Time
2025-12-02 : Application Deadline for Annual Scholarships for Study Abroad 2025
March 2026 : Final Interview for MOE-START/Overseas PG Scholarship Intake 2026 (for shortlisted applicants)
2026-03-19 : Application Closing Date for Academic Year 2026-27

Country: USA, Uganda, Ghana, South Africa, Kenya, Mozambique
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The Zawadi Africa Education Fund provides comprehensive scholarships designed to cover significant educational expenses. Specifically, the scholarships cover all academic costs, including tuition, room and board, plus annual travel, and most living expenses.
It is important to note that, on average, the program directly pays for less than 10% of the total costs of a four-year education. The balance is primarily funded by merit-based college grants secured by the students. Furthermore, students are required to be active partners in this initiative by holding down on-campus jobs to pay for books and incidentals, fostering a sense of responsibility and contribution.
Quantity: Not specified for current cycle; over 315 scholarships awarded historically
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be female students. Must have achieved an "A" or "A-" in their Kenya Certificate of Secondary Education (KCSE) exams (for Kenyan applicants). Must have undertaken leadership role(s) in their school and/or community. Must come from a financially disadvantaged background. Must have completed their secondary school examination (e.g., KCSE). Required Degree Level: Undergraduate.
Min_Gpa: Not strictly specified for application; scholars typically maintain 3.70-3.75 GPA
Experience_Years: Demonstrated leadership role(s) in school and/or community are required
Min_Working_Hours: Required to hold on-campus jobs to pay for books and incidentals; specific hours not mentioned
Special_Circumstances: The scholarship specifically targets students from disadvantaged and financially challenged backgrounds.
Career_Plan: Return to home countries to make a significant impact as leaders in their communities.
Other_Requirements: Applicants are required to submit scores for standardized tests such as the GRE and SAT. Reference letters are required, with referees named within the application form.
Scholarship_Info: The Zawadi Africa Education Fund is a leadership development program founded in 2002 by Dr. Susan Mboya. Its core mission is to provide university scholarships, leadership development, and life skills training to academically gifted but financially disadvantaged African girls to develop young African women leaders.
Application_Documents: A downloadable application form is required. Reference letters are required, with referees named within the application form. Standardized test scores (GRE and SAT) are required.
Timeline:
Currently open : Application process
2024-04-05 : Application Deadline for Kenya applicants
2025-04-05 : General Application Deadline
Post-application : Thorough selection process involving collection of personal, academic, and financial records

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Fully Funded. This prestigious scholarship provides a monthly allowance, accommodation, and exemption from various fees.
*   Tuition fees
*   Acceptance fees
*   Registration fees
*   Accommodation
*   Monthly allowance of BND $650
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to international students, including foreign/international students from OIC Member States. Scholarship recipients are required to conform to all the rules and regulations underlying this scholarship award scheme.
Eligible_Field_Group: Engineering & Technology, Natural Sciences, Humanities & Social Sciences
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Language_Certificate: Not explicitly mentioned as a universal requirement, but applicants should check specific university admission requirements.
Special_Circumstances: None specified

Scholarship_Info: The Government of Brunei Darussalam Scholarship (BDGS) is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship program offered annually by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Brunei Darussalam. It provides a unique opportunity for international students to pursue Diploma, Undergraduate, and Postgraduate Master’s Degree programs across a wide range of disciplines at leading higher education institutions in Brunei Darussalam.
