Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The scholarship offers substantial financial support, varying across different award tiers:
*   10 awards covering full tuition fees and a maintenance allowance (also referred to as living stipends or living fees).
*   20 to 23 additional awards covering full tuition fees only.
*   Beyond tuition and maintenance, some scholarships may also cover conference costs and a professional development package.
*   The scholarship is tenable for the normal duration of the undergraduate programme.
Covered Expenses Summary:
*   Full tuition fees
*   Maintenance allowance/Living stipends/Living fees
*   Conference costs (for some awards)
*   Professional development package (for some awards)
Quantity: 10 awards (full tuition fees and maintenance allowance), 20-23 awards (full tuition fees only)
Eligibility_Criteria: Must be an international student eligible to pay the overseas tuition fee rate at UCL. Must come from a low-income background. Must have submitted an admission application for a full-time undergraduate programme at UCL. An offer of admission is not required at the time of scholarship application, but the applicant's fee status must be confirmed by UCL Admissions.
Min_Gpa: Not specified, but academic excellence required
Experience_Years: Not required, but relevant experience encouraged (volunteer work, community service, impactful projects, leadership roles, extracurricular activities)
Language_Certificate: Not required for scholarship application; however, UCL general admission requires English language proficiency tests (e.g., IELTS, TOEFL) for international students.
Special_Circumstances: A demonstrated low-income background is a fundamental requirement for eligibility.
Other_Requirements:
Reference Letters: Required. Applicants must complete and submit a Reference Form, along with a supporting reference document.
Academic Excellence: Applicants must demonstrate academic excellence in their previous studies.
Admission Application First: Students must first submit an admission application to UCL before applying for the scholarship.
Separate Applications: A separate scholarship application form is required for each programme an applicant wishes to apply for funding for.
Personal Statement: Applicants should tailor their personal statement to highlight relevant experiences and motivations.
Application Guidance: Applicants are strongly advised to carefully read the UCL Global Undergraduate Scholarship Application Guidance to avoid errors in their submission.
Reporting Additional Funding: Scholarship recipients are obligated to inform the Student Funding Office (SFO) if they receive any additional funding for their undergraduate studies.
Programme Changes: If scholarship applicants wish to change their programme at any point (even after receiving a successful scholarship confirmation), they must notify the Student Funding Office (SFO) to ensure their scholarship remains valid.
Scholarship_Info: The UCL Global Undergraduate Scholarship is designed to enable and encourage academically excellent international students from low-income backgrounds to pursue full-time undergraduate studies at University College London. It aims to alleviate the financial burden of high expenses, allowing recipients to focus on their academic journey at one of the world's leading universities.
Application_Documents:
UCL Admission Application (must be submitted prior to scholarship application)
Scholarship Application Form
Reference Form
Supporting documents (e.g., offer letter, reference document)
Timeline:
January 2024 : Application Opening Date
2025-04-28 : Application Deadline for 2025 intake
Updates for 2026/27 awards : Made available on official scholarships finder page

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Partial Funding, Fixed Amount
Funding_Details:
The value of each scholarship can range significantly, from HK$5,000 up to full tuition coverage. For the 2024 entry, specific academic benchmarks were noted: achieving 3 A* and 1 A could qualify a student for a 75% scholarship, while 4 A* could lead to a 100% scholarship.
The highest tier of the scholarship provides full tuition coverage.
Quantity: No published cap on the number of scholarships awarded. Awards are highly competitive and are granted based on applicant merit, prioritizing the most academically outstanding candidates.
Eligibility_Criteria: Must be classified as international students. Must be admitted to The Chinese University of Hong Kong for a bachelor's degree program. Awards are highly competitive and are based on the applicant's overall merit and outstanding academic achievements.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Final Year High School Student
Min_Gpa: Not specified (academic excellence paramount; A-Level benchmarks for 2024 entry: 3 A* and 1 A for 75% scholarship, 4 A* for 100% scholarship)
Special_Circumstances: No specific requirements identified
Other_Requirements: Applicants are encouraged to apply early for scholarship consideration.
Scholarship_Info: The CUHK Entrance Scholarships offer varying levels of financial support, primarily based on the student's academic achievements.
Application_Documents: An Application Form is generally required for scholarship consideration.
Timeline:
Not explicitly specified : Opening Date
Ongoing : Applicants are generally advised to apply early for scholarship consideration.
Ongoing : Applicants are strongly advised to consult the official CUHK admissions portal for the most precise and program-specific deadlines.
2025-08-10 : General CUHK University Entry Scholarships Deadline
2025-11-15 : 'For Our Future Scholarship' Deadline
2026-01-15 : General CUHK University Entry Scholarships Deadline
2026-03-09 : Academic Performance Scholarship at CUHK Deadline

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Fixed Amount, Partial Funding, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Fully Funded Variant (Primarily Postgraduate):
*   Covered Expenses: Tuition fees, accommodation, living expenses, and travel costs.
Undergraduate Vice-Chancellor's Scholarship (£5,000/year):
*   Provides £5,000 per year for up to a maximum of three years.
*   Usage: Can be used towards either tuition fees or living expenses.
Quantity: Typically one award for the most prestigious Vice-Chancellor's Scholarship
Eligibility_Criteria:
All applicants must have received an offer for a full-time course at the University of Westminster.
For Fully Funded Postgraduate Scholarships: Primarily for international students, specifically targets "Developing Country Students", available for postgraduate studies.
For Undergraduate Vice-Chancellor's Scholarship (£5,000/year): Available for full-time undergraduate courses. Supports Home students for fee purposes, particularly those from a Black or Black Mixed ethnic background. EU students with Home Fee status are eligible if they qualify for a maintenance loan from Student Finance England.
Academic excellence is a primary selection criterion. Financial need is a significant consideration.
Language_Certificate: Not explicitly stated as a scholarship requirement, though university course admission would typically require proof of English proficiency.
Special_Circumstances:
Fully funded Vice-Chancellor's Scholarships specifically target "Developing Country Students".
Undergraduate Vice-Chancellor's Scholarship has variants that target Home students from a Black or Black Mixed ethnic background.
EU students with Home Fee status must be eligible for a maintenance loan from Student Finance England to apply for the undergraduate scholarship.
Scholarship_Info: The University of Westminster is a global and diverse institution located in the heart of London. The Westminster Vice-Chancellor's Scholarships are recognized as the University's most prestigious awards, reflecting the institution's commitment to supporting a global and diverse student body.
Application_Documents:
Relevant scholarship application form (to be downloaded and completed).
Westminster Reference Number (an 8-digit number found on the course offer letter).
Course offer letter from the University of Westminster.
Timeline:
January 2026 : Applications for the 2026-27 academic year are expected to open
July 7, 2025 : Application Deadline for the Undergraduate Vice-Chancellor's Scholarship for the 2025-26 academic year (now closed)
September : Some courses typically start

Funding_Level: Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Partial Funding, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Khalifa University provides various undergraduate scholarships, including tiered scholarships (Tier I, II, III) and other partial scholarships, with funding levels varying based on academic merit and the specific scholarship tier. A new benefits scheme, applicable to all undergraduate, Master’s, and PhD students admitted from Fall 2023 onwards, has been launched to enhance focus on research and innovation.

Covered Expenses:
*   Tuition Fees:
    *   Scholarships can cover up to 100% of tuition fees.
    *   Tier III scholarships offer up to 30% tuition fee remission, contingent on maintaining a minimum CGPA of 3.8 after completing at least 12 credit hours.
    *   Other partial scholarships can cover up to 75% of tuition fees.
*   Monthly Stipend:
    *   For Tier II students, a monthly stipend of 10,000 AED may be included, subject to approval and meeting scholarship progression criteria.
*   Medical Insurance:
    *   Medical insurance is implied for some scholarship tiers, particularly those offering a stipend.
Quantity: Multiple partial scholarships are available, specific total number not specified.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to qualified UAE national and international students who intend to pursue undergraduate programs on a full-time basis at Khalifa University. Nationality: Open to both UAE national and international students. Study Level: Must be enrolled in or applying for an undergraduate (Bachelor's) degree program. Study Mode: Full-time enrollment is mandatory. Academic Merit: Evaluation for scholarship tier mapping is primarily based on academic merit, research potential, and other relevant factors aligned with Khalifa University’s strategic priorities. Academic Standing (Maintenance): To maintain a Self-pay Scholarship, students must achieve a cumulative GPA of 3.8 or higher during their studies. To maintain a Partial Scholarship, students must achieve a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher. A general requirement for good academic standing is a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5 or greater.
Eligible_Fields: Mechanical Engineering, Electrical & Computer Engineering, Civil Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Nuclear Engineering, Applied Mathematics and Statistics, Chemistry, Physics
Min_Gpa: Not specified for initial application. Maintenance: Self-pay Scholarship: 3.8/4.0 CGPA; Partial Scholarship: 3.0/4.0 CGPA; General good academic standing: 2.5/4.0 CGPA.
Language_Certificate: Not specified
Special_Circumstances: Not specified
Other_Requirements: Applicants must be enrolled in undergraduate programs on a full-time basis.
Scholarship_Info: Khalifa University offers a range of undergraduate scholarships designed to support qualified UAE national and international students pursuing full-time Bachelor's degrees. These scholarships aim to foster academic excellence and contribute to the university's strategic priorities.
Application_Documents: Specific application documents are not detailed in the provided evidence, but applications are submitted through Khalifa University’s official portal. No application fee is required.
Timeline: Early January : Application Opening Date, Mid-April (general guideline), April 28, May 5, 2024, May 18, 2025 : Application Deadline, Early June : Notification of Acceptance, September : Commencement of Studies

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The awards are generously funded by the University of Richmond, supported by several endowments, including the Brockenbrough Family Scholarship and Elizabeth [other endowments implied]. Recipients receive a full scholarship covering:
*   Full-tuition
*   Housing (room)
*   Food (meals)
The scholarship is renewable for up to eight consecutive semesters of full-time enrollment, typically covering four years of undergraduate study. Scholars are also eligible for enrichment grants, requiring a formal grant application and a post-grant submission upon completion.
Quantity: Not specified, highly competitive (8% of applicants typically chosen as semi-finalists)
Eligibility_Criteria: Awarded exclusively to incoming first-year students. Applicants must submit a complete admission application to the University of Richmond by the December 1 deadline. The scholarship is merit-based, recognizing exceptional talent and academic achievement. International students are eligible for full scholarship consideration if they submit their admission application by the December 1st Richmond Scholars deadline.
Experience_Years: Not applicable, as it's for incoming first-year students
Language_Certificate: Not explicitly mentioned as a scholarship requirement, but may be part of the general admission application for international students.
Special_Circumstances: Not specified
Career_Plan: Not a mandatory document, but the program aims to assist future leaders as they begin to define and polish their personal and professional goals, suggesting an interest in applicants with clear aspirations.
Other_Requirements: The scholarship is highly competitive, requiring exceptional talent in a specific area. The selection process is rigorous, with only 8% of applicants typically chosen as semi-finalists.
Scholarship_Info: The Richmond Scholars Program is the University of Richmond's most prestigious academic merit award. It provides comprehensive financial support (full tuition, housing, and food) and fosters a unique learning environment within a small, multi-disciplinary community. The program is designed to cultivate future leaders and is renewable for up to eight semesters.
Application_Documents: Interested students must submit a complete admission application to the University of Richmond by the December 1 deadline. There is no separate scholarship application form; consideration is automatic upon timely submission of the admission application.
Timeline: December 1 : Application Deadline

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Full financial support for four years of undergraduate study.
Full financial support (tuition, fees, room, board, etc.)
A laptop
Access to three summers of generous funding for experiences such as internships, research, or service projects.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Open to international students of all nationalities and citizenship, provided they are able to obtain a U.S. Visa to study in the United States.
High school seniors (typically Year 13, or equivalent, e.g., NCEA Level) who are applying for undergraduate admission to Duke University and/or UNC-Chapel Hill in the same year they apply to the Robertson Scholars Leadership Program. Applicants must not have yet matriculated to any university.
Current first-year students (freshmen) already enrolled at Duke University or UNC-Chapel Hill.
Not open to transfer students for initial application.
Scholars must be enrolled full-time at either Duke or UNC-Chapel Hill for the duration of the program.
Applicants must be thoughtful and dynamic leaders who exemplify the highest levels of ethical standards.
A minimum 3.0 GPA is required for initial eligibility and must be maintained after the first semester at UNC or Duke to continue receiving the scholarship.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Final Year High School Student
Experience_Years: Not required, but strong record of leadership and community engagement is suggested.
Language_Certificate: Not mentioned for scholarship, but university admission may require it for international students.
Special_Circumstances: Not mentioned
Other_Requirements: Applicants must be thoughtful and dynamic leaders who exemplify the highest levels of ethical standards. Scholars must be enrolled full-time at either Duke or UNC-Chapel Hill for the duration of the program. Robertson Scholars are subject to the academic policies, requirements, and deadlines of other Duke and UNC undergraduates.
Scholarship_Info: The Robertson Scholars Leadership Program is a prestigious four-year merit scholarship and joint undergraduate program offered by Duke University and the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. It provides full financial support for undergraduate study, along with significant experiential learning opportunities. The program targets high school seniors (Year 13) applying to either Duke or UNC-Chapel Hill, as well as current first-year students at these universities. It emphasizes leadership, ethical standards, and academic excellence.
Application_Documents: Implies academic records, essays, and other supporting materials.
Timeline: August 15th : Application Opening Date, November 15th : Application Deadline

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Fixed Amount, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Amherst College's financial aid program is entirely need-based. The amount of financial aid offered is precisely the difference between a student's calculated expense budget and their family's determined contribution. This ensures that eligible students receive sufficient aid to cover their annual cost of education.
Grant Amounts: Eligible students typically receive an Amherst Grant (scholarship) of $87,000 or higher. This includes students admitted through the QuestBridge Match program.
Average Package: The average Amherst financial aid package is $70,081.
Example Aid Offer: A specific example showed a total aid offer of $69,020, with $67,220 provided in grants.
Components: Aid packages may include scholarships/grants, student employment opportunities, and loans.
Covered Expenses: Financial aid can be applied to a wide range of educational and living costs, including: The annual cost of education at Amherst College. Approved study abroad programs. Twelve College Exchange programs. Other domestic off-campus programs. Out-of-pocket co-pays and covered costs for active dental pain through a Medical Grant for students incurring covered medical and dental expenses.
Quantity: Not specified, provided to all admitted students who demonstrate financial need.
Eligibility_Criteria: Financial aid is available to prospective students, including international students. Eligibility is strictly based on demonstrated financial need, meaning the calculated financial need must be less than the annual cost of education. Transfer applicants already studying in the United States who demonstrate financial need are eligible for financial aid. Students admitted through the QuestBridge Match program are fully eligible for Amherst's comprehensive financial aid, typically receiving grants of $87,000 or higher. Approximately 59-60% of undergraduate students at Amherst College receive financial aid through grants or loans.
Eligible_Field_Group: Construction & Planning, Economics & Business, Arts, Design & Media, Education & Training
Language_Certificate: Not specified for financial aid eligibility
Special_Circumstances: Transfer applicants already studying in the United States who demonstrate financial need are eligible for financial aid.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must submit a complete Admission application to Amherst College. Applicants must demonstrate financial need through the required financial aid forms and supporting documentation.
Scholarship_Info: Amherst College offers a comprehensive, need-based financial aid program designed to make an Amherst education accessible to all admitted students, regardless of their family's financial circumstances. The program includes scholarships (Amherst Grants), student employment, and loans, with a strong emphasis on grants to minimize student debt. The average financial aid package is substantial, at $70,081, with many eligible students receiving grants exceeding $87,000. Aid can be utilized for various academic pursuits, including study abroad and domestic off-campus programs, and even covers out-of-pocket medical and dental expenses through Medical Grants.
Application_Documents:
Required financial aid forms and supporting documentation must be submitted. These may include:
- The Amherst Application for Renewal of Financial Aid (for returning students, submitted online via the Financial Aid Portal).
- The International Student Financial Aid Application (ISFAA) for the relevant academic year (e.g., 2026-2027 or 2025-2026).
- Other forms as specified by the college's financial aid office.
Timeline:
Applications for 2026-27 academic year : Begun loading into system
November 1 : Early Decision Application Deadline
January 15, 2026 : Regular Decision Application Deadline
March 1 : Transfer Applicants Application Deadline
March 1, 2026 : Renewal Priority Consideration Deadline for upperclassmen

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver
Funding_Details: The scholarship provides 100% tuition funding, amounting to an estimated $176,000 over the course of four years of study. It directly covers tuition costs. While the "Whole You" package ensures students do not pay tuition from personal income, the Tuition Promise Scholarship specifically addresses tuition, with other federal, state, institutional, and private grants contributing to other educational expenses.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must hold a high school diploma or its equivalent, demonstrate high academic potential, and meet specific financial qualifications (income must qualify them for admission to Berea College). International students are explicitly eligible.
Min_Gpa: High School Applicants: at least 3.0 (unweighted); Transfer Students: 3.25 (expected), ineligible if less than 2.5 college GPA in their last 24 hours of college credit.
Language_Certificate: TOEFL, IELTS (may be required, especially for international applicants)
Special_Circumstances: Applicants must meet specific financial qualifications, meaning their income must qualify them for admission to Berea College. Demonstrating financial need is a fundamental requirement.
Career_Plan: Not mentioned as direct scholarship criteria
Other_Requirements: Applicants must demonstrate high academic potential. An ACT or SAT exam may be required for admission.
Scholarship_Info: The Berea College Tuition Promise Scholarship is a distinctive financial aid program that, in combination with other grants and scholarships, guarantees admitted students will never pay tuition from personal income. Berea College has maintained a no-tuition policy since 1892, building this "No Tuition Promise" into an all-inclusive "Whole You" package. The scholarship is automatically awarded to every student admitted to Berea College, making the college's rigorous admission process the de facto selection process. Its philosophy is rooted in the belief that a college education is crucial for success and should be attainable regardless of personal income.
Application_Documents: Academic transcripts; Standardized test scores (ACT/SAT) (may be required); Language proficiency tests (TOEFL/IELTS) (may be required).
Timeline:
August 1 : Applications open annually
January 31 : General Application Deadline
February 1 : Transfer Student Priority Deadline
March 31 : Transfer Student Regular Deadline

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs, Partial Funding
Funding_Details:
Princeton University offers a comprehensive, need-based financial aid program designed to ensure that all admitted students, regardless of their economic background, can afford to attend. Since 2001, the university has replaced student loans with grants for all aid recipients, enabling undergraduates to graduate with little to no debt. This generous financial aid policy is applied equally to international students as it is to domestic students. The undergraduate financial aid budget for the 2022-23 academic year was $217.4 million, reflecting Princeton's commitment to accessibility.

Key Funding Details:
*   Grant-Based Aid: Financial aid packages consist entirely of grants, eliminating the need for student loans. Princeton Parent Loans (PPL) are available for families wishing to finance their expected contribution.
*   Income Tiers for Undergraduates:
    *   Most families with incomes under $100,000 qualify for grant aid covering full tuition, room, books, and personal expenses.
    *   Families with incomes up to $150,000 a year may pay nothing for their student to attend.
    *   Many families with incomes up to $250,000 receive aid to cover the full cost of tuition.
    *   Families with incomes up to and even beyond $350,000 (especially those with multiple children in college) may also receive significant grant aid.
*   Graduate Student Support: All Ph.D. and many master's degree candidates in the Princeton Graduate School receive financial support for the duration of their degree program. This support typically comes through a combination of University fellowships, assistantships in research or teaching, and non-University awards.
*   Study Abroad: Need-based aid is available for approved academic year study abroad programs. The aid budget includes tuition, housing, travel, meals, and reasonable program-related expenses such as personal expenses, airfare, books, and visa-related costs. It does not cover storage fees or discretionary spending like entertainment or optional travel.
*   Summer Courses: Students receiving term-time financial aid are eligible for comparable financial support for Princeton summer courses.
*   Outside Scholarships: The University considers all financial assistance from outside scholarships or other third-party funding and the expected family contribution before offering federal and institutional need-based aid.
*   Aid Disbursement: Institutional aid may be applied as early as 60 days prior to the start of a semester, while federal aid is applied no earlier than 10 days prior.

Covered Expenses:
*   Tuition
*   Housing
*   Food/Meals
*   Room
*   Books
*   Personal expenses
*   Transportation (for students residing outside of the university)
*   Travel (for study abroad)
*   Airfare (for study abroad)
*   Visa-related costs (for study abroad)
Quantity: No fixed number, all admitted students demonstrating need receive aid.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Princeton's financial aid is strictly need-based, not merit-based or athletic. Eligibility is determined by a thorough assessment of a family's financial need.

General Eligibility:
*   Need-Based: Aid is exclusively based on demonstrated financial need.
*   Income Thresholds: As detailed in the "Funding and Benefits" section, various income levels qualify for substantial grant aid, with many families paying nothing or receiving full tuition coverage.
*   Pell Grant Eligibility: The university aims for at least 22% of its undergraduate student body to be eligible for federal Pell Grants.
*   Family Financial Review: Princeton's policy is to review financial information from two parents for determining University financial aid eligibility. For independent students, their own household income and assets, including a spouse if applicable, are used.
*   Eligible Applicants: Financial aid is available for first-year applicants, current undergraduates (Class of 2026, 2027, 2028, 2029), and Ph.D. and many master's degree candidates.

International Students:
*   International students must demonstrate both top grades and a strong need for aid.
*   Princeton considers academic performance (grades) and extracurricular activities in addition to financial need for international applicants.
Required_Degree: Final Year High School Student, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Min_Gpa: Not specified for general applicants; International students require 'top grades'.
Language_Certificate: Not required for financial aid application; may be required for admission.
Special_Circumstances: The PFAA includes an opportunity for applicants to provide their best estimate of the amount parents will have available for college expenses, which can implicitly account for special financial circumstances.
Other_Requirements:
Application Process: Applicants must apply via Princeton's portal, complete the Princeton Financial Aid Application (PFAA), and submit all required documents.
Single-Choice Early Action Restriction: For applicants applying through the single-choice early action program (due November 1), there is a restriction against applying to an early program at any other private college or university within the United States.
Scholarship_Info: Princeton University Financial Aid is recognized as a #1 Private Best Value College. It is a cornerstone of the university's commitment to access and affordability, ensuring that a Princeton education is accessible to every admitted student by replacing loans with grants since 2001. The program aims for graduates to incur little to no debt and extends its generous policies to international students.
Application_Documents:
Princeton Financial Aid Application (PFAA)
Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Required documents and forms as specified by the financial aid office
Detailed household income and assets information (including spouse if applicable)
Financial information from both parents (for dependent students)
Timeline:
Mid-November : FAFSA Opening Date
November 1 : Single-Choice Early Action Admission Application Deadline
March 1, 2026 : FAFSA Application Deadline (midnight Central time)
May 1, 2026 : Princeton Financial Aid Application (PFAA) Deadline (for Academic Year 2026-27)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Partial Funding, Fixed Amount, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The Emory University Scholars Program offers merit-based scholarships that can range from partial to full coverage of educational expenses.
Scholarships may cover full tuition, fees, and on-campus room and board.
As part of the broader Scholar Programs, the Woodruff Scholars Program specifically offers merit-based scholarships to exceptional incoming first-year students. While the general program can cover full costs, some selected Woodruff scholars may receive a four-year scholarship up to $5,000 per year, specifically for tuition and fees. This indicates a tiered or varied funding structure within the overall Scholars Program umbrella.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Target Audience: Exceptional incoming first-year students.
Nationality: Open to students of any nationality.
Academic Standing: Selection is based on the admission application, recognizing academic excellence and potential.
Enrollment: Must be admitted to and attend Emory University.
Language_Certificate: Not explicitly mentioned for scholarship; standard university admission requirements apply.
Special_Circumstances: Not mentioned
Other_Requirements:
Nomination by a school official is required as part of the application process.
Applicants must apply to Emory University using the Common Application.
Candidates must explicitly indicate their interest in the Scholar Programs within their Applicant Portal by selecting the "Please update my application to be considered for the Scholar Programs" option.
Applicants must select one of the three admission decision plans: Early Decision I, Early Decision II, or Regular Decision.
Participation in an interview is a mandatory step for all finalists.
Recipients are required to attend Emory University.
Scholarship_Info: The Emory University Scholars Program is a highly competitive, merit-based scholarship initiative designed for exceptional incoming first-year students. Provided by Emory University, a private research institution located in Atlanta, Georgia, the program offers significant financial support ranging from partial to full coverage of tuition, fees, and on-campus room and board. Beyond financial aid, the program emphasizes specialized resources, unique programming, and a robust support network. It aims to cultivate leaders and scholars who will contribute significantly to the Emory community and beyond.
Application_Documents: The primary application document is the Common Application for admission to Emory University. No separate scholarship application is required beyond indicating interest within the Applicant Portal.
Timeline:
November 1 : Application deadline for Early Decision I applicants
November 15 : Application deadline for Early Decision II and Regular Decision applicants
March 1 : Finalist notification date
Post-March 1 : Finalist interviews and subsequent scholarship offers

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Dartmouth's financial aid program is entirely need-based, designed to cover 100% of the demonstrated financial need for all its students. This comprehensive approach aims to eliminate financial barriers to attendance.

Key Funding Details:
*   Full Demonstrated Need Met: Dartmouth guarantees to meet 100% of the demonstrated financial need for every student.
*   No Parent Contribution for Low-to-Middle Income Families: For families with a total annual income below $125,000 (and typical assets), the financial aid package is structured to require no parent contribution.
*   No Student Loan Expectation: Students who receive need-based financial aid from Dartmouth are not expected to borrow student loans as part of their aid package, ensuring a debt-free path to graduation for many.
*   Components of Aid: Demonstrated need is met through a combination of student employment, scholarships, and grants. A typical financial aid offer for a family with a zero Expected Parent Contribution (EPC) includes student employment of $2,450, along with any eligible Federal and state grants, and Dartmouth scholarship assistance.
*   Significant Scholarship Awards: Dartmouth has awarded over $135 million in scholarships. The average scholarship for the Class of 2025 exceeded $62,500. For the Class of 2028 first-year class, the average award was $71,582, representing an increase of $3,700 over the previous year.
*   QuestBridge Scholar Benefits: QuestBridge Match Scholars receive particularly robust financial aid packages. This includes provisions for off-setting increases in attendance costs for their sophomore through senior years. Many QuestBridge Match admission candidates qualify for an Expected Parent Contribution (EPC) of zero, which is maintained throughout their four years of college study.

Covered Expenses:
The financial aid package covers 100% of demonstrated need, which is fulfilled through a combination of:
*   Student employment
*   Scholarships
*   Grants (including Federal and state grants)
*   Off-sets for increases in attendance costs (specifically for QuestBridge Match Scholars)
Quantity: Varies annually, 59% of undergraduate students receive financial aid, 50.8% of the Class of 2028 received scholarship aid.
Eligibility_Criteria:
The Dartmouth College Financial Aid program is primarily for undergraduate students and is strictly need-based.

General Eligibility:
*   Demonstrated Financial Need: Eligibility is determined by assessing the total cost of education against the student's (or family's) ability to pay. Financial aid officers calculate the specific need and the amount of aid an applicant is eligible to receive based on the information provided.
*   Income Threshold for Zero Parent Contribution: Families with a total annual income below $125,000, provided they have typical assets for their income range, may qualify for a financial aid package that includes no parent contribution.

Application Requirements:
*   FAFSA: Applicants must complete and submit the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA®) form.
*   Tax Documents: For those applying for the 2026-2027 academic year, submission of 2024 tax returns and related financial documents is required.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Final Year High School Student
Language_Certificate: Not specified
Special_Circumstances: QuestBridge Match admission candidates are often strong contenders for a zero Expected Parent Contribution (EPC) and receive comprehensive aid throughout their undergraduate years.
Other_Requirements: Submission of 2024 tax returns and related documents is a mandatory requirement for applicants seeking financial aid for the 2026-2027 academic year.
Scholarship_Info: Dartmouth College, founded in 1769, is a distinguished private Ivy League institution located in Hanover, New Hampshire. It is recognized as one of the oldest and most prestigious universities in the United States. The Dartmouth College Financial Aid program underscores the institution's commitment to ensuring that a high-quality education remains accessible to all admitted students, regardless of their financial background.
Application_Documents: Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA®) form, 2024 tax returns and related financial documents (for 2026-2027 academic year), other required financial aid materials.
Timeline:
October 1 (annually) : FAFSA form becomes available
Late 2025 : Dartmouth-specific financial aid application for 2026-2027 academic year expected to be available
November 1 : Early Decision Applicants Deadline
February 1 : Regular Decision Applicants Deadline
March 1 : Transfer Applicants Deadline

Funding_Level: Full scholarship
Funding_Details: The USC Trustee Scholarship is a full-tuition scholarship, valued at approximately $260,000 to $276,000 over the course of an undergraduate degree. Each individual scholarship provides $276,000, covering the full tuition for the recipients. The total dollars awarded for this scholarship program is $27,600,000. Language_Certificate: Not specified for scholarship, typically part of general university admission requirements.

Scholarship_Info: The USC Trustee Scholarship is one of the most prestigious merit-based scholarships offered by the University of Southern California. It is designed to attract and support exceptionally talented undergraduate students. It is a highly sought-after award, administered through the Office of Admission, and is a cornerstone of USC's commitment to recognizing and fostering exceptional talent among its undergraduate student body.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs, Fixed Amount, Tuition Waiver
Funding_Details:
MIT Scholarships are grants that do not need to be repaid. They are designed to meet the yearly cost of attendance based on a family’s demonstrated financial need. Approximately 58-60% of undergraduates receive MIT Scholarships annually. For the 2023–2024 academic year, the median MIT Scholarship for undergraduates with need was $66,663, and the Institute awarded $158.2 million in MIT Scholarships. Overall, MIT awards over $165 million in financial aid every year.

The estimated cost of attendance for the 2025–2026 academic year is $84,768. Students are expected to contribute $2,000 from summer work towards their total cost of attendance. Additionally, there is a Federal Work-Study requirement of $3,400, which can be used towards personal expenses. A First Year Grant of $2,000 is provided, divided equally between the fall and spring semesters. Outside awards that exceed the student contribution will reduce the MIT Scholarship amount accordingly.

Covered Expenses (General MIT Scholarships):
*   Yearly cost of attendance (tuition, fees, housing, food, books, personal expenses, travel).
*   Personal expenses (via Federal Work-Study).

Specific Program Funding Details:
*   VT-MIT Scholars Program: Provides an average of $2,000 per spring or fall term for tuition and fees for students pursuing a Master of Information Technology degree.
*   MIT Summer Research Program (MSRP): Offers a stipend, housing, travel, and mentorship.
Quantity: Approximately 58-60% of undergraduates receive MIT Scholarships annually.
Eligibility_Criteria:
For Main MIT Scholarships (Undergraduate):
*   All students who apply for financial aid and complete the CSS Profile are automatically considered.
*   Eligibility is based entirely on a family’s demonstrated financial need.
*   All international undergraduate applicants are eligible to apply for financial aid.

For Specific Programs/Fellowships (as mentioned in evidence):
*   VT-MIT Scholars Program (Master of Information Technology):
    *   Must be in their first fall or spring term of study.
    *   Enrolled in at least six MIT credits.
    *   Enrollment should bring unique attributes or experiences to the VT-MIT program and/or IT industry.
    *   May be renewed for students with good academic performance, continuous enrollment with at least six MIT credits every fall/spring term, and completion of a minimum of four MIT courses per year.
*   Toigo MBA Fellowship:
    *   Planning to pursue a career in finance after graduation.
    *   Applying to or accepted into an accredited U.S.-based two-year full-time MBA, JD/MBA, Masters in Real Estate, or Masters in Finance program.
    *   Planning to begin MBA studies as a first-year student in the Fall of the given application cycle.
    *   A minority as defined by the U.S. Department of Labor (African American, Asian American/Pacific Islander, Hispanic/Latino, Native American/Alaska Native, and/or South Asian American).
    *   A U.S. citizen or permanent resident.
*   Churchill Foundation Scholarships (at Cambridge University):
    *   U.S. citizens.
    *   Between the ages of 19 and 26.
    *   Intend to pursue one year of graduate study in science, engineering, or mathematics at Churchill College, Cambridge University, England.
*   MHRD International Scholarship Program (for Indian Students):
    *   Indian citizenship.
    *   Admission to a recognized international institution.
    *   Minimum academic requirements as per specific scholarship guidelines.
Eligible_Fields: All undergraduate fields of study, Master of Information Technology, Finance, MBA, JD/MBA, Masters in Real Estate, Masters in Finance, Science, Engineering, Mathematics
Language_Certificate: English proficiency exams accepted
Age: Between the ages of 19 and 26 (for Churchill Foundation Scholarships)
Special_Circumstances: Must be a minority as defined by the U.S. Department of Labor (African American, Asian American/Pacific Islander, Hispanic/Latino, Native American/Alaska Native, and/or South Asian American) (for Toigo MBA Fellowship)
Career_Plan: Planning to pursue a career in finance after graduation (for Toigo MBA Fellowship)
Other_Requirements: U.S. citizen or permanent resident (for Toigo MBA Fellowship), Indian citizenship (for MHRD International Scholarship Program), Must have submitted a complete application to the VT-MIT Program before applying for the VT-MIT Scholars scholarship
Scholarship_Info: MIT Scholarships are the most common type of aid, providing comprehensive need-based financial aid to ensure access to education regardless of financial circumstances. They are grants that do not need to be repaid. The aid is awarded on an annual basis, and recipients must re-apply for aid each year. The program aims to cover the full demonstrated financial need of eligible students.
Application_Documents:
CSS Profile (required for all financial aid applicants).
A complete application to the VT-MIT Program is required before applying for the VT-MIT Scholars scholarship.
General admission application components (general information, essays, activities, academics, etc.) are also required as financial aid is tied to admission.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Partial Funding, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Stanford Financial Aid is a comprehensive, need-based program designed to make a Stanford education accessible to all admitted students. It primarily offers support through scholarships (which do not need to be repaid), federal and state grants, and institutional loans.

Undergraduate Students:
* Stanford is committed to ensuring that all admitted undergraduate students can attend without needing to borrow to meet their demonstrated financial need.
* Need-based aid is initially awarded from the Stanford Fund, with funds reallocated to named scholarships throughout the academic year.
* For parents with a total annual income below $150,000 and typical assets for that income range, Stanford guarantees that all tuition charges will be covered by need-based scholarships, federal/state grants, and/or outside scholarship funds.

Graduate Students:
* Financial support is provided through a combination of external fellowships, Stanford fellowships, research assistantships, teaching assistantships, and institutional loans.
* The Graduate Student Aid Fund offers assistance to a limited number of graduate students facing significant hardship with university fees, such as the Campus Health Service Fee and Cardinal Care Insurance.
* For specific master's programs, financial support covering the full cost of attendance may be provided for up to 100 students annually.
* Graduate students whose actual expenses significantly exceed standard allowances can submit documentation for a budget adjustment, potentially increasing their loan eligibility.

QuestBridge Match Students:
* Stanford provides generous financial aid to QuestBridge Match students.
* For those with parents whose total annual income is below $150,000 and who have typical assets, tuition charges are fully covered through a mix of need-based scholarships, federal/state grants, and/or outside scholarship funds.

Covered Expenses:
* Tuition charges
* Research costs
* Living expenses
* Travel expenses
* Full cost of attendance (for specific master's programs)
* Campus Health Service Fee
* Cardinal Care Insurance
Quantity: Total: Approximately 5,764 students; Specific Master's Programs: up to 100 students annually
Eligibility_Criteria: Stanford's financial aid program is strictly need-based, meaning eligibility is determined by a family's demonstrated financial capacity to contribute to educational costs.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Final Year High School Student, Bachelor's degree, Bachelor's equivalent, Final Year Student
Language_Certificate: Not specified
Special_Circumstances:
QuestBridge Match Students: For those with parents whose total annual income is below $150,000 and who have typical assets, tuition charges are fully covered.
Graduate students whose actual expenses significantly exceed standard allowances can submit documentation for a budget adjustment, potentially increasing their loan eligibility.
STEP Students: Have special application forms and specific budget information available on the STEP Students page.
Bing Overseas Studies Programs: Financial aid eligibility is automatically adjusted to reflect the associated costs for students accepted into these programs.
Graduate Student Aid Fund: Provides assistance to a limited number of graduate students experiencing significant hardship with university fees.
School of Medicine: For need-based aid, each natural parent must submit financial information and required tax forms. Institutional need-based aid (grants and loans) is available to international students.
Stanford Online High School: International students must complete and submit the SSS International Student Financial Aid Profile form. Fee waivers for application fees are available for families facing financial hardship.
Other_Requirements:
Eligibility is reassessed each academic year based on current family financial circumstances.
United States Citizens or Permanent Residents: Are considered for all types of aid, including need-based Stanford grants and loans, and federal loans.
International Students: Stanford institutional need-based financial aid (grants and loans) is available to international students, specifically mentioned for the School of Medicine and Stanford Online High School.
For parents with a total annual income below $150,000 and typical assets for that income range, Stanford guarantees that all tuition charges will be covered by need-based scholarships, federal/state grants, and/or outside scholarship funds.
Scholarship_Info: Stanford Financial Aid is a comprehensive, need-based program designed to make a Stanford education accessible to all admitted students. It primarily offers support through scholarships (which do not need to be repaid), federal and state grants, and institutional loans.
Application_Documents:
Applicants are generally required to submit the following forms:
* Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA): Required for federal aid consideration. Specific versions (e.g., 2024–2025 and 2025–2026) may be required depending on the program and academic year (e.g., for STEP students).
* Graduate Student Loan Application: Stanford’s online institutional application, including the Graduate Loan Application for the relevant academic year (e.g., 2025–2026).
* IDOC: Used for submitting tax documents to the Financial Aid Office.
* Required Tax Forms: For need-based aid at the School of Medicine, each natural parent must submit financial information and required tax forms.
* SSS International Student Financial Aid Profile form: Required for international students applying to Stanford Online High School.
Timeline:
November 15 : Application Deadline for Restrictive Early Action (REA) applicants
February 15 : Application Deadline for Regular Decision applicants
March 15, 2025 : Application Deadline for STEP students seeking financial aid for Summer 2025 through Spring 2026 (for FAFSA 2024–2025 and 2025–2026, and STEP Loan Application)
March 27, 2025 : Application Deadline for Summer Institutes applicants
April 15 : Deadline to respond to an offer of admission if receiving departmental financial aid
Within 6 to 8 weeks of completing all application requirements : Notification of financial aid availability (via Stanford email address)
March 2026 : Prospective new students for Stanford Online High School will view their award amount alongside their admission decision letter

Selection is based on a holistic evaluation of academic achievement, demonstrated leadership, integrity, and overall potential. The scholarship is need-blind, focusing solely on merit, success, and involvement. Students must actively apply for the Johnson Scholarship Program as part of their application to W&L.

Demonstrated leadership and integrity are crucial selection criteria, alongside outstanding academic achievement and potential. No explicit requirements for reference letters, age limits, or gender are mentioned.
Scholarship_Info: The Johnson Scholarship is Washington & Lee University's premier and most prestigious merit scholarship. It is a cornerstone of W&L’s broader Johnson Program for Leadership and Integrity, a comprehensive initiative that extends opportunities and funding to the entire student body, supports two full-time faculty positions, and has significantly contributed to W&L's distinction as the only liberal arts school to have produced more than one Rhodes recipient over the past 10 years. This program not only provides significant financial aid through scholarships but also fosters a culture of leadership and integrity across the university, offering various opportunities and additional funding for the entire student body.
Application_Documents: Common Application (CA) along with a specific Johnson supplemental essay. All necessary application instructions are included within W&L's section of these applications.

The scholarship primarily covers tuition fees and contributes towards the cost of living, making it a comprehensive financial aid package.

Available for both undergraduate and Master's degree programs.

Scholarship_Info: The Sciences Po Émile Boutmy Scholarship is a prestigious financial aid program offered by Sciences Po, a leading university in France. Named after the institution's founder, the scholarship aims to attract top-tier international students from outside the European Union/European Economic Area to pursue their studies in France. It is available for both undergraduate and Master's degree programs. The Émile Boutmy Scholarship is a cornerstone of Sciences Po's strategy to attract and support the most talented international students, fostering a diverse and globally-minded academic community.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The Morehead-Cain Scholarship offers a four-year, fully funded educational experience at UNC-Chapel Hill. This comprehensive funding covers all expenses for undergraduate study, extending far beyond just tuition and housing. The scholarship is valued at a minimum of $36,000 and includes:
*   Tuition
*   Room and Board
*   Housing
*   All expenses for four years of undergraduate study
*   Fully funded summer enrichment activities
The scholarship's distinctive feature is its commitment to accelerating leadership development through four distinct experiences. These include gaining resilience in wilderness experiences and pursuing professional internships, designed to provide a holistic and transformative educational journey.
Eligibility_Criteria:
To be eligible for the Morehead-Cain Scholarship, students must apply to the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. The scholarship primarily targets high school seniors who are competitive applicants for UNC-Chapel Hill and are on track to graduate.
Eligibility varies significantly based on nomination status and residency:
*   US Students: Those attending a Morehead-Cain nominating school or program are eligible if nominated by their institution.
*   International Students (Outside North Carolina, Canada, or the UK): Must attend a nominating school or affiliate program to be considered for the scholarship. If not attending a nominating school or affiliate program, they may be considered for nomination through the Admissions Referral Program (ARP). This requires applying Early Action to UNC-Chapel Hill by October 15, 2025.
*   North Carolina Residents: Specific nomination pathways exist for in-state students.
*   Canadian and UK Students: Specific nomination pathways exist for students from these regions.
*   Application Flexibility: Morehead-Cain applicants are permitted to apply Early Decision (ED) to other colleges and universities while still pursuing the Morehead-Cain Scholarship.
Required_Degree: Final Year High School Student, High School Diploma
Min_Gpa: Not specified; competitive applicants often show 4.0/4.0 (unweighted) or higher (weighted)
Experience_Years: Not mandated, but applicants should demonstrate a history of engaging in challenging activities and experiences.
Language_Certificate: Not mentioned
Special_Circumstances: Eligibility is heavily influenced by residency (USA, North Carolina, Canada, UK) and whether the applicant attends a Morehead-Cain nominating school or affiliate program. The Admissions Referral Program (ARP) provides an alternative pathway for certain non-resident applicants not attending a nominating school.
Other_Requirements:
Applicants are evaluated based on specific selection criteria:
*   Scholarship: Demonstrating deep curiosity, a love for learning, and an openness to new ideas and different perspectives.
*   Physical Vigor: A commitment to challenging oneself.
Reference Letters: While not explicitly listed as separate application documents, the selection process begins with requests for nominations from counselors and nominating schools/programs, implying a strong endorsement is crucial.
Scholarship_Info: The Morehead-Cain Scholarship is the first merit scholarship program established in the United States, founded at the first public university in the United States. It is provided by the Morehead-Cain Foundation and supports undergraduate study in the United States, specifically at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill (UNC-Chapel Hill). It is distinguished by its comprehensive funding and its unique 'four distinct experiences' designed to foster leadership and personal growth, including wilderness expeditions and professional internships.
Application_Documents: The application checklist requires applicants to provide school information, details of their senior year courses, and information about their college or guidance counselor. Nominations from counselors and nominating schools/programs are crucial.
Timeline:
Spring 2025 : Selection cycle for the Morehead-Cain Class of 2030 commences (including requests for nominations)
August 15, 2025 : Application Opening Date
October 15, 2025 : Application Deadline (Early Action for UNC-Chapel Hill, relevant for Admissions Referral Program or non-nominating school applicants)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
This is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship. The scholarship provides comprehensive financial support, which explicitly includes:
*   Economy class air-ticket to Brunei Darussalam from the scholarship recipient’s country of origin/country of domicile prior to the commencement of the course.
*   Economy class air-ticket from Brunei Darussalam to the scholarship recipient’s country of origin/country of domicile upon completion of the course.
*   Baggage allowance for shipment of the scholarship recipient's personal effects to their country of origin/country of domicile upon completion of the program, at a maximum amount of BND$250.00 for countries within the ASEAN region. (Specific amounts for non-ASEAN regions are not detailed in the provided evidence).
*   As a "fully funded" scholarship, it is generally understood to cover tuition fees, accommodation, monthly stipends, and book allowances, although these specific components are not itemized in the provided evidence.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to international/foreign students, including those from OIC Member States. Applicants must be seeking to pursue Diploma, Undergraduate Degree, or Postgraduate Master’s Degree programs. Age limits: For Undergraduate and Diploma programmes, applicants must not exceed 25 years old. For Postgraduate Master's programmes, applicants must not exceed 35 years old.
Language_Certificate: English proficiency test required (specific tests not detailed)
Special_Circumstances: Not detailed
Other_Requirements:
*   Post-Completion Departure: Scholarship recipients are required to leave Brunei Darussalam with immediate effect upon completion of their program.
*   Employment Restriction: Recipients are not permitted to undertake any paid employment or to serve on the staff of any country’s representative mission in Brunei Darussalam during the duration of the scholarship.
*   Insurance: Scholarship recipients are strongly urged to obtain additional insurance prior to their travel to Brunei Darussalam and for the entire duration of the scholarship, at their own expense.
*   Compliance: Recipients must conform to all the rules and regulations underlying this scholarship award scheme.
*   UBD Specific Application: Applicants interested in Universiti Brunei Darussalam (UBD) must also complete a separate online application through UBD's admission portal in addition to the scholarship application.
Scholarship_Info: The Government of Brunei Darussalam Scholarship for Foreign Students (BDGS) is a highly regarded, fully funded scholarship offered annually. It provides a unique opportunity for international students to pursue various academic programs at the Diploma, Undergraduate, and Postgraduate Master’s Degree levels at Brunei's leading higher education institutions. The scholarship is a key initiative by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs to foster international academic exchange.
Application_Documents: Not detailed

Scholarship_Name: Government of Ireland – International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend
Funding_Details:
- A €10,000 stipend is provided for one year of full-time study, intended to support student costs and living expenses. This stipend is typically disbursed monthly.
- Successful applicants receive a full tuition fee waiver from their host Irish higher education institution.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be international students with a domiciliary of origin outside the European Union (EU), European Economic Area (EEA), UK, or Switzerland. Candidates must possess a conditional or final offer of admission to an eligible Irish higher education institution for a full-time, international, fee-paying postgraduate program at NFQ levels 9 or 10 (Master's, Postgraduate Diploma, or PhD degrees). Applicants who have previously held a GOI-IES scholarship are not eligible to apply again. Successful candidates are expected to demonstrate outstanding academic excellence, strong leadership potential, and a clear commitment to global engagement.
Experience_Years: Not specified, but prior experience is a primary assessment criterion.
Language_Certificate: Not a direct scholarship requirement; required for university admission.
Other_Requirements: Mandatory reference letters (HEA provides 'Guidance for Referees'), a compelling personal statement, demonstration of leadership potential, and a commitment to global engagement. Application quality is crucial.
Scholarship_Info: The Government of Ireland – International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES) is a prestigious and flagship scholarship program provided by the Government of Ireland in partnership with Irish higher education institutions (HEIs). Managed by the Irish Higher Education Authority (HEA), this initiative is designed to attract outstanding international students to pursue postgraduate studies in Ireland. It reflects Ireland's commitment to international education.
Application_Documents: Essential documents available on HEA website: 2025 Call document, FAQs, Selection Process Infographic, Guidance for Referees, Application Help Document, indicative application form.
Timeline:
Prior to scholarship application : Secure conditional or final offer of admission from an eligible Irish higher education institution.
Currently open : 2025 call for applications for the 2025/2026 academic year.
2025-03-05 : Application Deadline for the 2025/2026 academic year.

Scholarship_Name: Danish Government Scholarship (University of Southern Denmark – SDU)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend
Funding_Details:
The scholarship typically covers full tuition fees and provides a monthly or sizeable living stipend. This comprehensive support allows students to focus fully on their studies without financial burden.
Covered Expenses:
*   Full tuition fees
*   Monthly stipend for living expenses
Important Note on Funding Variation: While generally fully funded, one source indicates that the scholarship may also be granted as partial tuition fee waivers. In such cases, it covers tuition for one year (specifically the second and fourth semesters), requiring the student to pay tuition for the first and third semesters. Applicants should verify the specific terms of their award upon offer.
Eligibility_Criteria: Must be a non-EU/EEA citizen. Must be an international student eligible to pay tuition fees in Denmark. Must be a highly qualified applicant. Applicants must not have previously received a Danish Government Scholarship or a similar funding award from a Danish university. Applicants who are eligible to receive the Danish State Grant cannot be considered for this scholarship.
Language_Certificate: IELTS: A score of 6.5 or higher. TOEFL: A score of 575 (Paper-Based Test - PBT), 230 (Computer-Based Test - CBT), or 88 (Internet-Based Test - iBT).
Special_Circumstances: Not mentioned
Other_Requirements: For Exchange/Guest Students: Exchange or guest students at the Master's level must have completed courses equivalent to 180 ECTS credits (three years of studies) at the university level to be considered. Campus Restrictions: Eligible Engineering Master's programs must be offered either on SDU's new campus in Vejle or at the Sønderborg campus. Application Process: A separate scholarship application is generally not required. Eligible students are automatically considered for the scholarship once they have been admitted to an eligible Master’s program at SDU. Applicants must first complete and submit the online admission application for their chosen Master’s program through the SDU portal. Application Submission: Incomplete or late applications for university admission will not be eligible for scholarship consideration.
Scholarship_Info: The Danish Government Scholarship, specifically offered at the University of Southern Denmark (SDU), is a prestigious funding opportunity for international students. Provided by the Danish Government through the Ministry of Higher Education and Science, this scholarship aims to attract top talent from around the world to pursue Master's degrees in Denmark. It recognizes the significant investment international students make in their education and offers an exceptional opportunity to study in a dynamic and world-class academic environment. The University of Southern Denmark is a public institution renowned for its high-quality education and research, welcoming students globally.
Application_Documents: Online admission application for an eligible Master’s program at SDU.
Timeline:
Currently open : Applications for 2026 scholarship intake
2024-10-15 : Application Deadline for 2024-2025 intake (past deadline for current cycle)
2025-10-15 : Application Deadline for February 2026 intake
2026-02-01 : Application Deadline for September 2026 intake

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Partial Funding, Tuition Waiver, Stipend
Funding_Details:

A monthly living stipend of up to CNY 2,000 is provided to scholarship recipients.
For postgraduate students, a partial scholarship of CNY 20,000 per academic year has been noted.
The scholarship explicitly covers tuition fees and provides a monthly stipend for living expenses.
Eligibility_Criteria: Must be a non-Chinese citizen (international student). Must be in good health, both mentally and physically. Open to both prospective applicants intending to enroll in a higher education institution in Tianjin and current international students already enrolled at a university in Tianjin. Generally aimed at foreign self-funded undergraduate, postgraduate, and PhD students who are normally enrolled or wish to enroll in Tianjin. Applicants must apply to Higher Education Institutions in Tianjin that are eligible to enroll international students.
Language_Certificate: For Chinese-instructed programs: HSK-5 certificate with a minimum score of 180. For English-instructed programs: English Proficiency Certificates (e.g., IELTS, TOEFL, or other recognized proofs). Applicants must meet the specific language requirements of their chosen higher education institution and provide relevant proofs.
Special_Circumstances: Not mentioned
Career_Plan: Required as part of Personal Statement/Study Plan
Other_Requirements: Two recommendation letters from professors or associate professors are required. A comprehensive Personal Statement is mandatory, which should include a study or research plan, personal background, financial situation, and personal strengths. For Master's and Doctoral degree applicants, this statement must be no less than 800 words, written in Chinese or English.
Scholarship_Info: The Tianjin Government Scholarship (TGS) offers a significant opportunity for international students to pursue Master's degrees in China, specifically within higher education institutions in Tianjin. Provided by the Tianjin Government, this scholarship aims to attract talented non-Chinese citizens to study in one of China's rapidly growing cities, fostering professional skill development and cultural immersion. The scholarship is typically a one-year award, renewable annually, and can offer full or partial financial support.
Application_Documents:
- Tianjin Government Scholarship Application Form.
- Personal Statement (including study/research plan, personal background, financial situation, personal strengths, etc., no less than 800 words for Master's/Doctoral degrees, in Chinese or English).
- HSK-5 certificate (minimum score 180) for Chinese-instructed programs, or English Proficiency Certificate for English-instructed programs.
- Bachelor degree diploma.
- Two recommendation letters from professors or associate professors.
- Note: After admission, students will need to present their personal and ordinary passport, Certificate of Admission, Visa Application Form (JW202/JW201), and original Form of Physical Examination Record for Foreigners (along with other original physical examination documents) to the Chinese Embassy or Consulate to apply for an X1 student visa.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Full coverage of tuition fees for the entire duration of the study program.
A monthly stipend is provided to cover living costs.
Scholarship holders are entitled to either dormitory placement or a monthly contribution of HUF 40,000 towards accommodation costs.
For programs taught in Hungarian, language proficiency is not mandatory as the scholarship includes a preparatory Hungarian language year.
The program offers dual education opportunities, allowing students to gain practical experience through internships. Scholarship holders are entitled and often required to participate in an internship as a prerequisite for their last semester.
Quantity: The number of scholarships available varies by country. For example, 200 scholarships have been announced for eligible Kenyans for the 2026/2027 academic year.
Eligibility_Criteria: The scholarship is specifically for foreign students. A critical eligibility requirement is that applicants are only eligible to apply for scholarship types and study fields that are determined in the educational cooperation programs in effect between Hungary and their specific sending partner (Ministry of Education or national scholarship office/agency) in their home country. Applicants must ensure their selected program is eligible under this agreement. The scientific fields, level of education, and number of applicants vary by country. Applicants are advised to inquire about possible programs directly with their country of origin's sending partner.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Language_Certificate: Not explicitly stated as a mandatory application requirement; preparatory Hungarian language year provided for Hungarian-taught programs.
Special_Circumstances: Includes a "Students at Risk Subprogramme."
Other_Requirements: Applicants must submit all required documents as specified in the Call for Applications. Scholarship holders are required to comply with the Stipendium Hungaricum Programme Operational Regulations, including academic progress requirements. Applicants and current students are encouraged to regularly review the "Rights and Obligations" and "Scholarship Agreement" documents, as updates may affect scholarship terms.
Scholarship_Info: The Stipendium Hungaricum Scholarship Programme is a fully funded opportunity launched by the Hungarian Government in 2013. Managed by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade and coordinated by Tempus Public Foundation, it aims to attract top foreign students to study in Hungary. The scholarship supports Bachelor's, Master's, One-Tier Master's, and PhD programs across over 800 full-degree programs in more than 30 Hungarian universities.
Application_Documents: Applicants must submit their completed online application and required documents through the Tempus Public Foundation portal. In addition to the Stipendium Hungaricum online application, applicants may also be required to complete and submit a country-specific scholarship application through their home country's Department of Education or equivalent body (e.g., Government of Saint Lucia Scholarship Application). Applicants must submit all required documents as specified in the Call for Applications.
Timeline:
January - February : Online application submission period
2026-01-15 : Online registration deadline (12 noon, 2 p.m. Central European Time, and 9 a.m. Atlantic Standard Time (Saint Lucia))
Results notification : By home country's ministry of education or national scholarship office/agency

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Scholarship recipients receive monthly stipends. The general scholarship amount is €8,000 per year. A specific program, "ITALYOU – Italy in your future," offers 70 annual scholarships of €6,250 each, disbursed over 12 monthly installments.
Covered Expenses:
*   Health and Medical/Accident Insurance contracted by MAECI.
*   University Tuition Fees (generally exempt).
*   Monthly Stipends.
*   Exceptions for Language Courses: tuition and enrollment fees are required and are not covered by the exemption.
*   Mandatory Fees: Students are responsible for covering a regional tax of €140 and a stamp duty of €16.
Quantity: For the third edition of the "ITALYOU" program (a.y. 2025-2026), MAECI will award 70 new annual scholarships specifically to students from Algeria, Cameroon, Egypt, Libya, Morocco, Senegal, and Tunisia. The total number of scholarships awarded each year varies and is not universally specified.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to international students, foreign students residing abroad, and Italian citizens living abroad (IRE). Applicants must hold an appropriate academic qualification required to enroll in the chosen Italian University or Institute.
Eligible_Fields: Master’s Degree Programs, PhD Programs, Higher Education in Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) Programs, Italian Language and Culture Courses, Research/Training Programs, "ItAS – Italian for Teaching to Foreigners" Master’s degree program
Eligible_Field_Group: Education & Training, Arts, Design & Media, Humanities & Social Sciences
Language_Certificate: Italian-Taught Programs (Bachelor's, Master's, AFAM): B2 level proficiency in Italian (CEFR). English-Taught Programs (Bachelor's, Master's, AFAM): B2 level proficiency in English. Italian Language and Culture Advanced Courses: A minimum A2 level proficiency in Italian (CEFR).
Age: Master’s Degree, AFAM Programs, Italian Language and Culture Advanced Courses: at least 18 years old and shall not exceed the age of 28 by the call's deadline (e.g., born after May 16th, 1996 for 2025-2026). PhD Programs: meet entry requirements and academic qualifications established by the specific university. Exception for renewals of existing scholarships.
Special_Circumstances: Open to Italian citizens living abroad (IRE). Specific program "ITALYOU" for students from Algeria, Cameroon, Egypt, Libya, Morocco, Senegal, and Tunisia.
Other_Requirements: PhD applicants are required to provide a letter of acceptance from the relevant Italian University. Applicants are responsible for undertaking their own research into programs and institutions to ensure their qualifications will be recognized. The MAECI grant is incompatible with any other grant offered by the Italian Government or any other Italian public institution, including DSU grants. Scholarships can be renewed for the following academic year, provided students meet specific performance requirements.
Scholarship_Info: The Italian Government Scholarship, officially known as the MAECI Scholarship, is an esteemed initiative provided by the Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI). This scholarship program is designed to support international students, foreign students residing abroad, and Italian citizens living abroad (IRE) in pursuing higher education, research, and training programs in Italy. Its primary goals are to promote cultural exchange, strengthen academic cooperation, support Italy's economic system globally, and foster the Italian language and culture. It offers a unique opportunity for international students to immerse themselves in Italy's rich academic and cultural heritage, fostering global talent and international understanding.
Application_Documents:
*   Academic credentials.
*   Certificate proving proficiency in the Italian language (if applicable).
*   Certificate proving proficiency in the English language (if applicable).
*   Letter of acceptance from the Italian University (for PhD programs).
Timeline:
April 2025 : Applications for the 2025-2026 academic year opened.
May 2025 : Application deadline for the 2025-2026 academic year (typically, precise universal deadline not explicitly stated).
November 1st, 2025, to July 31st, 2026 : 9-month scholarships available (renewable).
January 1st to September 30th, 2026 : 3-month scholarships available (exclusively for advanced courses in Italian language and culture).

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Türkiye Scholarships is a fully funded, government-backed program that comprehensively covers various expenses for its awardees. The scholarship ensures that students can focus on their studies without financial burden.

Covered Expenses Include:
*   Tuition Fees: Full coverage of all university tuition fees.
*   Monthly Stipend: A monthly stipend is provided to cover living expenses. This stipend is approximately 6,500 TL.
*   Health Insurance: All scholarship students are covered by general health insurance, allowing them to benefit from widespread health services in emergencies or other situations.
*   Turkish Language Course: Awardees who do not possess a C1 Level Turkish Proficiency Certificate are required to attend a mandatory 1-year Turkish Language Course. This course is fully covered by the scholarship, and students must attain the C1 Level Certificate by the end of their academic year, even if they are placed into English or other language medium programs.
Quantity: Approximately 5,000 new scholarships are awarded each year.
Eligibility_Criteria: Students from all countries are eligible to apply. Individuals currently enrolled in programs at Turkish universities at the same level of education they are applying for are ineligible. This also applies to joint scholarship programs. For Associate and Bachelor's Degree Candidates: A minimum academic achievement of 70%. For Graduate Candidates (Master's and PhD): A minimum academic achievement of 75%. For Master’s Programs: Under the age of 30. For PhD Programs: Under the age of 35. For Research Scholarship: Under the age of 50.
Eligible_Fields: Engineering, Social Sciences, Health Sciences, Basic Sciences, Humanities, Natural Sciences, Agriculture, Life Science and Environment, Information, Medicine, Performing Arts, Music, Fine Arts
Eligible_Field_Group: Engineering & Technology, Humanities & Social Sciences, Healthcare & Medicine, Natural Sciences, Agriculture & Environment, IT & Data Science, Arts, Design & Media
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Language_Certificate: C1 Level Turkish Proficiency Certificate (if not, mandatory 1-year Turkish Language Course); International language test results (e.g., TOEFL, DELF) if specified by university/program for English/other language medium programs.
Age: Master's: Under 30, PhD: Under 35, Research: Under 50
Special_Circumstances: Individuals currently enrolled in programs at Turkish universities at the same level of education they are applying for are ineligible. This also applies to joint scholarship programs.
Other_Requirements: At least one recommendation letter is required. A valid identification card or passport. A recent passport photo.
