Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend
Funding_Details: Awardees receive CHF 1,600 (approximately 1700 EUR) per month. This amounts to up to 19,200 CHF annually. The monthly stipend is intended to cover living expenses throughout the duration of the Master's program.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be foreign (non-Swiss) university graduates with outstanding academic results. Candidates must hold a foreign university degree and demonstrate academic results of a very high level. A strong academic record is essential. Applicants must not already be enrolled in a Master’s program at UNIL or in a preparatory year there.
Eligible_Fields: Master’s programs offered at UNIL, subject to specific exclusions. Programmes excluded from the Master’s Grant include Medicine, Education, most Law specialisms, Sports Didactics, Health Sciences, and all MAS (Master of Advanced Studies) or PhD courses.
Eligible_Field_Group: Arts, Design & Media, Humanities & Social Sciences, Economics & Business, Natural Sciences, IT & Data Science, Engineering & Technology, Construction & Planning, Agriculture & Environment, Social Services & Care, Security & Defense, Library & Information Management, Transportation & Logistics
Language_Certificate: Language proficiency of at least C1 level in either French or English is required. The specific language requirement depends on the chosen Master's program.
Special_Circumstances: No requirement
Other_Requirements: The application for the Master's scholarship also serves as an application for admission to the chosen Master's program at UNIL; a separate application to the Admissions Office (SII) is not required. For applicants whose bachelor’s university is in a country that did not ratify the Lisbon Recognition Convention, certified (sealed) copies of diploma and transcripts must be sent by post in addition to PDF uploads during the online application.
Scholarship_Info: The UNIL Master's Excellence Scholarships are competitive grants offered by the University of Lausanne (UNIL) in Switzerland. These scholarships are specifically designed for outstanding international students who wish to pursue a Master's degree at UNIL. The program aims to support global talent and provide a world-class education experience in Switzerland. These are scholarships for excellence, designed to support bright students graduating from non-Swiss universities.
Application_Documents: Applicants must apply online and upload their complete application file in PDF format during the online application process, referring to a "list of documents for an application" for necessary submissions. Certified (sealed) copies of diploma and transcripts are particularly important for applicants from countries not party to the Lisbon Recognition Convention.
Timeline: September 2025 : Application Opening Date, 2025-11-01 : Application Deadline, Academic year 2026/2027 : Scholarship targets

Scholarship_Name: University of Geneva Excellence Master Fellowships
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend
Funding_Details: The fellowship provides a grant amounting to CHF 10,000 to CHF 15,000 per year. This grant is primarily intended as a living allowance, and recipients are explicitly stated to have no teaching duties. The annual stipend can be up to CHF 15,000. While not explicitly stated as a waiver, the "fully funded" nature and the provision of a substantial grant typically imply that tuition fees are covered or significantly offset. The grant of CHF 10,000 to CHF 15,000 per year serves as a living allowance to support the student's expenses in Geneva.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to outstanding and highly motivated students. Available to both Swiss and international students, with no specific nationality restrictions. Candidates must meet the general admission criteria for a Master's program at the University of Geneva and fulfill the standard Master’s admission requirements of the Faculty of Science. Continued academic success in the first semester is a prerequisite for the fellowship's extension beyond the initial year.
Eligible_Fields: Master of Science (MSc) degrees in any of the disciplines covered by the Faculty of Science, including Earth Sciences, Physical and Mathematical Sciences, and other related disciplines.
Language_Certificate: Good command of French required; specific certificates not detailed.
Special_Circumstances: No requirement
Other_Requirements: A crucial component of the application is a two-page essay or motivation letter. In this document, applicants must describe their specific scientific interests, clearly specify the Master's program at the Faculty of Science they wish to pursue, and articulate their motivation for pursuing a Master of Science program at the University of Geneva. Continued academic success in the first semester is a prerequisite for the fellowship's extension beyond the initial year.
Scholarship_Info: The University of Geneva Excellence Master Fellowships program is a prestigious scholarship initiative offered by the University of Geneva in Switzerland. This program was specifically created by the Faculty of Science, in collaboration with several sponsors, to attract and support outstanding and highly motivated international students who aspire to pursue a Master of Science degree within the disciplines covered by the Faculty. The fellowship aims to foster academic excellence and encourage international exchange in scientific fields.
Application_Documents: Motivation letter/two-page essay (describing scientific interests, specific Master's program, and motivation for studying at UNIGE). All required documents, including this essay, should be prepared and sent as a unique PDF file.
Timeline: 28 February 2026 : Application Deadline

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details: The JFUNU Scholarship is comprehensive, covering full tuition fees or offering a significant tuition fee reduction. In addition to academic costs, it provides living expenses, including a monthly allowance of 120,000 JPY. The covered expenses explicitly include tuition fees, living expenses, and the aforementioned monthly allowance.
Quantity: PhD program: 1, Overall: very small number
Eligibility_Criteria: Targets outstanding applicants from developing countries who can demonstrate a clear financial need. Applicants must secure acceptance into specific programs at UNU-IAS or its partner universities. Applicants currently residing in Japan under a working visa are NOT eligible. Applicants pursuing a second PhD degree at UNU-IAS are not eligible. Applicants already enrolled in other postgraduate degree programs are not eligible. Applicants must not be recipients of other scholarships concurrently. For PhD applicants, there is an age limit: candidates must be under 35 years old at the time of application. Candidates are expected to demonstrate a strong interest in sustainability studies, a commitment to understanding global issues, and the ability to link their coursework and activities to the principles of sustainability. English language proficiency is also a mandatory requirement.
Eligible_Fields: PhD Program in Sustainability Science (at UNU-IAS), MSc in Sustainability (at UNU-IAS), MSc in Urban and Environmental Studies (at Waseda University/The University of Tokyo)
Eligible_Field_Group: Natural Sciences, Agriculture & Environment, Engineering & Technology, Construction & Planning
Experience_Years: PhD applicants: 2 years (full-time equivalent) of practical field experience
Language_Certificate: TOEFL (Paper-based: 600) or IELTS, taken within last two years
Special_Circumstances: Applicants currently residing in Japan under a working visa are NOT eligible. Applicants pursuing a second PhD degree at UNU-IAS are not eligible. Applicants already enrolled in other postgraduate degree programs are not eligible. Concurrent receipt of other scholarships is also prohibited.
Other_Requirements: Scholarship recipients are required to write a short essay. A strong interest in sustainability studies, a demonstrated commitment to global issues, and the ability to link coursework to sustainability principles are highly valued.
Scholarship_Info: The Japan Foundation for UNU (JFUNU) Scholarship is a competitive and merit-based award designed for outstanding applicants from developing countries who demonstrate financial need and are admitted to specific postgraduate programs at the United Nations University Institute for the Advanced Study of Sustainability (UNU-IAS).
Application_Documents:
Required Application Documents (for PhD applicants):
*   Three Letters of Reference
*   Copy of Official Transcripts
*   Proof of English Language Proficiency (TOEFL/IELTS score reports)
*   Proof of Awarded Degree with Date Received
Timeline:
12 February 2025 : Application deadline for MSc program
Late February (annual) : Typical application deadline for other programs
No specific opening date mentioned
Applicants expected to provide scholarship-related information and documents when applying to their chosen degree program.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Fully funded master's scholarships.
Tuition fees
Living stipend
Travel expenses
Economy class air travel between the scholar's home country and the host university at the start of the study program.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Must be a citizen of an African Development Bank (AfDB) member country (regional member countries or ADB's borrowing countries).
Must be 35 years old or less.
Must possess a Bachelor's degree (or an equivalent university degree) for master's level studies.
Must demonstrate outstanding academic achievement and potential.
At least 1 year of paid employment in their home country or in other African countries after receiving their Bachelor's (or equivalent) degree, within the past 3 years.
Must have relevant professional experience and a history/track record of supporting their countries’ development efforts.
Must be a healthy citizen of an AfDB member country.
JADS does not support applicants who are already enrolled in graduate degree programs.
Applicants must not be an Executive Director, his/her alternate, and/or staff of any type of appointment of the African Development Bank Group, or a close relative (defined as Mother, Father, Sister, Half-sister, Brother, Half-brother, Son, Daughter, Aunt, Uncle, Niece, or Nephew) of the aforementioned by blood or adoption.
Eligible_Fields: Energy development and related disciplines, energy, agriculture, health, environmental sustainability, engineering, and other areas aligned with Africa’s development goals.
Eligible_Field_Group: Engineering & Technology, Agriculture & Environment, Healthcare & Medicine, Natural Sciences
Min_Gpa: Not specified, but outstanding academic achievement and potential required.
Experience_Years: At least 1 year of paid employment in their home country or in other African countries after receiving their Bachelor's (or equivalent) degree, within the past 3 years.
Language_Certificate: Applicants must demonstrate proficiency in English or the language of instruction at the host institution. Some institutions may require official language proficiency tests such as TOEFL iBT or TOEIC.
Special_Circumstances: Not available to individuals already pursuing a graduate degree.
Career_Plan: Applicants are expected to have a clear vision of how their studies will contribute to Africa's development.
Other_Requirements:
Applicants must first apply directly to their chosen host university in Japan (e.g., Ritsumeikan Asia Pacific University - APU).
Applicants must not be an Executive Director, his/her alternate, and/or staff of any type of appointment of the African Development Bank Group, or a close relative (defined as Mother, Father, Sister, Half-sister, Brother, Half-brother, Son, Daughter, Aunt, Uncle, Niece, or Nephew) of the aforementioned by blood or adoption.
Scholarship_Info: The Japan Africa Dream Scholarship (JADS) Program is a prestigious capacity-building initiative jointly launched by the African Development Bank (AfDB) and the Government of Japan. Initiated in 2017, the program aims to provide academic financial support to highly talented African students to undergo master's level training in Japanese universities. The overarching goal is to empower outstanding African students to contribute to sustainable development across the African continent.
Application_Documents: Specific application documents are required by the host universities. These typically include academic transcripts, degree certificates, proof of employment, language proficiency certificates, and other supporting materials as per university guidelines.

Quantity: Total awarded: 3,474 (as of Nov 2023), including over 1,000 women scholars from 51 African Union member states. Between 2012 and 2021, 2,582 scholarships were awarded (830 female, 1,752 male). 10,789 applications received for 2021-2022 academic year.

Eligible_Field_Group: Economics & Business, Engineering & Technology, IT & Data Science, Natural Sciences, Law & Public Policy, Humanities & Social Sciences, Healthcare & Medicine, Personal Services & Tourism, Agriculture & Environment
Language_Certificate: Not mentioned
Special_Circumstances: Applicants must be from African countries or the African Diaspora. Required to undertake to serve any African Union Member State for a period equal to at least the duration of the scholarship after the successful completion of their studies. Students are prohibited from engaging in income-generating activities that may interfere with their academic programs, unless approved by the PAU Rectorate.
Career_Plan: Successful applicants are required to undertake to serve any African Union Member State for a period equal to at least the duration of the scholarship after the successful completion of their studies.
Other_Requirements: Students are required not to engage in any income-generating activities that could interfere with their academic programs. Any such activities must receive prior approval from the PAU Rectorate.
Scholarship_Info: The Pan African University (PAU) Scholarship is a prestigious program offered by the Pan African University (PAU), an initiative of the African Union. This scholarship supports outstanding African students and those from the African Diaspora pursuing Master's and Doctoral degrees. The PAU operates through four institutes located at host universities across different African Union member states: Algeria, Cameroon, Kenya, and Nigeria. The scholarship aims to foster world-class education in a multicultural academic environment with a strong research focus, ultimately leading to a joint degree award from the Pan African University.
Application_Documents: Academic transcripts and a 1st degree certificate are essential application documents.
Timeline: 15 November : Call Launch, 15 December 2025 : Application Deadline

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
- Air Tickets: From the recipient’s capital city to Malaysia.
- Tuition Fees: Approved tuition fees are fully covered.
- Monthly Maintenance Allowance: A stipend for living expenses.
- Annual Grant: For books and internal travel within Malaysia.
- Medical / Health Insurance: Coverage for health-related expenses.
- Installation and Termination Grant: Financial assistance for settling in and departing.
- Thesis Allowance: Specifically for PhD and Post-Doctoral candidates, paid in two installments: at the beginning of research (after proposal defense) and the balance upon thesis submission.
- Conference Travel Grant: Support for attending academic conferences.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be nationals of developing countries. Must be intending to pursue full-time postgraduate studies (Master’s, PhD, or Post-doctoral levels) at selected Malaysian public or private universities. Demonstrated strong academic performance. Applicants must possess professional work experience. Scholars are required to fulfill all study program requirements and adhere strictly to Malaysian laws, as well as the rules, regulations, and codes of conduct of their host university. Evidence of leadership and community impact may be expected. All research and study activities must be carried out exclusively in Malaysia. Scholarship holders are not permitted to undertake any paid employment in Malaysia during their scholarship tenure unless explicit written approval is obtained from their host university.
Min_Gpa: Master: 3.0/4.0 (or Second Class Upper), PhD: 3.5/4.0 (or very good result)
Experience_Years: Professional work experience required, no minimum years specified.
Language_Certificate: TOEFL or IELTS
Special_Circumstances: Applicants must be nationals of developing countries.
Career_Plan: Strong commitment to contributing to their home country upon completion of their studies.
Other_Requirements: Two (2) compulsory letters of recommendation from referees are required. If academic transcripts or other supporting documents are not in English, an official English translation is required.
Scholarship_Info: The Malaysia International Scholarship (MIS) is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship program offered by the Government of Malaysia, through its Ministry of Higher Education (MOHE), to outstanding international students. Designed to attract top global talent, the MIS supports full-time postgraduate studies (Master’s, PhD, and Post-doctoral levels) at selected public and private universities across Malaysia. The scholarship aims to foster international relations, cultural exchange, and contribute to the development of the recipients' home countries.
Application_Documents:
- Printed application form.
- Applicant’s academic transcript (with official English translation if applicable).
- Curriculum Vitae (CV).
- Medical Report Form.
- Admission Letter from a Malaysian university (if already obtained; otherwise, it may be submitted later as students can apply to the scholarship before university admission).
- Research Plan (compulsory for Master’s by Research and PhD applicants).
- English Language proficiency certificate (TOEFL or IELTS).
- Two (2) Letters of Recommendation.
- Endorsement Form.
Timeline:
June 2025 : Application Opening
2025-06-30 : Application Deadline
27 October 2025 - 31 December 2025 : Review Closing
2025/2026 : Academic Session

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Fully Funded
*   Tuition fees
*   Living expenses
*   Other educational costs
Quantity: 550 scholarships are available for the 2025–2026 academic year.
Eligibility_Criteria: International Students, including persons of Kazakh nationality who are not citizens of the Republic of Kazakhstan. Applicants must be pursuing each education level (Bachelor’s, Master’s, PhD) for the first time. For undergraduate applicants, this means applying for a bachelor’s degree for the first time. There is no strict age limit, but applicants must meet all academic eligibility requirements.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Min_Gpa: 3.0 out of 4.0 or its equivalent is required for Bachelor's and Master's degree applicants.
Language_Certificate: An international certificate confirming proficiency in a foreign language (e.g., IELTS, TOEFL, DSH, DELF, etc.) is required for Master's and Doctoral applicants. While minimum scores are specified, they are not provided in the available information.
Special_Circumstances: Not specified
Other_Requirements:
For Bachelor's Degree Applicants: An invitation letter from a Kazakh university (if available) is recommended.
For PhD Applicants: A research proposal, written in the language of instruction, must be provided.
Scholarship_Info: The Kazakhstan Government Scholarship is a fully funded opportunity for international students to pursue Bachelor's, Master's, and PhD degrees in top Kazakhstani universities across various academic disciplines. It is offered by the Ministry of Science and Higher Education of the Republic of Kazakhstan, aiming to foster international cooperation and global talent.
Application_Documents:
*   Copy of passport/identity document.
*   Bachelor's degree diploma and transcript with notarized translation into Kazakh, Russian, or English (for Master's applicants).
*   Master's degree diploma and transcript with notarized translation into Kazakh, Russian, or English (for PhD applicants).
*   International certificate confirming proficiency in a foreign language (e.g., IELTS, TOEFL, DSH, DELF, etc.).
*   Research proposal (for PhD applicants).
*   Invitation letter from a Kazakh university (if available) for Bachelor's Degree Applicants.
*   Previous Educational Certificates.

31 July 2025 : Announcement of Results

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend
Funding_Details:
The Skoltech Scholarship provides comprehensive financial support, making education free of charge for successful candidates.
*   Tuition Fee: Fully covered for the duration of the program.
*   Application Fee: There is no application fee required to apply for Skoltech programs.
*   Stipend:
    *   Master's students receive a monthly stipend of 40,000 rubles.
    *   PhD students receive a monthly stipend of 70,000 rubles.
Eligibility_Criteria: The Skoltech Scholarship is open to both local (Russian) and international students. Applicants for Master's programs must hold a Bachelor's, Specialist, or an equivalent degree in a relevant STEM field. For PhD programs, a Master's degree is typically required. Candidates must successfully pass the rigorous Skoltech admission process and be officially enrolled in a Master's or PhD program at the institution. Demonstrated proficiency in English is mandatory, as it is the language of instruction at Skoltech.
Eligible_Fields: Data Science, Advanced Computational Science, Applied Computational Mechanics, Materials Science, Advanced Manufacturing Technologies (Simulation based Engineering Sciences track, Materials Technologies track), Internet of Things and Wireless Technologies, Engineering Systems, Photonics and Quantum Materials, Mathematical and Theoretical Physics, Life Sciences, Computational and Data Science and Engineering, Mathematics and Mechanics, Materials Science and Engineering, AgroBioTechnologies and Engineering, Physics
Eligible_Field_Group: IT & Data Science, Engineering & Technology, Natural Sciences, Agriculture & Environment
Required_Degree: Bachelor's degree, Bachelor's equivalent, Master's degree
Experience_Years: While not strictly required, applicants may list internships, volunteering, or official work experience in their application. This section can also be skipped if no such experience is available.
Language_Certificate:
TOEFL iBT: Minimum score of 80.
TOEFL ITP: Minimum score of 450.
IELTS Academic: Minimum score of 6.0.
Special_Circumstances: Skoltech also offers specialized scholarships, such as the H.R.H. Princess Maha Chakri Sirindhorn Skoltech Scholarship. This prestigious award is given annually to a select number of students from Thailand to study specific Master of Science degrees (Data Science, Materials Science, and Energy Systems).
Other_Requirements: Candidates must successfully pass the rigorous Skoltech admission process and be officially enrolled in a Master's or PhD program at the institution.
Scholarship_Info: The Skoltech Master's Scholarship is a prestigious, fully funded opportunity offered by the Skolkovo Institute of Science and Technology (Skoltech), a globally recognized university located in Moscow, Russia. This scholarship aims to support both local and international students pursuing Master's and PhD degrees in various STEM fields, with a strong emphasis on innovation and research excellence.
Application_Documents: While specific application documents are not detailed in the provided evidence, applicants are generally expected to provide information related to their academic background, English proficiency, and any relevant experience.
Timeline:
Current : Application period for current MSc programs is closed.
2025-07-07 : Application deadline for 2025-2026 academic year.
December 2025 : Applications for 2026-2027 academic year expected to open.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Master's Students: A monthly basic scholarship of 850€, along with a lump sum of 20€.
International PhD Students: A grant of 1400 EUR each month.
The scholarship covers the full cost of tuition, fees, and living expenses.
Beyond financial aid, the scholarship department provides a wide range of support, including: Political education events, Summer schools, Workshops (conducted both domestically and abroad), Symposia, Educational trips.
Quantity: Approximately 60 scholarships are anticipated for the 2025/26 academic year.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Highly-qualified undergraduate and doctoral students from Germany and abroad.
Evidence of high levels of social and political engagement.
Foreign students (Master's only) and PhD students must be temporarily residing in Germany for study or research purposes.
Applicants must meet the criteria specified in §8 of the BAföG regulations (German Federal Training Assistance Act), which typically includes German passport holders, immigrants with long-term residence prospects, and a portion of international students fulfilling specific criteria.
Eligibility is also dependent on the applicant's status and country; not all statuses or countries are included in the program.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree, Bachelor's equivalent
Language_Certificate: Not specified
Special_Circumstances: Preference is given to students from non-academic and migrant backgrounds, the socially needy, and people with disabilities, provided they demonstrate comparable achievements and commitment. This initiative aims to compensate for social, political, or gender disadvantages.
Other_Requirements:
Proof of acceptance at a German university is required for dissertation/research stays.
For Bachelor's degree programs, applicants must have at least half of the standard period of study remaining before the start of funding.
Scholarship_Info: The Rosa-Luxemburg-Stiftung Scholarships are prestigious financial grants provided by the Rosa-Luxemburg-Stiftung, primarily designed for study and research in Germany, supporting highly-qualified students and doctoral candidates who demonstrate significant social and political engagement.
Application_Documents:
Completed application forms.
Proof of acceptance at a German university (required for dissertation/research stays).
Other documents as specified in the application guidelines for study or doctoral scholarships.
Timeline:
Applications are generally open for several months leading up to the deadline.
2025-10-01 : Application Deadline
2026-04-01 : Scholarship Start Date (Summer semester)

Scholarship_Name: POSCO TJ Park (Asian Fellowship at SNU)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The fellowship covers all essential expenses, ensuring comprehensive financial support for Master's and PhD degrees in South Korea.
*   Full tuition fees for the duration of the degree program.
*   A monthly stipend of ₩1,000,000 KRW (approximately $750 USD) to cover living expenses.
*   A research grant to support academic and research activities.
Quantity: While the number of recipients can vary by year (e.g., 17 in 2023, 30 mentioned in some sources), up to 109 awards have been mentioned in program summaries.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must hold Asian citizenship. All Asian countries are eligible, with the exception of Turkey. Must intend to pursue a Master’s or Doctoral program in STEM fields at one of the nine designated Korean universities. Applicants must have been admitted to a Master's or Doctoral program at a Korean graduate school. A recommendation from their admitting institution is required.
Eligible_Field_Group: IT & Data Science, Engineering & Technology, Natural Sciences, Construction & Planning
Min_Gpa: A minimum GPA of 2.7 on a 4.0 scale is required. Equivalent GPAs are also accepted, such as 2.87 out of 4.3 or 3.0 out of 4.5.
Language_Certificate: English Proficiency: A Certificate of Valid English Proficiency Test is required. Accepted tests include TOEFL, TOEIC, TEPS, and IELTS ONLY. Korean Language Proficiency: A Certificate of Valid TOPIK (Korean Language Proficiency Test) is also required.
Special_Circumstances: Not mentioned
Other_Requirements: Not mentioned
Scholarship_Info: The POSCO Asia Fellowship, provided by the POSCO TJ Park Foundation, is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship program designed to foster talent exchange and academic collaboration among Asian countries. It targets exceptional Asian students aspiring to pursue Master's or PhD degrees in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) fields at top-tier universities in South Korea. The fellowship offers comprehensive financial support, enabling recipients to focus entirely on their academic and research pursuits. The program is rooted in the mission to strengthen mutual understanding and cooperation among Asian countries by supporting talented Asian students to pursue advanced degrees in South Korea and fostering academic collaboration through the exchange of intellectuals.
Application_Documents:
Statement of Purpose
Recommendation letter (maximum of 2 letters)
Certificate of Valid English Proficiency Test (TOEFL, TOEIC, TEPS, IELTS ONLY)
Certificate of Valid TOPIK (Korean Language Proficiency Test)
Timeline:
Applications are currently being accepted for the 2026 academic year.
2025-05-31 : Application Deadline (for the 2026 academic year).

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Master's Students: Receive a monthly stipend of CZK 14,000.
PhD Students: Receive a monthly stipend of CZK 15,000 (approximately EUR 585).
Covered Expenses: Tuition fees, Living expenses, Health insurance, Accommodation support.
Travel expenses to and from the Czech Republic are generally not covered.
Eligibility_Criteria: Scholarships are exclusively available to students from Bosnia and Herzegovina, Georgia, Ukraine, Belarus (democratic forces), Ethiopia, Nigeria, Rwanda, Zambia, Cambodia, Sri Lanka, Guatemala, Jordan. Applicants must be citizens of one of the listed eligible developing countries. Only students from these countries can apply for follow-up Master's or Doctoral degree programs. Students from EU countries are explicitly not eligible to apply. Applicants must be officially nominated by the relevant authorities in their eligible home countries.
Experience_Years: Applicants with work experience are considered. Academic staff members may apply and are required to submit a specific letter with their application. In some cases, candidates may need a minimum of 4 years of teaching experience after obtaining a relevant teaching certificate.
Language_Certificate: Not universally required (e.g., 'Scholarships without IELTS'); host universities may have their own assessment methods or waive requirements. Mandatory 1-year Czech language preparation course if the chosen field of study is pursued in Czech.
Special_Circumstances: Applicants must be officially nominated by the relevant authorities in their eligible home countries. Scholarships are available for students from Belarus (democratic forces).
Career_Plan: Applicants must submit an 'Affirmation on Return to the Country of Origin upon Completion of Studies'.
Other_Requirements: No application fee. Medical confirmation about the applicant’s health, no more than two months old, with a certified translation into English or Czech. Applicants must sign declarations regarding the acceptance of the terms and conditions governing the granting of scholarships and the provision of health services.
Scholarship_Info: The Czech Government Scholarships are a prestigious initiative provided by the Government of the Czech Republic, specifically through the Ministry of Education, Youth and Sports. These scholarships are offered as a key component of the Czech Republic's Foreign Development Cooperation, aiming to support education for students from selected developing countries. The program facilitates full-time study at public institutions of higher education within the Czech Republic, primarily targeting Master's and PhD level studies. These are highly competitive, fully funded awards.
Application_Documents:
Completed online application form
Valid passport or ID photocopy
Academic degree certificates and official transcripts (legalized copies with certified Czech translation)
Curriculum Vitae (CV) with a focus on studies and employment
Legalised copy of birth certificate with a certified translation into Czech
Medical confirmation (no more than two months old) with a certified translation into English or Czech
Legalised copy of a foreign diploma or similar document proving due completion of a Follow-up Master’s Study program, with a certified translation into Czech
Legalised copy of a Diploma Supplement or list of completed subjects and examinations including their scope and grades, with a certified translation into Czech
Declaration about the Acceptance of the Terms and Conditions Governing the Granting of Scholarships
Declaration about the Acceptance of the Terms and Conditions Governing the Provision of Health Services
Affirmation on Return to the Country of Origin upon Completion of Studies
For academic staff, a specific letter with their application may be required.
Timeline:
August 4th : Applications for the Academic Year 2026/2027 opened
September 30, 2025 : Application Deadline for the 2026/2027 academic year
Nomination by Home Country Authorities : Initial selection procedures and recommendations
University Admission : Host universities make independent decisions on acceptance

Funding_Level: Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Fixed Amount
Funding_Details:
Tuition Fees: Scholarship holders are granted free studies at public universities and many private universities in Poland.
Monthly Stipend: A monthly scholarship of PLN 1,500 is provided during the second-cycle studies.
Total Stipend Value: The total value of stipends for the duration of studies can amount to PLN 32,400.
Program Budget: The total budget for a single call of the Banach NAWA programme is approximately PLN 9.9 million, though NAWA reserves the right to adjust this amount.
Quantity: Varies by year: 443 (from 3,587 applications), 240 (from 942 applications, 34 countries), approx. 260 (from 2,000 applications)
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be young people or citizens from developing countries. Candidates must not have previously received a NAWA scholarship under this specific programme. The scholarship is exclusively for second-cycle (Master's) studies. Candidates must demonstrate proficiency in either Polish or English, depending on the language of instruction of their chosen study program.
Eligible_Fields: Engineering and technical sciences, Agricultural sciences, Exact sciences, Life sciences
Eligible_Field_Group: Engineering & Technology, Agriculture & Environment, Natural Sciences
Language_Certificate: Proficiency in Polish or English required, depending on language of instruction
Other_Requirements: Confirmation of university application or admission in Poland is generally required, but not mandatory for those choosing the full Polish-language path that includes a preparatory course. The programme offers two main educational paths: Polish-language path (can include a one-year preparatory course or direct studies) and English-language path (typically supplemented with a Polish language and culture course). The selection process involves a substantive assessment.
Scholarship_Info: The Stefan Banach Scholarship Programme, commonly known as NAWA – Banach, is a prestigious scholarship initiative provided by the National Agency for Academic Exchange (NAWA) in collaboration with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Ministry of Education and Science of Poland. It is a joint initiative implemented under Polish Aid, aimed at supporting the socio-economic development of developing countries. The scholarship enables eligible individuals to pursue second-cycle (Master's) studies in Poland.
Application_Documents: Specific list not provided, but documents are required.
Timeline:
2022-03-31 : Previous application deadline
2024-06-27 : Recent application deadline (3 pm)
2025-05-19 : Upcoming application deadline
Currently open : Applications for 2025/2026 call

Country: USA, Spain, Antigua & Barbuda, Barbados, Jamaica, Trinidad and Tobago
Funding_Level: Partial Funding, Fixed Amount, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
This is a partial funding scholarship, offering up to $10,000 USD per year or per academic year. It is important to note that OAS scholarships do not fully fund all study-related costs.
Covered Expenses:
*   Tuition fees
*   Partial monthly subsistence allowance
*   Books or study materials
*   Health insurance
*   Round-trip airfare
Exclusions: OAS scholarships explicitly do not cover dependent expenses.
Quantity: PAEC OAS-UNI Certificate Programs: Unlimited; PAEC OAS-UNI Graduate Programs: 10; PAEC OAS-UNI CIEP English Program: 20; General Graduate Program: 1 per OAS member state.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Awarded to citizens of the Organization of American States (OAS) member states. For undergraduate studies, scholarships are specifically awarded to citizens/residents of OAS Member States in the English-speaking Caribbean and Suriname.
Recipients must agree to return and remain in their sponsoring country for a period of no less than twenty-four (24) months after completing their program of study. This requirement also applies to recipients pursuing online studies.
Applicants must be in good physical and mental health to successfully complete the program.
Eligible_Fields: Broad range of academic pursuits, including full-time undergraduate or graduate studies and/or graduate research that lead to a degree (Master’s or PhD level programs). Specific fields like Applied Environmental and Sustainability Studies are mentioned for certain universities.
Required_Degree: Bachelor's degree, High School Diploma, Final Year Student
Min_Gpa: Above minimum standard required by the chosen university
Experience_Years: No specified minimum number of years of experience, but professional background and work experience are considered and awarded 1 point.
Language_Certificate: English language proficiency generally required.
Special_Circumstances: Applications for online programs of study shall be prioritized during the scholarship selection process.
Career_Plan: Essay 1 focuses on how the program of study will directly impact the applicant's career, improving professional skills for their current job or future work.
Other_Requirements:
At least two (2) reference letters are required (academic, professional, or personal, written and signed by recommenders, not from relatives).
Completed essays are mandatory (typically two essays, each with a minimum of 800 characters and a maximum of 2900 characters).
An I-20 form may be used to show the schedule of study, if applicable.
Scholarship_Info: The OAS Academic Scholarship Program is a prestigious international scholarship offered by the Organization of American States (OAS). It aims to support outstanding individuals from the Americas in pursuing higher education.
Application_Documents:
To apply, candidates must submit:
*   An online scholarship application through the OAS Fellowship Management System.
*   The online 2025 OAS Graduate Academic Scholarships Application (for graduate studies).
*   All requested supporting documents.
*   Completed essays.
*   At least two (2) reference letters.
*   An I-20 form (if applicable).

2025-05-10 : PAEC OAS-UNI Results Publication

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Partial Funding, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The Latvian State Scholarships offer comprehensive financial support, which can be fully funded or cover full/partial tuition fees. Beyond tuition, the scholarship provides a monthly stipend to cover living costs such as food and accommodation.

The monthly stipend amounts are as follows:
*   €500 per month for Bachelor's students and those pursuing 2nd-level professional higher education (for up to 10 months).
*   €600 per month for Master's students (for up to 10 months).
*   €700 per month for PhD students (for up to 11 months).

Covered expenses include:
*   Living costs (food, accommodation, etc.)
*   Full tuition fee
*   Partial tuition fee
Quantity: Not specified for total awards. For the 2025/2026 academic year, Ukraine: 14, Azerbaijan: 10, Germany: 10, Finland: 9, Uzbekistan: 9, Turkey: 7, Italy: 5. Scholarships for applicants from one country may not exceed 10% of the total grant amount for study scholarships.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Scholarships are available to foreign students, researchers, and teaching staff. Applicants must be citizens of one of the 39 eligible countries (or over 30 partnering countries) that have bilateral agreements on co-operation in education and science with Latvia. Eligibility also extends to citizens of countries that offer scholarships for Latvian students, researchers, and teaching staff, even without formal agreements.

Specific academic level requirements include:
*   Bachelor's and First-level Professional Higher Education Studies: Applicants must have successfully completed at least one academic year of studies, either at their home HEI or at a Latvian HEI if they are already studying in Latvia.
*   Continuation of Studies: Students wishing to continue their studies for another year must re-apply for the scholarship.
*   Research Fellowships: Only academic and scientific staff of foreign higher education and research institutions are eligible candidates for research fellowships.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree, PhD
Experience_Years: Applicants for research fellowships must be academic and scientific staff of foreign higher education and research institutions. No minimum years of experience are specified for this category or for other study levels.
Language_Certificate: Not specified for scholarship application, but individual HEIs may have their own language proficiency requirements for admission. Instruction available in English and Latvian.
Special_Circumstances: Not mentioned
Other_Requirements:
Applicants must be citizens of one of the 39 eligible countries (or over 30 partnering countries) that have bilateral agreements on co-operation in education and science with Latvia. Eligibility also extends to citizens of countries that offer scholarships for Latvian students, researchers, and teaching staff, even without formal agreements.
For Bachelor's and First-level Professional Higher Education Studies: Applicants must have successfully completed at least one academic year of studies, either at their home HEI or at a Latvian HEI if they are already studying in Latvia.
Students wishing to continue their studies for another year must re-apply for the scholarship.
A confirmation letter from a Latvian HEI is a prerequisite for submitting the scholarship application.
Scholarship_Info: The Latvian State Scholarships are provided by the Latvian government and administered by the State Education Development Agency (VIAA). These scholarships are designed to support foreign students, researchers, and teaching staff pursuing studies, research, or participation in summer schools within Latvian higher education institutions (HEIs) across Latvia. The program operates under bilateral agreements on co-operation in education and science between Latvia and various partner countries.
Application_Documents:
Applicants must submit a comprehensive set of documents as part of their application:
*   Confirmation Letter from a Latvian HEI
*   Curriculum Vitae (CV)
*   Letter of Motivation/Personal Statement
*   Online Application Form
*   Document Translation: All necessary application documents must be translated into Latvian or English.
Timeline:
February 1 : Application Opening Date
April 1 : Application Deadline (for both studies and summer schools)
June : Notification of Award
