Scholarship_Name: Confucius Institute Scholarship (International Chinese Language Teachers Scholarship)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Stipend, Other Costs, Partial Funding
Funding_Details:
The scholarship is generally fully funded, offering comprehensive coverage for successful applicants. This includes tuition fees, accommodation, a living allowance (stipend), and comprehensive medical insurance. It's important to note that the living allowance may not be provided for students on four-week study programs.

In certain circumstances, partial funding may be offered, particularly if a student's academic results are not consistently above average. In such cases, the scholarship might cover all expenses except the monthly allowance for personal expenses.
Quantity: Varies by program and host institution
Eligibility_Criteria: The scholarship targets outstanding students, scholars, and currently-employed Chinese language teachers who wish to pursue studies in International Chinese Language Education or related majors at Chinese universities. Eligibility for scholarship renewal is strictly tied to maintaining above-average academic results throughout the study period. Academic requirements vary by program, with a Bachelor's degree required for some programs (particularly those offering two academic years of sponsorship) and Master’s degree studies specifically supported for the MTCSOL program. Experience in Chinese language teaching is a significant advantage, with more than two years of work experience required for applicants to programs requiring HSK Level 6 and HSKK Advanced scores. Proficiency in Chinese, demonstrated through HSK and HSKK test scores, is a crucial requirement with specific minimum levels depending on the program. Age restrictions apply: current Chinese language teachers can be up to 45 years old, while graduate scholarship applicants must not be over 25 years old. Applicants for the Master’s Degree in International Chinese Language Education (MTCSOL) are required to submit two reference letters. An application essay or study plan, written in Chinese (200–800 characters), is mandatory. All applicants must register a personal account on the official Confucius Institute Scholarship website to complete and submit the online application form.
Eligible_Fields: Doctoral studies, Research stays, Participation in international conferences, Chinese language and culture courses, International Chinese Language Education, Related majors (e.g., Chinese Language Study), Chinese language and literature, Chinese history, Chinese philosophy, Taiji Culture, Chinese Language plus Home-Stay in a Chinese Family program, Master’s Degree in International Chinese Language Education (MTCSOL)
Experience_Years: Applicants for programs requiring HSK Level 6 and HSKK Advanced scores must have more than two years of work experience in Chinese language teaching. Accepted types of experience include roles as Chinese Language professors, currently-employed Chinese language teachers, or in-service Chinese language teachers. A Professional Experience Certificate is required to validate this experience. Not required for other programs.
Language_Certificate:
HSK (Hanyu Shuiping Kaoshi) Requirements:
*   Chinese Language Study: Minimum HSK Level 3 score of 210.
*   International Chinese Language Education: Minimum HSK Level 3 score of 270. (Some programs in International Chinese Language Education, Chinese language and literature, Chinese history, or Chinese philosophy may accept a minimum HSK Level 3 score of 180).
*   Chinese Language and Literature: Minimum HSK Level 4 score of 180.
*   Two Academic Years Sponsorship (e.g., Master's): Minimum HSK Level 5 score of 210.
*   Advanced Programs (with work experience): Minimum HSK Level 6 score of 200.

HSKK (Hanyu Shuiping Kouyu Kaoshi) Requirements:
*   Generally required for programs in International Chinese Language Education, Chinese language and literature, Chinese history, or Chinese philosophy.
*   Chinese Language and Literature: Minimum HSKK Intermediate Level score of 60.
*   Advanced Programs (with HSK 6): Minimum HSKK Advanced Level score of 60.
*   Chinese Language Study: Priority is given to applicants who provide an HSKK test score.
Age: Current Chinese language teachers can be up to 45 years old; graduate scholarship applicants must not be over 25 years old.
Special_Circumstances: Applicants who have received an International Chinese Language Teachers Scholarship Certificate during Chinese Bridge competitions should submit their application documents directly to the Host Institutions along with their certificates via the scholarship website. Priority is given to applicants with HSKK test scores. Applicants demonstrating a confirmed job as Chinese Language professors after completing their master’s degree studies in China will also receive preference. Scholarship renewal is strictly dependent on maintaining satisfactory academic performance.
Career_Plan: An application essay or study plan, written in Chinese (200–800 characters), is mandatory. This document should detail the applicant's Chinese learning background, study objectives, and post-study plans.
Other_Requirements:
Reference Letters: Applicants for the Master’s Degree in International Chinese Language Education (MTCSOL) are required to submit two reference letters from professors or associate professors.
Online Application: All applicants must register a personal account on the official Confucius Institute Scholarship website (http://cis.chinese.cn) to complete and submit the online application form. The website provides information in both Chinese and English.
Scholarship_Info: The Confucius Institute Scholarship, officially known as the International Chinese Language Teachers Scholarship, is a prestigious program designed to foster global understanding of Chinese language and culture. It is provided by the China Center for Language Education and Cooperation (CLEC), formerly known as the Confucius Institute Headquarters Scholarship Division. The scholarship exclusively supports study in China.
Application_Documents:
Applicants are typically required to submit:
*   The Confucius Institute Scholarship Application Form
*   Application Guidelines
*   A List of Application Materials
*   Scholarship certificates (if applicable, from Chinese Bridge competitions)
*   A Professional Experience Certificate (if applicable)
*   An Application essay/study plan
*   Two reference letters (specifically for MTCSOL applicants)
Timeline:
October 31 (preceding year) : Application deadline for March Intake
May 31 : Application deadline for September Intake
April to May : Broader application window for July or September Intakes
September to November : Application window for December or March Intakes
Early May : General application deadline

Programs commence in March, July, September, or December.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The scholarship covers tuition fees, registration fees, accommodation on AIT's residential campus, and a bursary for living expenses. It offers either a full or partial tuition fee waiver.
Covered Expenses:
* Tuition fees
* Registration fees
* Accommodation
* Bursary for living expenses
Duration of Coverage: For Ph.D. programs, the scholarship covers the entire period of 41 months (7 semesters).
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to Asian students (including Bhutan, Timor-Leste, ASEAN countries, and other Asian nations). Applicants residing in Thailand are also eligible. Must possess an outstanding education record from an accredited institution. High English proficiency required, demonstrable via recognized tests or AIT English Test. Application process is highly competitive.
Eligible_Fields: HM King's Scholarship: All academic fields (Master's in School of Engineering and Technology (SET), School of Management (SOM); Doctoral in School of Engineering and Technology (SET), School of Environment, Resources, and Development (SERD)). HM Queen's Scholarship: Environmental-related fields.
Eligible_Field_Group: Engineering & Technology, Economics & Business, Natural Sciences, Agriculture & Environment, Law & Public Policy
Min_Gpa: For Master's applicants (from QS ranked universities): >2.75 (or equivalent); For Master's applicants (from other universities): >3.0 (or equivalent); For Doctoral applicants: >3.5 (or equivalent). Recipients must maintain >3.5 (or equivalent).
Experience_Years: HM King's Scholarships: 2 years of full-time professional working experience (acquired after a university degree). MBA Programs: 1 year of relevant work experience.
Language_Certificate: High proficiency in English required (e.g., IELTS, TOEFL, or AIT English Test)
Other_Requirements: Two recommendation letters. Detailed research proposal (for relevant programs). Application fee required.
Scholarship_Info: Prestigious non-binding scholarships offered by the Asian Institute of Technology (AIT), funded by the Royal Thai Government (RTG), designed to attract and support outstanding students from Thailand and other Asian nations who wish to pursue Master's and Doctoral degrees at AIT.
Application_Documents:
Online Application Portal submission
Two recommendation letters
Research proposal
Academic transcripts and degree certificates
Proof of English proficiency
Timeline:
28 February (annually) : General Application Deadline
20 December 2025 : Application Deadline for January 2026 intake
Early January 2026 : Application Deadline for 2026-28 cohort (October 2026 commencement)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Key benefits include:
*   Tuition Fee Waiver: Full tuition fees are covered for the duration of the program (up to 8 semesters for undergraduates). While standard tuition fees per semester are approximately KRW 9,500,000 for undergraduates and KRW 9,559,000 for graduates, the scholarship ensures these are waived.
*   Monthly Stipend:
    *   Undergraduate students receive a monthly stipend ranging from KRW 300,000 to KRW 350,000 to cover living expenses.
    *   Graduate students receive a general monthly allowance based on KAIST policies.
*   Accommodation: The cost of accommodation is covered.
*   Health Insurance: Health insurance expenses are included.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to international students worldwide. Applicants holding Korean Citizenship (including dual citizenship) are NOT eligible to apply as international students. Applicants of Korean origin who completed their entire education (elementary, junior high, and high school) outside of Korea must submit the "Certificate of the Facts Concerning the Entry & Exit" issued by the Korean Immigration Office. For undergraduate programs, applicants must have completed or expect to graduate from high school by February 2026 (for Spring 2026 intake) or August 2026 (for Fall 2026 intake). For Master's programs, applicants must hold or expect to hold a bachelor’s degree before enrollment at KAIST. For Doctoral programs, applicants must hold or expect to hold both a bachelor’s and a master’s degree before enrollment at KAIST. A strong interest in science, engineering, or technology-related fields, strong knowledge in mathematics, and familiarity with the intended field of study and research are highly recommended.
Eligible_Fields: Computer Science, Materials Science & Engineering, Physics, Mathematical Sciences, Chemistry, Biological Sciences, Graduate School of Medical Science and Engineering, School of Transdisciplinary Studies, College of Natural Sciences, College of Life Science & Bioengineering, College of Engineering, College of Business (including KAIST MBA and Finance MBA programs), Other science, technology, innovation, and entrepreneurship-related fields.
Eligible_Field_Group: IT & Data Science, Engineering & Technology, Natural Sciences, Healthcare & Medicine, Economics & Business
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Min_Gpa: Not specified for application; 2.7/4.3 required for undergraduate scholarship maintenance.
Language_Certificate: TOEFL, IELTS, or official documentation of English-medium education
Special_Circumstances: Applicants of Korean origin who completed their entire education outside of Korea must submit the "Certificate of the Facts Concerning the Entry & Exit".
Other_Requirements: All candidates must submit an online application using the official KAIST application platform. An application fee is required. Applicants admitted to KAIST as international students are automatically considered for the KAIST International Student Scholarship; however, applicants should explicitly check the "KAIST scholarship" option on the Statement of Financial Resources section of the online admissions application.
Scholarship_Info: The KAIST International Student Scholarship is a highly competitive, fully funded scholarship program offered by the Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (KAIST), a leading university in South Korea. Established in 1971, KAIST is renowned as a research-oriented science and engineering institution. This scholarship is specifically designed for international students pursuing undergraduate and graduate degrees, serving as a cornerstone of KAIST's commitment to attracting top international talent.
Application_Documents: Online application form, Payment of the application fee, Certificate of the Facts Concerning the Entry & Exit (for applicants of Korean origin who studied abroad).
Timeline:
September 19, 2025 : Early Admission (Undergraduate) Opening Date
October 23, 2025 : Early Admission (Undergraduate) Application Deadline
November 6, 2025 : Regular Admission (Undergraduate - Fall 2026) Opening Date
January 6, 2026 : Regular Admission (Undergraduate - Fall 2026) Application Deadline
March 2, 2026 : Study for Spring 2026 intake commences
March 31, 2026 : Graduate Admission Application Deadline

Funding_Level: Tuition Waiver, Other Costs, Partial Funding, Stipend
Funding_Details:
The scholarship provides full funding for the Oxford MBA course fees, tuition fees, and college fees. In addition to covering these academic costs, it also contributes partial living expenses.

Covered Expenses:
*   MBA course fees (full coverage)
*   Tuition fees (full coverage)
*   College fees (full coverage)
*   Partial living expenses
Eligibility_Criteria:
The Skoll Scholarship is specifically awarded to social entrepreneurs who demonstrate a profound commitment to social change.

Key Eligibility Requirements:
*   Applicants must be social entrepreneurs interested in undertaking an Oxford MBA.
*   They must demonstrate a strong commitment to creating and leading social ventures that tackle deep-seated social and environmental issues.
*   A clear commitment to a career in social innovation and impact is essential.
*   Applicants must be ready to utilize the Oxford MBA program and the Skoll Centre community to enhance and expand their social impact.
*   Candidates must articulate how being part of the University of Oxford, the Saïd Business School MBA programme, and the Skoll Centre community would advance their professional growth and their ability to create systemic social or environmental impact.
Experience_Years: Not explicitly stated, but significant practical engagement implied.
Language_Certificate: Required for Oxford MBA admission for non-native English speakers (e.g., IELTS, TOEFL)
Career_Plan: A strong commitment to a career in social innovation and impact is crucial. Applicants must articulate how the Oxford MBA and the Skoll Centre community will advance their professional growth and enhance their ability to create systemic social or environmental impact.
Other_Requirements: A key component of the scholarship application involves submitting responses to specific Skoll Scholarship essay questions. These essays are submitted as part of the broader Oxford MBA application.
Scholarship_Info: The Skoll Scholarship is a prestigious opportunity that provides not only financial support but also access to the vibrant Skoll community, aiming to enhance and broaden the skills of social entrepreneurs for more effective social change. It acknowledges the financial challenges that individuals committed to social innovation and impact may face when pursuing an MBA.
Application_Documents: Responses to Skoll Scholarship essay questions (integrated into Oxford MBA application), Reference letters (standard part of Oxford MBA application).
Timeline: Currently open : Application Opening Date, 2026-01-07 : Application Deadline

Funding_Level: Full scholarship
Funding_Details:
Full tuition and academic fees (paid directly to the university)
Living allowance
UK Visa and Health Surcharge
Travel costs, including flights to and from the study destination
Laptop allowance
Arrival allowance
Departure allowance
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be exceptional students from Zambia, Zimbabwe, or Malawi, and domiciled in these countries. The scholarship is exclusively for Master’s-level study. The Trust cannot consider applications from those who have already commenced a course of study. Applicants must apply to one or more of the partner universities in the UK and/or South Africa. An application may include up to four degree courses, at UK and/or South African Partner Universities. For South African universities, candidates may apply for the scholarship before receiving an official offer, but they must clearly list their intended programmes and institutions. Preference is given to applicants who have achieved a Distinction or Merit (Upper Second Class) in their undergraduate degree. Applicants should demonstrate the ability to study/work in a foreign environment, as assessed by their academic referee.
Min_Gpa: Distinction or Merit (Upper Second Class) in undergraduate degree
Experience_Years: At least one year's work experience
Language_Certificate: Not specified
Special_Circumstances: Not specified
Other_Requirements: Applicants to South African universities must provide a SAQA Certificate of Evaluation, verifying their qualifications' equivalence to NQF Level 8, which is required for Master’s study in South Africa. Applicants should demonstrate the ability to study/work in a foreign environment, as assessed by their academic referee.
Scholarship_Info: The Beit Trust Postgraduate Scholarships are a prestigious opportunity provided by The Beit Trust, a registered charity, designed to support exceptional students from Malawi, Zambia, and Zimbabwe who are domiciled in these countries. The program facilitates master's-level study at leading universities in the United Kingdom and South Africa. The Beit Trust offers annually a number of Postgraduate Masters Scholarships abroad for studies or research. For the 2026/27 academic year, the scholarships are jointly funded with the University of Edinburgh for students undertaking a Master's programme.
Application_Documents:
Scholarship Main application form
Academic Reference Form
Positive employer reference
SAQA Certificate of Evaluation (mandatory for applicants to South African universities)
Timeline:
Applications are open (specific opening date not provided) : Application Opening
2026-02-13 : Application Deadline (17:00 CAT)
2026/27 Academic Year : Scholarship Award Period

Scholarship_Name: Open Society Foundations Civil Society Leadership Awards
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Successful applicants receive comprehensive support, which includes:
*   Tuition and mandatory university fees.
Eligibility_Criteria:
The Civil Society Leadership Awards target individuals who are poised to make a significant impact in their home countries or regions. Applicants are evaluated based on a holistic assessment of their academic record, professional experience, leadership potential, and commitment to open society values.

Geographic Eligibility:
Awards are available to citizens of specific countries, including: Azerbaijan, Belarus, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan, Uzbekistan. Additionally, the program generally targets citizens from 17 countries across Africa, Eurasia, South-East Asia, and the Middle East.

Academic Requirements:
Candidates must possess: An earned bachelor's degree with an excellent academic record. While no minimum GPA is specified, a strong academic background is a crucial evaluation factor.

Professional and Leadership Requirements:
Applicants are expected to demonstrate: Professional excellence and aptitude. A deep commitment to leading positive social change in their communities. Maturity, intellectual curiosity, flexibility, and civil society leadership potential. A clear commitment to their home country or region in supporting open society development.

Language Proficiency:
Candidates must demonstrate proficiency in the language of instruction (English, French, or German) at a level required for admission by the host universities.
Eligible_Fields: Communications, Journalism & Media, Culture, History & Society, Development Studies, Economics, Education Management & Leadership, Environment & Natural Resource Management, Gender Studies, Human Rights, Law (including Human Rights law), Politics & International Studies, Public Health Policy & Health Management, Public Policy & Administration, Social Work & Social Policy
Eligible_Field_Group: Arts, Design & Media, Humanities & Social Sciences, Law & Public Policy, Economics & Business, Education & Training, Agriculture & Environment, Healthcare & Medicine, Social Services & Care
Language_Certificate: Proficiency in the language of instruction (English, French, or German) at a level required for admission by the host universities.
Career_Plan: Profound commitment to fostering positive social change within their communities; dedication to open society values; clear commitment to their home country or region in supporting open society development.
Other_Requirements:
Be able to receive and maintain a visa or study permit as required by the host country.
Be able to participate in an intensive pre-academic summer school, typically held in July or August.
Be prepared to commence their Master’s degree program in August or September.
Scholarship_Info: The Open Society Foundations (OSF) Civil Society Leadership Awards (CSLA) program offers fully-funded scholarships for master’s degree study to individuals who demonstrate exceptional academic and professional excellence, coupled with a profound commitment to fostering positive social change within their communities. As one of OSF’s priority areas for post-graduate scholarship funding, the CSLA aims to support the development of future leaders dedicated to open society values. The competition for these awards is open and merit-based, emphasizing academic achievement, professional aptitude, leadership potential, and a proven commitment to open society principles.
Timeline:
2019-05-15 : Application Deadline
July or August : Pre-academic summer school
August or September : Master’s degree program commencement

Scholarship_Name: Education for Sustainable Energy Development (ESED) Scholarship
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Fixed Amount
Funding_Details: The scholarship provides significant financial support. While some sources indicate an award of up to US$10,000 per year, others, including university-specific information, state up to US$21,000 per year. The scholarship is awarded for a maximum duration of two years.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be citizens of developing countries and territories identified for OECD official development aid in the DAC List of ODA Recipients. They must be full-time students planning to undertake studies at the Master's level or Post-Doctoral level. Students already receiving full funding for their studies are not eligible. Those receiving scholarships that cover their tuition fees may not be eligible for the full ESED scholarship amount. Applicants are expected to demonstrate excellent grades, typically ranking in the top 20% of their class.
Eligible_Fields: Zero-carbon energy, Smart grids, Electric transportation, Energy storage, Advanced electricity technologies, Public policy, Economics, Law, Political science, Other relevant fields contributing to sustainable energy development.
Eligible_Field_Group: Engineering & Technology, Law & Public Policy, Economics & Business
Experience_Years: Not strictly mandatory, no minimum years specified.
Language_Certificate: Not specified in report, consult official website.
Special_Circumstances: The scholarship is not retroactive, meaning it cannot be applied to studies already completed or expenses already incurred before the award.
Other_Requirements: No specific requirements for reference letters mentioned.
Scholarship_Info: The Education for Sustainable Energy Development (ESED) Scholarship, provided by the Global Sustainable Electricity Partnership (GSEP), is a prestigious program designed to foster the next generation of innovators and thinkers in sustainable energy. It targets outstanding students from developing countries pursuing advanced master's or post-doctoral level studies in fields critical to sustainable energy development. The scholarship offers substantial financial support and aims to build local expertise in developing nations. It is a key initiative by GSEP to support global efforts in sustainable energy by investing in human capital, empowering individuals who will drive innovation and contribute significantly to the field.
Application_Documents:
- A copy of their passport (photo page) or birth certificate.
- A comprehensive Curriculum Vitae (CV) detailing education, work experience (if applicable), honors, and background in volunteer and/or extracurricular activities.
- An admission letter from the chosen academic institution. If an admission letter has not yet been received, an acknowledgment of the institute’s receipt showing that an application has been submitted may be accepted.
Timeline:
January 9, 2023 : Application Opening Date
April 7, 2023 : Application Deadline

Scholarship_Name: Invest Your Talent in Italy Scholarship
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Full scholarship packages are provided.
Covered Expenses:
*   Subsistence allowance
*   Fee-waiver (exemption from tuition fees)
*   Dedicated student support services
Scholarships are typically awarded for 9 months.
Additional Benefits: A compulsory full-time, three-month internship in an Italian company that is part of the program is a key component for all scholarship winners. This internship is integral to the program's commitment to professional development.
Eligibility_Criteria: The scholarship is open to international students from specific eligible countries. Eligible Countries (for 9th Edition, A.Y. 2024-2025): Armenia, Azerbaijan, Brazil, Colombia, Egypt, Ethiopia, Ghana, India, Indonesia, Iran, Kazakhstan, Mexico, Republic of Korea, People’s Republic of China (PRC), Tunisia, Turkey, Vietnam. Applicants must first complete a pre-application process at their chosen Italian university, following each university’s specific admission procedures, before submitting an IYT scholarship application. Only students who have submitted their pre-application for one of the postgraduate courses included in the program can apply for an IYT scholarship.
Eligible_Fields: Economics, Management, Engineering, High Technology, Information Technologies, Architecture, Design, Business Management
Eligible_Field_Group: Economics & Business, Engineering & Technology, IT & Data Science, Construction & Planning, Arts, Design & Media
Experience_Years: Not required for application, but a compulsory three-month full-time internship is part of the scholarship program for all winners.
Language_Certificate: English language certificate (e.g., IELTS, TOEFL, or other recognized language certificates)
Special_Circumstances: Bachelor's degree must not have been awarded by an Italian institution.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must complete a pre-application process at their chosen Italian university as a prerequisite. For scholarship renewal: Achievement of 30 credits (CFU) by July 20th, regular attendance of courses indicated in the academic program, and attendance of the Italian language course offered by the university. The high degree of commitment required by the IYT program does not allow participation in other international training courses offered by universities.
Scholarship_Info: The "Invest Your Talent in Italy" (IYT) Scholarship is a prestigious program initiated by the Italian government, in collaboration with several ministries and agencies. It is designed to promote the internationalization of the Italian university system by attracting talented international students to pursue English-taught Master's degree programs in strategic fields. The program offers comprehensive financial support and includes a compulsory three-month internship in an Italian company, fostering academic excellence, professional proficiency, and career opportunities within Italy.
Application_Documents:
Initial Application: Reference letters, English language certificates.
Scholarship Renewal: University Transcript of exams (with CFUs), Certificate of Attendance of the Italian Language Course offered by the universities.
Timeline:
January 23, 2025 : Application Opening Date (A.Y. 2025-2026, 10th Edition)
February 24, 2025 : Application Deadline (A.Y. 2025-2026)
July 20th (e.g., July 20th, 2026, for A.Y. 2025-2026 renewal) : Deadline for scholarship renewal application

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Travel costs, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The fellowship provides comprehensive financial support, making it a full tuition scholarship from ESMT. The tuition coverage amounts to €25,000 for Master’s in Management (MIM) students and €43,500 for MBA students. In addition to tuition, fellows receive fair compensation for travel costs, accommodation costs, and program-related fees. One source indicates the overall value of the fellowship is €58,000, encompassing these various covered expenses.

Covered Expenses:
*   Full tuition fees
*   Travel costs
*   Accommodation costs
*   Program related fees
Quantity: Up to three fellowships are available each year.
Eligibility_Criteria:
The Kofi Annan MBA Fellowship targets academically distinguished students and high-potential professionals from developing countries who demonstrate financial need and do not have the financial means to study in Europe.

Key Eligibility Requirements:
*   Nationality/Residency: Emerging leader from a developing country. Applicants must be from developing countries.
*   Leadership Potential: Demonstrable leadership skills, significant professional achievements, and a track record of excellence.
*   Academic Excellence: Excellent academic credentials.
*   Financial Need: Must prove financial need.
*   Commitment to Home Country: Willingness to apply skills back home after completing the program.
*   ESMT Application Criteria: Must meet ESMT's full-time MBA application criteria.
Eligible_Fields: Master’s in Management (MIM), One-year full-time MBA program
Experience_Years: Minimum of three years of professional experience (for MBA applicants)
Language_Certificate: IELTS: Minimum score of 7, TOEFL: Minimum score of 95 (ESMT code: 8707), PTE: Minimum score of 64. General fluency in written and spoken English is required.
Special_Circumstances: Applicants must be emerging leaders from developing countries. Specific mention is made of residents of Nigeria in some contexts, indicating a potential focus or example.
Career_Plan: Willingness to apply acquired skills back home in their developing country after completing the program.
Other_Requirements: Letter of recommendation, Scholarship essay explaining how they qualify for this specific scholarship, Demonstrated financial need, Must meet ESMT's full-time MBA application criteria, GMAT or GRE score (GMAT minimum 640).
Scholarship_Info: The Kofi Annan MBA Fellowship is a prestigious scholarship program offered by ESMT Berlin (European School of Management and Technology) in Germany, in cooperation with the Kofi Annan Business Schools Foundation, based in The Hague, Netherlands. This fellowship is designed to support emerging leaders from developing countries who wish to pursue higher education in management, specifically a two-year Master’s in Management (MIM) or a one-year full-time MBA education.
Application_Documents:
Scholarship essay
Letter of recommendation
Other documents typically required for ESMT's full-time MBA application (e.g., Bachelor's degree, professional experience proof, GMAT/GRE, English proficiency scores).
Timeline:
September 30, annually : Application deadline for the full-time MBA program
January of each year : MBA program commences
Historically, June 30, 2018 : Application deadline for the Master’s in Management (MIM) program

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs, Partial Funding
Funding_Details:
Funding Details:
*   Monthly Stipend: CHF 1920/month for PhD and Research scholarships.
*   Health Insurance: Mandatory Swiss health insurance is covered for non-EU/EFTA awardees.
*   Tuition Fees: Partial tuition exemptions are provided, with some sources indicating full tuition fee coverage.
*   Additional Support: A professor hosting an FCS scholarship holder at a Swiss institute (e.g., USI) may decide to top up the scholarship with a part-time job appointment, funded by the institute's doctoral funding resources.
Covered Expenses:
*   Tuition fees (partial or full exemption)
*   Monthly stipend
*   Mandatory Swiss health insurance (for non-EU/EFTA awardees)
*   Practical benefits
Quantity: Not specified, awarded annually to individuals from over 180 countries.
Eligibility_Criteria:
General Eligibility:
*   Young researchers from abroad who have completed a master’s degree or PhD.
*   Foreign artists holding a bachelor’s degree.
*   Post-graduate researchers in any discipline (holding a master’s degree as a minimum) who are planning to pursue research or further studies at doctoral or post-doctoral level in Switzerland.
Exclusion:
*   Applicants who have already benefited from a Swiss Government Excellence Scholarship are not eligible to apply for a second scholarship.
Eligible_Fields: Any discipline (for researchers), Schools of music and arts (for artists)
Min_Gpa: Not specified universally; 2.5 GPA mentioned for visiting students (Caltech context).
Experience_Years: No specific minimum years of experience stated, targets young/post-graduate researchers.
Language_Certificate: Not explicitly mentioned as mandatory.
Special_Circumstances: Applicants who have already benefited from a Swiss Government Excellence Scholarship are not eligible to apply for a second scholarship.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must secure a willing academic supervisor at a host institution in Switzerland before applying; a letter of support from this supervisor is essential. The application for a PhD scholarship (including the letter of support from a host supervisor) and the application for admission to a doctoral program at a Swiss higher education institution are two separate procedures. Applicants who have already benefited from a Swiss Government Excellence Scholarship are not eligible to apply for a second scholarship.
Scholarship_Info: The Swiss Government Excellence Scholarships are an annual initiative by the Swiss Confederation, administered by the State Secretariat for Education, Research and Innovation (SERI, also known as SEFRI) and the Federal Commission for Scholarships for Foreign Students (FCS, also known as ESKAS or CFBE). These prestigious scholarships are designed to encourage international exchange and research cooperation between Switzerland and over 180 other countries. The program supports individuals pursuing research or further studies at doctoral or post-doctoral levels, as well as foreign artists, at various Swiss higher education institutions.
Application_Documents: Documents submitted online via GO ESKAS portal (specific list not provided).
Timeline:
Around September 15 : Application Opening Date
Around November 30 : Application Deadline (varies by country)
End of May : Selection Announcement
September 1 : Scholarship Start Date (entry not before August 1)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
- Tuition Fees: Full coverage of tuition fees for the entire duration of the study programme.
- Monthly Stipend:
    - For BA/BSc, MA/MSc programmes: HUF 43,700 per month.
    - For Doctoral (PhD) programmes: HUF 140,000 (approximately EUR 365-390) per month for the first four semesters, and HUF 180,000 (approximately EUR 470-500) per month for the second four semesters. This stipend is provided for 12 months a year until the completion of studies.
- Accommodation Contribution: Either a free dormitory place or a contribution of HUF 40,000 per month towards accommodation costs for the entire scholarship period.
- Medical Insurance: Comprehensive medical insurance is provided.
Eligibility_Criteria: The scholarship is open to international students from countries that have bilateral educational cooperation agreements with Hungary. Applicants are eligible only for scholarship types and study fields determined by the educational cooperation programmes between Hungary and their specific sending partner country. Applicants must conform to the application and entrance exam criteria of the chosen Hungarian higher education institution and officially enroll upon acceptance. Applicants must ensure that the programme they select is eligible under the agreement between Hungary and their home country’s sending partner.
Eligible_Fields: Agricultural Sciences, Arts and Humanities, Social Science, Computer Science and Information Technology, Legal Science, Economic Science, Engineering Science, Medical and Health Science, Sport Science, Natural Science, Arts, Art Education, Political Science and Public Governance
Eligible_Field_Group: Agriculture & Environment, Arts, Design & Media, Education & Training, Economics & Business, Engineering & Technology, Healthcare & Medicine, Humanities & Social Sciences, IT & Data Science, Law & Public Policy, Natural Sciences, Personal Services & Tourism
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Experience_Years: Not generally specified; PhD (Brazil specific) requires scientific or technological research production, including published articles, book chapters, book authorship, publications in event annals, and coordination of research or extension projects certified by an institution.
Language_Certificate: TOEFL IBT, TOEFL ITP, IELTS, Cambridge Certificate
Special_Circumstances: The "Students at Risk Subprogramme" is available for eligible applicants.
Other_Requirements: A signed Letter of Recommendation from a former or current academic tutor/supervisor is required. The recommender must hold a scientific degree and have insight into the applicant's professional work. The letter must be written in the language of the selected study programme or in Hungarian. If required by the proposed Doctoral School, a statement from the supervisor at the proposed Host Institution undertaking to supervise the student's work must be submitted by March 15. Scholarship holders must comply with the Stipendium Hungaricum Programme Operational Regulations, including academic progress requirements. New scholarship recipients at Liszt Academy are required to take a compulsory Hungarian as a foreign language and culture course during the first two semesters of their studies.
Scholarship_Info: The Stipendium Hungaricum Scholarship Programme is an official scholarship initiative of the Hungarian Government, managed by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade and coordinated by the Tempus Public Foundation. It aims to facilitate international students' pursuit of higher education in Hungary, promoting the internationalization of Hungarian higher education and attracting top international talent. Launched in 2013, the programme offered programmes at 28 Hungarian higher education institutions in the 2023/2024 academic year.
Application_Documents:
- Call for Applications for BA/MA/OTM programmes (2026/27)
- Call for Applications for doctoral programmes (2026/27)
- Application Guide (2025/26)
- Copy of BA/BSc certificate (for MA/MSc applicants) with notarized English/Hungarian translation
- Updated curriculum vitae (e.g., from Lattes Platform for Brazil PhD applicants)
- Undergraduate diploma
- Master’s diploma (optional for PhD applicants)
- Proficiency test results (TOEFL, IELTS, Cambridge Certificate)
- Video recordings (for Liszt Academy applicants)
- Letters of Recommendation
- Statement of the Supervisor (if required by the Doctoral School)
- Transcript of Records and its translations (if not in the language of the study programme or Hungarian)
- Copy of Identification Document (passport data page or national ID card)
Timeline:
January – February 2026 : Application period for the 2026/2027 academic year
Application system opening : To be announced (Call for Applications for the 2026/2027 academic year has already been published)
2026-01-15 : Application Deadline (specific submission times vary by region)
2026-03-15 : Supervisor Statement Deadline (for PhD, if required by the Doctoral School)
Before 2025-08-01 : Final Degree and Transcript Submission (for 2025/2026 academic year)
Initial Review : Applications are reviewed jointly by the sending partner (in the applicant’s home country) and the Hungarian host institution
Formal Checks : Host institutions conduct formal checks of application documents
Entrance Exams/Interviews : Formally correct applications lead to information about entrance exam/interview details from the host institution
Nomination : Scholarships are awarded by the Minister responsible for education in Hungary based upon the nomination of the Hungarian Scholarship Board
Notification : Applicants are informed about their results by the ministry of education of their country or by the national scholarship office/agency

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Accommodation, Tuition Waiver, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Master's Level: Monthly allowance of €1,181 (€1,031 maintenance + €150 stipend).
Doctoral Level: Monthly allowance of €2,100.
PhD Funding Duration: 12 to 36 months, depending on program and enrollment year. Specifically, 12 or 18 months for all candidates, including those already enrolled in a doctoral program (e.g., joint supervision or dual degree). Maximum 12 months for recipients entering the second or third year of a doctorate program, and maximum 18 months for recipients entering the first or second year of a doctorate program.
Covered Expenses: Living allowance, Tuition and fees, Travel and transportation expenses (international airfare and domestic travel support within France), Health (medical) insurance, Housing assistance (support in locating accommodation and covering housing search costs), Participation in cultural activities.
Eligibility_Criteria: The scholarship targets high-achieving international students seeking to enroll in Master's or PhD programs at French higher education institutions. Applicants must be nominated by a French institution.
Eligible_Fields: Biology and health, Ecological transition, Mathematics and digital, Science and engineering, French history, language and civilization, Law and political sciences, Economics and management
Eligible_Field_Group: Natural Sciences, Healthcare & Medicine, Agriculture & Environment, Engineering & Technology, IT & Data Science, Humanities & Social Sciences, Law & Public Policy, Economics & Business
Min_Gpa: Not specified, but high academic ranking (e.g., top 3-5% rank) is a decisive factor.
Language_Certificate: Not explicitly stated by the program, but individual French higher education institutions may have their own language proficiency requirements.
Age: Master's Programs: Under 27 (born after March 31st, 1998); Doctorate Programs: Under 32 (born after March 31st, 1993)
Special_Circumstances: Exclusively for foreign/international students; dual nationals (including French) are not eligible. Applicants must not be benefiting from another French government scholarship at the time of application. Candidates must be applying to the Eiffel Scholarship program for the first time. For PhD applications, a cotutelle or joint supervision agreement must be formally signed.
Career_Plan: A well-articulated career plan is typically expected to be integrated into the motivation essay.
Other_Requirements: Age Limits: Master's Programs: Applicants must be under the age of 27, or born after March 31st, 1998. Doctorate Programs: Applicants must be under the age of 32, or born after March 31st, 1993. Reference Letters: A detailed description of academic and/or professional performance from references is required. For PhD applications, a reasoned opinion on the scientific quality of the thesis subject, drafted by an expert (university professor/research supervisor) from outside the applicant's university, along with the expert's CV, is mandatory. As reiterated from the eligibility criteria, applicants must be first-time Eiffel Scholarship candidates, not hold another French government scholarship, and not be dual nationals (including French). For PhD candidates, a cotutelle or joint supervision agreement must be signed.
Scholarship_Info: The France Excellence Eiffel Scholarship Program is a prestigious initiative by the French Ministry for Europe and Foreign Affairs. Its primary objective is to enable French higher education institutions to attract top foreign students to enroll in their Master's and PhD programs in France. Campus France manages the program.
Application_Documents:
Applicants, through their nominating institutions, typically need to provide:
- A detailed description of the requested course and its schedule.
- Copies of the last diploma(s) obtained, including academic ranking.
- Any other documents certifying the applicant's level of excellence or performance.
- A certificate of enrollment for the current academic year (if currently a student).
- For PhD applicants: A reasoned opinion on the scientific quality of the thesis subject drafted by an expert (university professor/research supervisor) from outside the applicant's university, along with the expert's CV.
- A motivation essay (1-2 pages, maximum 1500 words), written in French or English, addressed to the Eiffel Scholarship committee.
Timeline:
October 2025 : Application Launch
Before November 24, 2025 : Internal University Recommendation Deadlines (contact program head/doctoral school)
January 8, 2026 : Official Program Deadline

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs, Fixed Amount
Funding_Details:
Key Funding Details:
*   Fully Funded Programs: Many scholarships are fully funded, covering tuition, living expenses, and travel support. Some programs offer a substantial €7,920 living stipend with no tuition fees.
*   Living Stipends:
    *   General: A living stipend of €400 per month is available for some programs, often including full tuition fee coverage and accommodation support.
    *   Bachelor's and Master's Studies: A common rate is €350 per month for students pursuing Bachelor's or Master's degrees. Degree students typically receive this scholarship for 12 months of the academic year, while exchange students are paid during their study period in Estonia.
    *   Master's Language Programs: Master's students enrolled in language programs may receive €288 per month.
    *   Doctoral Language Programs: Doctoral students in language programs may receive €385 per month.
    *   Historical/Other: A stipend of 4500 Estonian kroons (equivalent to €287) per month has also been noted for covering living costs.
*   Minimum Scholarship Value: Some specific scholarships, such as those offered by EUAS, have a minimum value of €1,500 per scholarship, with up to seven awards granted annually.
*   Overall Funding: The Estonian Centre for International Development (ESTDEV) has allocated significant funding, awarding 399,611 euros to 10 scholarship programs in a recent year.

Covered Expenses:
The scholarships generally cover:
*   Tuition fees
*   Living expenses (stipends for accommodation and daily costs)
*   Travel support
*   Research awards (for specific research grants)
*   Accommodation (for some fully funded programs)
Quantity: Up to seven awards annually (for specific scholarships like EUAS)
Eligibility_Criteria:
General Eligibility:
*   International students, researchers, and academic staff interested in studying or conducting research in Estonia.
*   Students already pursuing Bachelor’s, Master’s, and PhD degrees in Estonia are eligible for degree and exchange study scholarships.
*   Individuals interested in participating in short summer and winter schools.

Specific Program Eligibility:
*   Estonian Ancestry Scholarship: Intended for students of Estonian ancestry studying full-time in a Bachelor's or Master's degree program at an accredited academic institution in the USA, Estonia, or elsewhere. Applicants can apply a maximum of 6 times (4 years for Bachelor's + 2 years for Master's).
*   Estonian School of Diplomacy (ESD) Program: Targets young diplomats and civil servants.
Eligible_Fields: International Relations and Diplomacy, Estonian language and culture
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Experience_Years: No specific minimum years of experience or accepted types of experience are detailed in the provided information, beyond the general targeting of researchers and academic staff.
Language_Certificate: No specific IELTS, TOEFL, or other language certificates are explicitly mentioned as a general requirement for these scholarships.
Special_Circumstances: Estonian Ancestry
Other_Requirements: Academic Record: For programs like the Estonian School of Diplomacy (ESD), applicants must submit a copy of their academic record from the institution of higher education attended most recently. An unofficial English translation is required if the original is not in English.
Scholarship_Info: The Estonian Government Scholarships represent a comprehensive program designed to support international students, researchers, and academic staff interested in pursuing studies or conducting research in Estonia. The scholarships are primarily provided by the Estonian Ministry of Education and Research, in partnership with the Education and Youth Board (Harno), the Estonian Centre for International Development (ESTDEV), and the Estonian Ministry of Foreign Affairs for specific initiatives. The program is comprehensive, offering various scholarships for international students, researchers, and academic staff across different study levels and types.
Application_Documents:
Applicants are generally required to submit the following documents:
*   Application form: Typically in Word format.
*   Copy of passport or ID card.
*   Estonian higher education institution confirmation letter: This letter must confirm the applicant's degree or exchange student status for the relevant academic year (e.g., 2025/26), specify the level of study, curriculum, and the start and end dates of study.
*   Academic record: For specific programs like the ESD, a copy of the academic record from the most recently attended higher education institution is required, with an unofficial English translation if necessary.
Timeline:
January 15, 2026 : Applications open for USA high school graduates for Estonian Ancestry Scholarship (2026/2027 academic year)
February 1, 2026 : Applications open for all other eligible individuals for Estonian Ancestry Scholarship
February 16, 2026 : Applications close for all applicants for Estonian Ancestry Scholarship
End of November (following a November 1st internal deadline) : Decisions typically given for Estonian Ancestry Scholarship
General : Applications for the 2025/2026 academic year are generally open for foreign students wishing to study at Estonian higher education institutions as degree or exchange students.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Funding Details:
*   Full Coverage of Course Fees: The scholarship covers all course fees, including both tuition fees and college fees, in full.
*   Generous Living Expenses Grant: Scholars receive a generous grant for living expenses. For full-time students, this annual grant is at least the UKRI (UK Research and Innovation) minimum doctoral stipend rate. This amount is normally sufficient to cover the living costs for a single student residing in Oxford.
*   Duration of Funding: Funding is typically provided for the entire period of a scholar's fee liability. At the discretion of the academic divisions, some Clarendon scholarships may cover an additional period of study beyond the standard duration of fee liability.

Covered Expenses:
*   Course fees
*   Tuition fees
*   College fees
*   Living expenses grant
Quantity: Over 200 new scholarships annually (some sources specify 230+, around 140 full, or over 100 new scholarships)
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be applying for a new Master's or DPhil course at the University of Oxford. Current students who are continuing to study for the same degree at Oxford in the next academic year are not eligible. The scholarship is open to all nationalities, ordinary residence, and subject areas, with no restrictions based on country of origin. Awards are based on outstanding academic merit and potential, including exceptional academic performance, leadership potential, and for DPhil applicants, strong research potential. Applicants must meet the English language proficiency requirements set by their chosen graduate course, if applicable.
Min_Gpa: US degrees: 3.7/4.0 (most successful candidates achieve higher); equivalent first-class degree from other systems. An outstanding academic record at the Master's level can, in some cases, compensate for a moderate performance in a first degree.
Experience_Years: Not required generally; 2 years of full-time work for specific programs like MBA.
Language_Certificate: Required if English is not native language or previous education not in English (e.g., IELTS, TOEFL). Specific course requirements apply (e.g., MSc Computer Science: IELTS 7.5 overall, 7.0 each section).
Other_Requirements: Strong academic and/or professional reference letters are crucial. Applicants are expected to demonstrate leadership potential. For DPhil (PhD) applicants, demonstrating strong research potential and aptitude for the proposed course of study is essential, often assessed through research proposals and references. Particular consideration is given to an applicant’s future academic potential and their aptitude for the proposed course of study. Evidence of high academic achievement is also considered.
Scholarship_Info: The Clarendon Scholarship, also known as the Clarendon Fund Scholarship, is a prestigious, fully-funded scholarship program offered by the University of Oxford. It is designed to attract and support outstanding graduate students from around the world to pursue Master's and DPhil (PhD) degrees at one of the world's leading universities. The scholarship is tenable for study in the United Kingdom, specifically at the University of Oxford. Beyond financial support, it fosters an active, internationally diverse, and multidisciplinary community, enabling scholars to form lasting social, academic, and professional networks.
Application_Documents:
Applicants are automatically considered for a Clarendon Scholarship when they apply for their chosen graduate course through Oxford's official application portal by the relevant December or January deadline. No separate application or additional documents are required specifically for the scholarship. However, applicants must submit all required documents for their chosen graduate course, which may include:
*   Proof of English proficiency (IELTS/TOEFL, if required)
*   Academic transcripts
*   Reference letters
*   A personal statement or statement of purpose
*   A writing sample or portfolio (for some courses, e.g., humanities or fine arts)
*   A research proposal (for DPhil applicants)
Timeline:
Currently open : Applications for 2026/27 academic year
December or January deadline (course-specific) : Application deadline for graduate course (automatic scholarship consideration)
After shortlisting : Official scholarship offer letter issued

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
*   Tuition fees
*   Return airfare
*   A monthly stipend
*   Other related expenses, ensuring a fully supported study experience in Taiwan.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be a citizen of a country on the official List of Countries Eligible for TaiwanICDF Scholarship (historically over 40 countries). Must satisfy any additional criteria associated with their country. The scholarship is exclusively for students attending partner schools and programs within the Taiwan International Cooperation Alliance (TICA).
Eligible_Field_Group: Agriculture & Environment, Healthcare & Medicine, Law & Public Policy, Engineering & Technology
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Language_Certificate: TaiwanICDF itself does not impose English proficiency test requirements (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS). However, individual partner universities and specific programs may have their own requirements (e.g., TOEFL >80 IBT, 213 CBT, 550 PBT, or IELTS 6.5).
Special_Circumstances: Must be a citizen of a country on the official List of Countries Eligible for TaiwanICDF Scholarship. Must enroll in programs within the Taiwan International Cooperation Alliance (TICA).
Other_Requirements: Be in good mental and physical health. Complete the online application, print the form, and accurately upload all necessary documents. Unsuccessful applicants are not prohibited from reapplying in subsequent years.
Scholarship_Info: The TaiwanICDF Scholarship is a prestigious program by the International Cooperation and Development Fund (Taiwan ICDF) to support international students pursuing higher education in Taiwan. It fosters international talent and cooperation by partnering with 18-19 Taiwanese universities, offering 29 English-taught programs (27 Master's, 2 PhD) across diverse disciplines. It targets students enrolling in TICA framework programs.
Application_Documents: Completed online application form (mandatory), printed form, and accurately uploaded all required documents (specific list not detailed).
Timeline:
December 1, 2025 : Application period opens
March 15, 2026 : Application period closes

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The scholarship provides comprehensive financial support for up to three years of graduate studies at Stanford University. It covers the full cost of the first three years of a graduate program.
Covered Expenses:
* Full tuition fees.
* A stipend for living and academic expenses, which includes room and board, books, and academic supplies.
* A travel stipend for one annual trip to and from Stanford.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to citizens of all countries. Applicants must have earned their first undergraduate (bachelor's) degree within the last seven years. The first bachelor's degree must be completed before enrollment in the Stanford graduate program. Even if an applicant has already earned a graduate degree, they remain eligible as long as the undergraduate degree timeframe requirement is met. Applicants must simultaneously apply for admission to a full-time graduate degree program at Stanford University. Competitive candidates for the Knight-Hennessy Scholars Program are, at a minimum, competitive candidates for their selected graduate program at Stanford. The chosen program must be a full-time graduate degree program at Stanford.
Min_Gpa: Not specified for Knight-Hennessy Scholars; applicants must meet Stanford graduate program requirements. Competitive candidates generally have at least 3.7/4.0, with many successful Stanford graduate candidates having 3.9+/4.0.
Experience_Years: No specific minimum years of professional experience are required. The focus is on demonstrated leadership and civic commitment.
Language_Certificate: TOEFL, IELTS, PTE (for MBA)
Age: No explicit age limits are stated, but the requirement to have earned the first undergraduate degree within the last seven years acts as a de facto limit for recent graduates.
Career_Plan: Applicants are required to reflect on their life's calling and how their Stanford education and the Knight-Hennessy Scholars experience will support their future plans. Essay questions often prompt deep self-reflection on past experiences, influences, and future aspirations, including connecting the dots of their life journey.
Other_Requirements: Reference letters required (specifics not detailed); Applicants must record a two-minute video within the application (prompt: “Teach something to your cohort of fellow Knight-Hennessy Scholars”); Selection based on Independence of Thought, Purposeful Leadership, and Civic Mindset; No institutional nomination or endorsement from an applicant's undergraduate institution is required to apply.
Scholarship_Info: The Knight-Hennessy Scholars program is designed to build a multidisciplinary, multicultural community of graduate students at Stanford University. Scholars are united by independence of thought, purposeful leadership, and a civic mindset, dedicated to finding creative solutions to the world’s greatest challenges. The program aims to prepare scholars to be visionary, courageous, and collaborative leaders who can address complex global issues. It fosters a vibrant community and aims to cultivate visionary, courageous, and collaborative leaders equipped to tackle the world's most pressing challenges.
Application_Documents: Online application form, video statement, several essays.
Timeline: Current Status : Application for 2026 cohort is closed; 2025-10-08 : Application Deadline (2026 Cohort); Summer 2026 : Application anticipated to open (2027 Cohort)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Fully-funded, all-expenses-paid scholarship, offering a comprehensive package that covers all educational and living costs for the one-year Master's program.
*   Tuition fees
*   Program fees
*   Housing (room and board)
*   Food
*   Travel to and from Beijing at the beginning and end of the academic year
*   In-country study tour/excursion travel
*   Required course books and supplies
*   Laptop
*   Smartphone
*   Health insurance
*   A modest personal stipend
Eligibility_Criteria: The program targets aspiring global leaders from across the world who demonstrate exceptional potential and a desire to understand other cultures. Applicants must possess an undergraduate degree or a first degree from an accredited college or university or its equivalent. Those currently enrolled in an undergraduate program must be on track to successfully complete all degree requirements before August 1 of their Schwarzman Scholars enrollment year. Candidates must be at least 18 years of age but not yet 29 years of age as of August 1 of their Schwarzman Scholars enrollment year. There are no restrictions on citizenship or nationality. Strong English language skills are mandatory. No official minimum GPA is required; however, the median GPA of successful applicants has historically been 3.8, with only a small number of scholarship recipients having a GPA below 3.7 (on a 4.0 scale). No specific minimum years of professional experience are stated; the program is open to graduating seniors, recent graduates, and young professionals up to age 28. Applicants are expected to demonstrate leadership potential and a track record of leadership, an entrepreneurial spirit, the ability to anticipate and act on emerging trends and opportunities, exemplary character, and a desire to understand other cultures. Professional experiences, volunteer work, and extracurricular leadership roles are all considered.
Eligible_Fields: Public Policy, Economics and Business, International Relations
Eligible_Field_Group: Law & Public Policy, Economics & Business, Humanities & Social Sciences
Required_Degree: Bachelor's degree, Bachelor's equivalent, Final Year Student
Min_Gpa: No official minimum GPA required; historically median 3.8, few below 3.7 (on a 4.0 scale)
Experience_Years: No specific minimum years of professional experience stated; open to graduating seniors, recent graduates, and young professionals up to age 28.
Language_Certificate: Official English proficiency test scores (e.g., IELTS, TOEFL) must be submitted if the applicant's native language is not English. This requirement is waived for applicants who have studied at an undergraduate institution where the primary language of instruction was English for at least two years of their academic program.
Age: 18-28 years of age as of August 1 of enrollment year
Career_Plan: Applicants must articulate how the Schwarzman Scholars program will contribute to their leadership development within their chosen field and demonstrate a clear global vision.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must confirm and certify that all information provided in the application is complete and accurate, that all submitted essays are their own work, and that all factual representations are true and correct.
Scholarship_Info: The Schwarzman Scholars Program is a highly prestigious, fully-funded one-year Master's degree program in Global Affairs at Tsinghua University in Beijing, China. Established by Stephen A. Schwarzman, the program aims to prepare the next generation of global leaders for the challenges of the future by providing unparalleled academic, cultural, and professional experiences. Scholars live and study together on the campus of Schwarzman College, a newly built, state-of-the-art facility where all classes are taught in English. The program is designed to build leadership capacity across sectors and borders, fostering a deep understanding of China and its role in the world.
Application_Documents:
Completed online application form.
Official academic transcripts (most updated if still completing a degree).
Official English proficiency test scores (if applicable).
Two essays.
Two short answer responses.
Three letters of recommendation.

Essays and Short Answer Responses: Two essays and two short answer responses are required. These are critical components of the application, designed to help the selection committee understand the applicant as an individual, assess their leadership abilities/potential, and evaluate their writing and analytical skills. Essays should demonstrate leadership, goals, and a global vision.

Letters of Recommendation: Three letters of recommendation are required, with specific guidelines based on the applicant's current status:
*   For current undergraduates: Two letters from professors who can speak to academic abilities, and one letter specifically addressing leadership abilities (this can be from an employer, supervisor, mentor, faculty member, advisor, or other).
*   For graduate students or young professionals: At least one academic letter from a professor, one letter addressing leadership abilities, and one additional letter that best reflects the applicant’s current profile (e.g., from an additional employer, mentor, or faculty member).
Recommendations should provide examples of how the applicant meets the program's requirements, including academic aptitude, intellectual ability, leadership potential, entrepreneurial spirit, exemplary character, and a desire to understand other cultures.
Timeline:
Applications for the 2026–2027 academic year are officially open.
2025-05-20 : Application Deadline for applicants with Chinese passports (including Taiwan, Hong Kong, Macao)
2025-09-10 : Application Deadline for US/Global applicants

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Fully funded Master's scholarship.
Covered Expenses:
*   Full tuition fees
*   Accommodation in the residential college
*   Monthly stipend / Living expenses
*   One round-trip travel fare / Travel stipend (for travel to and from Beijing)
*   Related fees
*   Field study costs (including support for travel and research trips)
Quantity: Approximately 120 international students are selected annually.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to candidates from all over the world. Strong interest in the interdisciplinary study of China. Demonstrated leadership potential. Outstanding academic record. Broad curiosity. Not required to have Chinese language experience, but applicants should have a strong interest in China. Chinese nationals are not eligible to apply.
Min_Gpa: Not strictly specified, but typically 3.7 or higher
Experience_Years: No minimum years of experience specified for general applicants; Zhuoyue Scholarship recipients are required to have three or more consecutive years of employment experience in government, senior management, higher education, or international organizations.
Language_Certificate: English language proficiency (IELTS, TOEFL, or other language certificates) required for non-native English speakers; specific scores not detailed.
Age: No strict age cut-off; typically under 29 (excluding Zhuoyue Scholarship recipients); some sources suggest 25 years of age or younger at the start of the program.
Special_Circumstances: Zhuoyue Scholarship: This scholarship has specific experience requirements and is an exception to the typical age trend for admitted scholars. Campus-Specific Deadlines: Applicants from partner universities (e.g., UC Berkeley) must adhere to their institution's internal deadlines, which may precede the official Yenching Academy deadline. Institutional Endorsement: Applicants from certain institutions, such as Washington University in St. Louis (WashU), require an endorsement from their university.
Career_Plan: A Statement of Purpose in English, which must include a study plan.
Other_Requirements: Resume/CV: Maximum of two pages. Research Proposal: Maximum of one page. Self-Introduction Video: A three-minute English self-introduction video. Application Form: Completion of the official application form. Statement of Purpose Word Limit: Maximum of 1,500 words, excluding citations.
Scholarship_Info: The Yenching Academy Scholarship, provided by Peking University (PKU), is an esteemed interdisciplinary graduate scholarship program located in Beijing, China. It is a fully funded, residential Master's degree program designed for the 2026-2027 cohort. The scholarship aims to cultivate future leaders with a deep understanding of China.
Application_Documents:
Application form
Resume/CV (two pages maximum)
Research proposal (one page maximum)
Statement of Purpose in English (including a study plan, maximum 1,500 words excluding citations)
Three-minute English self-introduction video
Two letters of recommendation
Timeline:
August 15, 2025 : Application Opening Date
December 1, 2025 (12:00 noon Beijing time) : Application Deadline
November 24, 2025 (12:00 noon) : Campus deadline for the University of California, Berkeley (for the 2026–2027 cohort)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The comprehensive financial package includes:
*   Full Tuition Coverage: All tuition fees for the chosen study program are covered.
*   Monthly Stipend for Living Expenses:
    *   CZK 16,000 (approximately €650) per month for Master's degree students.
    *   CZK 17,000 (approximately €690) per month for PhD degree students.
*   Accommodation Support: Assistance with housing costs is provided.
*   Health Insurance Coverage: Subsidies for health services and comprehensive health insurance are included.
*   Language Preparation Courses: If required for the chosen program, language preparation courses are covered.
*   Travel: Support for travel expenses is part of the scholarship benefits.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be citizens of one of the following countries: Bosnia and Herzegovina, Georgia, Ukraine, Belarus (democratic forces), Ethiopia, Nigeria, Rwanda, Zambia, Cambodia, Sri Lanka, Guatemala, and Jordan. Applicants must be officially nominated by the relevant authorities in their home countries. The scholarship is open to university students, graduates, PhD candidates, and in certain cases, academic staff who wish to undertake study or research visits. Applicants must choose study or research areas that are relevant to their current or previous academic focus. Applicants are expected to demonstrate academic excellence.
Eligible_Fields: Study or research areas relevant to current or previous academic focus; specific Master's programs at Charles University: Master in Economics and Finance (MEF), Master in Finance and Data Analytics (MFDA).
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Experience_Years: Not required for all applicants; academic staff for study or research visits have specific requirements (submission of a specific letter).
Language_Certificate: Required for chosen program's language of instruction (Czech or English); specific standardized tests not explicitly mentioned as mandatory for the scholarship application itself, but host universities autonomously stipulate their own admission terms and language requirements.
Special_Circumstances: Special consideration is given to applicants from Belarus (democratic forces).
Career_Plan: Applicants must sign an "Affirmation on Return to the Country of Origin upon Completion of Studies" (Annex No. 3) as part of their application.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must be officially nominated by the relevant authorities in their home countries. Recognition of foreign secondary and higher education is required. There is no application fee for the Czech Government Scholarship. Pre-evaluation for MEF and MFDA programs at Charles University is offered to enhance chances.
Scholarship_Info: The Czech Government Scholarship is a prestigious initiative provided by the Government of the Czech Republic. It is a cornerstone of the Czech Republic’s Foreign Development Cooperation, designed to support international students from selected developing countries in pursuing higher education in the Czech Republic. Since the 1950s, over 20,000 foreign students have benefited from this program, enabling them to achieve world-class education at public universities across Czechia. The scholarship aims to foster academic excellence and international collaboration.
Application_Documents:
Applicants must prepare and submit a comprehensive set of documents via an online form:
*   Application Form for a Scholarship of the Government of the Czech Republic.
*   Curriculum Vitae (CV) with a focus on studies and employment.
*   Photocopy of passport.
*   Declaration about the Acceptance of the Terms and Conditions Governing the Granting of Scholarships (Annex No. 1).
*   Declaration about the Acceptance of the Terms and Conditions Governing the Provision of Health Services (Annex No. 2).
*   Affirmation on Return to the Country of Origin upon Completion of Studies (Annex No. 3).
*   Legalized copy of birth certificate with a certified translation into the Czech language.
*   Medical confirmation (no more than two months old) with a certified translation into English or Czech (Annex No. 4).
*   Legalized copy of foreign diploma or similar document proving due completion of a Follow-up Master’s Study program (for Doctoral applicants) with a certified translation into the Czech language by a sworn translator/interpreter.
*   Legalized copy of a Diploma Supplement or list of completed subjects and examinations including their scope and grades (marks) achieved, with a certified translation into the Czech language.
Timeline:
Early August : Typical Application Opening
August 4th : Application Opening (for Academic Year 2026/2027)
Late September : Typical Application Closing
