Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The scholarship provides financial assistance to cover:
*   Living costs during the stay in Slovakia.
*   Travel allowances or travel grants, provided as a flat rate to cover travel costs for undertaking the supported study, research, or artistic stay.
Quantity: 146 (75 students, 25 PhD students, 46 university teachers/researchers/artists) for April 30, 2025 deadline
Eligibility_Criteria: Supports mobility of international students, PhD students, university teachers, researchers, and artists for scholarship stays at Slovak universities and research organizations. All Nationalities are eligible. Applicants must be studying or working outside Slovakia. University Students: enrolled in university outside Slovakia, pursuing Master’s or completed at least 2.5 years of undergraduate studies. PhD Students: pursuing higher education/scientific training outside Slovakia. University Teachers, Researchers, Artists: accepted by a Slovak host institution for teaching/research/artistic stay. Ineligible if: accepted for full degree higher education (bachelor, master, doctoral studies) in Slovakia; already studying full degree in Slovakia and wish to fund via NSP; university teachers/researchers/artists without a PhD degree (or its equivalent) who, at the application deadline, have more than 4 years of work experience in these roles (PhD studies are considered work experience); spent 15 or more months (in total) in the territory of the Slovak Republic within the 36 months prior to the application deadline; accepted for a scholarship stay in Slovakia in the framework of other scholarship programmes funded from public resources (e.g., International Visegrad Fund, Erasmus+, CEEPUS, bilateral agreements, etc.).
Eligible_Fields: Study stays, Research stays, Teaching stays, Artistic stays
Experience_Years: 4 years or less of work experience in university teacher, researcher, or artist roles (for those without a PhD)
Language_Certificate: Not specified
Age: Bachelor's/Master's students: 18-26 years, PhD students: 23-35 years
Other_Requirements: Two letters of References; Acceptance/invitation letter from a Slovak host institution
Scholarship_Info: The National Scholarship Programme (NSP) is an esteemed initiative officially known as the National Scholarship Programme of the Slovak Republic. Its primary purpose is to support the mobility of international students, PhD students, university teachers, researchers, and artists for short-term study, research, teaching, or artistic stays at Slovak universities and research organizations. Beyond international mobility, the programme also supports Slovak university students, PhD students, and postdocs for study or research stays outside Slovakia, covering their living costs. The NSP aims to foster academic excellence, cultural exchange, and global collaboration.
Application_Documents:
*   Curriculum Vitae (CV)
*   Motivation Letter
*   Two Letters of Reference
*   Detailed study, teaching, research, and/or artistic programme
*   List of publications/artistic activities (specifically for PhD students)
*   Online application form
Timeline: Applications for the 2026-2027 academic year program are open, with new calls typically announced for the upcoming academic year's summer semester; 2025-09-01 : Earliest start date for 2025-2026 call (PhD students, university teachers, researchers, artists); 2026-04-30 : Application Deadline for 2026-2027 academic year program; 2026-08-31 : Latest start date for 2025-2026 call (PhD students, university teachers, researchers, artists); 2026-11-30 : Latest completion date for 2025-2026 call (PhD students, university teachers, researchers, artists); Specific dates must align with the Admission/Invitation Letter from the host institution.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
- Economy Class Air-Tickets: Provision of economy class air-tickets for travel to Brunei Darussalam from the scholarship recipient’s country of origin/domicile prior to the commencement of the course, and an economy class air-ticket for return travel upon completion of the course.
- Free Education & Tuition Waiver: Full coverage of tuition fees, ensuring free education throughout the scholarship period.
- Living Expenses: Financial support for daily living costs in Brunei Darussalam.
- Travel: General travel allowances are also included.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must not hold Brunei Darussalam citizenship. The scholarship is specifically for international students. Applicants must satisfy the admission requirements for their chosen programs at the selected higher education institution in Brunei. Scholarship recipients are strictly prohibited from undertaking any paid employment or serving on the staff of any country's representative mission in Brunei Darussalam for the entire duration of the scholarship. Upon successful completion of their academic program, scholarship recipients are required to leave Brunei Darussalam with immediate effect. Recipients must conform to all the rules and regulations underlying the scholarship award scheme. The scholarship is open to international students, including those from OIC Member States.
Language_Certificate: English language test required (proof of proficiency)
Age: Undergraduate and Diploma programs: Under 25 years
Special_Circumstances: Open to international students, including OIC Member States.
Other_Requirements: Reference letters are a mandatory part of the application process, typically assessing academic ability and often required to be submitted directly by referees to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Applicants interested in Universiti Brunei Darussalam (UBD) must complete an additional online application through UBD's admission portal. Similarly, applicants for Universiti Teknologi Brunei (UTB) may also have specific application requirements through their respective portals. Applicants may be required to attend an interview and/or sit for a written test. These assessments can be conducted in English, Malay, or Arabic, depending on the specific program requirements and the institution.
Scholarship_Info: The Brunei Darussalam Government Scholarship (BDGS) is a prestigious award offered by the Government of Brunei Darussalam, primarily administered by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. It is exclusively for foreign and international students who wish to pursue higher education in Brunei Darussalam at institutions such as Universiti Brunei Darussalam (UBD), Universiti Islam Sultan Sharif Ali (UNISSA), Universiti Teknologi Brunei (UTB), and Politeknik Brunei (PB).
Application_Documents: Completed application forms, Reference letters (often emailed directly by referees to a designated email address at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs).
Timeline:
Late 2024 / Early 2025 : Applications for 2025/2026 academic session opened
2025-02-15 : Application Deadline for 2025/2026 academic session (16:00 hrs Brunei time)
Currently closed : Applications for Academic Session 2025/2026
Minimum period required to obtain degree (e.g., 4 years for First Degree) : Scholarship Duration
May include interview and/or written test : Selection Process

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The scholarship provides full funding, a stipend, and covers living expenses. It is described as "Fully Paid."
Covered Expenses:
*   Stipend
*   Housing
*   Round-trip travel
*   Living Expenses
Eligibility_Criteria: Rising leaders who have demonstrated a commitment to finding solutions to challenges in their communities, countries, and regions. Individuals focused on an issue of global importance, possessing a track record and commitment to advancing the public good. Those who wish to accelerate their impact through an intensive program, described as "global social changemakers" on the cusp of tackling broader challenges.
Eligible_Fields: Thematic focus on social impact and global challenges; finding solutions to challenges in communities, countries, and regions; advancing the public good.
Eligible_Field_Group: Humanities & Social Sciences, Law & Public Policy, Social Services & Care
Experience_Years: No specific minimum number of years of professional experience is stated.
Language_Certificate:
Applicants whose native language is not English are required to demonstrate proficiency in English by submitting scores from one of the following exams. Exams must have been taken in the last five years.
*   TOEFL: Internet-Based Test (IBT): 100, Paper-Based Test (PBT): 600
*   IELTS: 7
*   PTE Academic: 68
*   Duolingo English Test (DET): 120
Scholarship_Info: The Obama Foundation Scholars Program at Columbia University is a highly competitive, fully funded, nine-month immersive leadership development program designed for emerging global social changemakers. Hosted at Columbia University in New York City, the program integrates academic, skills-based, and experiential learning, developed in consultation with the Obama Foundation. Scholars engage in a rigorous curriculum aimed at deepening their knowledge, building new capacities and networks, and amplifying their impact on issues of global importance.
Application_Documents:
Resume/curriculum vitae
English language proficiency test scores (TOEFL, IELTS, PTE Academic, or DET)
Recommendations
Timeline:
August (Academic Year Start) : Program begins
December 16 : Application Deadline (for 2025-2026 cycle, now closed)
May (Academic Year End) : Program concludes

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The scholarship fully funds an eligible master's or second-entry professional undergraduate program at McGill University. This includes full tuition and fees. Scholars also receive a living stipend of C$2,300 per month during academic terms.
Covered Expenses:
*   Tuition and fees for an eligible master’s or second-entry professional undergraduate program.
*   A living stipend of C$2,300 per month during academic terms.
*   A one-time relocation grant to assist with moving to Montreal.
*   Summer funding options, providing flexibility for academic or professional pursuits during breaks.
*   An enrichment program, which includes mentorship, interdisciplinary learning, and participation in a global community designed to accelerate scholars' impact on the world.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Open to students and graduates of universities in Canada and the United States. Open to Canadians studying abroad. Now open to people from around the world, regardless of their country of origin, as long as they meet other eligibility requirements.
Applicants must be planning to apply for admission to a full-time master’s or professional degree at McGill University.
Recent Graduates: Those who earned their first bachelor’s degree in the last five years (e.g., January 2020 or later for the 2026 cohort).
Current Students: Seniors (final year undergraduate students).
Alumni: Alumni under age 30.
Experienced Professionals: There is also a path for those who earned their first bachelor's degree more than five years ago.
Eligible_Fields: over 150 eligible master’s or professional degree programs, including popular options like the MBA and Master of Management, as well as second-entry professional undergraduate programs.
Min_Gpa: CGPA: 3.0/4.0; Last two years GPA: 3.2/4.0; Note: Some McGill programs may require higher (e.g., 3.3/4.0)
Experience_Years: No specified minimum number of years, but significant leadership experience is required.
Language_Certificate: TOEFL IBT: 86 overall (min 20 in each component); IELTS: 6.5 or greater. Required for non-native English speakers or those not studied in English-speaking institutions.
Special_Circumstances: Current students and recent alumni (those who have graduated within the past two years) from participating universities are typically required to seek campus nomination or institutional endorsement. Alumni who graduated more than two years ago generally do not need institutional endorsement and should submit their application directly to the McCall MacBain scholarship selection committee via the online application portal.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must apply separately for admission to an eligible master’s or professional degree program at McGill University. The scholarship application is distinct from the university program application, though both are necessary.
Scholarship_Info: The McCall MacBain Scholarship is Canada's first comprehensive, leadership-driven scholarship program for master's and professional degree studies. It is provided by the McCall MacBain Foundation in partnership with McGill University. It is Canada's largest leadership-based scholarship program, providing financial support, mentorship, interdisciplinary learning, and access to a global community of scholars to accelerate their impact on the world.
Application_Documents:
Online Application Form
Two letters of recommendation (one academic, one community work)
Four short essays reflecting on community involvement, goals, and significant leadership experiences.
Unofficial transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
A personal statement.
Timeline:
2026 Cohort (General/Canadian/US Applicants): Applications generally closed.
2025-10-15 : 2026 McCall MacBain International Fellowships Opening Date
2026-01-13 : 2026 McCall MacBain International Fellowships Application Deadline (4 PM ET)
2026-06-01 : 2027 Cohort (All Applicants) Opening Date

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Covered Expenses Include:
*   Tuition Fees: Full coverage of all academic tuition fees.
*   Monthly Stipend: A monthly stipend of 16,000 Baht is provided to support living and housing expenses.
*   Accommodation: Specific provisions for accommodation are included within the monthly stipend.
*   Return Flights: Economy class return flights are covered, with the amount of reimbursement varying based on the applicant’s home location.
*   Health Insurance: Comprehensive health insurance is provided for the duration of the scholarship.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to international students from ASEAN and non-ASEAN countries, including students from regions such as Asia, Europe, Africa, and Australia. Thai nationals are explicitly excluded from applying. Applicants must possess an excellent academic record and fulfill all specific academic requirements of their chosen program. Students who have been studying in any program at Chulalongkorn University for more than one semester are not eligible to apply for this scholarship.
Eligible_Fields: All subjects and disciplines offered at the Master's and Doctoral levels within Chulalongkorn University. There are no specific field restrictions.
Language_Certificate: Applicants must demonstrate English proficiency through either a certificate from their prior university confirming English as the medium of instruction or by submitting results from standardized tests such as TOEFL or IELTS.
Special_Circumstances: Students who have been studying in any program at Chulalongkorn University for more than one semester are not eligible to apply for this scholarship.
Other_Requirements: Applicants are generally expected to submit academic references for graduate programs as part of 'relevant documents'. Applicants must first be screened and recruited by the specific Faculty/Programme of their choice. Only after this initial selection process will their names be forwarded to the Office of Academic Affairs at Chulalongkorn University for final scholarship consideration.
Scholarship_Info: The Graduate Scholarship Program for ASEAN or Non-ASEAN Countries is a flagship initiative by Chulalongkorn University to attract talented international Master's and Doctoral students, fostering a diverse and academically rich environment. The scholarship duration is fixed: 2 years for Master's degree programs and 3 years for PhD programs. The term of these scholarships cannot be extended under any circumstances.
Application_Documents: The application requires a completed application form and other relevant documents. A specific, exhaustive list of all required documents is not provided in the general scholarship overview, but applicants should prepare standard graduate application materials.
Timeline:
Applications for 2026 academic year officially open : Opening Date (not specified)
Applicants must send their completed application form and relevant documents directly to their chosen Faculty/Programme at least two weeks prior to the deadline set by the University’s Office of Academic Affairs.
2025-10-13 : Application Deadline

Funding_Level: Fixed Amount, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details: The Excellence Fellowship offers a substantial grant, amounting to CHF 10,000 to CHF 15,000 per year. This grant does not require any teaching duties from the recipient. Initially awarded for one year, the fellowship is extendable for the entire regular duration of the chosen Master's program (typically three or four semesters), contingent upon the applicant's academic success at the end of their first semester of studies. The financial benefits of this fellowship are comprehensive, aiming to make Geneva an affordable study destination. The grant is intended to cover both tuition fees and living expenses.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to outstanding and highly motivated international students from all nationalities who aspire to pursue a Master of Science degree within one of the disciplines covered by the Faculty of Science at the University of Geneva. Students who have already commenced a Master's program at the Faculty of Science are explicitly ineligible to apply for the Excellence Master Fellowship.
Eligible_Fields: Earth Sciences, Physical and Mathematical Sciences, Biochemistry
Language_Certificate: While not strictly mandatory, providing scores from tests such as GRE, TOEFL, or other language certificates is considered an optional but beneficial addition to an application. For general University of Geneva requirements, accepted English language tests and their typical score ranges include: Cambridge English Advanced (CAE): 180–199, Cambridge English First (FCE): 180–190, C1 Business Higher, IELTS: 6.5–7.5, TOEFL iBT: 95–120, TOEIC Listening & Reading (specific score not fully detailed in provided context, but mentioned as accepted).
Special_Circumstances: Not mentioned
Other_Requirements: Reference Letters: Letters of Reference are a crucial component of the application. It is preferred that these letters be sent directly to the institution by the referees themselves, via email to Excellence-Master-Sciences@unige.ch, attesting to the applicant's qualifications. Motivation Letter/Essay: Applicants must submit a motivation letter or a two-page essay. This document should clearly describe the applicant's specific scientific interests, explicitly state the Master's program at the Faculty of Science they wish to pursue, and articulate their motivation for pursuing a Master of Science program at the University of Geneva.
Scholarship_Info: The University of Geneva Excellence Master Fellowships program was established by the Faculty of Science, with the valuable support of external partners. Its primary objective is to attract and encourage outstanding and highly motivated international students to undertake a Master of Science degree in one of the diverse disciplines offered by the Faculty.
Application_Documents: Motivation letter/two-page essay, Letters of Reference. All application documents should be compiled into a single PDF file and sent via email to Excellence-Master-Sciences@unige.ch.
Timeline: January : Application period opens, 28 February, 2026 : Application deadline for 2026 intake

Funding_Level: Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The AKF ISP awards are structured as a unique half grant and half loan model, requiring recipients to repay 50 percent of the total award amount. There is some variation in information regarding the loan's interest rate: some sources indicate it is an interest-free loan, while others state the interest rate is based on prevailing market conditions, similar to standard education loan rates, potentially with a 0.25% discount for automatic recurring payments.

The scholarship is comprehensive in its coverage of essential expenses, including:
*   Tuition fees
*   Student living expenses, which encompass accommodation, food, and transportation.

However, the award does not cover additional costs such as international travel, clothing, furniture, or living expenses for family members.
Eligibility_Criteria: Outstanding scholars from specific developing countries who demonstrate no other means of financing their postgraduate studies. Eligible nationalities include Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Egypt, India, Kenya, Kyrgyz Republic, Madagascar, Mozambique, Pakistan, Syria, Tajikistan, Tanzania, and Uganda.
Min_Gpa: Typically 3.0/4.0, though some sources indicate 2.7/4.0 or 3.0/4.0
Language_Certificate: Not specified
Age: Preference given to students under 30 years of age, but no age limits to apply for the scholarship
Special_Circumstances: Applicants must be residing in one of these eligible countries where there are local Aga Khan Foundation (AKF), Aga Khan Education Services (AKES), or Aga Khan Education Board (AKEB) offices that are equipped to process applications and conduct interviews. Applicants must have no other means of financing their studies and must demonstrate ongoing financial need throughout their program to maintain the award.
Career_Plan: Applicants should articulate a clear career plan, demonstrating how postgraduate studies align with their objectives, particularly for employment within the AKDN. PhD applicants must show that a PhD is necessary for their career objectives, whether academic or research-oriented.
Other_Requirements:
Reference Letters: For PhD applicants, strong recommendations from their professors are essential, indicating they are highly recommended for doctoral studies.
Scholarship Duration: Scholarships for Master's studies are granted for the entire duration of the degree course. For PhD students, scholarships are awarded for the first two years, after which applicants are expected to secure funding from alternative sources.
Academic Standing: To maintain the scholarship, recipients must demonstrate good academic standing throughout their postgraduate program.
Study Location Restrictions: Explicitly excludes universities located in the UK, Germany, Sweden, Austria, Denmark, Netherlands, Italy, Norway, and Ireland.
Scholarship_Info: The Aga Khan Foundation’s International Scholarship Programme (AKF ISP) is a prestigious opportunity for outstanding scholars from selected developing countries. It is provided by the Aga Khan Foundation (AKF) and aims to support postgraduate education (Master's and PhD degrees). The scholarship allows study at any highly reputable university in Canada, the USA, France, or Portugal.
Application_Documents: Application forms, academic transcripts, recommendations, and a statement of purpose or career plan are likely required.
Timeline:
March 31, 2025 : General Application Deadline
June 8, 2025 : Alternative Application Deadline
June/July (Annually) : Award Notification

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The scholarship covers full tuition fees, subsistence (including a housing allowance), book allowance, medical insurance, travel expenses, and research subsidies.
Covered Expenses:
*   Full tuition fees
*   Subsistence allowance (including housing)
*   Book allowance
*   Medical insurance
*   International airfare
*   Visa costs
*   Monthly stipend
*   Room and board
*   Research subsidies
Eligibility_Criteria:
Citizenship: Must be a national of an ADB borrowing member country. Applicants from countries that are no longer borrowing from ADB are not eligible. Must be a citizen of a Japanese Official Development Assistance (ODA) scholarship eligible country.
Employment Restrictions: Applicants living or working in a country other than their home country are not eligible.
Affiliation Restrictions: Executive directors, alternate directors, management and staff of ADB, consultants, and their close relatives are not eligible. Staff of ADB–JSP partner institutions are not eligible.
Program Type: Only Master's degree programs are eligible.
Institutional Restrictions: Only programs at participating academic institutions within the Asian and Pacific Regions are eligible for ADB–JSP funding.
Required Degree Timing: Applicants must hold a Bachelor's degree (or equivalent) earned at least three years before the application deadline.
Experience: Applicants must have at least two (2) years of full-time professional working experience, acquired after obtaining their university degree, at the time of application. Only full-time professional working experience is considered.
Age: Applicants must not exceed 35 years old at the time of application.
Eligible_Fields: economics, business and management, science and technology, and other development-related fields
Eligible_Field_Group: Economics & Business, Natural Sciences, IT & Data Science, Engineering & Technology, Law & Public Policy
Experience_Years: at least two (2) years of full-time professional working experience
Language_Certificate: English proficiency test score report (IELTS accepted, no minimum score specified for scholarship)
Special_Circumstances: Not eligible to work at ADB for two years after the completion of their academic programs.
Career_Plan: Scholars must agree to return to and work in their home country for a period of at least two (2) years after completing their studies to contribute to its development.
Other_Requirements:
A one-page research proposal is often required, particularly for some universities (e.g., Institute of Science Tokyo).
Individual academic institutions may require reference letters for admission to their Master's programs.
No separate application to ADB is required; applications must be submitted directly through the academic institution.
For some institutions, such as the Institute of Science Tokyo, applicants must first find an academic supervisor.
For programs like the one at the University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa (UHM) through the East-West Center (EWC), a separate application for admission to UHM is required in addition to the ADB-JSP application to EWC.
Scholarship_Info: The ADB-Japan Scholarship Program (ADB-JSP) is a prestigious and comprehensive educational opportunity established in April 1988 with financing from the Government of Japan. Its primary goal is to encourage and strengthen human resource development by providing well-qualified citizens of the Asian Development Bank's (ADB) developing member countries with the opportunity to pursue graduate studies. The program aims to foster future leaders and professionals who will contribute to the development of their home countries.
Application_Documents:
*   ADB-JSP Application Form
*   Certified Copy of Bachelor’s Degree Official Academic Transcripts (signed and sealed by the university)
*   Applicant’s Certificate of Employment and Compensation/Income (must be on company letterhead, signed by an authorized signatory, with complete details of employment dates, position, and monthly/annual income in USD; computer-generated income notes are not acceptable)
*   ADB-JSP Information Sheet
*   Income Certificate
*   One-page research proposal (if required by the institution)
*   English proficiency test score report

November–December 2025 : Interview Period
Shortly after 10 December 2025 : First Screening Results Released
Mid- (month unspecified, likely early in the new year) : Initial Result Announcement
Late February 2026 : Scholarship Result Announcement
May 2026 : Final ADB-JSP Selection Results Announced

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Key benefits include:
*   Full Tuition Fee Coverage: All tuition fees for the duration of the study program are covered.
*   Monthly Living Stipend: The scholarship provides a monthly living stipend, though reported amounts vary across sources. Some sources indicate a generous stipend of 40,000 AED (approximately $10,890 USD), while others report 20,000 AED. For the specific Graduate Research Teaching Assistantship (GRTA) Scholarship, the stipend is reported as 8,000 AED per month for Master's degree students and 10,000 AED per month for PhD students.
*   Medical Insurance: Full-time international students sponsored by Khalifa University receive medical insurance coverage.
*   No Application Fee: There is no application fee required to apply for admission or the scholarship.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to all qualified students (UAE nationals and international students) enrolled in full-time graduate programs, specifically supporting international students pursuing Master's and Doctoral degrees, Pre-Medicine, or Doctor of Medicine Programs. Recipients must maintain a minimum GPA of approximately 3.2 throughout their study duration.
Language_Certificate: Not detailed in report, refer to university general admission requirements.
Other_Requirements: Submission of two recommendation letters; Maintenance of a minimum GPA of approximately 3.2 throughout study duration.
Scholarship_Info: The Khalifa University Graduate Scholarship is a prestigious funding opportunity provided by Khalifa University, located in the United Arab Emirates (UAE). It is designed to support students pursuing postgraduate studies at the university. It is a fully funded program, offering comprehensive coverage for educational expenses, aiming to provide significant financial support to graduate students, including international applicants.
Application_Documents: Applicants must submit an online application through the official Khalifa University admissions portal, uploading all required documents and supporting materials in the correct format, including the two reference letters.

Academic Year 2025-2026 : Scholarship offered

Scholarship_Name: KAUST Fellowship (King Abdullah Univ of Science & Tech)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The KAUST Global Fellowship is a fully funded opportunity, covering all associated expenses for the duration of the program. The comprehensive package includes:
*   Full Free Tuition Support: All academic fees are covered.
*   Annual Living Allowance: A substantial allowance of up to $30,000 USD per year.
*   On-Campus Housing: Accommodation is provided within the university's state-of-the-art campus.
*   Annual Stipend: Fellows receive a generous annual stipend of 75,000 USD.
*   Independent Research Project Budget: An independent annual budget is allocated for the fellow's research project, enabling significant autonomy and resource access.
This comprehensive funding ensures that fellows can focus entirely on their research without financial burden, with access to advanced laboratories and equipment.
Quantity: Not generally specified; one source mentioned a single grant, which may pertain to a specific sub-category or a different program.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to individuals of all nationalities, provided they are nationals of a country with diplomatic relations with Saudi Arabia. No age restrictions for applicants. Applicants must have been awarded a doctoral (PhD) degree from a well-recognized university within the last four calendar/solar years prior to the application year (e.g., for 2026 applications, the PhD must have been awarded within the last four years). Applicants must identify and secure a confirmed agreement from a KAUST faculty member to host them and their proposed research project. The proposed independent research must align with KAUST's strategic research priorities. The fellowship is specifically designed for postdoctoral researchers and early-career researchers.
Eligible_Fields: Science, Engineering, Technology, Environment, Sustainable Energy, Water Security, Environmental Science, STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics) fields, Sustainability fields
Eligible_Field_Group: Natural Sciences, Engineering & Technology, IT & Data Science, Agriculture & Environment
Min_Gpa: 3.0 on a 4-point scale (or equivalent); historically, 90% of admitted applicants have a GPA above 3.3, and 75% have a GPA above 3.5 on a 4-point scale.
Experience_Years: PhD awarded within the last four calendar/solar years prior to the application year.
Language_Certificate: TOEFL score of 81 on the IBT (Internet Based Test) or an IELTS score of 6.5
Special_Circumstances: Nationals of a country with diplomatic relations with Saudi Arabia.
Other_Requirements: All applications must be drafted in English. Applicants must use the provided templates for their application documents. All required documents must be completed and submitted to be eligible for review. If admitted, an official transcript must be sent directly to the Office of Admissions by the awarding institution prior to the fellow's arrival at KAUST. Applicants must identify and secure a confirmed agreement from a KAUST faculty member to host them and their proposed research project. The proposed independent research must align with KAUST's strategic research priorities.
Scholarship_Info: The KAUST Global Fellowship Program 2026 is a prestigious postdoctoral scholarship offered by the King Abdullah University of Science and Technology (KAUST) in Saudi Arabia. This program is designed to attract early-career researchers from around the globe to conduct cutting-edge, transformational research. KAUST is internationally recognized for its advanced research, world-class faculty, and focus on solving global challenges, providing an exceptional environment for scientific advancement. The program's duration is three years, providing ample time for significant research contributions.
Application_Documents:
Research Proposal (Template)
Application Guidelines
Addendum for KAUST Affiliated Applicants
Application Kit (comprising all necessary documents)
Official Transcript (if admitted)
Reference Letters (typically required, though not explicitly detailed)
Timeline:
July 1, 2025 : Application Period Starts
January 15, 2026 : Application Deadline
Flexible : Fellowship Start Date (contingent upon applicant's readiness and visa approval processes)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
- Full Tuition Fees: All academic tuition costs are covered.
- Accommodation: Mandatory stay at the SIIT dormitory for a period of at least 12 months is provided.
- Living Stipends: A living allowance/stipend, specifically mentioned as $5,800, is provided to cover daily expenses.
- Travel Costs: Round-trip airfare is included, covering travel to and from Thailand.
- Health Insurance: Comprehensive health insurance is provided.
- Fieldwork Expenses: Costs associated with fieldwork are covered.
- Research Support: Financial support for research activities is included.
Quantity: For the 2026/27 academic year, 400 PhD Fellowships were awarded. Additionally, 40 Continuing Scholarships are mentioned.
Eligibility_Criteria: The scholarship is open to international students (foreign applicants) who wish to pursue Master's or PhD degrees at SIIT. Applicants must meet the general qualifications for SIIT graduate programs, be in good health, and have a clean record and good conduct.
Experience_Years: Approximately 1.5 years of full-time work experience
Language_Certificate: Mandatory, but specific tests/scores not detailed in report.

Scholarship_Info: The SIIT Graduate Scholarship, provided by the Sirindhorn International Institute of Technology (SIIT) at Thammasat University in Thailand, is a fully funded opportunity designed to attract top-tier international students for Master's and PhD degrees. It offers a world-class education and research experience in a diverse academic environment.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The fellowship provides a stipend of CHF 10,000 per semester.
The total funding can be up to CHF 32,000, depending on the program duration and specific fellowship type.
Program Costs: All program costs are included.
Housing: Recipients are provided with guaranteed housing.
Living Expenses: The per-semester stipend is intended to cover living expenses.
Quantity: A limited number of excellence fellowships are offered each year.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to international students. Candidates must be talented students starting their Bachelor's or Master's degree, demonstrating remarkable academic achievements and potential. Selection is purely merit-based. Candidates who already hold a Master's degree in the same or a similar field are not eligible. If the Master's program at EPFL would constitute a second Master's degree for the applicant, they are not eligible for an excellence fellowship. Previous research experience is generally required for Master's applicants. For candidates applying to Architecture programs, twelve months of professional experience is mandatory.

Language_Certificate: English proficiency certificate (e.g., IELTS, TOEFL, or other recognized language certificates) is required for all applicants.

These fellowships are designed to attract highly talented students from around the world to pursue either a Bachelor's or Master's degree at EPFL. They are fully funded for Master's students and provide substantial support, including guaranteed housing, to candidates who demonstrate remarkable academic achievements and potential. A limited number of these fellowships are awarded annually.
Application_Documents:

Personal Statement: A personal statement demonstrating the applicant's passion and academic interests is essential.
Work Certificates: For Architecture candidates, work certificates proving twelve months of professional experience must be uploaded with the application.
Academic Transcripts: Strong academic records and transcripts are crucial to demonstrate academic excellence.

Scholarship_Name: Joint Japan/World Bank Graduate Scholarship Program
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
- Full tuition fee
- Accommodation
- Economy class air travel (round-trip from the scholar's home city to the study country)
- Other associated costs (though not explicitly detailed, "fully funded" implies living stipends and other necessary expenses).
Quantity: Historically, over 7,000 scholarships have been awarded. Approximately 130 awards annually. Regular Program: 3,503, Other initiatives: 1,380.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Applicants must:
- Be a national of an eligible World Bank member developing country and not hold dual citizenship of a developed country.
- Hold a bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) earned at least three years prior to the application deadline date.
- Possess three years or more of paid professional experience in a development-related area, acquired after earning a bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) and within the past six years from the date of the application deadline.
- Secure unconditional acceptance to enroll in the upcoming academic year in one of the JJ/WBGSP participating master’s programs by the scholarship application deadline date.
- Demonstrate a history of supporting their countries’ development efforts and a commitment to returning to their home countries to apply their knowledge.
- Have outstanding academic records and proficiency in English.
Eligible_Fields: development-related fields, including economic policy management, tax policy, infrastructure management, public planning, global health, education, environment, and urban development.
Eligible_Field_Group: Economics & Business, Law & Public Policy, Engineering & Technology, Construction & Planning, Healthcare & Medicine, Education & Training, Agriculture & Environment, Natural Sciences, Humanities & Social Sciences
Experience_Years: three years or more of paid professional experience in a development-related area, acquired after earning a bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) and within the past six years from the date of the application deadline.
Language_Certificate: English proficiency required
Special_Circumstances: Japanese mid-career professionals dedicated to poverty alleviation and enhanced shared prosperity in developing countries, who are currently enrolled in a master’s or PhD graduate degree program outside of Japan in development-related fields, are also eligible.
Career_Plan: Demonstrate a history of supporting their countries’ development efforts and a commitment to returning to their home countries to apply their knowledge.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must be employed in development-related work in a paid full-time position at the time of submitting the scholarship application. Preference is given to applicants working in government agencies, research institutions, or international development organizations. Not be a World Bank Group staff member (including consultants) or a relative of a WBG staff member.
Scholarship_Info: The Joint Japan/World Bank Graduate Scholarship Program (JJ/WBGSP) is a prestigious, fully-funded master's scholarship for professionals from developing countries and Japan. Jointly funded by the World Bank and the Government of Japan, it aims to empower mid-career professionals to pursue graduate degrees in development-related fields at leading universities worldwide. The program equips future leaders to drive economic and social development, alleviate poverty, and enhance shared prosperity in their home countries, while also providing access to global policymakers and experts.
Application_Documents:
- JJ/WBGSP scholarship online application form
- Two professional references / two strong professional letters of recommendation
- Unconditional offer of admission from one of the JJ/WBGSP participating master’s programs
- Official academic transcripts
- Updated Curriculum Vitae (CV)
- A compelling Statement of Purpose (SOP) clearly articulating how the scholarship will enable the applicant to uplift their community or country
- Some universities, like IHE Delft, may require an additional internal application form for nomination for the JJ/WBGSP scholarship.
Timeline:

2024-03-25 to 2024-05-24 : General Application Window #2 (example)
2024-11-01 : Columbia University (MPA programs) academic admission deadline

2025-03-07 : IHE Delft academic admission deadline for scholarship eligibility
2025-05-15 : International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) JJ/WBGSP scholarship application deadline for nominated students
2026-03-25 to 2026-05-31 : Yokohama National University (YNU PPT) JJ/WBGSP scholarship application (Window 2)

Scholarship_Name: TU Delft Justus & Louise van Effen Scholarship
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend
Funding_Details: The scholarship covers both tuition fees and living costs for the entire two-year Master's program. Recipients are expected to receive up to 30,000 EUR annually to cover these expenses.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be excellent international students with outstanding academic results. They must be motivated and ambitious individuals. Crucially, applicants must be conditionally admitted to a 2-year regular MSc program at TU Delft. Candidates must have achieved excellent academic results in their previous study program(s), and these results must be relevant to the Master's program they are applying for at TU Delft. Applicants must submit a complete MSc application before the scholarship deadline. Conditional admission to a 2-year regular MSc program at TU Delft is mandatory for scholarship consideration. The scholarship is not applicable to joint MSc programs.
Eligible_Fields: All regular (non-joint) 2-year MSc programs at TU Delft
Min_Gpa: 80 percent or higher of the scale maximum in their Bachelor's degree
Language_Certificate: Not explicitly stated for the scholarship itself, but typically a standard admission requirement for TU Delft's MSc programs.
Special_Circumstances: No specific provisions detailed
Career_Plan: Not explicitly mentioned as a separate required document
Scholarship_Info: The Justus & Louise van Effen Excellence Scholarships for the 2026-2027 academic year are a prestigious and generous opportunity offered by the Delft University of Technology (TU Delft) in the Netherlands. These scholarships are specifically designed for outstanding international students aspiring to pursue a Master's degree in a world-class academic environment. The program aims to support the brightest minds globally, enabling them to study at TU Delft, one of Europe’s top research universities. The Foundation Justus & Louise van Effen was established to stimulate and financially support excellent international MSc students at TU Delft. Mr. van Effen, an alumnus from the 1940s, believed strongly in technology's role in solving societal issues. Past recipients include Berkay (2020) and Mythili (2022, Biomedical Engineering), highlighting the scholarship's impact on promising students.
Application_Documents:
- Scholarship Application Form
- Reference letters
- Complete MSc application (including all admission requirements and supporting documents)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs

Additionally, scholarship recipients may benefit from a reduction or waiver of tuition fees, further alleviating the financial burden of their studies.
Eligibility_Criteria: Acceptance into either the United Nations University Institute for Advanced Study of Sustainability's (UNU-IAS) PhD Program in Sustainability Science or the Master of Science in Sustainability Programme is a prerequisite for scholarship consideration.

Experience_Years: Minimum 2 years of practical field experience (full-time equivalent) after university degree, OR two completed Master’s degrees (at least one in sustainability studies).

This scholarship supports international students pursuing higher education in Japan, specifically at UNU-IAS in Tokyo.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Partial Funding
Funding_Details:
- Full MBA Course Fees: The scholarship covers the entire tuition fees for the Oxford MBA program, which are among the most expensive globally.
- Partial Living Expenses: It provides partial living expenses, up to an additional £8,000, based on need.
- Access to the exclusive Skoll Scholar community, a group of leaders positively impacting the world.
- Exclusive opportunities to meet with world-renowned entrepreneurs, thought leaders, and investors.
- Mentorship, networks, and intellectual resources necessary to accelerate social impact.
- Growth opportunities for young individuals to polish their critical thinking skills and build an international career.
Eligibility_Criteria:
- A strong commitment to creating and leading social ventures that tackle deep-seated social and environmental issues.
- Have set up or been working in entrepreneurial initiatives with a social purpose, or have pursued an impact career.
- A desire to improve their knowledge of market-oriented practices for social change pursuits and a readiness to utilize the Oxford MBA and the Skoll Centre community to enhance and expand social impact.
- The ability to clearly articulate how being part of the University of Oxford, the Saïd Business School MBA program, and the Skoll Centre community would advance their professional growth and their ability to create systemic social or environmental impact.
- Home and international students are eligible.
Min_Gpa: 3.5/4.0 (or the UK equivalent of a First or strong Upper-Second-Class undergraduate degree)
Experience_Years: at least 3 years in a social venture or related impact career
Language_Certificate: English language proficiency tests (like IELTS or TOEFL) are typically required for international students applying to the Oxford MBA if their prior education was not in English.
Special_Circumstances: Applicants for the Oxford 1+1 MBA program are welcome; however, the scholarship covers only the MBA year.
Career_Plan: Implied through essay questions and eligibility criteria, demonstrating how the MBA and Skoll Centre community would advance professional growth and social/environmental impact.
Other_Requirements:
- Candidates must first submit their application for the Oxford MBA through Saïd Business School.
- Applicants must include their Skoll Scholarship essays in the “Funding” section of the MBA application or upload their responses as part of the MBA application. A complete MBA application and the Skoll Scholarship essay document must be submitted by the deadline.
- GRE or GMAT tests are required for MBA admission. Recommended Scores: A GMAT score of 650 or higher is recommended. For the GRE, a verbal score of 160 and a quantitative score of 161 are recommended.
- Reference letters are part of the standard MBA application process. Following acceptance to the MBA program, shortlisted scholarship applicants will receive a Logistics and Reference Form from the Skoll Centre via email.
Scholarship_Info: The Skoll Scholarship is a highly prestigious and competitive scholarship for social entrepreneurs pursuing an Oxford MBA at the Saïd Business School, University of Oxford, UK. Funded by the Skoll Foundation and Skoll Centre for Social Entrepreneurship, it aims to remove financial barriers for individuals committed to tackling social and environmental challenges through innovative ventures. It offers full tuition and partial living expenses, plus unparalleled access to a global network of change-makers, mentorship, and exclusive opportunities with world-renowned leaders in social innovation. It emphasizes a proven commitment to social impact and entrepreneurial solutions.
Application_Documents:
- Complete Oxford MBA application
- Skoll Scholarship essay questions/document
- Reference letters (part of standard MBA application)
- GRE or GMAT scores
- English language proficiency tests (if prior education not in English)
Timeline:

2025-10-04 : Specific Scholarship Submission Deadline
Following MBA acceptance : Shortlisted scholarship applicants receive Logistics and Reference Form
Following MBA acceptance : First-stage online interviews with Skoll Scholarship Selection Committee

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details: The Heinrich Böll Foundation Scholarship is a fully funded opportunity, providing comprehensive financial coverage for the entire standard duration of the recipient's degree program. The scholarship covers a range of essential expenses, including tuition fees, living expenses, and additional support for research or academic activities. For students educated in Germany and EU nationals (not schooled in Germany), the scholarship can amount to up to INR 59,347 per month, supplemented by INR 27,468 in book money. The funding is primarily provided by the Federal Ministry of Education and Research and the Federal Foreign Office, ensuring robust support for scholars.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to German students, EU nationals (including "Bildungsinländer"), and international students. Recipients are expected to be socially and politically engaged and align with the foundation's values: ecology and sustainability, democracy and human rights, self-determination, and justice. Scholarships are also offered to students committed to careers related to the environment. Applicants should show excellent promise for future academic and professional careers. Eligibility can vary by applicant's status and country of origin; applicants must verify specific requirements on the official website, as the program may not be open to all countries or statuses.
Min_Gpa: Potentially 1.5 or better (German scale) in high school diploma for full scholarships
Language_Certificate: German: DSH 2 or TestDaF B2 (mandatory for international applicants)
Career_Plan: Applicants should show excellent promise for future academic and professional careers, embodying the foundation's core values.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must submit a personal reference detailing their social commitment and an expert reference from a university lecturer (or a schoolteacher for school leavers). Convincing reasons for applying to the Heinrich Böll Foundation are a key assessment criterion. Proof of financial need may be a consideration for some scholarship categories.
Scholarship_Info: The Heinrich Böll Foundation Scholarship is a prestigious, fully funded opportunity provided by the Heinrich Böll Foundation. It is designed to support outstanding students pursuing higher education in Germany. The foundation, known for its commitment to ecology and sustainability, democracy and human rights, and justice, extends its support to both German and international students. The scholarship aims to foster future academic and professional leaders who embody these core values.
Application_Documents:
1. Information Gathering: Thoroughly review the application process and required documents on the official website.
2. Online Registration: Register for the online application portal.
3. Online Application Submission: Provide all requested information and upload documents through the portal.
4. Required Documents: These typically include written application documents, a personal reference on social commitment, and an expert reference from a university lecturer or schoolteacher. Specific forms like Info Sheet A1-1b (PDF), Application Form A1-2 (in German, PDF), Info Sheet A2-1b (PDF), and Application Form A2-2 (in German, PDF) are often required.
Timeline:
Approximately six weeks prior to each deadline : Online application portal opens
March 1st : Application Deadline
September 1st : Application Deadline
Submission of Written Application Documents : First stage of selection
Interview with a Liaison Lecturer : Second stage of selection
Final Selection : Third stage of selection

Scholarship_Info: The Queen Elizabeth Commonwealth Scholarships (QECS) program offers a unique and life-changing opportunity for students to pursue a two-year Master's degree in a low or middle-income Commonwealth country. These scholarships are specifically aimed at individuals who are committed to creating positive change in their communities, providing them with a chance to experience a new country and culture, broaden their horizons, and build a lasting global network. The program is made possible by the generous support of The Commonwealth Scholarship and Fellowship Plan (CSFP) endowment fund. The scholarship is designed for individuals who are committed to creating positive change in their communities, emphasizing a strong academic background and a clear, impactful plan for their studies and future contributions.

Funding_Level: Partial Funding, Tuition Waiver
Funding_Details:
Recipients receive a 15% or 30% reduction of international tuition fees. The specific percentage awarded is based on academic merit.
Covered Expenses: Tuition fees only.
Expenses Not Covered: The scholarship explicitly does not cover the costs of visas, Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC), travel, accommodation, living expenses, books, study materials, or any other associated costs beyond tuition fees. The scholarship is also not transferable.

Commencement Period: Available for students commencing their studies at the University of Adelaide in the period between 2021 and 2026.
Language_Certificate: Not mentioned
Other_Requirements: Nationality Exclusions: Citizens of Australia and New Zealand are not eligible. Transferability: The scholarship is not transferable.
Scholarship_Info: The University of Adelaide Global Citizens International Scholarship is a merit-based scholarship designed to attract high-achieving international students to pursue undergraduate or postgraduate studies at the University of Adelaide in Australia. It offers a partial tuition fee reduction of either 15% or 30% for the duration of the program. The scholarship is automatically considered upon application for admission to the university, requiring no separate application form. It is open to citizens of any country (excluding Australia and New Zealand) who demonstrate academic excellence in their previous studies. The scholarship has been available for commencing students from 2021 and is expected to continue through 2026, with specific deadlines for different intakes and degree levels.
Application_Documents: As no separate application is needed, the documents submitted for university admission are used for scholarship consideration.
Timeline:
2021 : Scholarship available for commencing students
July 31, 2025 : Application deadline for Master degrees
December 31, 2025 : General application deadline for 2025 intake
2026 : Scholarship expected to continue until this year for commencing students

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Partial Funding, Fixed Amount, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
*   **Funding Details:**
    *   Fully Funded: Some Masters and PhD scholarships are fully funded, covering both tuition fees and living expenses.
    *   Vice-Chancellor’s International Scholarships: Up to $60,000 to support high-achieving international students in coursework studies.
    *   International Scholarship: Offers between $5,000 to $10,000.
    *   Sydney International Student Award: Provides a 20% tuition fee waiver for the duration of the course.
    *   University of Sydney International Scholarship (USYDIS): Offers a grant of $41,753 per year.
*   **Covered Expenses:**
    *   Tuition fees (full or partial waiver/reduction)
    *   Living expenses (for fully funded scholarships and stipends)
Quantity: Sydney International Undergraduate Academic Excellence Scholarship: Approximately 20; Sydney International Student Award: 50; University of Sydney International Scholarship (USYDIS): Multiple
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to international students from all countries. Available for undergraduate, postgraduate coursework, and higher-degree by research (HDR) students. Primarily for commencing international students enrolled in an undergraduate or postgraduate coursework full degree. Applicants commencing a second degree at the University of Sydney are eligible, provided they have not previously held the Vice-Chancellor’s International Scholarships. Some scholarships (e.g., RTP) are for outstanding commencing and enrolled HDR students (both domestic and international). For some "International Scholarships," applicants must have completed a degree at the University of Sydney and hold an unconditional offer for a new course. Many scholarships require the applicant to hold an unconditional offer for a course at the University of Sydney. Scholarships are primarily awarded on the basis of academic merit, targeting exceptional, high-achieving, and outstanding students. Specific scholarships may have additional unique requirements not universally applicable.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree, PhD
Min_Gpa: Some scholarships: 4.5 (scale not specified); Experience in Industry Scholarship: WAM of 70
Experience_Years: Not required for most; academic and research experience valued for postgraduate research scholarships.
Language_Certificate: IELTS score of 6.5 generally required; TOEFL or other recognized English language certificates accepted. Waiver conditions: At least one year of full-time tertiary study in an English-speaking country within five years of course commencement; A three-year undergraduate degree completed within five years of course commencement, where the language of instruction, assessment, and examination was English; A two-year postgraduate degree completed within three years of course commencement, where the language of instruction, assessment, and examination was English.
Special_Circumstances: Applicants commencing a second degree at the University of Sydney are eligible, provided they have not previously held the Vice-Chancellor’s International Scholarships.
Other_Requirements: Academic merit is the primary criterion for selection, assessed from the student's application for admission. Scholarships are typically for exceptional, high-achieving, or outstanding students. For some scholarships, applicants must hold an unconditional offer for a course at the University of Sydney. For the Experience in Industry Scholarship, completion of a minimum of 24 credit points is required, and applicants must be enrolled in Experience in Industry BWIL2150 or BWIL6150. Specific scholarships may have additional unique requirements not universally applicable.
Scholarship_Info: The University of Sydney International Scholarships (USyd) represent a broad umbrella of financial aid opportunities designed to attract and support outstanding international students across various levels of study. These scholarships are provided by the University of Sydney, Australia, and aim to alleviate the financial burden of tuition and living expenses for eligible candidates. While there is no single 'USyd International Scholarship,' the collective offerings include fully funded options for Masters and PhD students, significant tuition fee waivers, and stipends, awarded primarily based on academic merit. This is an umbrella term encompassing a diverse range of scholarships for international students at the University of Sydney, including the Vice-Chancellor’s International Scholarships, Sydney International Undergraduate Academic Excellence Scholarship, Research Training Program (RTP) & Higher Degree by Research Scholarships, University of Sydney International Stipend Scholarship (USYDIS), Sydney International Student Award, and Experience in Industry Scholarship. Scholarships are available for undergraduate students, postgraduate coursework students, and postgraduate researchers.
Application_Documents: Specific application documents are not explicitly detailed for the scholarships themselves, but typically include all documents required for university admission (e.g., academic transcripts, proof of English proficiency, passport, etc.).
Timeline: Year-round: Applications generally open, aligned with University admissions timeline. 2025-11-07: Fixed deadline for Research Training Program (RTP) scholarships and equivalent university awards for 2025 intake.

Country: Germany, Palestine, Israel, Jordan, Egypt, Lebanon
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Covered Expenses Include:
*   Tuition Fees: Full coverage of university tuition fees.
*   Travel Expenses: Support for travel costs.
*   Living Costs:
    *   Master's or postgraduate students receive a monthly scholarship of €934.
    *   PhD students receive a monthly scholarship of €1,400.
    *   Additionally, students may receive up to €649 per month depending on their income.

The maximum duration of the scholarship is two years, which is also the standard funding period.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants should be particularly gifted and committed young people with a strong interest and involvement in socio-political issues, guided by Christian-democratic values. Specific country and/or status eligibility lists apply; applicants whose country or status is not included in these lists cannot apply for the program.
Experience_Years: Not specified, but strong interest and involvement in socio-political issues expected.
Language_Certificate: Not mentioned
Special_Circumstances: Applicants already living or studying in Germany are eligible to apply via the domestic selection program using an online procedure.
Other_Requirements: Not mentioned
Scholarship_Info: The Konrad-Adenauer-Stiftung (KAS) Scholarship is a prestigious, fully funded program for gifted and committed young people, primarily for study and research in Germany, but also in Palestine and neighboring countries. It aims to foster academic and personal development, socio-political awareness, and connection within a community, guided by Christian-democratic values. It has supported international students globally since 1970.
Application_Documents:

- Other required documents (specific naming guidelines: LAST NAME, FIRST NAME – Name of Document)

For Shortlisted Applicants:
