Scholarship_Name: DAAD Doctoral Programmes in Germany (Research Grants)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
*   Monthly Stipend: Doctoral candidates receive a monthly stipend of 1,200 euros.
*   Covered Expenses: The scholarship covers a wide range of essential costs, including:
    *   Living expenses
    *   Research costs
    *   Health insurance
    *   Accident insurance
    *   Personal insurance
Eligibility_Criteria: International students from specified countries of origin are eligible, including those from the USA and Canada. The scholarship targets PhD students and Post-Docs, highly qualified doctoral candidates who are early in their academic or professional careers, individuals wishing to earn a doctoral degree in Germany, those currently pursuing their doctorate at a university or research institution outside Germany, and individuals who have already completed their doctorate (post-doc). Applicants must have either enrolled in a doctoral programme or have completed a master's degree.
Experience_Years: While the scholarship targets 'highly qualified doctoral candidates who are early in their academic/professional careers,' no specific minimum years of professional or research experience are explicitly stated.
Language_Certificate: Not specified
Special_Circumstances: International students from specified countries of origin are eligible, including those from the USA and Canada. For applicants from the USA and Canada, to be considered for a priority candidate slot, DAAD application materials must be submitted to The Graduate School by their internal deadline, including a printed copy of the DAAD application materials via their online system.
Career_Plan: Not explicitly listed as a mandatory application component.
Other_Requirements: An advisor or recommender is required to send a signed reference form directly to the DAAD New York office, either via email or mail. For most DAAD scholarships, applicants must apply separately to the university or research institution in Germany. Submitting a DAAD scholarship application does not automatically constitute an application to a study or research program. The research stay in Germany must be a required part of the curriculum of the applicant's study program and cannot be conducted in their home country. For some grants, applicants may need to be nominated by the professor supervising their research project. Application details and requirements can vary from country to country.
Scholarship_Info: The DAAD Doctoral Programmes in Germany (Research Grants) scholarship is a prestigious and highly sought-after funding opportunity provided by the German Academic Exchange Service (DAAD). It is designed to help international students and researchers realize their ambition of studying or conducting research in Germany. This specific grant focuses on supporting doctoral candidates and researchers pursuing their PhDs or post-doctoral research at German universities and research institutions.
Application_Documents: An advisor or recommender is required to send a signed reference form directly to the DAAD New York office, either via email or mail. While the primary application is online, some documents may need to be sent separately by post. Applicants are also advised to print a copy of their DAAD application materials for their records and for submission to local DAAD offices or partner institutions if required.
Timeline:
2025-10-31 : Application Opening Date
2026-02-16 : Application Deadline
May 2026 : Selection Process
August 2026 : Funding Start
Funding Duration : The exact funding period will be determined by the selection committee during the selection process, taking the applicant's work schedule into account. The scholarship cannot be extended beyond the initially determined funding period.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend
Funding_Details:
The scholarship offers comprehensive financial support for the full four-year duration of the PhD programme. This includes a maintenance stipend and full university tuition fees.

Key Funding Details:
*   Full Financial Support: All successful applicants receive full financial support for four years.
*   Covered Expenses:
    *   Maintenance stipend
    *   University tuition fees
*   Tuition Fee Coverage Nuances:
    *   For applicants from the UK and EU, tuition fees are typically paid in full at the home/EU rate.
    *   For some specific programmes, such as the Wellcome Sanger Institute 4-Year PhD Studentships, full financial support, including University tuition fees, is provided regardless of nationality. For the Sanger Institute, maintenance is covered for four years, but university tuition fees are covered for the requisite three years.
*   Specific Programme Funding: The Wellcome Trust-NIH PhD scheme, which supports study in the UK and Ireland, provides £80,000 for UK funding.
Quantity: Wellcome Sanger Institute: 12; Wellcome Trust-NIH PhD Scholarships (last 8 years): 39; Edinburgh Infectious Diseases: 2
Eligibility_Criteria:
Applicants must be graduates or students who have obtained, or expect to obtain, a degree (or equivalent for EU and overseas candidates) in a relevant subject. Candidates with other relevant qualifications or research experience may also be eligible.

Nationality/Residency:
*   Applicants from the UK and EU are eligible for a studentship that includes a maintenance stipend and tuition fees paid in full at the home/EU rate.
*   For certain programmes, such as those at the Wellcome Sanger Institute, full financial support, including University tuition fees, is available regardless of nationality.

Geographic Restrictions: Applicants cannot apply to carry out activities that involve the transfer of grant funds into mainland China.

Programme-Specific Details: For more detailed eligibility information, applicants are advised to contact the individual programmes directly.
Eligible_Fields: General Science, Mental Health Research, Infectious Diseases, Hosts, Pathogens and Global Health, Integrative Infection Biology, Quantitative aspects of biological research
Eligible_Field_Group: Natural Sciences, Healthcare & Medicine, IT & Data Science
Required_Degree: Master's degree, Master's equivalent, Final Year Student
Experience_Years: Not specified, but relevant research experience is considered a valuable asset.
Language_Certificate: Not specified
Special_Circumstances: Activities involving the transfer of grant funds into mainland China are prohibited.
Career_Plan: While not an explicit application requirement, the programmes emphasize career development. Students can tailor their training pathways to meet evolving needs and career goals, with programmes including cohort building activities and career development support.
Other_Requirements: Referees are required to state the applicant's name and the specific Wellcome Trust 4-year PhD programme on the reference letter. They must also detail how they know the applicant and for how long. The Dundee programme aims to produce graduates who are data literate and skilled in the quantitative aspects of biological research.
Scholarship_Info: The "Wellcome Trust Four-year PhD Programmes" are prestigious doctoral scholarships provided by the Wellcome Trust, a global charitable foundation. These programmes are designed to offer graduates outstanding training in scientific research, providing broad, interdisciplinary training. A key feature is the inclusion of cohort building activities and dedicated career development support, allowing students to tailor their training to their evolving needs and career aspirations.
Application_Documents: Reference Letters. A comprehensive list of all required application documents is not provided; applicants should consult individual programme websites for full details.

28 November 2024 (09:00 GMT) : Application Deadline for Wellcome Sanger Institute 4-Year PhD Studentships (2024 entry)

October 2026 : Applications currently open for King's PhD Programme in Mental Health Research for Health Professionals entry

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Other Costs, Tuition Waiver
Funding_Details:
The FPI/FPU Predoctoral Grants offer comprehensive financial support, making them fully funded opportunities for a maximum duration of four years. The annual funding amounts are designed to increase over time throughout the grant period.

Covered expenses typically include:
*   Salaries: Providing a stable income for the PhD student.
*   Overseas Research Stays: Funding for international research stays, particularly for students aiming to obtain a PhD with an international mention.
*   Related Costs: Other expenses associated with the research and training.
*   Tuition Assistance: Predoctoral grant holders from the Ministry of Economy and the Ministry of Education are entitled to tuition assistance.
Eligibility_Criteria:
These grants are primarily aimed at the training of PhD students by funding predoctoral contracts. Candidates must meet several academic and experience-based requirements:
*   Applicants must hold both a Bachelor's degree and a Master's degree in a relevant field, as these are prerequisites for doctoral programs in Spain.
*   A proven interest or background in research is required.
*   A minimum average grade of the academic transcript is required. While specific GPA figures for FPI/FPU are not universally stated, general graduate student requirements in some institutions suggest maintaining a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0.
*   All areas of scientific research generally eligible for funding.
Experience_Years: Not specified, but a proven interest or background in research is required.
Language_Certificate: Not mentioned
Special_Circumstances: No requirement
Other_Requirements:
*   Candidates must not already hold a PhD degree.
*   Applicants must not have held similar predoctoral funding exceeding 12 months prior to the application deadline.
*   Students already hired for longer than one year as PhD students holding a "Predoctoral" training contract are also not eligible for these calls.
*   Thesis supervisors must be in possession of a doctoral thesis and have a contractual relationship with the host institution.
Scholarship_Info: The FPI/FPU Predoctoral Grants are prestigious Spanish Government scholarships officially known as "FPI/FPU Predoctoral Grants (Spain)". These grants are provided by the Spanish Ministry of Education and/or the Ministry of Science and Innovation. They are distinguished financial aid initiatives designed to promote research and higher education by funding predoctoral contracts for the training of PhD students. They aim to lessen financial barriers, honor academic achievement, and promote creativity in Spanish research institutes and universities, fostering innovative research and intellectual development in Spain’s top academic institutions.
Application_Documents:
*   Academic transcript.
*   Upon acceptance of the grant, candidates must submit the necessary documentation to sign the contract.
Timeline:
January 12, 2023 : 2022 FPI call applications opened
January 26, 2023 : 2022 FPI call applications closed
November 30, 2023 : Another FPI call submission deadline
October 1, 2025 : Research Training Grants Programme opened
November 15, 2025 : Research Training Grants Programme application period closed (at 23:59 Spain, GMT+1)
January 26, 2026 : Specific 4-year FPI grant call applications accepted until 14:00 Central European time
After application period : Final selection process takes place

Funding_Level: Fixed Amount
Funding_Details:
The F.R.S.-FNRS provides doctoral grants with a specific scale for FRIA and FRESH fellowships.
    *   1st scholarship: 27,836.40 € (gross annual)
    *   2nd scholarship: 29,158.56 € (gross annual)
The FRIA scholarship is specifically designed to support PhD completion over four years, focusing on fields related to industry or agriculture.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be PhD students with a fully paid affiliation at a Belgian University at the deadline of the call and when leaving for the research stay. No applicant may apply for a FRIA Grant if they have successively received two Research Fellow fellowships (ASP + ASP-REN) from the F.R.S.-FNRS or two FRESH grants. Only one application for a Research Fellow (ASP) is allowed.
Language_Certificate: Not specified
Special_Circumstances: Not specified
Other_Requirements: Only one application for a Research Fellow (ASP) is permitted.
Scholarship_Info: The F.R.S.-FNRS is a significant employer of researchers, supporting over 2,000 individuals at various career stages through grants and fixed-term contracts, including doctoral fellowships. The FRIA, FRESH, and ASP grants are key components of their doctoral funding initiatives. The primary purpose of the FRIA scholarship, specifically, is to enable researchers to complete a PhD within a 4-year timeframe. The F.R.S.-FNRS supports doctoral researchers through grants like FRIA, FRESH, and ASP, aiming to facilitate the completion of PhDs, particularly the FRIA scholarship over a 4-year period.
Application_Documents:
Online Submission via the FNRS e-space portal is mandatory.
Applicants must submit an administrative application on e-space within 5 working days after the general deadline of the GEH call.
Required documents include the Call Text & Guidelines and Appendices (see section 2.1).
The application process is also referred to as "ASP Belgium Doctoral Support Early."
Timeline: Annual: The Grants and Fellowships Call is opened once a year and announced on the F.R.S.-FNRS website. Specific key dates for each call are published on the F.R.S.-FNRS website (www.frs-fnrs.be/en/calendrier-des-appels) once the call is open. Applicants are advised to check the website for current deadlines.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Tuition Waiver, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
*   Annual Stipend: €25,000 to cover living expenses.
    *   Tuition Fees: A contribution to tuition fees up to €5,750 per year. This includes non-EU fees. An additional €4,000 may be possible, bringing the total fee contribution potential higher.
    *   Direct Research Expenses: €3,250 annually for eligible direct research expenses.
Quantity: Hundreds of awards are given annually
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to outstanding students from all countries (international students) pursuing research-based master's and doctoral degrees at eligible Irish institutions. It supports exceptional research master's or doctoral candidates from any country and is open to all nationalities worldwide.
Min_Gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.0–3.5 (65–75%); for fully funded positions, often above 3.7 (80%) is expected. On a 4.0 grade point average scale, specific requirements apply. On a 7-point scale, a GPA ranging from 5.0 to 5.49 or its equivalent is typically required.
Experience_Years: Not specified. Candidates with a 2.2 honours degree may be considered if they possess extensive relevant experience.
Language_Certificate: No specific language proficiency tests (like IELTS or TOEFL) or other standardized tests are explicitly mentioned as a universal requirement in the provided information. Individual institutions may have their own language requirements.
Other_Requirements: Reference Letters: Two recommendation letters are required. These letters must be independent of the proposed supervisor. Supervisor Support: Applicants must secure a letter of support from a supervisor at an eligible Irish institution. This letter is a critical component of the application.
Scholarship_Info: The Government of Ireland Postgraduate Scholarship Programme is a prestigious national initiative designed to support outstanding students pursuing research-based master's and doctoral degrees in Ireland. It is funded by the Department of Further and Higher Education, Research, Innovation and Science, and managed by the Irish Research Council (IRC), also known as Taighde Éireann/Research Ireland, a new national research agency. This scholarship is unique in the Irish research landscape, complementing other avenues for funded postgraduate education, and emphasizes excellence across all academic disciplines. It is a cornerstone of Ireland's research ecosystem, fostering high-quality research and attracting top talent globally.
Application_Documents: The application typically includes an applicant form (e.g., GOIPG_2025_Applicant-form.docx), two recommendation letters, and a letter of support from a proposed supervisor.
Timeline:
11 September 2025 : Applications Open
23 October 2025 : Applicant Deadline
6 November 2025 : Supervisor Deadline (for submitting letters of support)
13 November 2025 : Research Office Endorsement

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The scholarship includes a total grant of EUR 9,000 for most programs, typically disbursed in three installments. It also provides a full tuition waiver or exemption, covering the cost of enrollment in Italian universities and institutes. Additionally, health insurance is covered for the duration of the scholarship period.
Covered Expenses:
*   Tuition waiver/exemption (full or partial tuition coverage)
*   Monthly/Annual stipend (total grant of EUR 9,000)
*   Health insurance
Eligibility_Criteria: Primarily for foreign students not residing in Italy and Italian citizens living abroad (IRE). Both international and local students are eligible if they meet the stipulated criteria. Applicants must hold an appropriate academic qualification required to enroll in an Italian University or Institute. For postgraduate courses, a Bachelor's degree is generally required. The scholarships support various programs, including Master's Degree programs, Higher Education in Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) programs, Italian Language and Culture advanced courses, PhD programs, and research/training programs. PhD applicants are specifically required to provide a letter of acceptance from the relevant Italian University.
Eligible_Fields: Master's Degree programs, Higher Education in Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) programs, Italian Language and Culture advanced courses, PhD programs, Research/training programs
Required_Degree: Bachelor's degree, Bachelor's equivalent, Master's degree
Language_Certificate: B2 Italian (CEFR) for Italian-taught courses, B2 English (CEFR) for English-taught courses. Certificate of proficiency required, university-issued certification may be accepted.
Age: Minimum 18 years old. Maximum 28 years old for Master's Degree programs, AFAM programs, and Italian Language & Culture advanced courses. Maximum 30 years old for PhD programs. Age limits typically do not apply to scholarship renewals.
Special_Circumstances: The MAECI grant is incompatible with any other grant offered by the Italian Government or any other Italian public institution, including DSU grants.
Other_Requirements: Scholarship renewal possible for the following academic year, provided students meet specific performance requirements. Candidates are evaluated based on academic qualifications, language proficiency, and adherence to all eligibility criteria.
Scholarship_Info: The MAECI Italian Government Scholarships are a prestigious funding opportunity provided by the Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI). These scholarships are designed to promote cooperation in cultural, scientific, and technological fields, supporting international students and Italian citizens living abroad (IRE) who wish to study, train, or conduct research work in Italian universities and higher education institutions. The program aims to make higher education in Italy more accessible by offering significant financial and academic support.
Application_Documents:
Key documents include:
*   A letter of acceptance from the Italian University (mandatory for PhD programs).
*   A certificate of Italian language proficiency (for Italian-taught courses).
Timeline: May 15, 2025, 2 pm CET : Application Deadline (for the 2025-2026 academic year). Specific opening dates for the application window are not explicitly stated, but applicants are encouraged to apply early.
Url: Not provided, refer to "Study in Italy" portal.

Funding_Level: Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs, Partial Funding
Funding_Details:
Covered Expenses:
*   Monthly allowance/stipend (amount varies between Master's and Doctoral programs).
*   Travel assistance (international and domestic).
*   Housing assistance.
*   Health insurance.
*   Cultural expenses.
Exclusions: Tuition fees are explicitly not covered by the scholarship.
Funding Scope: Only study program components taking place in France are funded, with specific exceptions for internships or exchange periods.
Quantity: Approximately 350 scholarships are awarded each year across both Master's and PhD levels. A few years ago, approximately 70 scholarships were specifically awarded to PhD students.
Eligibility_Criteria: Candidates must be nominated by a French higher education institution and accepted into a doctoral program. Applications are submitted exclusively by these institutions. Only candidates applying for the first time at the PhD level and from one educational institution are eligible. The 36-month scholarship is conditional on enrolment in the 1st year of PhD and is exclusively for newcomers to the French higher education system.
Eligible_Fields: Science and Techniques: Biology and health, Ecological transition, Mathematics and digital, Science and engineering. Human and Social Sciences: French history, language and civilization, Law and political sciences, Economics and management.
Eligible_Field_Group: Natural Sciences, Healthcare & Medicine, Agriculture & Environment, Engineering & Technology, IT & Data Science, Humanities & Social Sciences, Law & Public Policy, Economics & Business
Min_Gpa: Expected above 15/20 (on a 20-point scale); no specific GPA thresholds publicly stated, selection based on portfolio quality, Olympiad performance, and interviews.
Language_Certificate: English B2 level is required, typically demonstrated by IELTS (5.5+) or TOEFL (72+).
Age: Generally under 32 for a Doctorate program. Specific institutions may vary: Université Paris Cité (aged 35 or under, born after March 31st, 1990); Université Paris-Saclay (born after March 31st, 1993).
Special_Circumstances: The 36-month scholarship is strictly for enrolment in the 1st year of a PhD program and for newcomers only. It cannot be used to sign a cotutelle agreement. Candidates must not be beneficiaries of another French government scholarship at the time of the application deadline.
Other_Requirements: Not mentioned
Scholarship_Info: The France Excellence Eiffel Scholarship Program is a prestigious initiative developed by the French Ministry for Europe and Foreign Affairs. Its primary objective is to enable French higher education institutions to attract the best international students to master's and doctoral degree programs in France. The management of the program is entrusted to Campus France.
Application_Documents: Academic portfolio, evidence of performance in academic competitions (e.g., Olympiads).
Timeline:

November 17, 2025 : TSM (Toulouse School of Management) Application Deadline (example)
January 8, 2026 : Institutional Deadline to Campus France

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver
Funding_Details:
The Siemens China Scholarship is a full scholarship, valued at approximately 25,000 Euro annually.
Covered Expenses: The scholarship explicitly covers tuition fees, meaning recipients do not have to pay these on their own.
Non-Covered Expenses/Requirements: Tsinghua University does not guarantee on-campus accommodation for scholarship recipients. Students are responsible for applying for their own on-campus accommodation or arranging off-campus housing. Additionally, recipients are required to purchase comprehensive medical insurance upon registration.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to outstanding international students of any nationality, specifically for PhD candidates. Applicants must possess a Master's degree and have a minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.3/4 (B+ or 85/100). Applicants for the PhD program should generally be under 35 years of age. Candidates must not have received any other award from Tsinghua University.
Eligible_Fields: Artificial Intelligence, Future of Automation, Autonomous Robotics, Other related fields
Language_Certificate: Not mentioned
Special_Circumstances: Not mentioned
Other_Requirements: Recipients are required to purchase comprehensive medical insurance upon registration. Tsinghua University does not guarantee on-campus accommodation for scholarship recipients; students are responsible for arranging their own housing.
Scholarship_Info: The Siemens China Scholarship at Tsinghua University is a prestigious full scholarship designed to support outstanding international PhD candidates pursuing studies in cutting-edge fields such as Artificial Intelligence, Future of Automation, and Autonomous Robotics. Offered by Siemens Ltd., China in partnership with Tsinghua University.
Application_Documents:
A specific "Application Form for Siemens China Scholarship" is required and can be downloaded from https://yzbm.tsinghua.edu.cn/intlLogin/b/yzlxs/yz_sys_xxfjb/download/file?id=206522.
Typical PhD applications at Tsinghua University would generally require academic transcripts, degree certificates, a study plan/research proposal, and potentially other supporting documents. The downloadable application form would provide a comprehensive list.

Funding_Level: Fixed Amount, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The award is intended to cover field research expenses for advanced doctoral students. This includes:
*   Data collection
*   Interviews
*   Workshops
*   One return trip from Canada to the developing country
*   Housing
*   Food
The total expenses covered by the award can be up to CA$20,000 per year.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be enrolled in a doctoral program at a Canadian university. Must be pursuing their first PhD. Open to Canadian citizens, permanent residents of Canada, and citizens of developing countries who are pursuing doctoral studies at a Canadian university. Intended for advanced doctoral students who plan to conduct their field research in one or more developing countries.
Eligible_Fields: Climate-Resilient Food Systems, Democratic and Inclusive Governance, Education and Science, Global Health, Sustainable Inclusive Economies, international development research
Eligible_Field_Group: Agriculture & Environment, Law & Public Policy, Education & Training, Natural Sciences, Healthcare & Medicine, Economics & Business
Language_Certificate: Not mentioned
Special_Circumstances: Not mentioned
Other_Requirements: Research conducted in the Global South may require approval from nationally recognized ethics bodies/committees. Examples include: University Institutional Review Board (IRB), National Council for Science and Technology, National government ministry
Scholarship_Info: The IDRC International Doctoral Research Awards (IDRC-IDRA) program is a prestigious scholarship designed to strengthen the research capacity of doctoral students enrolled at Canadian universities. Funded by the International Development Research Centre (IDRC) and administered by Universities Canada, these awards support advanced doctoral students conducting field research in developing countries. The program aims to foster Canadian and developing-country research capacity to improve the lives of people globally, particularly focusing on key development areas. The IDRC has supported PhD students in international development research since 1982, with the IDRA program being a key initiative to foster research capacity and improve lives in developing countries.
Application_Documents: While a specific list of documents is not provided, the process requires submission through an online portal, implying various supporting documents will be requested. All documents must be submitted via this online portal; late applications or documents submitted by email are not accepted.
Timeline:
2024-07-17 : Application Deadline (2024 Cycle)
Following the application and review period : Awards announced to recipients

Funding_Level: Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The HEC Paris PhD Program offers extensive financial support to all successful applicants. This funding is primarily provided by the HEC Foundation and aims to cover both academic and living expenses throughout the program.

Key Funding Details:
*   Full Tuition Fee Waiver: All admitted PhD students receive a complete waiver of tuition fees.
*   Cost-of-Living Scholarship: A scholarship of €26,000 per year is provided for a duration of 5 years to cover living expenses.
*   Conference Funding: Students receive generous support to present their research output at academic conferences, facilitating their integration into the international research community.
*   Research Project Funding: The program offers good funding opportunities to support students' individual research projects.
*   Additional Financial Support: The PhD office provides further financial assistance, which includes:
    *   Return ticket
    *   Visa fees
    *   Mandatory health insurance

The HEC Paris PhD Program is open to a diverse pool of candidates from around the globe.

General Eligibility Requirements:

*   Academic Background: Applicants must hold a university degree (Bachelor or Master).

Eligible_Field_Group: Economics & Business, IT & Data Science, Law & Public Policy
Min_Gpa: Not specified for PhD admission; 3.3/4.0 suggested for general HEC Paris admission; 2.5/4.0 required for program maintenance
Language_Certificate: Not specified
Special_Circumstances: Not specified
Other_Requirements: Applicants must show a clear ambition to become top researchers in international academic institutions.
Scholarship_Info: The HEC Paris PhD Program Funding is a comprehensive scholarship provided by HEC Paris, located in France. This funding is specifically designed to support students pursuing doctoral studies at one of the world's leading business schools. It offers extensive financial support to all successful applicants, covering academic and living expenses, and aims to develop top researchers.

Scholarship_Name: Aga Khan Foundation International Scholarship Programme (AKF-ISP)
Funding_Level: Partial Funding, Tuition Waiver, Stipend
Funding_Details:
The AKF-ISP awards are structured as a unique half grant and half loan model, meaning scholarships are awarded on a 50% grant and 50% loan basis. Recipients are required to repay 50 percent of the total award amount.
The scholarship covers essential educational and living costs, specifically:
*   Tuition expenses
*   Student living expenses
It is important to note that the scholarship does not cover other costs such as international travel or clothing.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be outstanding scholars originally from Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Egypt, India, Kenya, Kyrgyz Republic, Madagascar, Mozambique, Pakistan, Syria, Tajikistan, Tanzania, Uganda. They must demonstrate good academic standing and initial financial need, having no other means of financing their postgraduate studies. For studies in France, Portugal, UK, USA, and Canada, applications are accepted from individuals originally from these developing countries. Some years of work experience in their field of interest are expected.
Experience_Years: Some years of work experience in their field of interest (specific number not defined)
Language_Certificate: Not mentioned
Special_Circumstances: Not specified
Career_Plan: Scholars are expected to prepare for employment, primarily within the Aga Khan Development Network (AKDN), upon completion of their studies.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must demonstrate ongoing financial need throughout their postgraduate programme and confirm they have no other means of financing their studies. Maintaining good academic standing is required to retain the scholarship award.
Scholarship_Info: The Aga Khan Foundation International Scholarship Programme (AKF-ISP) is a prestigious scholarship opportunity provided by the Aga Khan Foundation. It aims to support outstanding scholars from selected developing countries in pursuing postgraduate education. The programme is designed to develop effective scholars and leaders, preparing them primarily for employment within the Aga Khan Development Network (AKDN).
Application_Documents: Official AKF Scholarship Application Form
Timeline:
2025-03-31 : Application deadline for 2025-26 academic year
June or July (annually) : Awards announced
Master's studies : Scholarship covers entire duration of degree course
PhD studies : Scholarship awarded for first two years

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
DCU PhD scholarships offer substantial financial support, with specific benefits varying by program and school.

    *   €22,000 per annum: DCU Business School EI PhD Scholarship.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Fully Funded
Covered Expenses:
* Tuition fees
* Airfare (round-trip)
* Monthly stipend
* Other benefits may include settlement allowance, medical insurance, research allowance, and Korean language training fees, though specific details for 2026 were not fully enumerated in the provided evidence beyond the core three.
Eligibility_Criteria:
- Citizenship: All international students are eligible to apply, with the explicit exclusion of Korean citizens.
- Previous Study in Korea: Students who have previously studied in Korean high schools, associate programs, or online Korean curricula are not eligible.
- Prior GKS/Korean Government Scholarship: Applicants who have already received a GKS degree scholarship or any other scholarship from a Korean government agency are ineligible.
- Application Track Restriction: Applicants may apply to only one track: either the General program or the R-GKS program.
- University Application Limits (Embassy Track):
    - General and Overseas Korean Programs: Applicants may apply to up to three different universities, and at least one of these choices must be a Type B university.
    - R-GKS Program: Applicants can choose up to two different universities, both of which must be Type B universities.
- University-Specific Requirements: Applicants are required to check for any additional restrictions or eligibility criteria set by each individual university they wish to apply to.
- Korean Language Course: All scholarship recipients are required to take at least one course on Korean language during their study period.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Final Year High School Student, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Min_Gpa: 80% out of 100, or ranked within the top 20% of class
Language_Certificate: English proficiency certificates (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS) for additional points; TOPIK Level 3 generally required during mandatory Korean language year.
Age: Under 40 years old as of September 1st of the inviting year (born after September 1, 1985 for graduate programs)
Other_Requirements:
- Health: Applicants must be in good physical and mental health to undertake studies in Korea.
- Document Submission (Provisional Graduates): R-GKS Track applicants, and generally all applicants with provisional graduation certificates, must submit their official graduation certificate/diploma and final academic transcript to the GKS Center, NIIED, by December 31st, 2025.
Scholarship_Info: The Global Korea Scholarship (GKS) is a prestigious scholarship program provided by the Korean government to offer international students the opportunity to pursue higher education (undergraduate and graduate degrees) in South Korea, fostering global education exchange and strengthening friendly relations. It supports students from 71 countries through the Embassy Track and all countries through the University Track.
Application_Documents:
- Official graduation certificates/diplomas
- Final academic transcripts
- All other required documents as specified in the official application guidelines and forms (available in PDF and DOCS formats on the official website).
Timeline:

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Full Tuition Fees
Monthly Stipend: Scholars receive a generous monthly stipend of S$2,700. This stipend increases to S$3,200 after passing the Qualifying Examination. Some sources also mention an annual stipend of S$24,000, which increases to S$30,000 after passing the Qualifying Examination.
One-time Settling-in Allowance: A one-time allowance of S$1,000 is provided to help new scholars settle into Singapore.
One-time Airfare/Travel Grant: A one-time travel grant of up to S$1,500 is provided to cover airfare to Singapore.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to International Students from all world countries. Applicants must possess an excellent academic record in their previous studies. A degree in a relevant field (Science, Engineering, or related) is required. While some general mentions refer to it as a "Master & PhD scholarship," it is explicitly stated that applicants for a Master's program are generally not eligible, making it primarily for PhD studies. A demonstrated passion for Science and Engineering research is essential. Applicants must be proficient in English. A good TOEFL or IELTS score is required if the medium of instruction for previous degrees (Bachelor's or Master's) was not English. Eligible applicants are required to search for a research project and identify a potential supervisor before submitting their application.
Min_Gpa: 3.5/4.0 or equivalent (often greater than 3.5) in their undergraduate studies
Experience_Years: No specific minimum years of professional experience are stated.
Language_Certificate: A good TOEFL or IELTS score is mandatory for applicants whose medium of instruction at the Bachelor's or Master's level was not in English.
Special_Circumstances: Scholars may apply in writing to reserve the scholarship benefit due to illness, injury, or other extenuating circumstances, subject to approval.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must submit two referee reports from individuals who can attest to their academic and research capabilities. Beyond academic excellence, a genuine passion for Science and Engineering research and a degree in a relevant field are crucial. Eligible applicants are required to search for a research project and identify a potential supervisor before submitting their application. GMAT/GRE/IELTS/TOEFL/SAT I & II/GATE Results (as applicable to the chosen program and university) may be required as part of the application.
Scholarship_Info: The Singapore International Graduate Award (SINGA) is a prestigious and fully funded scholarship program for international students pursuing PhD studies in Science and Engineering in Singapore. It is a collaborative effort between the Agency for Science, Technology & Research (A*STAR) and several leading Singaporean universities. Since its inception in 2008, the SINGA program has supported over 900 graduates from more than 40 countries, contributing to Singapore's reputation as a hub for scientific research. The scholarship provides an excellent opportunity for recent graduates to delve into advanced research.
Application_Documents: Required documents typically include two referee reports and relevant standardized test scores (GMAT/GRE/IELTS/TOEFL/SAT I & II/GATE Results, as applicable). Applicants must follow specific steps outlined on the official portal to submit their applications.
Timeline:
February 10, 2025 : Opening Date
December 1, 2025 : Application Deadline
Four years : Typical duration to complete PhD studies

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The scholarship covers all major expenses, ensuring students can focus entirely on their studies.
Monthly Stipend: Scholars receive a monthly stipend of approximately 150,000 JPY. This stipend is intended to cover living expenses, including accommodation (e.g., dorms) and daily necessities.
Covered Expenses:
Tuition Fees: Full exemption from tuition fees at the host Japanese university.
Travel Expenses: Round-trip airfare to and from Japan is covered. Additionally, scholars are advised to bring approximately US$2,000 to Japan to cover initial settlement costs.
Quantity: Globally: over 102,000 students benefited as of 2015; Pakistan: 11 scholarships; India (research students): more than 6 to 8
Eligibility_Criteria:
Applicants must generally be citizens of a country that has diplomatic relations with Japan. Specific requirements may include citizenship of the country where the application is submitted (e.g., U.S. citizen for applications through the Chicago consulate).
Individuals who have not yet graduated at the time of application must receive their high school diploma before the date of departure for Japan as a scholarship recipient.
Past grantees of MEXT scholarships may be ineligible if their educational or work experience exceeds three years from the following month of the period of the previous scholarship to the estimated first month of the payment of this scholarship. Exceptions apply to past grantees of specific programs such as Japanese Studies Students, Japan-Korea Joint Government Scholarship Program for Students in Science and Engineering Departments, and Young Leaders’ Program.
Applicants must be in good health.
Applicants must inquire directly with the Japanese Embassy or Consulate General in their country of nationality for precise details.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Experience_Years: While not a universal requirement, relevant work experience can be a significant asset. For instance, applicants with 5 years of work experience in Japan, particularly if related to their research proposal, have been noted. However, a specific requirement of "five years of active teaching experience" mentioned in one source appears to be for a specialized teacher training scholarship, not the general research student scholarship.
Language_Certificate: While not always a mandatory requirement, proficiency in English (e.g., IELTS/TOEFL) or Japanese (e.g., JLPT N3) can strengthen an application. Successful applicants have included those with IELTS certificates and Japanese Language Proficiency Test (JLPT) N3.
Age: Not explicitly mentioned in the provided text
Special_Circumstances: Past grantees of MEXT scholarships may be ineligible if their educational or work experience exceeds three years from the following month of the period of the previous scholarship to the estimated first month of the payment of this scholarship. Exceptions apply to past grantees of specific programs such as Japanese Studies Students, Japan-Korea Joint Government Scholarship Program for Students in Science and Engineering Departments, and Young Leaders’ Program.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must inquire directly with the Japanese Embassy or Consulate General in their country of nationality for precise details.
Scholarship_Info: The Japanese Government (MEXT) Scholarship (Research) is a highly prestigious and fully funded opportunity for international students to pursue research studies in Japan. Provided by the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology (MEXT) since 1954, this scholarship aims to foster academic exchange and assist students at Japanese universities. It is a flagship scholarship program by the Japanese government, designed to attract international talent to Japanese universities for research-oriented studies.
Application_Documents:
MEXT Scholarship Application Form (for FY2026)
Certificate of Health
Recommendation Letter (to be submitted to the embassy/consulate)
Application Guidelines for Research Students (for reference)
Other supporting documents as specified by the local embassy/consulate.
Timeline:
Application Period : Applications for the MEXT Scholarship 2026 are now open.
Varying Deadlines : Application deadlines and specific schedules differ significantly according to the applicant's country of nationality. It is imperative for applicants to inquire directly with their local Japanese Embassy or Consulate General.
Examples of Deadlines:
May 20, 2025 : Jordan Application Deadline
May 23, 2025 : Malawi, Honolulu Application Deadline
September 1, 2025 : University of Tokyo (general/university-related contexts) Application Deadline
Selection Process:
First Screening at the Embassy : Review of application documents.
Interviews : Shortlisted candidates invited for interviews at the embassy.
Written Examinations : Some embassies may also conduct written examinations.
Final Selection by MEXT : Successful candidates from the embassy screening are then recommended to MEXT for final approval.

Country: EU Member State, Associated Country, UK, International
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The 2025 call for MSCA Doctoral Networks boasts a substantial budget of approximately EUR 597.8 Million. Additionally, funding for programmes in the UK is supported by the UK Research and Innovation (UKRI) Horizon Europe guarantee funding.

The grant provides a comprehensive allowance designed to cover various costs for the doctoral candidates, including:
*   Living costs: A basic allowance for daily expenses.
*   Travel costs: Expenses related to relocation and project-related travel.
*   Family costs: Additional support for researchers with family responsibilities.
*   Training costs: Contributions towards the structured training activities within the doctoral programme.
*   Networking costs: Support for participation in conferences, workshops, and other networking events.
*   Research costs: Funding for the execution of individual research projects.
*   Visa and UK health surcharge: Specific costs incurred by doctoral candidates to take up positions in the UK.
*   Tuition fees: Coverage for any tuition fees associated with the doctoral programme.

The EU directly contributes to the training, networking, and research costs, while the grant provides the allowance for living, travel, and family expenses.
Quantity: The number of awards for the overall call is not specified, as funding is allocated to networks rather than individual positions directly. However, individual Doctoral Network projects may advertise a specific number of fully funded PhD positions.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Applicants for individual PhD positions within MSCA Doctoral Networks must meet specific criteria:
*   Doctoral Candidate Definition: Candidates must satisfy the MSCA definition of Doctoral Candidates (DC), meaning they must not already be in possession of a doctoral degree at the date of recruitment.
*   Doctoral Programme Enrollment: Researchers must be enrolled in a doctoral programme leading to the award of a doctoral degree in at least one EU Member State or Associated Country.
*   Strict Requirements: There are strict eligibility requirements for DC positions, which applicants must ensure they meet before applying.
While the call is open to organisations from third countries, the degree award must be from an EU Member State or Associated Country.
Experience_Years: The MSCA Doctoral Networks do not specify a minimum number of years of professional or research experience. The focus is on supporting early-stage researchers at the doctoral level.
Language_Certificate: General language proficiency tests such as IELTS, TOEFL, or other language certificates are not explicitly mandated by the MSCA framework. However, individual host institutions or specific Doctoral Network projects may require proof of language proficiency.
Special_Circumstances: No explicit age limits or gender-specific requirements for applicants, though the MSCA generally aims to boost women's careers in science.
Career_Plan: A career development plan is an expected output for doctoral candidates, focusing on increasing career opportunities and employability.
Other_Requirements: International mobility is a fundamental aspect of the MSCA, encouraging researchers to move between countries. Inter-sectoral secondments are a key feature, promoting collaboration and knowledge transfer between academic and non-academic sectors. For Industrial Doctoral Networks, a stay in the non-academic sector is strongly encouraged for a minimum of 50% of the fellowship duration. Secondments are generally limited to a maximum of one-third (≤ 1/3) of the fellowship duration. Appropriate supervision is a core component, with joint supervision encouraged for standard/industrial networks and mandatory for Joint Doctorates. For Joint Doctoral Networks, joint collaborations leading to a joint/multiple doctoral degree are required, along with a pre-agreement for joint degrees and joint selection and supervision processes. Doctoral candidates receive scientific training, transversal skills training, and participate in individual research projects (IRP).
Scholarship_Info: The MSCA Doctoral Networks are a flagship initiative of the European Union, fostering excellence in research training. They support doctoral programmes implemented by diverse partnerships across sectors and countries. The programmes emphasize international mobility, inter-sectoral collaboration, and comprehensive training to enhance the career prospects and employability of doctoral candidates. The initiative aims to strengthen Europe's human capital, facilitate talent and knowledge circulation, increase Europe's attractiveness as a research hub, and foster open science, innovation, and entrepreneurship.
Application_Documents: Organisations or consortia of organisations submit proposals for doctoral networks to the open call via the EU Funding & Tenders portal. They should consult the "Guide for Applicants Doctoral Networks 2025" for full details. Individual researchers seeking PhD positions funded by MSCA Doctoral Networks should apply directly to the specific funded projects. These open vacancies are advertised internationally, notably on the EURAXESS portal, which is updated daily. Researchers develop an application jointly with their chosen host organisation.
Timeline:
28 May 2025 : Opening Date
24 June 2025 : Info Day for prospective applicants
25 November 2025 : Application Deadline
August 2026 : First EU-funded projects tentatively scheduled to commence

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Key benefits include:
*   Tuition Waiver: Full or partial tuition coverage for the chosen program.
*   Accommodation: Free or subsidized accommodation, typically in university dormitories.
*   Living Allowance/Monthly Stipend: A monthly stipend to cover personal expenses. The stipend amounts are:
    *   Undergraduates: RMB 2,500
    *   Master's / General Scholars: RMB 3,000
    *   Doctoral / Senior Scholars: RMB 3,500
*   Medical Insurance: International medical insurance is provided.
*   Additional Costs: The scholarship may also cover education administration costs and expenditures to support student activities.

It is important to note that recipients are generally responsible for covering their own round-trip international travel expenses. If a study plan extends beyond the academic year for which the scholarship is initially granted (e.g., beyond AY 2026/2027), applicants are advised to seek additional scholarship coverage from their host university for the exceeded period.
Quantity: Varies by program and country; specific country allocations exist (e.g., 59 Pakistani students in 2021).
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be in good health. For the Chinese Universities-Postgraduate Program, applicants must not have completed their previous study within China, or at least one year must have passed since they completed their previous study in China. While some programs are open to all nationalities, others may be restricted. For example, the ‘Silk Road’ program is specifically for nationals of countries belonging to the ‘One Belt One Road’ initiative. Specific country requirements also apply, such as being a Pakistani/AJ&K national (dual nationality holders are not eligible), a US citizen, or a South African national who must sign a contract to return to South Africa upon completing their studies. Applicants for general scholar programs must be under the age of 45.
Eligible_Fields: Undergraduate (Bachelor's) programs, Postgraduate (Master's or PhD) programs, Non-degree Chinese language studies, Medical programs, including MBBS.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Language_Certificate: For Chinese-taught programs, HSK reports are required. Direct Entry: HSK Level 5 or above (min 180). Bachelor's: HSK 3 (min 180). Master's and PhD: HSK 4 (min 180). One year of Chinese language study may be granted if minimum HSK met but not sufficient for direct major entry.
Special_Circumstances: Specific country requirements apply (e.g., Pakistani/AJ&K national, US citizen, South African national contract to return). Dual nationality holders are not eligible for Pakistani/AJ&K.
Other_Requirements: All applicants must apply online via the "Study in China" portal, selecting the 'Application Online for International Students' option. Applicants for postgraduate studies are required to submit a research proposal and any admission documents obtained from Chinese universities.
Scholarship_Info: The Chinese Government Scholarship (CGS) is a prestigious award provided by the Chinese Government to international students, administered by the Chinese Scholarship Council (CSC). It facilitates study in China across a network of affiliated Chinese universities and is a flagship program designed to attract international talent to China's higher education institutions.
Application_Documents:
Commonly required documents include:
*   Degree certificates (for Master's or PhD applicants).
*   Research proposal (for postgraduate studies).
*   Admission documents from Chinese universities (for postgraduate studies).
*   HSK reports (for Chinese-taught programs).
Timeline:
2025-11-13 : Applications opened for 2026/2027 academic year
2026-01-05 : Application deadline for many countries (e.g., South Africa, Pakistan)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Approximately 150 scholarships are offered annually. This includes up to 130 special doctoral fellowships specifically for candidates from certain countries, including developing nations worldwide. Funding for the programme can also be provided through national authorities, such as the Department of Further and Higher Education, Research, Innovation and Science in Ireland, or the University of Oslo for Norwegian candidates. The application for admission to the EUI doctoral programme often automatically serves as an application for national funding, though exceptions may apply.

The scholarship comprehensively covers:
*   Tuition fees for the entire four-year duration.
*   Living expenses, which include accommodation, public transportation, utilities (electricity, internet), books, and groceries.
*   Some travel expenses related to research or academic activities.
*   Necessary research costs.
Quantity: Approximately 150 scholarships annually, including up to 130 special doctoral fellowships for candidates from specific countries.
Eligibility_Criteria: Candidates must meet the minimum degree requirements set by the funding authority of the country for which they are applying. Special Doctoral Fellowships are specifically open to developing country nationals worldwide. While not a universal requirement, proficiency in other working languages of the EUI (French, German, Italian, or Spanish) may be required for specific research projects, depending on the applicant's research proposal and departmental needs.
Eligible_Fields: Economics, History (including History and Civilisation), Law, Political and Social Sciences
Eligible_Field_Group: Economics & Business, Humanities & Social Sciences, Law & Public Policy
Language_Certificate: Proficiency in French, German, Italian, or Spanish may be required for specific research projects, depending on the research focus. General English language proficiency is expected for academic work, but specific IELTS/TOEFL scores are not explicitly listed as a universal requirement.
Special_Circumstances: Not explicitly mentioned
Other_Requirements: Applicants must register two academic referees in the online application form. These referees are required to submit their reference letters online directly by the application deadline of 31 January. A detailed research proposal is a mandatory component of the application. All required documents must be submitted as part of the application.
Scholarship_Info: The European University Institute (EUI) Doctoral Programme is a prestigious, fully-funded four-year PhD programme based in Florence, Italy. It is designed for aspiring researchers in the social sciences and humanities, offering an internationally recognized doctorate. The programme is highly structured, providing extensive training and research support within a culturally diverse academic community. A significant percentage (85%) of EUI doctoral researchers successfully complete their dissertations.
Application_Documents: Online application form, a comprehensive research proposal, and two academic reference letters, along with other supporting documents as specified in the application guidelines.
Timeline: 1 November : Application period typically opens (e.g., 1 November, 2025, for the 2026-2027 cycle), 15 January : Example specific national funding deadline (Irish funding), 31 January, 14:00 (CET) : General application deadline for all required documents, Annually : Approximately 150 scholarships offered, 2026-2027 : Programme cycle

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The iPhD program offers a comprehensive scholarship package for full-time study over four years.
*   Stipend: The scholarship provides a generous stipend, approximately $46,000 per annum (2024 rate). Other sources indicate the stipend as $47,000 or $47,020 annually, reflecting a competitive remuneration package.
*   Project Expenses and Development Package: In addition to the stipend, recipients receive a Project Expenses and Development package of $13,000 per annum for up to four years. This package supports research-related costs and professional development activities.
*   Additional Benefits: The program offers significant non-monetary benefits, including:
    *   Access to real-world projects and opportunities to solve industry challenges.
    *   Mentorship and expertise from industry partners, host universities, and CSIRO researchers.
    *   A structured 60-day Industry Engagement component with the industry partner, providing invaluable practical experience.
    *   A unique three-way supervision model involving supervisors from the university, CSIRO, and the industry partner.
    *   Enhanced employability through industry exposure and applied research skills development.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be an Australian citizen, an Australian permanent resident, or a New Zealand citizen. Candidates must meet the PhD admission requirements of their chosen host university. Applicants must not have previously completed a PhD. Applicants must not be in receipt of another primary scholarship concurrently with the iPhD program. Candidates must satisfy the English language proficiency requirements set by their host university.
Eligible_Fields: Applied research that directly benefits industry by solving real-world problems, supporting a wide range of scientific and technological disciplines with clear industry application. No explicit restrictions on specific academic disciplines are stated, as long as they align with the program's applied research mandate.
Eligible_Field_Group: Natural Sciences, IT & Data Science, Engineering & Technology, Construction & Planning, Agriculture & Environment, Healthcare & Medicine, Economics & Business, Humanities & Social Sciences
Experience_Years: No minimum number of years of experience is specified.
Language_Certificate: Required, typically IELTS or TOEFL, as per host university requirements
Other_Requirements: Suitability for the project: Candidates must demonstrate a strong alignment with the proposed research topic and the ability to contribute effectively to the industry-focused objectives. Location: The primary location for study must be in Australia, at the host university, a CSIRO facility, or on the industry partner's premises.
Scholarship_Info: The CSIRO Industry PhD Program is a four-year research training initiative designed to bridge the gap between academia and industry. It emphasizes applied research, offering students real-world projects and unparalleled access to expertise from industry, university, and CSIRO. The program's structure, including a 60-day industry engagement component and a three-way supervision model, is specifically designed to boost the employability of its graduates.
Application_Documents: Not detailed, but typically includes academic transcripts, research proposals, and CVs.

2025-04-28 : Second Round Application Opening
2025-08-22 : Second Round Application Deadline

Scholarship_Name: EURAXESS – PhD Studentships/Jobs (cổng việc làm nghiên cứu)
Country: Croatia, Cyprus, France, Germany, Ireland, Norway, Portugal, UK, Europe (general)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
EURAXESS plays a crucial role in supporting researchers globally, particularly those facing political pressure, funding cuts, or limitations on academic freedom. Through its platform, it facilitates access to various funding programs, including those from the Marie Skłodowska-Curie Actions (MSCA), which fund the creation of high-quality doctoral and postdoctoral training programs and financially support collaborative research projects worldwide. These programs aim to foster independent research careers and the training and employment of new doctoral students. The Research and Innovation Foundation (RIF) also offers various funding programs, some of which are open to international researchers, especially those collaborating with Cypriot institutions. Many PhD positions advertised on EURAXESS are fully funded, often including a tax-free stipend.
Successful applicants typically receive comprehensive financial support, which may include:
*   Complete tuition fee coverage or tuition fee waivers.
*   A competitive monthly stipend for living expenses, ranging from €1,500 to €3,000, depending on the country and specific opportunity.
*   A tax-free stipend, with one example citing 25,000 per annum for 4 years.
*   Travel costs, such as to and from Oxford for specific programs.
*   Research and travel grants to support project-related activities.
*   Health insurance and social security contributions.
Quantity: Highly variable, examples include 2, 10, up to 120, 1, or multiple positions depending on the specific opportunity.
Eligibility_Criteria:
EURAXESS supports researchers worldwide, with a particular focus on those facing political pressure, funding cuts, or limits on academic freedom. Many programs are open to international researchers, especially those involving collaboration with European institutions.
Portugal: Citizens (Portuguese or foreign) with long-term resident status in Portugal may apply for studentships or fellowships for work carried out totally or partially at foreign institutions. Foreign researchers who are non-residents in Portugal may apply to post-doctoral fellowships if their application is supported by a Portuguese institution and the research project is to be carried out entirely in Portugal.
General: Studentships are generally open to full-time home, EU, and international students, though specific residential eligibility guidance may apply for certain programs (e.g., for international applicants at UEA).
Min_Gpa: 15/20 for Bioengineering/Biomedical Engineering; Distinction or first-class level for Master's in Music Performance/Composition or Musicology
Language_Certificate: Not specified, depends on host institution
Special_Circumstances: EURAXESS specifically supports researchers facing political pressure, funding cuts, or limits on academic freedom.
Other_Requirements: For specialized PhDs, such as in AI and Music, applicants must possess a suitable technical background relevant to the research area.
Scholarship_Info:
EURAXESS – Researchers in Motion is a flagship pan-European initiative by the European Commission. It acts as a central hub, delivering comprehensive information and support services to professional researchers at all career stages. Its core functions include:
*   Job and Funding Portal: Offering thousands of research job offers and funding opportunities across Europe.
*   Mobility Support: Providing free assistance and information for researchers planning to change countries for work or study.
*   Program Funding: Directly funding the creation of high-quality doctoral and postdoctoral training programs and financially supporting collaborative research projects globally.
*   Targeted Support: Offering special support to researchers worldwide, particularly those facing political pressure, funding cuts, or limits on academic freedom.
Application_Documents: Not detailed, refer to individual calls/institutions
Timeline: Varies by opportunity: Application deadlines (e.g., 2024-09-02, 2025-01-08); Opening dates (not centrally specified); Duration: 3-4 years for PhD, up to 4.5 years for Master's plus PhD.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs, Fixed Amount
Funding_Details:
Scholarships typically include a full tuition fee waiver.
A monthly stipend of 14 million VND is provided.
RMIT also offers additional top-up funding and a living allowance.
In 2025, RMIT Vietnam awarded 102 scholarships worth over 47.5 billion VND.
Over 106 scholarships were officially launched in January 2025.
In October 2024, 13 fully funded PhD scholarships were awarded to promising young researchers.
A specific PhD scholarship in Business Management offered an award of 14 million VND for Vietnam candidates.
Covered Expenses: Tuition fees, Monthly stipend, Airfare (for some scholarships, e.g., Vietnam Government Project 89), Health cover (for some scholarships, e.g., Vietnam Government Project 89).
Quantity: Over 106 scholarships launched in January 2025; 102 scholarships awarded in 2025; 13 fully funded PhD scholarships awarded in October 2024; specific scholarships may have a single award.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to Vietnamese PhD students at RMIT and Vietnam-based PhD candidates. Aimed at outstanding researchers and promising students. Open to both domestic and international students. Current students with excellent grades may also be eligible for academic scholarships. Applicants must satisfy RMIT University’s entry requirements for graduate research programs. Evidence of appropriate academic qualifications and/or experience demonstrating knowledge of the field of study and potential for research sufficient to undertake the proposed program is required. Current Master by Research candidates are eligible to apply for a transfer to a PhD program. Existing RMIT Vietnam undergraduate students are generally not eligible for these PhD scholarships. Applicants must demonstrate potential for research sufficient to undertake the proposed program.
Eligible_Fields: Digital learning and creative, transferrable skills, Computer science, Business Management
Eligible_Field_Group: Education & Training, IT & Data Science, Economics & Business
Min_Gpa: Suggested: 85% or higher for competitive stipend scholarships; Not strictly specified otherwise.
Experience_Years: No minimum years of experience are specified.
Language_Certificate: Not specified, though typically part of general university admission for international students.
Special_Circumstances: Scholarships for new students cannot be deferred unless explicitly stated otherwise in the scholarship terms. Currently enrolled candidates applying for a scholarship, or those transferring from another institution, must have at least 24 months (or part-time equivalent) remaining in their candidature at the time of scholarship commencement.
Other_Requirements: Applicants are expected to demonstrate the ability and willingness to work extremely hard. All scholarships are subject to specific Terms & Conditions, which applicants are advised to review.
Scholarship_Info: The RMIT Vietnam PhD Scholarships are a prestigious offering from RMIT University Vietnam, designed to support doctoral candidates pursuing their research in Vietnam. These scholarships reinforce RMIT's commitment to academic excellence and aim to foster outstanding researchers. RMIT University Vietnam is committed to providing opportunities for promising students through its scholarship programs and provides a range of scholarships annually.
Application_Documents: Information on how to prepare an expression of interest (EOI) and the full application for PhD programs at RMIT Vietnam is available on the university's research degree application pages.
Timeline:
January 2025 : RMIT Vietnam Scholarships program officially launched
30 August 2025 : EOI deadline for international applicants
30 September 2025 : EOI deadline for domestic applicants
2026 : Scholarships commencing
2026 : Scholarship recipients expected to commence their program

Funding_Level: Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The scholarship operates on a two-tiered funding model:
*   Vietnam Government Scholarship (Project 89): This foundational scholarship covers tuition fees for a maximum duration of 3 years and 6 months.
*   UTS Top-up Scholarship: UTS provides additional financial support to Project 89 scholars. This top-up is specifically designed to supplement the main scholarship, contributing towards a broader range of expenses.
*   Covered Expenses (Combined):
    *   Tuition Fees: Covered by the Vietnam government scholarship and further supplemented by the UTS top-up.
    *   Living Stipends: Provided through the UTS top-up scholarship, enhancing the financial support for daily living expenses.
Eligibility_Criteria: Exclusively available for Vietnamese PhD students. Applicants must be current lecturers or faculty members at Vietnamese tertiary institutions/universities. Candidates must be seeking to complete a Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) at the University of Technology Sydney (UTS). Successful receipt of the main Vietnam government Project 89 scholarship is an implicit requirement for eligibility for the UTS top-up.
Experience_Years: No minimum number of years of experience is specified in the provided information.
Scholarship_Info: The "UTS FEIT – Project 89 PhD Top-up" scholarship is a specialized financial aid program designed to support Vietnamese PhD students at the University of Technology Sydney (UTS). It functions as a supplementary scholarship for individuals who have already secured the primary Vietnam government's Project 89 scholarship. UTS holds the distinction of being the first Australian university to formalize a partnership for this initiative. The top-up specifically aims to enhance the financial support provided by the Vietnamese government, contributing towards both tuition fees and living stipends for eligible candidates.

Scholarship_Name: University of Brighton – Funded PhD Studentships
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Tuition Waiver
Funding_Details:
The primary "Funded PhD Studentships" are fully-funded, providing a substantial stipend of £20,780 annually to cover living costs. Tuition fees are typically supported at the home rate (a minimum of £5,006 per year).
Covered Expenses:
* Living costs (via the annual stipend).
* Tuition fees (at the home rate).
Note on International Research Scholarships: Specific International Research Scholarships, when available, cover full tuition fees for up to 3 years. These are distinct from the general fully-funded PhD studentships in their tuition coverage for international students.
Other Awards: While the focus of this report is on fully-funded PhD studentships, the University of Brighton also offers other international scholarships with varying award amounts (e.g., £2,500, £1,500, and £5,500). These are generally separate from the comprehensive PhD studentships.
Quantity: Total: 19, International Research Scholarships: 4 (when running), Arts, Architecture, and Humanities: 3
Eligibility_Criteria:
General Eligibility:
* Open to both domestic (Home) and international students.
* Applicants must be new, full-time research students.
* Applicants must have already applied to join a research program at the University of Brighton.
Specific Eligibility (International Research Scholarships):
* Applicants must be current University of Brighton masters students who have received a PhD offer.
* Note: These specific International Research Scholarships are not running for the 2025-26 entry cycle.
Eligible_Fields: Arts, Architecture, and Humanities, Life and Physical Sciences, Social Sciences and Policy, International research in any field (for specific international research opportunities)
Eligible_Field_Group: Arts, Design & Media, Construction & Planning, Humanities & Social Sciences, Natural Sciences, Law & Public Policy
Language_Certificate: Not specified for scholarship, but university English language proficiency required for admission.
Special_Circumstances: Not specified
Scholarship_Info: The University of Brighton offers a comprehensive suite of funded PhD studentships, totaling 19 awards. These include general fully-funded opportunities with a generous stipend and tuition support, as well as specialized scholarships like the International Research Scholarships (though not running for 2025-26 entry) which historically covered full tuition for current Brighton masters students. Opportunities are available across a broad spectrum of research fields, with varying application deadlines and start dates.
Application_Documents: A specific list of required application documents for the scholarship was not provided in the collected evidence. Applicants should refer to the official university website for detailed application guidelines for their chosen PhD program and associated funding.
