Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend
Funding_Details: Each scholarship is fully funded, covering the University tuition fee in its entirety. In addition to tuition, recipients receive a stipend set at the UKRI (UK Research and Innovation) minimum rate for the relevant academic year. For the 2025/2026 academic year, the UKRI level is £20,780 for full-time students, with a pro-rata equivalent for part-time students. The stipend for the 2026/2027 academic year will also be set to the prevailing UKRI level.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to both UK and overseas students. Applicants must be applying to start their first year of study for an on-campus research degree (PhD or PhD by Distance) at the University of Edinburgh. Applicants must have already applied for admission to a full-time or part-time PhD or PhD by Distance programme and must have submitted their fully completed PhD programme application to the University before they can be considered for the scholarship.
Eligible_Fields: All PhD research degrees offered at the University of Edinburgh, with one specific scholarship for Business School doctoral programmes.
Language_Certificate: Not specified
Special_Circumstances: International students should also be aware that visa restrictions may apply.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must have secured admission to a full-time or part-time on-campus PhD or PhD by Distance programme at the University of Edinburgh.
Scholarship_Info: The Edinburgh Doctoral College Scholarships are prestigious awards provided by the University of Edinburgh, located in the UK. These scholarships are designed to attract and support outstanding PhD students, offering unparalleled research facilities, superb supervision, and development opportunities to aid their progression beyond their doctoral studies.
Application_Documents: Candidates must submit the University's online scholarships application form. This form is accessible via MyEd/ApplicantHub (EUCLID) once an applicant has logged in. It is a prerequisite that applicants have already submitted their fully completed PhD programme application to the University.
Timeline:
2025-02-03 : Application Deadline for 2025-2026 academic intake
2026-02-28 : Application Deadline for 2026-2027 academic intake (including September 2026 and January 2027 starts)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
TIGP students receive a tax-free stipend of NT$ 40,000 per month (comprising NT$ 34,000 + NT$ 6,000) for the first year.
The scholarship/stipend is typically extended for an additional 2 to 3 years, subject to academic performance.
The scholarship comprehensively covers various costs, including:
*   Tuition fees
*   Monthly stipend for living expenses
*   Health insurance coverage
*   Subsidized accommodation on campus
*   Travel grants
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to international students of all nationalities, with the explicit exclusion of applicants from Taiwan, China, and Hong Kong. Applicants must be newly admitted doctoral students with outstanding academic records. Candidates must not have received any other scholarships concurrently. Applicants must hold either a Bachelor's or a Master's degree to be eligible for the Ph.D. program. To ensure the continuity of the scholarship for the full three-year period, students must maintain an average GPA of at least 3.4 in their previous academic studies. Prior research experience is not mandatory for application consideration, though it can strengthen an application. Applicants are strictly limited to applying for ONLY ONE TIGP program.
Eligible_Fields: Ph.D. degree programs, including but not limited to: Chemical Biology and Molecular Biophysics, Molecular and Biological Agricultural Sciences, Molecular and Cell Biology, Molecular Science and Technology (Joint Admission Program), Nano Science and Technology (Joint Admission Program), Sustainable Chemical Science and Technology (Joint Admission Program)
Eligible_Field_Group: Natural Sciences, Agriculture & Environment, Engineering & Technology
Language_Certificate: Not strictly required (IELTS/GRE), but highly valued
Other_Requirements: Applicants are strictly limited to applying for ONLY ONE TIGP program. Candidates must not have received any other scholarships concurrently. Applicants must be newly admitted doctoral students with outstanding academic records.
Scholarship_Info: The Taiwan International Graduate Program (TIGP) is a prestigious Ph.D. degree program jointly organized by Academia Sinica, the national academy of Taiwan, and several top national research universities across Taiwan. Established to attract outstanding international talent, TIGP offers a unique opportunity for doctoral studies in a vibrant research environment. It is widely recognized as Taiwan's most prestigious and highest-paid scholarship program for international students.
Application_Documents:
Required Documents:
*   Online application form
*   Two letters of recommendation
*   Statement of Purpose (SOP)
*   Applicant's Curriculum Vitae (CV)
*   Original academic transcripts

IELTS/GRE scores are not strictly required for application, but submitting strong scores is highly valued and can significantly enhance an applicant's profile.
Timeline:
November 1st, 2025 : Application Opening Date
February 1st, 2026 (GMT+8 Time Zone) : Application Deadline
Annually (November 1st to February 1st) : Online applications received for subsequent fall semester intake

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Other Costs, Tuition Waiver
Funding_Details:
The HKPFS provides a comprehensive, fully funded package for the normative study period.
*   Annual Stipend: HK$340,800 (approximately US$43,690).
*   Conference and Research-Related Travel Allowance: Up to HK$86,800 (approximately US$11,130) for the entire normative study period, which translates to HK$14,200 annually.
*   Covered Expenses: The fellowship primarily covers the stipend and the research/travel allowance.
*   Special Consideration (HKUST): For eligible candidates applying to HKUST who are not selected for the HKPFS, there is a possibility of being considered for admission to a relevant PhD program with a Postgraduate Studentship of HK$229,620, the HKUST Redbird PhD Award, and a waiver of tuition fees in the first year. HKUST also offers additional funding opportunities like the Global Research Award and Research Travel Grant.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to new, full-time PhD students. Applicants from all countries and ethnic backgrounds are eligible. Ideal candidates are outstanding international students who demonstrate strong leadership, communication, and research skills. There are no restrictions on prior work experience.
Language_Certificate:
Required Tests: TOEFL (Minimum score of 550 Paper-based or 79 Internet-based) or IELTS (Minimum score of 6.5 Academic).
Other Accepted Proofs: A pass grade in English in the Hong Kong Advanced Level Examination (AS Level), Hong Kong Higher Level Examination, CUHK Matriculation Examination, or General Certificate of Education A-Level / AS-Level. Achieving Level 4 or above in the English Language subject of the Hong Kong Diploma of Secondary Education (HKDSE) Examination. Holding a degree from a university in Hong Kong or an English-speaking country. Obtaining a recognized professional qualification awarded in Hong Kong or an English-speaking country.
Special_Circumstances: For eligible candidates applying to HKUST who are not selected for the HKPFS, there is a possibility of being considered for admission to a relevant PhD program with a Postgraduate Studentship of HK$229,620, the HKUST Redbird PhD Award, and a waiver of tuition fees in the first year. HKUST also offers additional funding opportunities like the Global Research Award and Research Travel Grant.
Other_Requirements: Applicants are generally expected to possess strong communication skills and a valid passport.
Scholarship_Info: The Hong Kong PhD Fellowship Scheme (HKPFS), established in 2009 by the Research Grants Council (RGC) of Hong Kong, is a prestigious international scholarship designed to attract the world's brightest and most outstanding students to pursue full-time PhD studies in Hong Kong. The scheme offers comprehensive funding across all academic disciplines at Hong Kong's eight internationally recognized research degree-awarding universities. With 400 fellowships awarded annually, the HKPFS targets new PhD students demonstrating exceptional leadership, communication, and research skills, fostering a dynamic and globally connected academic environment.
Application_Documents: Required documents include score reports for TOEFL or IELTS.
Timeline:
2025-09-01 : Application Opening Date
2025-12-01 : Application Deadline (12:00 noon, Hong Kong Time)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Total Allocation: For the 2024/25 entry, up to £5 million was expected to be allocated to these scholarships.
Covered Expenses:
*   Full Tuition Coverage: The scholarship covers the full cost of tuition fees.
*   Annual Maintenance Stipend: An annual maintenance stipend is provided, paid at the prevailing UKRI (UK Research and Innovation) rates. This stipend is offered for 3.5 years. For the 2024/25 academic year, the stipend was £18,750, increasing to £21,300 for the 2026/27 entry.
*   Research, Training and Supporting Grant (RTSG): A grant of £5,000 is provided to support research, training, and other related activities.
*   Immigration Support: Financial assistance is also provided for immigration to the UK.
Quantity: 2024/25 entry: Up to 42; 2026/27 entry: More than 40 fully funded awards
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to International and EU PhD / MPhil-PhD applicants who are classified as paying overseas fees. Current University of Warwick students are eligible to apply only if they are within their first year of study (commenced enrolment within 12 months prior to October of the application year, e.g., within 12 months before October 2025 for the 2026/27 cycle). Applicants must have already submitted an application for a PhD program at the University of Warwick, typically for an October start. Scholarships are awarded to outstanding students who demonstrate exceptional academic excellence and strong potential in research activities. Beyond being classified as international or EU for fee purposes, there are no other specific nationality criteria.
Language_Certificate: English language proficiency required. IELTS scores vary by course band (A-D), with minimum scores typically ranging from 6.5 to 8.0. Other recognized English language tests are also accepted.
Other_Requirements: Scholarships cannot be deferred to the next academic year; successful applicants are expected to commence studies in the academic year for which the scholarship is awarded. A separate and successful application to a PhD program at the University of Warwick is a mandatory prerequisite for the scholarship application. GRE/GMAT are not explicitly stated as requirements for the scholarship, but might be relevant for specific courses or general university admission requirements.
Scholarship_Info: The Warwick Chancellor’s International Scholarships represent one of the United Kingdom's most prestigious fully funded doctoral awards. Offered by the University of Warwick, this program provides substantial financial support to outstanding international students pursuing PhD degrees across all academic disciplines at the university. The scholarship aims to attract and support top-tier postgraduate researchers from around the globe, fostering academic excellence and groundbreaking research.
Application_Documents: While specific scholarship application documents are not detailed, a complete and competitive PhD program application, including academic transcripts, research proposal, and references, is implicitly required as a foundation for scholarship consideration.

Applications are now open for the 2026/27 entry.

2025-12-11 : 2026/27 entry Scholarship Application Deadline
Autumn : 2026/27 entry Start Date

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Monthly Stipend: S$3,200
Tuition Fees: Full support for tuition fees.
Conference Allowance: Up to S$4,000 per financial year, specifically for two major overseas conferences over the 4-year scholarship period.
IT Allowance: A one-time grant.
Book Allowance: An annual grant of S$500.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to outstanding graduates or final-year students globally who aspire to pursue a full-time PhD at NTU. Preference is given to Singapore citizens and residents. Applicants must demonstrate excellence across academic, research, and leadership domains. Applicants must hold a bachelor's degree (an Honours degree is preferred) or be in their final year of a bachelor's degree program. The scholarship is exclusively for PhD programmes. Minimum GPA/Percentage: Conflicting information regarding specific academic thresholds has been noted: A minimum GPA of 2.50 (or equivalent) for a bachelor's degree. A bachelor's degree with a GPA of 3.5 or above. Minimum academic percentages: 70% for a bachelor's degree, 75% for a master's degree, and 90% for health sciences. Applicants are generally required to have at least two years of relevant experience in management or a professional capacity. Proficiency in the English Language is a mandatory requirement. An acceptable score in a Graduate test (such as GRE) is mentioned as a potential requirement, but not explicitly confirmed as universally mandatory. One source indicates an age limit of "Under 21". Applicants must demonstrate exceptional performance in academics, research potential, and leadership qualities.
Eligible_Fields: Engineering, Science, Business, Animal Conservation, Cryobiology
Eligible_Field_Group: Engineering & Technology, Natural Sciences, Economics & Business, Agriculture & Environment
Min_Gpa: Bachelor's degree: 2.50 or 3.50 (conflicting), Bachelor's degree (percentage): 70%, Master's degree (percentage): 75%, Health Sciences (percentage): 90%
Experience_Years: at least two years of relevant experience
Language_Certificate: English Language Proficiency
Special_Circumstances: Preference is given to Singapore citizens and residents.
Career_Plan: embark on a leading research career
Other_Requirements: An acceptable score in a Graduate test (such as GRE) is mentioned as a potential requirement. Applicants must demonstrate exceptional performance in academics, research potential, and leadership qualities.
Scholarship_Info: The Nanyang President’s Graduate Scholarship (NPGS) is a highly competitive and prestigious doctoral scholarship offered by Nanyang Technological University (NTU) in Singapore. It is recognized as the premier doctoral scholarship at NTU and one of Asia’s most esteemed awards for PhD study, aiming to attract outstanding graduates and final-year students to pursue a full-time PhD and embark on a leading research career. The scholarship provides comprehensive financial support, including a monthly stipend, full tuition fee coverage, and various allowances, for a maximum duration of four years.
Application_Documents: Not explicitly provided
Timeline: 1 November 2025 : Application Opening (Academic Year 2026-2027), 31 December 2025 : Application Deadline (Academic Year 2026-2027), Post-deadline : Final interview at university level, Post-interview : Official NPGS award letter issued

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:

Scholarship_Info: The Manchester President's Doctoral Scholar (PDS) Award is the University of Manchester's flagship scholarship program designed to attract and support the most outstanding PhD applicants from around the world. This prestigious award offers fully-funded 3.5-year scholarships, providing comprehensive financial support and unique opportunities for academic and professional development. Recipients are given the chance to collaborate with prominent academics and participate in a series of exclusive events, fostering a vibrant research environment.

Scholarship_Info: The QMUL Principal’s Postgraduate Research Studentships are prestigious, fully funded doctoral awards designed to support outstanding PhD candidates. They are a cornerstone of QMUL's commitment to supporting doctoral research and part of a wider array of funding opportunities.

The scholarship provides comprehensive financial coverage, including full tuition fees and a substantial living allowance or stipend, aiming to foster world-class research.

Scholarship_Name: Pierre Elliott Trudeau Foundation Doctoral Scholarships
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Scholars receive an annual stipend of up to $50,000 for three years, intended to cover tuition and living expenses. Additionally, an annual allowance of up to $20,000 per year for three years is provided. This allowance is specifically allocated for the learning of languages, travel and accommodations related to the Foundation's leadership program, and research activities.
The funding is designed to cover a wide range of expenses, including:
*   Tuition fees
*   Living expenses
*   Costs associated with language learning
*   Travel and accommodation for participation in the Foundation's leadership program
*   Research-related expenditures
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be outstanding doctoral students. Candidates must already be accepted into, or be in year one, two, or three of a full-time doctoral program. They must be expected to complete their doctoral studies in 2026 or later (or ending at least in 2027 or later). The scholarship is open to both Canadian and international students. It is an "in-program" scholarship, meaning applicants are already enrolled in their doctoral studies. A mandatory requirement is that the applicant's doctoral research must be related to at least one of the Foundation’s four central themes: Human Rights and Dignity, Responsible Citizenship, Canada and the World, People in their Natural Environment.
Eligible_Fields: Humanities and Social Sciences, Business Schools, Public Health Schools, Law Faculties
Eligible_Field_Group: Humanities & Social Sciences, Economics & Business, Healthcare & Medicine, Law & Public Policy
Experience_Years: Not explicitly stated, but leadership potential and relevant experiences demonstrating leadership, community engagement, or impact would be highly beneficial.
Language_Certificate: English proficiency required, typically through standardized tests such as IELTS or TOEFL, or qualify for a waiver.
Special_Circumstances: Not specified
Other_Requirements: A critical requirement for all applicants is that they must be nominated by a university. Evaluation is primarily based on candidates' high academic standing and demonstrated or implied leadership potential. The scholarship encourages a focus on both doctoral studies and active participation in the Foundation's leadership initiatives.
Scholarship_Info: The Pierre Elliott Trudeau Foundation Doctoral Scholarships are a prestigious program offered by the Pierre Elliott Trudeau Foundation. This scholarship is designed to support outstanding doctoral students pursuing their studies in Canada. It is recognized as a unique scholarship of its scope and stature within the country. A key distinguishing feature of this scholarship is its emphasis on community and leadership development. Recipients become part of a vibrant community of over 500 alumni, gaining opportunities to learn from both academic and non-academic role models. This aims to diversify their training and professional activities. The program includes a three-year leadership program specifically designed to cultivate "Engaged Leaders," equipping doctoral candidates with the skills to translate their ideas into action for the betterment of their communities, Canada, and the world.
Application_Documents: Complete transcript package from prior institutions.
Timeline: September 9, 2024 : Opening Date, November 17, 2025 : Application Deadline

Candidates must have submitted a complete application for admission onto an eligible UCL research degree program by the specified admission deadline. It is not necessary to have secured an offer of a place at UCL to apply for the scholarship, but the admission application must be complete and submitted to UCL Admissions by the deadline.
Language_Certificate: Not explicitly mentioned as a scholarship requirement, but international applicants would typically need to meet UCL's general English language proficiency requirements for admission to their chosen degree program.
Special_Circumstances: No specific special circumstances mentioned
Other_Requirements: Submission of a complete application for admission to a UCL research degree program by the relevant admission deadline is mandatory.
Scholarship_Info: The UCL-ORS is a key initiative by UCL to support its international research student community by alleviating a significant portion of the financial burden associated with overseas tuition fees.
Application_Documents: While specific scholarship application documents for UCL-ORS are not detailed, applicants must submit a complete application for admission to a UCL research degree program, which typically includes academic transcripts, research proposal, references, and other standard university admission materials.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Recipients receive $50,000 CAD per year for three years during their doctoral studies.
The scholarship is fully funded and is intended to cover:
*   Tuition and university fees
*   Research and lab expenses
*   Living and accommodation costs
Quantity: Not explicitly provided in the collected evidence.
Eligibility_Criteria: The Vanier CGS is open to both Canadian and international students who demonstrate excellence in academic achievement, research potential, and leadership. Candidates cannot apply directly to the program; they must be nominated by a Canadian institution. Candidates must be nominated by only one Canadian institution, which must have received a Vanier CGS quota. Direct applications from individuals are not accepted. The nomination process can be initiated by the student informing the faculty of graduate studies at their selected institution, or by the institution contacting a desired candidate. Candidates must intend to pursue full-time doctoral studies and research at the nominating institution in the summer semester or the academic year following the announcement of results. This includes doctoral degrees (PhD) or joint graduate research programs such as MD/PhD, DVM/PhD, JD/PhD, MBA/PhD, MA/PhD, or MSc/PhD. For combined degrees, only the PhD portion is eligible for funding. Applicants must be pursuing their first doctoral degree, including joint undergraduate/graduate research programs with a demonstrated and significant research component. Direct entry from a Master's degree to a Doctoral program without obtaining the Master's degree is possible. To hold the scholarship, candidates must be registered as a full-time student at the nominating Canadian institution, not hold a faculty appointment concurrently (unless on a leave of absence), and remain enrolled demonstrating continued satisfactory progress in their doctoral program. Eligible candidates may apply to both the Vanier CGS program and other agency-specific doctoral-level scholarship/fellowship programs in the same academic year, provided the research proposed in each application falls within the mandate of the respective federal granting agency.
Eligible_Fields: Social sciences and humanities, natural sciences and engineering, or health-related fields.
Eligible_Field_Group: Humanities & Social Sciences, Natural Sciences, Engineering & Technology, Healthcare & Medicine
Min_Gpa: Minimum GPA requirements vary by institution and department. For example, a minimum CGPA of 3.00 at SFU, a GPA of at least 3.5 on the University of Alberta scale, or a general admission GPA of 3.0, with departments potentially requiring higher.
Experience_Years: Not explicitly specified. Demonstrated research potential and leadership skills are key.
Language_Certificate: An English proficiency test (such as IELTS or TOEFL) is required by the Canadian university to which the applicant is applying. Good scores in these tests are necessary.
Age: No specific age limits are mentioned.
Special_Circumstances: Applicants are permitted to explain any gaps in the chronology of their experience but are not required to justify the circumstances when noting these considerations.
Career_Plan: Not explicitly mentioned as a separate required document.
Other_Requirements: A strong research proposal is essential. Applicants must confirm their eligibility and apply to a Canadian university that is on the Vanier Scholarship Universities list and has an allocated Vanier nomination quota.
Scholarship_Info: The Vanier Canada Graduate Scholarships (Vanier CGS) is a prestigious and highly competitive, fully funded scholarship program offered by the Government of Canada. Launched in 2008, the program is named after Georges Philias Vanier and aims to attract and retain world-class doctoral students, thereby establishing Canada as a global centre of excellence in research and higher learning. The scholarship supports doctoral-level studies at top Canadian universities, strengthening the nation's position as a leader in global research. The program is concluding, with the current competition (results mid-April 2025) being the final one.
Application_Documents: The application package requires the submission of academic work, including a strong research proposal. Academic and leadership reference letters are required, though they may not be needed at the initial stages (e.g., stage 2) of the application process.

mid-April (e.g., mid-April 2025) : Results Announcement
mid-April 2025 : Final Competition Results

Funding_Level: Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The KAUST Fellowship provides comprehensive financial support, making it a fully funded opportunity for international students pursuing PhD studies. The benefits cover all essential expenses for the duration of the graduate program, including:
*   Full Tuition Support: All tuition fees are completely covered.
*   Annual Living Allowance: A generous stipend is provided, with amounts up to $30,000 annually, and some specific awards potentially offering up to USD 38,000 per year.
*   On-Campus Housing: Accommodation is provided on the university campus.
*   Medical and Dental Coverage: Comprehensive health insurance is included.
*   Relocation Support: Assistance is provided for students relocating to Saudi Arabia.
Eligibility_Criteria: The KAUST Fellowship is exclusively available to international students who are admitted to a PhD program at KAUST. Every student admitted to a master's or PhD program at KAUST automatically earns the fellowship, without exception, meaning the primary eligibility is successful admission to a graduate program. Applicants must meet specific academic benchmarks, including a minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale, though successful applicants often possess higher GPAs (typically closer to 3.4 or 4.0). Applicants should hold a Master's degree to apply directly to the PhD program, or a Bachelor's degree with significant research experience. While there isn't a specified minimum number of years of experience, the quality and relevance of an applicant's research and job experience are crucial. English language proficiency is mandatory for most international applicants, requiring a minimum TOEFL IBT score of 81 (with 17 in all sections, KAUST code 4107) or an IELTS overall score of 6.5 (with 5.5 in all sections). Exemptions apply if the applicant has received a degree from an accredited institution in the United States, Canada, UK, Ireland, Australia, or New Zealand. The GRE exam is not required. Beyond these, applicants are typically required to submit reference letters and a document detailing job experience, research experience, and any other relevant information. Applicants applying with a Bachelor's degree for direct PhD admission are advised to contact a KAUST professor beforehand. There are no explicit age limits or gender-specific requirements.
Eligible_Fields: Food and Health, Water, Energy, Environment, The Digital Domain
Eligible_Field_Group: Agriculture & Environment, Healthcare & Medicine, Engineering & Technology, Natural Sciences, IT & Data Science
Min_Gpa: 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. However, successful applicants often possess higher GPAs, typically closer to 3.4 or 4.0.
Experience_Years: Not specified, but quality and relevance of experience are crucial.
Language_Certificate: TOEFL: minimum score of 81 on the Internet Based Test (IBT) with a minimum of 17 in all individual sections (KAUST code 4107). IELTS: minimum overall score of 6.5 with a minimum of 5.5 in all individual sections. Exemptions: Degree from an accredited institution in the United States, Canada, UK, Ireland, Australia, or New Zealand.
Special_Circumstances: Not mentioned
Other_Requirements: Reference Letters: These are a critical component of the application, providing insights into the candidate's ability to conduct independent research and their future potential. Contacting a Professor: Applicants applying with a Bachelor's degree for direct PhD admission are advised to contact a KAUST professor beforehand to discuss potential research alignment. Other Information: A document detailing job experience, research experience, and any other relevant information is also required.
Scholarship_Info: The KAUST Fellowship is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship program offered by the King Abdullah University of Science and Technology (KAUST) in Saudi Arabia. Established in 2009, KAUST is a graduate research university dedicated to addressing critical scientific and technological challenges. The fellowship is an integral part of KAUST's commitment to attracting top talent globally, as every student admitted to a master's or PhD program automatically receives the KAUST Fellowship, with no exceptions. It supports students for the entire duration of their studies.
Application_Documents:
*   Curriculum Vitae (CV)
*   Proposed Research Proposal
*   Academic Transcripts and Degree Certificates
*   Statement of Purpose
*   Letters of Recommendation
*   English Language Proficiency Scores (TOEFL/IELTS), if applicable
*   A supplementary document detailing job experience, research experience, and other relevant information.
Timeline:
July 1, 2025 : Application Opening Date
January 15, 2026 : Application Deadline
PhD program duration: minimum of 2.5 years
MS/PhD combined program duration: approximately 5 years
MS/PhD track option: leave after approximately 2 years with a Master's degree

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Partial Funding, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The funding structure for Cambridge Trust scholarships varies, ranging from part-cost awards to comprehensive full-cost packages, often depending on specific partnership programs.
*   **General Cambridge Trust Awards:** Mostly part-cost awards, contributing towards tuition and/or living expenses.
*   **Partnership Programs (e.g., Gates Cambridge, UCA-Cambridge Trust):** These often provide full-cost scholarships.
    *   **Gates Cambridge Scholarships:** Cover the full cost of studying at Cambridge.
    *   **UCA-Cambridge Trust Scholarship Programme:** Offers full tuition fee coverage and an annual stipend for living expenses.
*   **Specific Full Awards:** Some scholarships may include a substantial annual allowance (e.g., £21,000), free air travel, and visa costs.
*   **Covered Expenses (for full-cost awards and some partial awards):**
    *   Full or partial tuition fee coverage.
    *   Annual stipend or allowance for living expenses.
    *   Free air travel (for some awards).
    *   Visa cost (for some awards).
    *   Fieldwork maintenance allowance for PhD students (e.g., Gates Cambridge, where other fieldwork costs are expected to be covered by the academic department).
Quantity: Cambridge Trust (all awards): approximately 500-600 scholarships annually; Gates Cambridge Scholarships: approximately 80-95 full-cost scholarships annually (around 40 to US citizens)
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to applicants from countries other than the UK or Ireland. Applicants must be highly ranked by their prospective Departments within the University of Cambridge. There is no restriction on scholars receiving awards from the Trust for further courses of study (e.g., a scholarship for an MPhil followed by a PhD).
Min_Gpa: Not specified for Cambridge Trust; Gates Cambridge Scholars often have average GPA of 3.92, with cumulative GPA of 3.65 or higher expected.
Language_Certificate: Required for University admission for non-native English speakers (refer to University's general admission criteria)
Special_Circumstances: UCA-Cambridge Trust Partnership: Recipients of this scholarship will be offered an employment arrangement with the University of Central Asia (UCA) or another appropriate role within the Aga Khan Development Network (AKDN) upon completion of their studies. This arrangement includes an agreed-upon teaching, research, or professional contribution.
Career_Plan: Applicants must be able to articulate a compelling rationale for their selected graduate programs and why pursuing that training specifically at the University of Cambridge is essential for their academic and professional goals. This often involves demonstrating extensive research in their field and a clear vision for their future contributions.
Other_Requirements: Demonstrated intellectual distinction, evidenced by previous academic performance. Ability to prove the requisite academic background necessary for success in their chosen graduate discipline. Commitment to community building and leadership potential (particularly emphasized for Gates Cambridge Scholars).
Scholarship_Info: The Cambridge International PhD Scholarships, primarily offered through the Cambridge Trust, are prestigious opportunities for highly distinguished international students (outside the UK and Ireland) to pursue postgraduate studies, predominantly PhDs, at the University of Cambridge, UK. These scholarships are awarded to the highest-ranked international students and are often provided in partnership with the University and other organizations like the Gates Cambridge Scholarship and the UCA-Cambridge Trust Scholarship, offering both part-cost and full-cost funding.
Application_Documents: Specific documents are required for admission to the University of Cambridge (e.g., academic transcripts, research proposal, personal statement, references), which then serve as the basis for scholarship consideration.
Timeline:
Early September 2025 : Application Opening Date (for 2026/27 cycle)
15 October 2025 : US Round (Gates Cambridge) Application Deadline
16 November 2025 : UCA Scholarship Component Application Deadline
2 December 2025 : International Rounds (Gates Cambridge & UCA-Cambridge Trust) Application Deadline (Option 1)
7 January 2026 : International Rounds (Gates Cambridge & UCA-Cambridge Trust) Application Deadline (Option 2)
Course-dependent : General University of Cambridge postgraduate application funding deadlines
